question_list.author: SheilaB
question_list.text:
Uncle Wayne always gives me a pain.
His ideas are vain and inane.
He's both asinine (fatuous)
And a gas bag who's flatuous.
I treat the old fool with disdain.
question_list.question: What is wrong with Uncle Wayne's ideas?
question_list.answer: Uncle Wayne's ideas are vain and inane.
alternate_answers:
Uncle Wayne's ideas are considered vain and inane,
He's both asinine and flatuous, causing disdain.

Based on the limerick, there are a few things wrong with Uncle Wayne's ideas:

1. They are described as "vain and inane" - meaning they are empty, worthless, and foolish.

2. He is characterized as being "asinine" - which means stupid or foolish. 

3. He is also described as being a "gas bag" who is "flatuous" - implying his ideas are full of hot air and empty rhetoric.

4. The narrator treats Uncle Wayne with "disdain" - showing a strong dislike and lack of respect for his ideas.

Overall, the limerick portrays Uncle Wayne's ideas as being foolish, stupid, and unworthy of serious consideration. The narrator clearly has a very negative view of his uncle's thought processes and opinions.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
He called, "Abracadabra!" Despair!
His white rabbit was simply not there.
Well aware that he faced
Getting mocked, first he paced,
Then he frenziedly pulled out his hare.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In our bottomlands, davening trees
(In atonement?) now bow with the breeze,
Up-and-downing all day.
Has the marsh learned to pray?
Do the cypresses bend at their knees?

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
If your pubic hairs number a trillion,
The waxing for you is Brazilian.
They'll rip out all that hair,
Leaving labia bare,
But the pain factor's ten times a million.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A bumblebee, glumly gone slumming,
Finding hummingbirds' hum un-bee-coming,
Sang, "I humbly bee-seech you,
Permit me to teach you
The words, as your humming's bee-numbing!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I have been in a state of euphoria,
All due to my landscaper Gloria.
She planted an herb
Now in bloom: a superb,
Showy knapweed—the thistly centaurea.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
He isn't exceedingly keen
To receive bordetella vaccine,
So he grumbles and fusses.
But later, pertussis
Is not a big whoop—just routine.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
In meiosis (for cells, that's hot sex),
They're swapping their genes, little specks.
These cellular slatterns
Are trading in patterns
Chiasmic: they're shaped like an X.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Back at camp, all the cooks would upset us
With the horrible chow they would get us.
Our request was quite valid:
"A simple green salad.
We'd make it ourselves if you'd lettuce."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
This variable's I.Q. is point two —
He does just what you tell him to do.
"Hold on, stay in place!
Problem solved? Self-erase!"
Such a useful no-brainer.  Who knew!?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm the holder of many degrees,
And my transcript shows all A's and B's.
Ph.D.'s? Listen, I'm
Earning three at a time.
I'm so brainy, I do this with ease.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Grandma threw Grandpa's shirts all away,
As their cuffs were beginning to fray,
And the collars as well.
Now he's giving her hell —
Poor old girl has the devil to pay!

limerick_list.author: Morphiend
limerick_list.text:
I don't know if it's due to my genome,
But I'm dying to actually see Nome.
What I'm sure is genetic
Is my height—it's pathetic!
I'm so short that I married a she-gnome.

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
Alexander the Great conquered Greece,
Or at least a significant piece.
Alexandrian finds
May produce many kinds
Of relics to sell, or just lease.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This geometry textbook provides
A solution that helpfully guides
As I take my exam.
"What's a chiliagon?" "Ma'am,
It's a figure with one thousand sides."

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
The twins (who were monozygotic)
Embraced with a fervor hypnotic,
But their parents, who'd split,
Merely found them a bit
Uncontrollably antimitotic.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
At the pub, I embarked on a quest:
Just what makes a best bitter the best?
And I learned—what the devil?—
It's the alcohol level.
No one cares how the taste is assessed.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Danny drove as though trying his luck—
Suicidal or merely a schmuck?
In the death seat Dee waited
For whatever was fated.
She'd've jumped, but the lap belt was stuck.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The reason I've gone on "vacation"
Is bad: autoimmunization.
My own lymphocytes seek
To destroy me—I'm weak
And defenseless, in constant prostration.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
The acinaces, sword of antiquity,
Once hung from men's belts with ubiquity.
Any Persian or Mede
Likely made his foes bleed
With this blade, which would make them persniquity.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It was gentle—not mean or obscene,
So I laughed at her comic routine,
And I hoped it was slapstick
When, putting on ChapStick,
She swallowed the tube and turned green.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I just love my new hairdo. It's neat!"
I thought not, but one must be discreet.
"A busker did this,"
She went on. I said, "Miss,
Did you have your hair styled in the street?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Go ahead, we'll just call you Miss Ann.
Act as white as you possibly can.
You can pass? We don't care.
Go and straighten your hair,
Dye it blonde, learn to ski, join the Klan.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Activity holiday? Yes,
Sail a yacht or learn cricket, play chess!
But when you return
To your job, you will yearn
To go back on vacation. Confess!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
International finance is funny?
This is more than a strip about money.
What makes Alex a hit?
Dazzling wordplay and wit
Making rainy day forecasts seem sunny.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Our love's endless and can't be denied.
"I will love you forever," you cried.
But I wondered today
If you still felt that way
Since you just thrust a spear in my side.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The remarkable Robert the Bruce
Tried again and again to deduce
Why the spider's finesse
Wasn't crowned with success;
Could there be a moose loose 'boot the hoose?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"In my daywear I won't look all slobbery,
And I think to imply so's pure snobbery.
The gowns that are formal,
On me, don't look normal,
And prices? It's pure daylight robbery!"

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Said the bedbug, "I offer this ring
And a love only insects can bring."
"We must marry, my dear,
But what time of the year?"
"Let us spring for that fling in the spring."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My mother says Roxie's a doxie
Whose gown is held up by epoxy,
And whose billowing chest's
Got two silicone breasts—
But to me she's a fox full of moxie.

limerick_list.author: Lawrence A. Herman
limerick_list.text:
An obscure word is cognominations.
It refers to those short appellations
With which "Malcolm the Maiden"
Or "The Bald" Charles were laden,
That describe someone's traits or vocations.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Have you ever considered the strains
Placed on couplings occurring on trains?
Note, I don't mean the sort
That could end up in court!
No, the kind that a dragbolt contains.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Rosy fingerprints crossing the skies—
From Aurora, the Dawn, I surmise—
Make this day seem too red,
So I'll stay in my bed
With my coverlet over my eyes.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
From his speech, he's no man of the cloth.
He's become most exceedingly wroth
As each bug in his code
Jeers a maddening ode
To the myth that it came from a moth.

limerick_list.author: John Young and Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'm confused, as I'm sure you can guess.
I can't sleep for the worry and stress,
Since I lost our First Folio
And caused an embroglio—
A troublesome, turbulent mess!

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
Some may die in a hospital johnny.
Then again, there is Clyde, and there's Bonnie.
Robbing banks was their game.
"Gun them down!" was the aim
Of the lawmen. Sing hey-nonny-nonny.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Blacksticks Blue is a soft blue-veined cheese
With a hue one infrequently sees.
It's dark amber, and I
Sure would give it a try
Since I'm tired of cheddars and bries.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When our dad bought our first TV set,
All us kids danced with joy, you can bet.
Though the critics found faults
With my brother Bob's waltz,
I drew praise for my fine minuet.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
You've got chilblains and warts on your toes;
All that's painful enough,  I suppose.
Your long marriage just ended,
Credit's overextended.
Barking dogs are the least of your woes.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
A booty-full lass, Mrs. Fidgous
Had wished she were more callipygous.
The surgeon was crass,
As he slaughtered her ass.
Now our patient is highly litigious!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Banzai is a word you won't see
In Milano, Berlin, or Paris.
In Japan the word cheers,
Meaning "ten thousand years,"
While a bonsai's a miniature tree.

limerick_list.author: Mr. Davis
limerick_list.text:
En route to a fine cabaret,
Looking smart in your scarf and beret,
On Broadway you'll find,
As you're losing your mind,
Life is naught but a big cab array.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I must finish this coursework — get through it.
The last time this happened, I blew it.
So what I must do
Is stop sleeping with you!
Did I really just say that? Oh, screw it!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My contract, I've learned, is extendable:
I can stay on my job.  That's commendable.
Life will not be destroyed;
I'll sign up and avoid
Joining hordes unemployed and expendable.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Stressing out at the gym once again,
I came home feeling muscular pain.
Said my wife, "Embrocation
Will be your salvation;
Come here, I'll rub some on your brain!"

limerick_list.author: D Frayer
limerick_list.text:
A singlet (one lens) is transparent,
But its focus is likely aberrant
When color's concerned.
As Newton once learned,
Achromatism isn't inherent.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Aperitifs are the drinks meant to whet
Diners' appetites, yet if they get
One more drink than they should
Before dinner—not good!
Their appetizers are headaches, I'll bet.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak and SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The capillary: smallest of tubes
Bringing blood to your tarsals or boobs.
Red cells from an artery
Feed your brain's smartery
(In eggheads, much more than in rubes).

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Yes, it crops up, not just now and then —
No, it pops up again and again!
Do you rhyme it with rain
And pronounce it "a gain"
Or allow it to rhyme with a wren?

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
If our arteries, muscle and bone
Hurt so much that the pain makes us moan,
Could it be arteritis,
A disease that will fight us,
Attacking ourselves on our own?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Television or radio stations
May broadcast to several nations.
One can tell them apart
Through the call letters' art—
Which provides their identifications.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
When I walked round behind the new colt,
A loud bang caused the young horse to bolt.
As I closed the barn door,
I could hear the boss roar,
"Don't just stand there! Go catch it, you dolt!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This membrane is called Descemet's,
And through it your eyes daily gaze.
It's the layer defining
Your cornea's lining;
If it's thickened, you'll see just a haze.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Some beliefs deem religious affairs
Out of bounds to a person who dares
To make light of a God
Who's supreme. Why, that's odd!
So is mine, but I don't put on airs.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
What's been scripted the guy keeps revising
At his desk; that's not new or surprising.
But while reading the news,
He's been airing his views.
And that's pure editorializing.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When thick ice stops you closing the door
Of your freezer, it's time for a thaw.
So spread towels all around,
For I've usually found
That defrosting means pools on the floor.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Nyah-nyah-nyah, nyah-nyah-nyah!" my son said.
He, with thumbs in his ears — palms outspread,
His fingers a-wrigglin'
And sisters a-gigglin' —
Did donkey's ears taunts before bed.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The centigram isn't much used
In Australia, because we perused
Both the kilo- and milli-
gram, found them less silly,
And centigrams simply refused.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
He's intractable, Jill's new Prince Charming,
His devotion to logic alarming.
He disputes with true zeal,
And his passion seems real.
Such discussional ardor's disarming.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I am flummoxed, bewildered and vexed.
Can't decipher a word of your text.
Scratch my head while I'm waiting —
Your note needs translating.
For now, I'm confused and perplexed.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Inhibitions I gladly let go
To a man who speaks clearly, and so
Just enunciate well—
I'll be horny as hell!
Are you ready to rock?" "I dunno."

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
Some aspects the power plant lacked
Comprised offsets and LAER using BACT.
But the ministry said,
"It's OK, go ahead."
Now the minister ought to be sacked.

limerick_list.author: squid_shirt
limerick_list.text:
As I hungrily sit at my bench,
I ponder my food while I quench:
"If it's  à l'espagnole
In this Spanish-style bowl,
Then why would you name it in French?"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It isn't a hard diagnosis,
In light of how horribly gross is
The food that I eat:
Only fried, only meat.
My arteries suffer sclerosis.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I look back on the deal unbelievingly—
How my broker beguiled me deceivingly.
"These investments can't lose,'"
He cajoled, "Don't refuse!"
Now I'm singing the blues, sighing grievingly.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
With harlots galore POTUS scores,
Which Melania clearly abhors.
Love to know what she says
To our whoremaster prez
(It's Top Secret!) behind their closed doors.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Diagraphical: word for depictive?
I've found evidence—wholly convictive.
(Searching textbooks for words
Is a joy for us nerds;
Can linguistics, perchance, be addictive?)

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I'm accustomed to working with stealth,
Because secrecy safeguards my wealth.
I'm closemouthed, reserved,
And in public unnerved,
So my covertness bolsters my health.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
One will find that wherever one looks,
Bibliopegists seldom are crooks.
They work hard every day
At their craft so they may
Make a living by binding our books.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The officer labeled commissioned
(Not a sergeant) has long been conditioned
To a life free from sin.
If it's trouble you're in,
With cheap sex he won't be propositioned.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq and Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The mustachioed villain comes near;
Snidely's heartless demeanor is clear.
But Dudley, the hero,
Says, "Snide, you're a zero!"
And to Nell, tied to tracks, "Have no fear!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A movie-mad woman named Katie
Is eager to date Warren Beatty.
"Outrageous!" I rage.
"Why, that guy's twice your age!"
Kate replies, "I don't care if he's eighty!"

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A colporter's work, night and day,
Fights the gay, and the gay divorcée,
Wielding Biblical tracts
Against musical acts
And society's moral decay.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
He's a monster, so ugly and tall;
Little children he's looking to maul.
The bogeyman's here—
He will fill you with fear!
(But he didn't scare Lauren Bacall.)

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Gearhart
limerick_list.text:
By Cocytus, the ghosts groan and greet us:
"This Underworld river's sho' beat us!
We's stuck walkin' round
On deez banks underground
Cuz we cain't raise da cash so's yo'll seat us!"

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
My big toe's developed a bunion —
Now the obvious rhyme here is onion.
While OK in line two,
In line five it won't do;
Let the last rhyming word be a funny 'un.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
There once was a little French chamois
Who frolicked on rocks near his mamois.
His blameless young fun
Was then wrecked by a gun,
And he's now washing cars in Miamois.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
All the functions performed by your brain
Have locations we must ascertain.
With help electronic,
Cytoarchitectonic
Research will these riddles explain.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The Decalogue Moses brought down
From Mount Sinai had brought him renown,
But he heard the folks shout,
"What? Adultery's out?"
As each wandered about with a frown.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Let's get earthy!" she purred, in a skirt
So close-fitting and short that it hurt.
I'm a fool, it appears:
For the last thirteen years
She's done nothing but treat me like dirt.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Our gossipry meets once a week.
Our manners are gentle and meek.
We comment on neighbours,
Their leisure and labours,
And tear them apart, so to speak.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
My blood gushed as I sat on my tush,
Feeling bushed; seems my innards went squoosh
When the bush pilot's landing
(For his skills, too demanding)
Bounced over most shrubs but this bush.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
I'm a music tycoon on a roll.
R&B's the domain I control.
I am nobody's fool;
I'm exploitive and cruel,
'Cause I surely am baron of soul.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Want a gemstone, but don't have a mint?
Pick a quartz that's translucent with tint.
Chrysoprase, tiger's-eye—
Their price won't make you sigh.
Cool chalcedony charms with its glint.

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
Now, Connecticut's small, we admit.
In the world, why our state's just a nit.
And we've got a few snobs,
But we're pros at our jobs,
So our income per acre's a hit.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
There's a brash soccer fan from Dundee
Who's, alas, a two-time amputee.
	Though a violent young lout,
	No-one's scared of his clout
'Cause this hooligan's armless, you see.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
I've been eating a bag lunch each day;
From the diners I stay far away.
In a brown paper sack
Is the food that I pack,
Though I much prefer Louie's Café.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Think of plant parts with strange elongation,
Malformation or odd deviation.
Early Engelmann work
Covered plants gone berserk:
Add apostasis as the notation.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
You should never engage with a bickerer —
A petulant, petty fight-pickerer.
He'll quarrel and brawl,
And profess to know all,
When his skull couldn't be any thickerer.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"It's a fabulous social event.
Buy a ticket — it's money well spent."
"While I hear your injunction
To go to this function,
Beheadings I rather lament."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You love windmills?  Try growing the grass
That will give your lawn plenty of class.
If you nurture a lot o'
This Chloris truncata
Your neighbors will smile as they pass.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Having avi- beginning a word
Is a clue it pertains to a bird.
Like the avian flu
That chick's given to you—
You'll feel ducky real soon, so I've heard.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A large ship filled with folk from all lands
Hit a squall and went down with all hands
(Also feet, noses, eyes,
Ankles, shoulders, and thighs,
As the average dolt understands).

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Corners, Tops, Beatles' mops, singing Aces,
Cello strings, card-deck kings, baseball bases,
Mt. Rushmore noses,
Horsemen, and Roses:
All things that have 4 as their faces.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
There are buyers who choose to acquire
Only one artist's work. Some aspire
To buy art, here and there,
Then discuss and compare,
Feeling they've made a deal to admire.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Your visage? Astounding! And so
I must avert eyes or I'll go
As blind as a bat,
For your beauty's such that
Mortal men can not look on you—Oh!

limerick_list.author: FunkyTuba
limerick_list.text:
They're contractions all right, but don't fret.
Honey, don't start your pushing quite yet.
Named for John Braxton Hicks,
This condition just tricks
Late-term uteri: "Ready, get set..."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Just moments ere Donna would don it,
She'd be checking for bees in her bonnet,
Lest some curious thought
Get her fraught and distraught
While she's busy obsessing upon it.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
Though my character you may impugn
As a  goon, a buffoon or poltroon,
To the voters endeared,
I'm respected — revered —
And elections are coming up soon.

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
"This monotonous weather's to blame!"
I hear Solomon crossly exclaim.
"It's annoying, not stopping,
All day drip-and-dropping.
(A quarrelsome wife is the same.)"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We've been criticized lots. Here's the latest,
From a source that we'd though was the straightest:
We're charged with elitism!
Did it lead to defeatism?
Not a bit! We still know we're the greatest!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Dobbin's workday's now come to a close:
Her old feedbag's tied onto her nose.
"Daily dinners of oats
Are my favorite," she gloats.
'Course, she's known nothing else. Her life blows.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I was racing (it helps me relax)
In my Spyder. What power it packs!
Hit an albatross—POW!
Broke my windshield and now,
What's ironic? The spider web cracks.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
Alkene hydrogens—wondering about
How to name them? I'll settle all doubt:
Paired vinylics will stand
Guarding double-bond land,
With allylics the next layer out.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
Do you think that I've lost my allure?
I've tried in my heart to be pure.
I don't disregard sex
Though it tends to perplex,
But my sex appeal—that will endure!

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
An architect plans the design
For a house, or a school, or a shrine.
But an architect bee
Knows just one layout, see:
The beehive's where he draws the line.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This cactus, the cereus, can't
Be considered a serious plant
Since it blooms in the night
Under Sirius light
That is sorrily, starrily scant.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To advance my career, cinematic,
I am shooting a film in my attic.
With my camera and lights
I stage swordplay and fights.
See tonight's? Climb three flights—I'm ecstatic!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Some traditions I wouldn't oppose;
I'd be breeding a scab on my nose.
There are those who might balk
At such mutinous talk.
I dissent, but I'm loath to disclose.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When the wings of a fighter are swept
Towards the back, it is likely adept
At exceeding the speed
Interceptors would need
To succeed and, indeed, intercept.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
Americium's souped-up uranium;
Just add neutrons: come on, use your cranium!
	You should treat it with care,
	It's expensive and rare:
You can hide it beneath that geranium.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Here the river grows lazy and coils
In sauntering curves over soils
All sandy and baked,
Earthy thirst to be slaked;
Onwards, seawards, it languidly toils.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Arara, the cockatoo bird,
Has a call, as you might have inferred,
That's exactly the same
As its palindrome name.
Rara avis just might be the word.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Our cheers are the loudest they've been,
Since our stadium crowd likes to win.
But our team's water boys
Make more-deafening noise.
What a clamorous din, Gunga Din!

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
When my catamaran's in the spray,
Then its mainsail starts tending to sway.
Right in front of the mast
A short stay I hooked fast
And that tightened it. Stay, babystay.

limerick_list.author: natelevin
limerick_list.text:
O cookie!  O noblest of foods!
O lifter of many foul moods!
If oatmeal and raisin
Or chocolate I'm praisin',
No thought of the waistline intrudes!

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
Cross your legs, close your eyes and breathe deep!
You've a date with nirvana to keep.
If you get to dhyana,
You've out-blissed Pollyanna.
Or maybe you've fallen asleep.

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
In a town we once knew as Bombay
(Now for Indians, Mumbai's the way),
They make musicals. Golly!
From woods known as Bolly
Come films that are jolly and gay.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
At a shoot out, the cops — held at bay —
Called, 'Surrender! Come out now — okay?'
But the answer to that
Was a swift RAT-TAT-TAT,
And some bullet holes spelling 'NO WAY!'

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease kills the brain
By destroying its nerve cells; complain
Of dementia, and you
Could have CJD too!
Either that, or you're simply insane.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
There are folks who like food rather bland,
Where all trace of flavor's been banned.
But if I had my wishes,
They'd serve fiery dishes
In every joint in the land.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's Empetrum? Genus of snowberries—
To the Inuit, just-can't-say-no berries.
The color of blueberries,
These sweet tried-and-true berries
Are edible—not merely show berries.

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
Desdemona was wed to a Moor
So misled that he called her a whore.
She was pious and pure.
What she had to endure!
Shakespeare's tragedies all end in gore.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This kayaker's personal goal
Is elusive: an Eskimo roll.
To perform that full spin,
Popping up with a grin,
Demands fortitude, poise and control.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Examine an Amazon's chest
And I'm sure you'll be greatly impressed.
You don't need a physician
To name her condition,
Amastia: missing a breast.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
As to what it might take to compel
Cal to talk? Try a cold day in hell.
When she heard Coolidge died,
Dottie Parker replied
(So the story goes), "How could you tell?"

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Pharaoh Phelpeses, great his renown,
Ordered pyramids built— upside down.
In a very short while,
They fell in the Nile
(Which explains why, once blue, it's now brown).

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
At the play, through an audio mask,
The describer gets on with the task.
For the blind who attend,
It's like having a friend
Who explains things before you can ask.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Said Threadneedle, starting to purr,
"That will certainly never occur.
You can bank on it: that cat
Will ne'er be a fat cat,"
While absently licking his fur.

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
Extracting cube roots to infinity
Can help to preserve your virginity.
When given to boys
This chore removes noise
And creates a more peaceful vicinity.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
CDB! is a  book that I took
From my bookshelf; it's been long forsook.
Each letter's a word;
Using numbers? — preferred.
U-L  C;  U  B  1  4  A  look.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Time to pay. Think our service comes cheap?
Here's your statement — now read it and weep.
Think it's steep? It's not fair?
Well, guess what — I don't care.
Cough it up, man, you're into us deep.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
When converting your attic, peruse
Skylight catalogues—better still, choose
Perpendicular placements
For roof-hugging casements—
Dormer windows give views as you snooze.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
A document captures my thoughts
With some symbols, like numbers or jots
That are stored on a disk
Or some paper—no risk
Of their loss when my grey matter rots.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Bea could never see birthdays with glee.
A comparable outlook might be
Harold's holiday gloom
Over Christmas.  No room
For the bright side discourages me.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
From the fusty Victorian gloom
The bright 'Bloomsberries' let themselves bloom.
Their artistic affairs
Moved in circles round squares
(I forget though just who slept with whom).

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Some cosmetics are made from snail jelly
To smooth out the marks on your belly.
But if you're a mug
And use stuff from a slug,
You'll be wrinkly and slimey and smelly.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
The testing, I know, makes you squirrelly;
The process (at best) leaves you surly.
Grit your teeth. Be tenacious.
It is most efficacious:
Colon cancer's detectable early.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The emcee is obese—roly-poly—
And he answers his phone wholly drolly:
"No, it's not Monty Hall
Who has picked up your call.
Holy Moly, it's jolly Joe Foley!"

limerick_list.author: hermez
limerick_list.text:
My big toe is swollen, no doubt
'Cause my antipodagrics ran out.
This pain is distressing;
Those drugs are a blessing.
They always help out with my gout.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Sleeping, Dad took a consciousness break,
And he didn't arouse to a shake.
We just thought he was dead
To the world, but instead
Here he's dead to the world at his wake.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
My master is out on patrol
To find out if I dug a new hole.
But he shouldn't indict
My effodient rite —
Bowwow arf, that's my bonafide role.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
These seedlings are sickly and small.
Is the climate at fault? Not at all.
Exhaust from the traffic?
No, surely edaphic—
To do with the soil. But your call.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
In a play in a play in a dream,
Things are rarely just quite what they seem.
Through a chink in a wall,
Our two lovers tell all
In the midsummer twilight's last gleam.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My knowledge I strive to enwiden,
So I study Greek gods, like Poseidon.
I'm expanding my learning;
With facts my brain's churning:
Obama's vice president? Biden.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Said the church's conservative minister:
"God declares all these people are sinister—
One who speaks with the dead,
You must chop off his head;
Burn the witch, and then hang the divinistre."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
My dad isn't ruled by the trends.
He contends that contentment depends
On controlling temptations,
Loving all God's creations,
And a circle of trustworthy friends.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Seems an eagle—an egalitarian—
Tried eschewing his diet of carrion.
But he learned, with dismay,
That an old bird of prey
Finds it irksome to stay vegetarian.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My lawyer, Enrico Valenti,
Made it clear I had problems a-plenty.
"Catch you later," I sighed
As he left. He replied,
"If you're lucky, in fifteen-to-twenty!"

limerick_list.author: limarico
limerick_list.text:
'Tween the 70s, 80s meridians,
Pushed south of Punjab's Sattagydians
In the past by Caucasians,
Live darker-skinned Asians
(Once known as madrasis): Dravidians.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
"Your CD collection's a joke,
And classical sucks," yelled the bloke.
My discs couldn't handle
This rampaging vandal:
Now all of my Bach sets are broke.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"They're exaggerated greatly," Sam said;
"Overstatements which make me see red.
Mark my words, I'm unslain.
I am not cleft in twain."
Nonetheless, in due course he dropped dead.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
An old Filipino, Manolo,
Used a long native knife, called a bolo,
To extinguish the life
Of Imelda, his wife,
Pointing out, "When dough's low, you're best solo."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
What's that beautiful barnyard delight?
It's a bovine with plumage (so bright!).
Though I never would lie,
You've a skeptical eye.
You say "Bullfeathers!"  Perfectly right.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Ray's play is a dramatization
Of the crimes of a large corporation.
Though this scathing creation
Won a standing ovation,
It's closed, due to (yup!) litigation.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
She wrote an exhortative note
That earnestly urged me to vote
For whoever should sport
The rosette that she thought
The right colour: in this case — a goat!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
A smelly young student called Howard
Never washed, never bathed, never showered.
He raised his friends' hopes
Buying six scented soaps
But was too scared to use them, the coward!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The singer was called Jussi Björling.
His voice, said the critics, was sterling.
This tenor from Sweden
Made Earth into Eden;
His artistry set the world twirling.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Lament not, in poker, your poor hand;
Just think, it could never be more bland
Than if you foresaw
Every card you would draw,
'Cause you knew of the shuffle aforehand.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Caliciviridae, scientists say,
Simple strands that are pure RNA,
Can produce hepatitis,
And even gastritis.
Let's keep these bad microbes away!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I've a church music problem that's chronic:
Those huge organs, to me, seem demonic.
Though their sound is delightful,
Their size I find frightful."
"Try mine; it is small, electronic."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You ask, "How many yen in a peso?"
I don't know, so you answer, "OK, so
Your calc I will use."
If the tool that you'd choose
Is my calculator, why don't you say so?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
If we etiolate plants, they go pale;
Without life-giving light, they will fail.
In deep shadows, at length,
Plants lose color and strength.
Think of drowning—no air to inhale.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
When we're coming undone, rapport ceases,
And disunity only increases.
Time to break up again?
I'm beside myself then.
Fragmentation means falling to pieces.

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
Cyan's a deep greenish-blue.
It's the blue that your printer can do.
And in CMYK
It's the C, by the way.
Many blues contain cyanide too.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
You're parched, so you head for a fountain.
On a cool draught of water you're countin'
But decide you're not drinking
When you find that some stinking
Galoot spat his wad there—a mountain!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Blue-, huckle-, bil-, all just the same,
As a prefix attached to the name
Of a wonderful berry;
Black- 'n' goose- (that one's hairy).
Fine straw- fields forever found fame.

limerick_list.author: Son of Baltimore
limerick_list.text:
A fisherman loaded his dhow
With more weight than the craft would allow.
A passerby laughed,
"Hey, you're showing your aft!
You've got much too much bait in the bow."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The garden's a jungle of weeds,
Mainly thistles, and what the place needs
Is some elbow grease, vigour
— and mechanical digger!
So we all get stuck in: work proceeds!

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
"This grimalkin will suit our illusions.
She's got over her three spinal fusions,
And though old, she'll find joy,"
Thought Siegfried and Roy.
Their tiger drew different conclusions.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
When golfing, a chip shot's routine
(It's a short, arcing shot to the green),
And no landscaper blanches
When chipping up branches.
As groundcover, wood chips look clean.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Though I'd thought that the loan would be minor,
My credit eye's sporting a shiner.
The collateral angle?
Tangential, a tangle.
I'll lean on my dad as cosigner.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Though a fairy-tale stepmom's a curse,
A stepmother's blessing's no worse
Than a back-friend or hangnail,
An agnail or thang-nail —
A torn slip of skin, says the nurse.

limerick_list.author: kandabongo
limerick_list.text:
Spirits dwell in all things: Though simplistic,
This phrase can define animistic.
Just the thought makes me cower—
That mat in my shower?
I fear it would turn voyeuristic.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Like a tome for an elegant elf,
There it rests on my curio shelf—
Just four inches around,
But most splendidly bound—
It's my bibelot. See for yourself.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a radical, chemists have found,
That in alanines often is bound,
But this alanyl now
Is essential (and how!)
To a word that will truly astound.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
In your mouth goes a protein intact,
Linked by peptide bonds, matter of fact!
Aminopeptidase splits
Off N-terminal bits,
Which your gut will most gladly extract.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
It's hatred toward those with black skin.
In some cultures, alas, it's baked in.
Goes beyond Ku Klux Klan
Or a fear of Sudan.
It's as bad as original sin.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"This breakout suggests that you've crossed,
With your script, all our limits on cost.
If we film in Peru,
We must double the crew,"
Said the analyst working on Lost.

limerick_list.author: hugh.adler
limerick_list.text:
When my metre and rhyme go astray,
This guy fixes them up straightaway.
He (my W.E.)
Has so much NRG
That I call him "Acetyl CoA".

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
As drank is the past tense of drink,
Analogously, you would think
That you'd have to say "thank"
And not "thought." To be frank,
Irregular verbs really stink.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"How circinately fern fronds unfurl
From their stems in an opening swirl,
With an 'eye' at the middle
Like the scroll of a fiddle…"
"Can the mush, Gus; I'm fixin' to hurl."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'm in pain every month without fail,
And I'm leaving a bloody red trail;
I just don't wanna see ya
With dysmenorrhœia.
Next week you can get some more tail.

limerick_list.author: Amelia A
limerick_list.text:
Acolyctine's derived from a plant
With a dangerous sedative slant.
So for making a spell
Or to make beasts unwell,
Wolfsbane works where some other plants can't.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Though cucumber sarnies are posh,
Much less so the pumpkin and squash.
While marrows are edible,
Some are incredible
Decorative gourds — oh my gosh!

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Choose deerskin, an excellent leather,
For gloves that outwear any weather.
Make one then the next, thus,
Left/right, bambidextrous,
Handy pair that you just put together.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
A chap who was musically bored
Changed the fifth of his dominant chord:
By a half step he raised it
("Augmented," he phrased it)—
His V-to-I movement's adored.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
She spoke eloquently, clear and compelling,
So the mob simmered down and stopped yelling.
Most relaxed, even smiled,
Now entranced and beguiled—
Defused, and no longer rebelling.

limerick_list.author: Margaret Ford
limerick_list.text:
She asked, so he tweeted a "Yes".
They wed—it was Twitter success.
When babies were made,
The ounces they weighed:
One hundred and forty or less.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"In a cyber-relationship, Chris,"
Said my lover online, "when we kiss,
I'm not touching your face."
(We don't share the same space,
And a :^* doesn't bring the same bliss.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Whenever I serve a buffet,
There's a chafing dish out on display
To keep food nice and hot.
What an odd name it's got—
It has never rubbed me the wrong way.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
There's a cork tree that grows out in back.
Its bark, once prepared, will not crack.
Thus it wins the award
For Best Bulletin Board:
Pin your photograph up — here's a tack.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
The Blue Riband event can be gruelling
And forbids transatlantic refuelling.
Higher average speed
(Not the time), now agreed,
Is the target of nautical duelling.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
Neolithics who ceased to exist
Were buried inside of a cist:
A pit lined with stone,
Where the dead lay alone
(Not a very nice place for a tryst).

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Look around and you'll see, to your sorrow,
The needy who beg, steal, and borrow
To get through the day,
While the billionaires play
In a world both unfair and bizarro.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Ten French aerodromes, up in the sky
(On a mountain, that is, so "sky-high"),
Are called altiports, and,
Far away from this land,
There's another to which you can fly.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
"Introducing . . . the bride and the groom!"
(As the DJ, I always presume
Sincere happiness rests
In the hearts of the guests.)
Cheers went up as they entered the room.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
The pumpkins I carve go awry
No matter how often I try.
I hear "Oh, my gosh!"-es
When folk see my squashes.
"Just smash 'em and make pumpkin pie!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
In the church tolls a clarion bell;
Whereas at church, the congregants tell
All their deepest confessions
To priests, whose profession's
To listen, at which they excel.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq and Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
When bullies in school say out loud,
"Sam, with brains you're not greatly endowed —
In fact, you're a doofus!"
I say, "I play the goofus —
That's a horn that blows chords." (They're not wowed.)

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Aching joints can't maintain a low crouch,
And with legs tightly bent, you'll say "Ouch!"
As your knees start to hurt—
You'll be snappy and curt
And you'll quickly turn into a grouch.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Navigation seems cryptic and hazy,
Made by programmers stupid or lazy.
The software's a beta,
An unfinished state; a
Consumer who'd buy this is crazy.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
As porcine's to pig (which is clear),
And bovine's to cow, bull or steer,
So elaphine's what?
To elephant? Not.
It's to stag (Cervus elaphus), dear.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
"Mum, your freshly baked cookies taste lush!"
Say your kids, keen to crunch to a mush;
But be ready for crumbs
That don't make it to tums.
Clear them up with a dustpan and brush.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There's a canvas that's blank on my easel.
The size of my customers' fees'll
Decide what I paint,
And you'll hear no complaint.
Want a diesel? A saint? Or a weasel?

limerick_list.author: psheil
SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This woodland Don Juan is a cervid;
Chasing winsome young does, he is fervid.
By antlers adorned,
This buck's horny, not horned.
His repute as a suitor's deservéd.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Covered, close-woven reed basket daubed
With bituminous dysodile bobbed
At the edge of the Nile
Amid bulrushes while,
In its fetor, a baby boy sobbed.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My defailance was dreadful this time —
Such a failure at learning to rhyme!
Of ten words that I picked
That should rhyme with indict,
None was right (which rhymes right!), so sad I'm.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Noah packed them all in? There's a laugh!
No, the Ark lacked the room and the staff.
He just ran out of space,
And the wuffalo's place
Was assigned to a pushy giraffe.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A cone of uncertainty shows
A best guess where a hurricane goes.
Each spaghetti-type line
In a group helps define
A storm's path — where it moseys, who knows.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
As I sit and I ponder reflectively,
I embrace my computer protectively.
Now it's broke, more's the pity,
Since it's from Circuit City—
Should have known it would function defectively.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
When yer out on the booze with yer mob,
Ya should choose a mate:  "Who's Sober Bob?"
Whether straight, gay or lezzo,
Please do pick a deso
To drive yers home safely. Good job.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
A capitonym is a word
Changing sense (and at times how it's heard)
When it changes its case,
As in Turkey (the place)
Versus turkey (the big, stupid bird).

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Acts of state are what governments do;
No one blames them on me or on you.
So we're safe from attack
(For the war in Iraq)
By al-Qaeda and terrorists, too.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"This odd word has me thrown for a loop:
What's an ethnos? I want the straight poop."
"A shared culture or race
Gives this faction its face.
It's a crowd, a discreet ethnic group."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mr. Anthony Comstock—he saw
Dissoluteness in George Bernard Shaw.
Shaw answered with mockery,
He laughed at comstockery
And called it America's flaw.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
His hive is so clean that it squeaks.
Just one spot and the beekeeper freaks.
So he shoots all the birds
That bombard it with turds,
Eats the corpses and heaps up the beaks.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
In the hot Amazonian summer
It's embarrassing being a plumber.
	When the weather is ripe,
	Boas leap from the pipe —
And a death by aboma's a bummer.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Chinese boxes give patience a test,
For inside one another they nest.
You'll find one inside one
Inside one inside one…
And there's always one more than you guessed.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
There's no-one big Bertha can't beat
When she gears up to chow down and eat.
Her gluttonous eyes
Open way past the size
Of her stomach, stuffed full and replete.

limerick_list.author: C. H. Carpenter
limerick_list.text:
When the copier goes on the fritz
And the printer jam sets you in fits,
Time to call it a day.
Hang it up. Walk away.
Lock the door. Close up shop. Call it quits.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
A young music student of Leiden
Decided his tastes he should widen;
Faced with Bartók's Dance Suite,
He admitted defeat
(Until then he'd heard nothing but Haydn).

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle and eris8x6
limerick_list.text:
Agent Orange strips leaves from a tree
With the herbicide 2,4,5-T,
But its trace of dioxin—
A chemical toxin—
Is linked to the lethal big C.

limerick_list.author: Sella Turcica
limerick_list.text:
Bacteriologists live in a daze,
A prokaryotical haze,
So in love with their task—
Growing germs in a flask—
That they don't think to ask for a raise.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
You can trust that I've taken great pains
To assuage her because she complains.
Now, the grouch needs a treat,
So I'm rubbing her feet.
I'm relieved as her grumpiness wanes.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Each year we indifferently gather
For dull food, exhibitions and blather.
My future intention's
To skip these conventions.
Why not read the synopsis? I'd rather.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I shall buy at the duddery, Ruth,
Woolen cloth for a waistcoat. In truth,
That fine houndstooth, I think,
Suits me well, in bright pink.
Then we'll hie to a clothier's booth!

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
The beeps (when I started to back)
So annoyed me I parked the big Mack.
Then I hired a brass band
And the beeping was canned—
We recorded a new backing track.

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
Acupuncture is not a new trend
According to Willy, my friend.
He's familiar with this,
Since his picky wife Chris
Has been needling him, time without end.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We're cutting you loose; you know why:
You've given our firm a black eye.
Keeping peace with our clients
Takes tact and some science,
Not shouting, "Go somewhere and die."

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Besprent is a word from the past;
Its usage today? Far from vast.
Generations ago,
Every priest would well know
It's for those on whom sprinkles are cast.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
There's just one thing I've got to pursue:
That new crystalline Japanese loo!
Made to coddle the arse, its
Encrustation of glass fits
The number, whichever you do.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
An airborne suspension of smoke
Or dust, that could cause you to choke:
It's a toxic black cloud;
Wraps the sun in a shroud —
Air pollution is far from a joke.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Now the end of his lifetime is nearing,
My grandfather's losing his hearing.
I say, "Hi, you ol' sot!"
Then I whisper a lot,
But such cheekiness isn't endearing.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
It's the customable (usual) style:
A proud dad walks his girl down the aisle.
But not mine: I've a father
Who says that he'd rather
His daughter eloped—I just smile.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
What's an anthracolithic deposit?
Well, you've gotten it right on the schnozz: it
Means graphite (How droll!)
Or some anthracite coal,
Which you shouldn't keep stored in your closet.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Trees have fruits like a peach or a plum,
Or grow nuts, which taste better to some.
Though the beechnut is edible,
With flavor incredible,
Don't feed it to Baby, by gum!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
When the butler is sounding the gong,
See their dinner gowns, slinky and long.
But when ladies depart,
Then the menfolk will start
To make bets on who's wearing a thong.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Her students' attempts at blank verse   
Were no match for blank minds, and what's worse,
The iambic they tried
Proved so tough that they cried,
So she steered them toward being more terse.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Avascular tissue's the kind
Without blood (with the word underlined),
Like the lens in the eye
Or the cornea: try
To incise them — no bleeding you'll find.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Is your nation engulfed in deep trouble?
Though you'll risk quick reduction to rubble,
I can offer this cure
(It's the new curse du jour) —
May the West bring you aid on the double.

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
I am sailing in search of some cod,
Armed with hook, line, and sinker — and rod.
But lacking a reel
Or a handle, I feel
A blank rod's blanking useless, by God!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Don't use downplay," my mom will insist,
"Since play down is the phrase to enlist."
"So play up," I then said,
"Can't be upplay instead?"
"No, it can't. Stick to words that exist."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The Abrams: one hell of a tank
With thick armor that tankers can thank
For their lives.  Almost none
Have expired in one,
Though one fell in a river and sank.

limerick_list.author: kandabongo
limerick_list.text:
I'm balancing books for my boss:
i's I dot, funds I check, t's I cross.
It's a balancing act
Between fiction and fact
(Every windfall now looks like a loss).

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
The bank robber's cornered, he's stuck.
Like Clyde Barrow, he's plumb out of luck.
But he swallows the jack,
Throws the cops off the track —
Not the last time he's passing the buck.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
His remarks had been made extemporaneously,
And the audience cheered him spontaneously.
His impromptu oration
Was a comic sensation—
Dirty jokes that he chose miscellaneously.

limerick_list.author: dasharath
limerick_list.text:
If cuisine Provençal you embrace,
Then you must try a good bouillabaisse:
Make a stew out of fish,
Add Pernod to the dish
And enjoy any time, any place.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
I like barbecue; you prefer stew.
For me, only chocolate will do,
While you are a fella
Who goes for vanilla:
I see no accordment, do you?

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Here lies Bob, about whom it was said
That he wasn't quite right in the head.
Is this tribute sarcastic?
It's un-encomiastic.
He'd argue the point, but he's dead.

limerick_list.author: Fringe
limerick_list.text:
Expending the rest of my money
For brandy you say you need, honey,
Is surely no joke,
Because I am the bloke
Who is broke now, and that isn't funny.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
For your ice climbs, prepare with some thought.
There are items you'll need to have bought—
Such as crampons—spiked plates
For your boots—so your rates
Of descent aren't the head-banging sort.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"You'll be needing the patience of Job
If, for dinner, you're craving a daube,"
Was his girlfriend's response.
"I've no herbes de Provence,
And do not say, 'Instead, please disrobe.'"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
While it's true you look utterly stunning,
Delays, dear, I've got to be shunning.
I happened to grab
A damn Limerick Cab
And his anapest meter is running.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A fils is a Frenchman's own sonny,
As in Cyril et Fils, yet it's funny
That in English the word
May also be heard
As a unit of Middle East money.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mamma's shocked and unsettled; she's grieving,
But she just can't conceive of your thieving.
Though she's gone to the jail,
And she's paid for your bail,
She remains unconvinced, disbelieving.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Atheistical? Me, to a T!
Yes, I'm godless. Whenever I see
"God" let hate and want reign
And the good suffer pain,
I must ask, just how "great" could He be?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"When you babyproof something," said Clyde,
"Make sure danger has no place to hide.
Take this room of my son's:
No machetes, no guns,
And I'm moving the meth lab outside."

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
The villainess surnamed de Vil
Wanted furs, and she maybe does still.
She was far past desire;
She was ardent, on fire.
Doramania drove her to kill.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Was your database recently hacked?
Was your pitiful password just cracked?
To get better protection,
Remove the connection—
With an air gap you can't be attacked!

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
I've tried threesomes. I'm quite well-endowed,
But my head wasn't all that was bowed.
For a lively affair
All you need is a pair.
Two is company, three is a crowd.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As every good mom understands,
Proper feeding of babies demands
That you break bulky food
Into bits for your brood,
Or have blue, choking kids on your hands.

limerick_list.author: Colin Salter
limerick_list.text:
There is nothing new under the sun.
What we think of as modern's been done:
To be centrally heated,
The ancients completed
Their homes with a caliduct run.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You're aboard a large ship; things look dire:
It appears you're about to expire.
A Code Bravo's been called
On the PA installed
On all decks. Seems the tub is on fire!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Mrs. Bentz I shall fervently praise:
Sweet Melitta, who launches my days.
Toast the angels who sent her—
The lady inventor—
My well-filtered coffee I raise!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
A cooling coil's made from a pipe
That's helically bent, like the type
Of 'life memory stick'
Found by Watson and Crick,
But with cooling there's so much less hype.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
Is this lampshade antique or just old?
They tell me it's rare.  I'm not sold.
But I had it appraised
And was rather amazed:
It's worth thousands, though covered in mold.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
International dancer and star,
This Ukrainian gal has come far.
In Seville, Ms Shevchenko
Does a frisky flamenco
While some Gypsies play Spanish guitar.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
To play conquian, one of the greats,
Use a deck with no 10s, 9s, or 8s.
You must meld cards to win
Like the rummy game, gin,
And most card-matching games it pre-dates.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
While I was out having a facial,
I talked of our abbey palatial.
I spoke (out of habit)
Of abbess and abbot,
Thus making my gossip abbatial.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
No one knows me. I think it's a shame
That I'm fameless. My family's to blame.
I just called Mom and Dad
And it makes me feel sad
That neither remembered my name.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I adopt many creeds with proteanism,
Like Shinto, Bah'ai, Manicheanism,
But I'm sure this is right:
I say "Europe, unite!"
Yes, I'd fight for this cause: Europeanism.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
Said the bailiff, "Ya see this 'ere capias?"
I looked: I had just been as happy as
Could be; that was gone
As the fellow went on:
"It means I'm arresting your crappy ass."

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
How I wish that a photon eject me
From my valence abode, and deflect me
Not too far from the ground;
I remain Coulomb bound
To a hole. Now just try and detect me!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The bullish investor grows mulish,
Watching stocks going up as-a-rule-ish.
His portfolio's biggish;
He's stubbornly piggish,
And holds after prices get foolish.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The great Daedalus, ancient inventor,
To son Icarus acted as mentor.
He constructed a maze,
Then built wings with wax glaze,
Though he was, in the end, a repenter.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
In list after list, you can learn
It means "guest becomes family." Spurn
That spurious host!
Agenhina's a ghost
Word — a lexical pratfall (from Byrne).

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
When attacked, Mister Bond, you've a flair
For avoiding most blows. But beware:
From the shoe of this "maid"
Juts a poison-tipped blade.
Drat—you fend off her kicks with a chair.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
When a lender is forced to foreclose,
The problem's best solved if it knows
About pricing and selling
Each repossessed dwelling.
The most likely tool? BPOs.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
The Japanese bombers had neatly
Flown into the harbor, completely
Disabling our base.
We responded apace
The next day as we joined the war fleetly.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
To dietary law I stay true.
Certain foods, certain drinks are taboo,
So from these I abstain.
Yet that doesn't explain
Why my weight is 472.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
A type of great whale, which was sought a lot,
Was boiled for its oil, which was bought a lot.
The cachalot, or sperm,
(You may use either term)
Went nearly extinct. It was caught a lot!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Both Darden and Clark had a goal —
Systematically blowing a hole
In the Simpson defense,
But the jury, quite dense,
Freed the killer of Ron and Nicole.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
She's got beauty the world's never known!
She's a queen! She belongs on a throne!
She's exquisite! Ideal!
She's got boundless appeal!
She's so perfect, I think she's my clone!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Imagine poor Wallace and Gromit
On a carnival ride called The Comet,
Where employees are busying
Themselves with the dizzying
Of patrons, who try not to vomit.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Here's a hound with incredible moxie:
The wiener dog, dachshund or dachsie.
Send him into a sett
For a badger? No sweat.
He will stick to the beast like epoxy.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Mahogany, African grown
(Not a monochrome orangey roan),
Lays a color array
Which covers, some say,
The full range of human skin tone.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
That bus over there from Daytona
Is a chatterer, bone-shaker, groaner.
Such a rattly, rough ride
I could never abide
All the way to Queen Creek, Arizona.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Some Velcro has fastened each shoe;
But the loud rasp-like sound gives the clue
That what's been on Tom's feet
Has been tossed in the street
From his pushchair.  He is only two.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"You'll take pro, I'll take con. Then you'll gratingly
Argue your points, but frustratingly
Not choose to fish
Or cut bait, and just pish
At my brilliance," said Thomas debatingly.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Into credulousness she was lulled,
When he swore it meant "apt to be culled".
Cut it out! You believe?
Then this means you're naïve:
Cullibility — girl, you've been gulled.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
As we sneak through the bushes, we'll peep
Round each plant, and then onwards we'll creep,
Through the tall jungle grasses:
First cover our arses—
Then look, check for danger, and leap!

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
When the royals pass, keep them unseen.
Just avert your rude gaze from the queen!
You are common and coarse,
And you'll feel much remorse
If you dare by your stare to demean.

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
Thomas Hobbes said we ought to be glad
To have laws, be they ever so bad.
Lawless life was, he taught,
Nasty, brutish and short.
You want proof?  Take a look at Baghdad.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Your white skin emerging's a clue,
And pink eyes—no usual hue.
Gadzooks—you're albino,
You sweet baby rhino!
We're thrilled you'll debut at our zoo.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Consequentialness makes people feel
That they must be a really big deal.
And the fact that they're right
Causes envy and spite
(Which I'm doing my best to conceal).

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
It has never been known as a glam shaft,
But nor is it cursed as a damn shaft.
This valve-timing thingy
Can't make your car pingy
(No knock). So no knocking the camshaft!

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Periodically, scientists see
A new element (e.g. Np)
That they cannot break down.
Since I boast great renown,
Maybe one will be named after me!

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
Once, leprosy treatment would be
Oil squeezed from the seeds of a tree.
We can all now rejoice:
The new treatment of choice
Is much better, all doctors agree.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
At the dog pound you'll hear caged mutts yapping.
They bark and they howl when not scrapping.
Woofs and snarls from each pen
Induce madness in men,
But, at least, it stops keepers from napping.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
If braised kidney is all that you eat,
That is way too much iron-filled meat.
Take an antisideric
Or else call on a cleric,
For you soon will be dead in the street.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My amiableness comes from my dad,
Who's the friendliest anyone's had.
He's affectionate, warm
(Simply out of the norm),
And the port in a storm when I'm mad.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The consultant's demeanor was gentle.
She knew of my fears, incremental,
Of the sound of my heart;
So she looked through my chart,
Said, "Your murmur, Ms. Blume? Accidental."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Why the gutting of fish freaks me out?
Why I dash from the room, curse and shout?
Just recall how I yowled
The day Dad disemboweled
Little Scout, our beloved rainbow trout.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Al Jazeera bought Current TV,
Which was led by our former V.P.
From a mindset progressive
To anti-U.S.-ive —
No difference as far as I see.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Dirty plates piled up high leave me reeling;
Instant action's a must. I've a feeling
That I'd better get started,
Get weaving, faint-hearted
Or not, before more reach the ceiling.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Tough meat is more easily swallered
If it's decreased in size: i.e., smallered.
In fact, that's what we do
When enjoying roast gnu,
Or our Thanksgiving peccary (collared).

limerick_list.author: skipjordan and Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Though it's not comme il faut, I am sure,
For our rendezvous you're my amour.
But, pardon my Franglais,
It's bound to go wronglais,
When your husband kicks moi out the door.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
She's a dancer, a comic, a star
In the movies. Her name: Teri Garr.
Dustin Hoffman played footsie
With this beauty in Tootsie,
Her most stellar film role by far.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
In a tale where the truth's often blurred,
King-Smith's threatened dodos are spurred
To survive through endeavour—
Could these birds live for ever?
(In real life, extinction occurred.)

limerick_list.author: Philip Chris Erickson
limerick_list.text:
An unfortunate victim of theft
Doubtless hasn't a single cent left.
No nickels or dimes—
These uncivilized crimes
Have left him, of coinage, bereft.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
There's nothing that brought Patrick Swayze joy
On a set like a Martin Scorsese ploy
That involved cool chablis
And allowed him to be
Just reclining at ease in an armchair.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
My accommodativeness now
Is, I know, insufficient, but how
Can I find enough space
To define with good grace
Clumsy words that so furrow my brow?

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
My aloha to you is a greeting
With a kiss and embrace when we're meeting.
And a lei—oh, how sweet
As an extra love treat!
Was it good for you, too, or just fleeting?

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
When Beckett was over the hill
His wit made the odd stirrings still.
He held 'less is more'
For a truth, but his score
Never changed—Questions: one, Answers: nil.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
My entrenching tool can't make a hole,
And that flare means that  Luke's on patrol.
It's near zero degrees
In this Chosin deep freeze.
I sure miss my warm hooch back in Seoul.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
A pass is a way to get through:
At Apache Pass, Texas, the view
Is historic—a stream's
Gravel crossing that gleams
With the dreams the old Spaniards once knew.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Keep your freak hair and nose ring at home.
If you play where the buffalo roam,
Grab a Stetson and beer;
We drink long-necks 'round here,
Not that warm crap all covered in foam.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
The aelurophobe despot's harsh laws
Force his serfs to rebel — with good cause.
So he's catapult-pelted
With kittens, black-belted,
Who knead him to death with their paws.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Bypass doors will slide right past each other,
Since where you have one, there's another.
In small homes, they save space,
Like that minuscule place
Where you put (you cheap bastard) your mother.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
I vellicate, hearing you speak —
Your prolixity's such bad technique.
Eschew obfuscation.
Prefer dilucidation —
At least translate those words from the Greek.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Our footing we couldn't regain
When a death spiral came with its chain
Of misfortune.  Such rippling
Did critical crippling.
Our business was sent down the drain.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
What an alcaptonuric's endurin'
Is homogentisate in urine.
His enzyme for aidin'
Phenylalanine's degradin'
Is lackin'—a fact we ain't curin'.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This poem is lyric, not stony—
Italian, but not by Marconi.
Perhaps Provençal,
Although not by Mistral,
It's the songlike, medieval canzone.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
An angel once visited Hell
To toast marshmallows, charring them well.
When Satan asked why,
There came the reply,
"'Cause I missed s'mores' great campfire smell."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He was costumed as Raggedy Andy,
Climbed my steps, but he kept mother handy.
When I opened my door
And adored what he wore,
I bemusedly gave him some candy.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Entrapment's a means for a cop
To produce a new perp he can pop.
But I think it not nice
To coat Main Street with ice,
Then arrest me for failure to stop!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas and Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Hurry up and start moving your ass
A lot faster.  Don't give me no sass.
(You could speed up our take-off
By taking the brake off.)
Get the lead out.  Yo!  Step on the gas!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
We hail to the president—chief—
In the hope that his tenure be brief:
That he'll do little harm,
Then retire to his farm:
Cincinnatus's civic belief.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Out carousing one night at Cornell,
He was crossing the gorge, and he fell.
The school's chasmed and canyoned;
He was baked, uncompanioned.
Alone, he had no hope in hell.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
On his throne, for his portrait in paint,
'Til dethroned, due to public complaint,
When his dukes overthrew
His regime, in a coup:
One day king, and de-next day, he ain't.
 
He would pose on his throne, in his chair,
Unconcerned by the crowd, unaware
Of their menacing tone,
'Til, at last overthrown
And deposed by the mob in the square.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Doctrinairism — what does it mean?
It seems to see life through a screen
Which filters its bits,
Leaving only what fits
Narrow theories — there may be umpteen!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
There's a rich golden tone to our brew.
Nature's flavonoids lend it that hue.
And there's no call to panic:
They're healthful, organic,
Aromatic—good stuff through and through

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
For ease's and sanity's sakes,
Be thankful for syllable breaks:
Giving words some divis-
ibility is
What defining-by-limerick takes.

limerick_list.author: Rich Ristow
limerick_list.text:
Apocryphally, Dwight likes to write
Many grant letters late in the night.
They have many a fact
That ain't close to exact,
With no credible sources to cite.

limerick_list.author: Ulfras and mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The cannibals start up a waltz
(They can't dance, you know—one of their faults).
The schmuck in the pot
Should be worried. He's not;
He's mistaken the spice for bath salts.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
With authoritativeness, Trump said, "I'm speaking:
It's official — go plug all the leaking!"
From the staff, a bold speaker
Said, "Sir, you're prime leaker!"
She was fired in a Trump fit-of-pique-ing.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
"Ain't nobody can say where he at."
"Dem Ice Creams be smoov, man; dey phat."
"Dis bling bling be onyx."
I'm hooked on Ebonics:
Black English be cool. Dat be dat.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When danger was near, Thor went first.
Though I dared not, that daredevil durst.
I applauded his pluck,
And I wished him good luck,
But I always predicted the worst.

limerick_list.author: Brent Annable
limerick_list.text:
I enjoy spinning wool I can stitch,
And I bought a new batch labeled "britch".
Then I learned it's the dregs
From the tail and the legs,
And so spinning this stuff is a b#@$%!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
All these obits have left me aghast —
How much longer can you and I last?
Though it's certainly great
To reach 78,
Aged cronies are dying too fast.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This'll kill me. I'm well past my peak.
I've been backing and forthing all week.
The wife's belly's expanding;
She's growing demanding—
Gotta shop till her womb springs a leak.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Not age-eligible, barred from the rink,
This fine skater is right at the brink
Of her shot at great fame.
There are those, though, who claim
Her time's now, and are causing a stink.

limerick_list.author: ironmike
limerick_list.text:
ABIOS is BIOS enhanced.
It is firmware that's truly advanced.
In ROM it resides
As nimbly it guides
A computer to get up and dance.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Eichmann, deathsman to millions: "No fear
And no blindfold for me." Made severe
By the great evil done,
Eichmann's deathsman killed one,
And it haunted his dreams for a year.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
I've got twenty-four beers in the fridge,
And some salsa, and hummus, a smidge.
Keep 'em cool, shut the door.
There's Raoul, we've got four.
Now we're ready for Friday night bridge.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
Politicians are very loquacious,
And many of them are mendacious.
With their lies, voters cope
And denounce them (I hope)
In ways that are more perspicacious.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What one word follows elder and child,
Also verbal, both heavy and mild,
And emotional, too?
Then there's self. That's when you
Are alone—don't feel guilty, go wild!

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
Despite being named like a girl, he
Sought fame as a grappler, all burly.
Who'd have thought that small laddie
Would become a Big Daddy?
Don't laugh at his name, though: it's Shirley.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I've been hit by a truck, and a suit
Has been filed by my lawyers—a beaut!
It's the best on the docket;
They've found a deep pocket.
I'll certainly win lots of loot.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Leave the lights on? That's torture, you brute!"
Maybe so, but consider the boot:
Wedge it tighter; he'll beg —
Slowly crush a man's leg.
Is that torture? Not much to dispute.

limerick_list.author: Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
"Nine o'clock's when we killed Mr. Snell."
"No, my dear, it was eight when he fell."
"Now the body won't fit—
Chop it up, and let's split."
"Ah yes, I dismember it well."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Living high on the hog was so easy;
We were happy when life was so breezy.
But I'm aching all over
From walking in clover —
My allergy's making me sneezy.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
To add to your backbone, don't go
Into subjects you really don't know;
It results in retreat.
If you aim to defeat,
You want confidence always to show.

limerick_list.author: AronKuppersmith
limerick_list.text:
Big bad Bluto was Popeye's buffoon.
They would battle throughout each cartoon.
Each loved Olive (Ms Oyl).
Her charms made their blood boil.
With her Swee'Pea, she'd watch them and swoon.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The fat on this hamburger's gealing
As it cools. It's so gross, unappealing —
See — the grease hides the meat!
Now this crap day's complete;
In my belly's a sickening feeling.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The bluegrass and blackberry weeds
Are plants without sexual needs.
What gives 'em their kicks is
Prolonged apomixis:
They clone, on their own, all their seeds.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Dr. Jock said, "It's bad to begin
Juggling chainsaws on stilts — nerves set in.
It's nae fun to tak saw-topplers tae
Dermatoautoplasty
Where grafts will re-site their ain skin."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Our approximate time of arrival
At Howard the Duck: The Revival?
A bit after eight.
Every minute we're late
Increases our chance of survival.

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
In your fiction, a creable land
Must be strictly and carefully planned.
You have to take care
That your sea, land, and air
