Are just right, lest your novel be panned.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The bellwether sheep feels like hell,
Bleating, "Flock-leading's all very well,
But this leader recalls
That he gave up his balls
In exchange for that leadership bell."

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
Sailing close to the wind in a lugger,
All the seamen were bunked hugger-mugger.
When I yelled "Mates! Ahoy!
There's a conical buoy!"
I was crushed in the rush for the bugger.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My new home has no lawn. I'm still grassless.
All my "glasses" are plastic—I'm glassless,
Plus my windows aren't in
As of yet. I just grin
When my neighbors complain that I'm classless.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though this jumbo-leafed plant may appear
In the tropics, the elephant's ear
Can be grown in a pot,
But believe it or not,
Its huge leaves are unable to hear.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Michael Palin arrived (unexpected)
But the torture device Jones selected
Was a dish rack. When used
On a woman, bemused,
No signs of great pain were detected.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I know an old man from Dubuque
Who claims he is not antinuke.
"Blow 'em up," he will say,
"Like 'em better that way!"
One can tell at a glance he's a kook.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's elysian is joyful; it's bliss,
Like a tune a lad croons to his miss
In those heavenly fields,
So she gleefully yields
To a sweet but spectacular kiss.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Evaporated Water", tag read.
Bought a gallon, not using my head.
Next day took it along
On a hike.  Was I wrong!
Shoulda bought the condensed kind instead.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There are glorious globular heads
(Or capitula) seen in the beds
Of chrysanthemums—flowers
Bedecking my bowers
In purples, magentas, and reds.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
In scenarios somewhat surreal,
Blast-proof silos are built to conceal
Skulking ICBMs,
Whose launch surely condemns
Stricken folk to a deadly ordeal.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
You've been seeking both hither and yon
The location of Azerbaijan?
Try the westerly shore
Of the Caspian. Or
Just below, in northwestern Iran.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
A mouse had been warned of the clock:
"It's electric and likely to shock."
This advice went unheeded,
So now what is needed?
A hickory dickory doc.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Such diversity! — change after change
Within life here on Earth. It's so strange:
Across land, air and sea
There's amœbæ, there's me,
And bananas and ducks … What a range!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The dastardly villain's portrayed
Wildly wielding his excurvate blade,
Its edge cleaving the air.
But the good guy won't scare—
He's not there to be diced and filleted.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
As she felt the room spinning, slurred Lizzie,
"Gosh—I'm drunk!  Blame the wine: it was fizzy.
Though I do love champagne,
Both my balance and brain
Disagree, when my head goes all dizzy."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My periods?  Flowers, Mom said.
And I learned that my vulva instead
Was my flower.  Amused
By the terms that I used,
My friends laughed, and my face turned beet red.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As our railroads are broad-gauge, we would
Find your narrow-gauge freight cars no good.
We use all broad-gauged track,
And there's no turning back.
(Wouldn't buy your old junk if I could!)

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
In arrondissement 5, in Paree,
Les putains have such swift repartee.
When we sought a ménage,
We got this badinage:
We asked, "May we?"  She answered, "Mais oui!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Pray, what is the meaning of drearing?"
Asked Kiri, her eyes slightly tearing.
"It, sadly, means 'sorrow,'"
I answered. "Tomorrow
Let's look for a word that's more cheering."

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
DX stands for "distance", my dear,
Used where shortwave reception's not clear.
There is no good exchange
Outside radio range,
So your message is faint, hard to hear.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a small piece of luggage—a case
For cosmetics you put on your face.
Take a break from the rush,
Grab your lipstick and blush,
Pretty up, and get back in the race.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
These are dust covers draped on your chair
And the sofas that furnish your lair,
When you've gone, on your own,
To explore parts unknown,
And your home is alone—no one's there.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
When harsh scolding's dispensed biparentally,
Mom and dad will both rave temperamentally.
They constantly lecture
Till offspring conjecture
A plan to tune out till they're twentily.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
I mildly derided my bride
For childishly chiding our guide
On our honeymoon tour.
She was sooo immature—
That Ghost Train was such a cool ride.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
If you're constant, unchanging and true,
Little number, then we can use you
For molecular counting
(Avogadro's), amounting
To accounting in atomic milieu.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Aurea mediocritas, too,
Is a rectangle known by all who
Praise the Parthenon's features,
Or leaves, or shelled creatures —
Fibonacci's (go google) your clue.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I discovered my delphian node;
Near the top of my thyroid it rode.
Doc removed it; the answer
Was glandular cancer—
Metastatic, the biopsy showed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You have asked if I like Dutchman's pipes.
I'll admit they are one of my gripes.
Many plants have this name
And they're not all the same.
I can cite at least three different types.

limerick_list.author: expat
limerick_list.text:
Old Chemakum's not to be heard,
By human or brown bear or bird.
On the Puget Sound shore,
The tribe is no more,
Since smallpox and war have occurred.

limerick_list.author: Wattlebird
limerick_list.text:
"Please, I need to get out, may I go?"
"You're confined, so the answer is 'no'.
You will no longer roam
But must stay in your home;
It's the virus, not me, that's your foe."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Country A reckons lingerie teases.
Country C says a swimsuit's what pleases.
Between them, one neutral
Remains birthday-suit-ral:
Country B, as their buffer, appeases.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
This direction could fit with legato,
Or perhaps with some notes played staccato,
But always impassioned.
A piece that's so fashioned
Is Beethoven's.  Joy ostinato!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Extremism?  Well, that's the price —
In defense of mouse freedom, no vice.
To achieve that, it's fine
To employ a small mine
To emancipate fellow lab mice!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
This double-named beauty has flanks
With scales like plate armor. Give thanks —
It's a non-picky feeder,
This bubble-nest breeder.
But it jumps, so please cover your tanks.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
When disaster and shame seemed to blend,
I got help from my posh British friend:
"It looks bad, but this tosh
Will come out in the wash —
Things will sort themselves out in the end."

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
He has failed in our contract, the lout,
And he thinks I'll roll over, no doubt.
I have options, I guess,
For pursuing redress.
In a civil court, I'll call him out.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In one of those grim public scenes,
A mom shrieked at two insolent teens:
"So you think you're so clever?
I swear that you'll never
Amount to a damn hill of beans!"

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
Curly grass is a very small fern—
It's uncommon, which causes concern.
With spiralling fronds,
It grows close to ponds;
It's slender and tufty in turn.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
"I'm up in the air—I'm aloft!"
Cyril said; but his dad only coughed.
"Very funny, my lad,
But you must think I'm mad;
You're my first-born, not airborne," he scoffed.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
In New Zealand, the skiing was ace!
I would ski with my buddies and chase
Down the slopes of Mount Cook,
Where, by hook or by crook,
We would race to the base of the face.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
If you're heating your water up, hot,
And a pound's the amount that you've got,
Each degree you go through
Requires one BTU
(For an hour, three-tenths of a watt).

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Roasted witch, poisoned food, butchered toes —
Grimm's too grim for young minds; out it goes!"
Until Bettelheim said
That it's good for the head:
Both enchanted and chilled, a child grows.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
When I mention the name English bond,
Don't be fooled or misled, don't be conned.
It's a pattern of brick,
Not an agent who's slick,
With a licence to kill—and a blond.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"Make me envoy to France!" was his chant.
But Guiteau was told, "Sorry, we can't.
An ambassador must
Be a man we can trust."
So he shot Garfield down in a rant.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Will a bar printer print out your tab
While you wait with your date for a cab?
Not at all. Nothing lingers;
To and fro speed its fingers
(On a bar), while the back-hammers jab.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
"Do it ASAP!" she said, her voice edged.
For a comeback, my brain I had dredged.
Then suppressing my laughter:
"I'll do it soon After
September or August," I Pledged.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Great aunt is the name you would call
Any aunt of a parent. That's all.
Despite how it sounds,
She's not 200 pounds,
Seen in B-films, some 50 feet tall.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
When Phil kicks a ball it won't roll;
It will fly like the wind through a hole.
This one glanced off my head,
Barely touched, but they said,
"Well placed; a superb headed goal!"

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Encephalography has several kinds.
One type reads people's brains (not their minds).
There electrodes are placed
On the scalp where they're spaced
Such that printouts form clearly, one finds.

limerick_list.author: psheil and Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
With science, it's truth that's our aim;
What is written in Scripture's just claim.
Where we see contradiction,
We know that it's fiction.
Forgive them, in Charles Darwin's name.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Being cardiogenic, the pain
That you're feeling comes not from a sprain,
But instead from your heart.
No surprise when you start
Shooting heroin, speed, and cocaine.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I have many a pain — there's no lack.
Lots of parts of me feel out of whack.
When the doctor asked, "Where?"
I replied, "Here and there;
Mostly dorsad, I'd say — towards the back."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
In our boat down the river we go,
But we don't need to paddle or row.
See that shoal of gold bream?
They are heading downstream;
Like the fishes we'll go with the flow.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The cephalochordate is prone
To hide in the sand when it's grown.
It is shaped like a sword,
And its nerves form a cord,
But it hasn't a spine made of bone.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
A collector of rocks and of blocks
Sought a means of securing his stocks:
"I have geodes galore,
Chunky slabs by the score;
What I need is a boxful of locks."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Not in church, this fine pair were wed secularly.
Though too small to be seen by us specularly,
When two molecules joined
A new compound was coined,"
Cried the chemistry prof, "bimolecularly."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
My atheist friend's evangelic:
"The only spots heaven- or hell-ic
Are those we've created.
The Bible is dated,
And God's an irrational relic."

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A religious fanatic named Bell
Breathed his last and was cast into Hell.
He complained, "It's not fair!"
Satan scoffed, "I should care.
Save your prayers—God's indifferent as well!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
With the building ablaze in the night,
The equipment's just sitting there tight.
For an aerial ladder,
There's little that's sadder
Than firefighters fearful of height.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A career in chiropody? Sweet!
I will join the physicians' elite!
(Till the strain of podiatry
Leads to psychiatry,
Haunted by horrible feet.)

limerick_list.author: lopey
limerick_list.text:
Although aproned to keep my front dry,
I was spattered with grease on my thigh.
I was forced to conclude
That to fry in the nude
Is a horrible way to get by.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Szechuan chicken's a hit in Beijing.
Escargot gives a Frenchman his zing.
They're too fancy, I say.
In the U. S. of A.
Earthy meat and potatoes are king.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
The centner or quintal's a weight
That I hardly can lift, it's so great.
Be it kilo or pound,
When I try it I've found
That sore muscles are surely my fate.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
Abrachia-racked chimpanzees
Get terribly troubled by fleas,
As without arms attached
They're unable to scratch.
Sadly, nor can they clamber up trees.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm aware ecophobia's odd.
"You're uncomfortable home?" Here, I nod.
"Folks wherever I roam
Say, 'There's no place like home,'
And I always reply, 'Yes, thank God!'"

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
He was lazy, bereft of ambition,
So he ceded his potent position.
His abdicated seat
Is in want of fresh meat.
Contact casting. Arrange an audition.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
You pester and plead and cajole,
Till it feels like you're boring a hole
In the side of my head.
You have bullied and pled.
I give in, have your way, claim a goal!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When she called me a dabster, I wept,
As I thought she had found me inept.
It was hard to accept
Till reality crept
In—by golly, she means I'm adept!

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
First, our eyes meet; it's pure electricity.
Then my heart skips a beat. What felicity!
Then my heart skips again.
Well, to hell with it, then:
Gotta stick with my ticker's cyclicity.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
If you claim to support benefaction,
Then your boasting is just a distraction.
 There's no "Charity Show";
 Just go donate some dough,
For a word's not as loud as an action.

limerick_list.author: Morphiend
limerick_list.text:
Trump's toadies say, "You are the Man, sir."
When he claims fossil fuels are the answer
To our energy needs.
Wind's a source he concedes,
But a wind turbine's noise causes cancer.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Through my childhood I slept on a pillow
That was stiff and as scratchy as Brillo.
When I tried to complain,
Momma cried, "You're a pain.
Why it's smooth as a soft pussy willow!"

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Study termites; you'll come to believe
Their allure is a pure joie de vivre.
In their burrow or mound,
What's the first chamber found?
Copularium! Can you conceive?

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
My face is contorted and twisted
In a grimace. My dentist insisted
On drilling my tooth
With no numbing (Forsooth!)
As she knows I won't pay. I'm tightfisted.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The savage young Beatles could play
A whole album of hits in a day.
Please Please Me still pleases
The lads and their squeezes
In Liverpool, oop round are way.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
If you steal my dimensions, I'll fight:
Being out of my depth isn't right;
And I'll fight to the death—
To my very last breadth—
If you threaten my length or my height.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
'It belongs to my dad' could replace
'It's my dad's', but five words need more space.
So let's keep the count less;
Use apostrophe s:
With this, dad's is the genitive case.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
This oddly named band was, no joke,
Bubble Puppy; they hit with "Hot Smoke
& Sassafras," seen
On the charts at 14;
But no more in the limelight they'd soak.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
In the president's speeches, he'll pause
After lines he hopes garner applause.
With these statements he hears
Neither clapping nor cheers
But just silence or jeering guffaws.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In my youth it was hard just to smother
My desire for a beautiful lover,
But after one night
My desire took flight.
Learn—you can't judge a book by its cover!

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
When viciously casting aspersions,
Or making vindictive assertions,
Be careful, you see,
'Cause then you might be
The target of nastier versions.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
A back and forth's sometimes a drag
When the argument's hitting a snag.
With respect or disdain,
There is something to gain—
But indifference? Go pack your bag!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
They're exploring in depth. Soon we'll see
Just how deep their inquiry will be.
As they dive into files,
Of which there are piles,
Will they dig up my wiles? Lordy me!

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Able seamen are surely no dopes.
Sailors follow the stars with their scopes.
They excel in particular
In matters funicular.
They are expert in knowing the ropes.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
As I swing on the porch with my fellow,
We've a feeling of peace; we are mellow.
Few mosquitos will bite,
Since my lovely bug light
Bathes the porch in a glow that is yellow.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A dear friend, of his own daft volition,
Tried to drive in an awkward position.
He sat on the wheel
But then sighed, "Oh, I feel
I've adopted a bum steer condition!"

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
I'm a fact-checker, checking the truth
Of that stuff we call "news". I'm a sleuth
Who gives journos the terrors
By finding their errors,
Driving writers en masse to vermouth.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The trouble with bitty wee mouses:
They insist on invading our houses,
Where they nap for the day,
But then happily play
And carouse with their minuscule spouses.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Al's an anchorite, lives like a moose
In the woods, a religious recluse.
As a hermit, he'll spend
Days in prayer without end,
But for me, I would say, "What's the use?"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
At Harrow, the bill is a list
To record all the students who missed
Or attended. This tally
Tells boys: "Those who dally
Will suffer a rap on the wrist!"

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
In Hawaii, a brief exegesis
On life and its roots was my thesis.
It brought me no joy
That my helping of poi
Was a playground for biopoiesis.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
I'd been searching for bargains in Beares
Without finding a trace of such wares.
Then I saw in their basement
This sign of displacement:
"Bargain Basement on Fourth Floor Upstairs".

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My thoughts on this word are predictive:
Diagraphical's meaning's restrictive,
And the word diagraphic
Yields no added traffic—
It's a synonym. Both mean "depictive."

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
"The chaos in here," said my boss,
"Or a rock you can't climb is called choss";
But the chaos my boss meant
Wasn't what my friend Ross meant
When he slipped climbing choss slick with moss.

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
I've a cold. Can't you tell from the goop,
From the viscous gelatinous gloop,
From the jellylike blob
I expelled from my gob
That now wobbles and bobs on your soup?

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Why is charlatanism ignored?
Are my colleagues all busy — or bored?
Blushing charlatans, they
Maybe don't wish to say
Cheating's something they all have explored.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"I just love being green," said the frog.
"That color's just right for this bog.
Between yellow and blue
On the spectrum… Hey you!
Don't sit down! I'm no bump on a l…"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"April Showers," a singer may croon,
With a promise of joy coming soon.
He'll remind us that May
Isn't too far away
In this Silvers/De Sylva-penned tune.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
The twins soiled their diapers, no doubt,
And the odor is grossing me out.
Will you change those poor girls
Before somebody hurls?
Take the diapers off, someone. Disclout!

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
"My electrified fence—best not touch—
Is protecting my critters and such."
That was what I had boasted
Till cattle got roasted.
Could twelve thousand amps be too much?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Black comedy doesn't require
A Cosby or Murphy or Pryor.
It's humor with bite,
Pretty morbid, that might
Knock 'em dead at a funeral pyre.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Down south, Dave will take sweet Regina
To visit the local cantina.
They'll drink lots of wine
Till the stars start to shine,
Then they'll walk all around Al's marina.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
They all loved New York's Chelsea Hotel.
Those with talents were handled there well:
Dylans, Thomas and Bob,
Arthur Clarke at his job,
Others plagued by some personal hell.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
A bouquet for my date?  I feel powerless —
There's so little time, and I'm showerless.
But lucky for me
She prefers gluten-free,
So she won't mind at all if I'm flowerless.

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
I really will have to chastise
My canary; he sits there and sighs,
He shuns alpist, his feed
(That's canary grass seed),
And has dark circles under his eyes.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
The decolling took place late at night,
And the deathsman's swing veered to the right.
Half her head hit the ground
With a dull thudding sound.
Said the axeman, "Who's blocking my light?"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Just how many home runs are bat-able
Per game? Is the record come-at-able?
If my son keeps on slugging
And stays free of drugging,
Will baseball teams find him compatible?

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
A new husband, who yelled himself hoarse,
Screamed, "It MUST be a matter of course.
With no coffee filter
A brew is off-kilter.
I swear this is grounds for divorce!"

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
The crotchety tutor told Bev,
"I told you to play alla breve.
That means a quick duple,
My quavering pupil,
So crank it up. Give it a rev!"

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
What is estivating? How to beat heat
By sleeping all summer — so neat:
I seek out where it's cool
And still wet, as a rule,
So by autumn I'm fit to compete.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Were the earth to revolve n:1
On its annual trip 'round the sun,
Then the years wouldn't leap
Each quadrennial sweep —
Making common years special to none.

limerick_list.author: laurajhawk
limerick_list.text:
The OEDILF has some byzantine rules
To prevent publications by fools.
Workshops, holds, RFAs—
It's like walking a maze,
But ensures those approved are the jewels.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My chiropteran pet turned thirteen,
And the party I threw her was seen
By my buddy, who's Jewish,
As sort of a newish
Bat mitzvah. (You know what I mean?)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Celebrification — "Great pecs!
His physique has me thinking of sex."
Calm down, fourth estate.
Though he's cool and looks great,
Drooling's something the public rejects.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
As he slathered his pancakes ambitiously,
His siblings addressed him suspiciously:
"That Log Cabin's for all!"
"But my flapjacks are small."
Unobserved, Tom still poured surreptitiously.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Burundi's a nation that's poorer
Than nearly all others. It's sure a
Locale that's had more
Than its fair share of war,
And its capital's called Bujumbura.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
How are you, pal? Let's sit doon thegether;
We can chat. Aye, let's have a good blether.
Family well? Nothing new?
Aye, the same for me too...
Dum-di-dee... Wid ye credit the weather?

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Drive the limo?  My parents won't let me.
Where's that driver they promised to get me?
Now my driver's appeared:
It's a golf club.  They're weird,
Going out of their way to upset me.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Allow me to say, here and now,
That meanings abound for allow:
To permit by intent
Or to fail to prevent;
To assign or concede or avow.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
I promise to you I'll bequeath,
From the heavens to Earth underneath,
The lighthearted glow
Of folks in the know
And a full set of thirty-two teeth.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A funny old bird is the eccle,
Going PECK-peck-peck-PECK-peck-peck-PECK all
Day long in his tree.
He's a woodpecker, see,
And a right royal pain in the neckle.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
At the bus stop, we'd wait in the rain
For the bus.  People called us insane
For our flirting while waiting.
It led to us dating,
And now, a new name she will gain.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
My libertine lover shows freeness;
Takes liberties. Oy, what a Venus!
Feel free, Aphrodite:
Shed nightly your nightie...
(I swear: there is nothing between us.)

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
I've put vitamin pills in this jar,
Some water, some rocks, and some tar.
  Now I stir with a knife
  Till it blooms with new life
And autogeny makes me a star!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Ed Wood had a hidden agenda
When he starred in his film Glen or Glenda.
He appeared in pastels
And was no Orson Welles
But, like Brando, coulda been a contenda.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The beef plant has leaves that grow red,
So for planting in gardens it's bred.
This perennial herb,
While its tint is superb,
Is a medicine too, so it's said.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Out West, where the dust often scuttles
And rain falls in rather large puddles,
My brother and I,
Along with Aunt Vi,
Have farms that share borders (abuttals)!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In session (or that's my impression),
The Senate employed its discretion
To annex the Southwest—
Their obsession, or quest,
Later known as the Mexican Cession.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
On some laws not yet thought of before,
Ludwig Boltzmann found out so much more
Than some colleagues could bear;
But two great ones still share
Names of laws we can never ignore.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As it's processed, take care not to spoil it.
It's helpful to add to the soil; it
Is called biosolid.
Its origin's squalid:
The stuff that we flush down the toilet.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
He thinks that he's catching her eye,
While he's angling for bluefish, but why
Does she sidle up to him
As if she just knew him?
She's eyeing his catch for a fry.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Ms Harriett Elizabeth Cow
Was a teacher (though unemployed now).
It's reliably claimed
That this puppet was named
For Fred's aunt in real life, I avow.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Near the launch pads whence space shuttles soar,
Merritt Island hosts herds of wild boar.
Sus scrofa's sharp tusks
Carve the ground as their musks
Turn their squeals to a deafening roar.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
As a cuckoo, I don't build a nest
Because other kind birds do it best.
Is it asking too much
That my egg joins the clutch?
And for this, I am known as a pest?

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
If your humorous, written creation
Comes with pages of dense annotation,
Then the force of your spiel
May be less than ideal:
Your jokes need too much explanation.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
Tempestuous winds swirl and blow,
And a scent in the air speaks of snow.
Every offshoot and bough
Bears a cicatrice now
Where each beautiful leaf used to grow.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
I puzzled and stewed, my heart sank.
I  brooded; my mind drew a blank.
I'm told, "Please to remember
The fifth of November."
(Could that be the weekend I drank?)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A psychosis is rife in Albania
That the doctors have named "U-Haul-mania."
With Europe they're fed up.
They want now to head up
And move to Monroe, Pennsylvania.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I was liquor dependent at first,
Then with Xanax abuse I was cursed.
My dreadful affliction
Has a name: cross addiction.
Now I'm heroin-hooked. That's the worst.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My job at the airport's a drag,
And my back problem's raised a red flag.
My condition is owed
To the luggage I load
And unload.  This just isn't my bag.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Moses claims an acute asbestosis,
Though it isn't the right diagnosis.
Shaken up in a crash,
He is looking for cash—
It is called compensation neurosis.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My sister's a nun and a mystic;
My brother is sweet and artistic.
My mother is proud
Of them both, but feels cowed
Because neither is capitalistic.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
An amen: it'll come at the close
Of all prayers, or be uttered by those
Who are making a point,
Emphasized to anoint
An opinion that everyone knows.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
While this could be regarded as quaint,
When I'm hurt, it's a massive constraint.
I get breathless and dizzy,
Since, quiet or busy,
All hospitals make me feel faint.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You declare that you'd like a critique
Of your highly developed physique.
Well, your buff, sculpted torso
Would appear even more so
With a larger external oblique.

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
Got a coin where one image prevails
On both sides (thus two heads or two tails,
One reversed)? That's a brockage
And caused by a blockage
When the process of minting coins fails.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Where a printing faux pas was concerned,
Charles the First ordered Bibles be burned.
That adultery bit?
It says Thou shalt commit....
(Not omitted).  I stopped when I learned.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Czechoslovakia's no more intact:
Into two parts the nation was cracked.
Czech Republic does great —
Czechvar beer is first-rate!
Pilsner Urquell is too — that's a fact.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I am a beagle-at-large.
When my nose detects chow, in I barge.
I'll never stop begging
(For food I keep egging),
And isn't the beagle-in-charge?

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
A virtuous dame on a tour
Prattled on about helping the poor.
She admitted to qualms,
When dispensing her alms,
Because some of the homeless weren't pure!

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Liu and Ramos, two heroes in blue,
Lost their lives to a mad killer who,
In cold blood, shot them down
To "avenge" Garner, Brown.
This vile cretin then took his life too.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
He wore a red fez. What a hat!
His routines were so perfect and pat.
With his quips fast and strong
And his tricks (that went wrong):
Tommy Cooper, a star, "Jus' like that!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"All my capital's dead!" complained Mel,
"Stocks and bonds earning zip. What the hell?
I've some cash that I keep
'Neath the bunk where I sleep,
And it's doing exactly as well."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In his memoir, Sam tends to fantasticate.
Rigid truths he will soften—elasticate.
Though a drop-out, his spin
On the facts is: "I've been
To a Jesuit school—a scholasticate."

limerick_list.author: Quickbeam
limerick_list.text:
The aerosphere's barely a ghost
Of a gaseous layer. At most,
It's a hundred miles tall,
Yet without it we'd all
Very quickly be nothing but toast.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"This calendered paper is glossy,
As it's pressed by machine," stated Flossie.
"So it's hardly a wonder
That we use it down under
For posters we Aussies find saucy."

limerick_list.author: psh and danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
Practiced colature (straining technique)
Is performed by top chefs as we speak.
While just pasta some sieve,
Many others may give
A fruit sauce or a soup a nice tweak.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
"Discriminately" doesn't explain
The way we burn bones. We maintain
And, in fact, guarantee
That, yes, all men are cre-
mated equal (so ghosts can't complain).

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
"In the courtroom, I hope to elicit a
Mistake," said the clever solicitor.
"The accused said his sister
Was living in Bicester,
But I'll prove his sis is in Cirencester."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
From where has that aircraft just come?
Or where in the loaf is one crumb?
Parameters three
Give the answer, you see:
They're cylindrical coordinates, chum.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
In the Great War, the dawn patrol flew
As the sun was just rising to view.
They would charge up their guns,
Keep their eye out for Huns,
In the hopes they could shoot one or two.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"I think tumor reduction is wise,
So debulking is what I'd advise,"
Said my doc.  My approval
I gave for removal.
A portion is what they'll excise.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"What's a congress boot, Mom? I've no doubt
It means kicking a senator out—
Through impeachment, I'd guess,"
Stated Tess, in distress.
"Ours is crooked. Let's boot out the lout!"

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Götterdämmerung! Total collapse!
It's the time when society snaps!
The demise of the gods!
Good and evil at odds!
Is it worse than Sharknado? Perhaps.

limerick_list.author: Michael Daws
limerick_list.text:
My odes are beginning to irk,
And my ballads have sent me berserk.
Though I've sat here for hours
Setting verse to the flowers,
No sonnets to bluebonnets work.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A tenant of land for some years,
Or for life, needn't shed any tears
When wood he requires,
Say for fences or fires:
Estovers rights banish all fears.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Top American chestnut?  This renders
Two choices as leading contenders:
The tree that's so grand
For the shade it gives, and
"Why do firemen wear red suspenders?"

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
We had flirted; my niceness impressed you.
Then you sneezed; I'm polite, so I blessed you.
Well your head twirled about;
Vomit gushed in a spout.
It would seem my short prayer dispossessed you.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
When Edward, the victor at Crecy,
Decided that more might be less, he
Said, "Let's make a meaty
Great Anglo-French Treaty
And stop all these wars; they're too messy."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
From its blossoms, a lovely perfume
Fills the air when this vine is in bloom.
Chilean jasmine is fine
In a garden like mine;
Brought inside it brings scent to each room.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Our executive: how he's enstyled
Must be set, be he loved or reviled.
"Your High Mightiness," "sire,"
Or "This Flintlock for Hire"?
"Mr. President"—forceful, yet mild.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Lots of beer and tortillas I'll buy, oh,
For my party on Cinco de Mayo.
It's a day set aside
Here for Mexican pride.
I've forgotten the date, so I sigh—oh!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Not a suitor since moving to Perth!
Seems of suitable men, there's a dearth.
Aussies' manners appall me;
A "Sheila" they call me,
Though my name has been Bertha since birth.

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
Now the weather has warmed, I admit
I'm a farmer at heart, and it's fit.
Green from brown is my thing;
I can't feel part of spring
Till my hands have been dirtied a bit.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Among memories, this I don't treasure —
The teacher who preached antipleasure.
If we giggled at some
Little joke or chewed gum,
She would cancel our recess at leisure.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Knobbly apples, so sour and green!
But, for cooking, these apples are seen
As the best fruit supplies,
Sliced and sugared, for pies:
Oh yes, Bramleys are fit for a queen.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"My skin's getting crapy," I whine.
"You mean crepey," he said.  Okay, fine.
I look really crappy.
"One face-lift, and snappy:
I demand a new dermal design."

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Said a flounder whose future looked grim:
"Oh, I'll never fit in. An assim-
ilator would mark
The approach of a shark,
And take trouble to learn how to swim!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With punctata, I'm sure that no kid'll
Say this acne is much of a riddle.
In each open sore
That you care to explore,
There's a blackhead stuck right in the middle.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
"Being earnest is," Oscar once wrote,
"Quite important." He added (I quote):
"Lose a parent — that's sad;
Losing both though's a tad,
Let's say, 'careless'. Pray, Worthing, take note."

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
For shoppers in search of a deal,
This closing sale's useless, I feel.
It's a trade made by pros
In options, to close
A position that has no appeal.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In our class, this old cup is the Grail.
More canvas, more wind — we'll prevail.
Make this glorious yacht
Show us all that she's got.
We're leading. Keep crowding on sail!

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Two hydrogen atoms, concussed:
One's electron was lost; they discussed—
"My friend, are you sure?"
"Yes, I'm positive!  You're
Now the headbanger here who's nonplussed."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The dignified king, among gentry,
Was hailed by a uniformed sentry,
And acclaimed, in the main,
But a lad made it plain:
"Look, he's starkers!" The truth wrecked his entry.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My pre-arranged husband's Todd Rodham.
My parents asked, "Know where we got him?"
He's the dregs and a sap,
Lazy ass piece of crap.
"Let me guess.  From a barrel, the bottom."

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I went to apply for a job,
Stripping kernels of corn off the cob.
With each passing ear,
It grew ever more clear
I'd become one of Les Miserables.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My artation — compulsion — soon grew.
I asked, "Love, have you strong urgings too?"
My gal needed no prod;
Her sweet head gave a nod.
She then quipped, "Shall we skip to my loo?"

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
When the cliff swallows come back to stay
For the summer in March, they don't play.
No, these birds do not shirk;
On their mud nests they work
Till the house sparrows chase them away.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Nurse, bag him!" the doctor had said,
And I thought, Is my grandfather dead?!
But the bag in this case
Was placed over his face
To assist with his breathing instead.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
To depolish means take off the shine
From an object or something that's fine:
Make a slick surface worse,
Or degrade a good verse
To make too many syllables in a line.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An axis of symmetry's straight.
It's a line to which figures relate
By defining two sections
With matching reflections.
The left has the right as its mate.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Transubstantiation, it's true, has its backers,
But I am amongst its attackers.
This doctrine's a dud:
They say wine's really blood—
And the wafers? Flesh! Bud, they're all crackers.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Lots of veggies, fresh fruit, and whole wheat—
Diet's building blocks—foods you should eat."
When she gave this advice
I said, "Better think twice.
What's a building block made of? Concrete!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Can you find me a plural for egg;
Not a current, but old word?" asks Greg.
"One that calls like a siren
For attention is eyren,
But please don't revive it," I beg.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Deliber means "carefully weigh
Every possible factor that may
Help in getting things right";
This takes time but it might
Save your cash at the end of the day.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Boring marriage? Ah, well, that's the rub. He
Was once very sociable. Clubby.
Then stylish, now grubby,
He's widened to "stubby,"
A pleasant but dull chubby hubby.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
The government does take in money,
But it spends even more! That's not funny!
It must borrow to make
Up the difference; we wake
To the federal deficit, sonny.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
You'd be thrown into jail for contempt
For appearing in court so unkempt
And bedraggled and lousy
And scruffy. You're frowzy!
But since you're the judge, you're exempt!

limerick_list.author: Edmund Conti
limerick_list.text:
The next time you spy a young cholo,
Please note that you won't see him solo.
He runs in a gang,
And they all like to hang
With their pals, but they're not playing polo.

limerick_list.author: A. M. Warren
limerick_list.text:
Some kid in PE told a shocker:
Bacteria lived in his locker!
(What bio-class beaker's
As rich as old sneakers
And socks full of microbes from soccer?)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Out of style, this poetical tactic
Strove to teach through its verses (didactic).
Now our textbooks are tomes
That do not contain poems.
Verse is personal, moving, climactic.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
A thousand regrets; it dismays
Me to distance your amorous gaze.
Such sorrow and pain
I am under, it's plain
I'll be briefly defining my days.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
British (B.) Racing (R.) Motors (M.):
Jo Bonnier, Graham Hill drove for them.
'62 saw their thrill:
F1 World Champion Hill!
When he died, B.R.M. lost their gem.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Doggoned bus driver passed me again,
Hasn't paused here since heaven-knows-when!"
I complained. "He won't halt!"
Pop replied, "It's your fault.
Try the bus stop; he'll stop for you then."

limerick_list.author: Renate Baird and SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He invested his money in skis' wax,
Which he made very cheaply from trees' wax.
But he would not explain
Either losses or gain.
All he said was: "That's none of your beeswax."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Jeannie's new electronic machine
Sounded just like a drum. Mom was mean
As she howled and avowed
That its sound was too loud:
"Play it, Jean, in your grandpa's latrine."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cousin Jay gave a crazy oration,
Maintaining our planet's salvation
Will depend on its loss
Of the whole of its moss.
He explains that it needs emuscation!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Cure the beef, let it pickle in brine
(Argentinian cows provide mine):
I just open a tin,
Slice it up, stick it in
Between slices of bread — it tastes fine!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
If you're looking for noble and nice,
Many fictional heroes suffice.
If it's cynics you seek,
With a violent streak,
Antiheroes are sure to entice.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I love road trips, and I'm a survivor.
I believe I'm a true defensive driver.
I stay present, keep cool,
Heed the "two-second rule,"
And when tired, I'm a stop-and-take-fiver.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I have had a dispute with my wife,
And this argument's changing our life.
She declares that she's ripe
For a strong James Bond type
When, in truth, I am more Barney Fife.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick and Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
A boxer gal, doubtless with clout,
Invariably won every bout.
As she squeezed through the ropes,
Her coach had high hopes,
Saying,  "Go for it — knock yourself out."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A deed we would label felonious
Is criminal—that's not erroneous,
But the sound of that word
Is the sweetest I've heard.
Yes, to my ear it's music—euphonious.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
Where's the crow's nest? It's not up a tree;
It's as high on the mast as can be,
Where a man will look out
And no doubt   give a shout
When he sees there is land out at sea.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A radish they like in Japan
Is the daikon, and now I'm a fan.
Be it cooked, be it raw,
It's a root that I chaw
With great gusto whenever I can.

limerick_list.author: LMAK
limerick_list.text:
Glucose bound into saccharide rings;
Chained together, rings form sturdy strings.
Polysaccharides long
Make the cell wall so strong.
Thank you cellulose: greening our springs.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
An aquerne did greedily gnaw
At an ackerne (a squirrel I saw
Chewing fruit of an oak).
Then the little guy spoke:
"I can't wait for my apples to thaw."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
That philatelist, what a disgrace—
Penny Blacks stored inside an old case!
That's what albums are for:
Keeping covers and more
All together in just the right place.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The chinook took a look, as it swam;
"I'm a schnook! It's the Bonneville Dam!
All its monstrous concrete
Will mean certain defeat!
I'm a sorrowful salmon, I am!"

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman and neilski
limerick_list.text:
Johnners gave me a stare cold and chilly
When I claimed that he'd said something silly.
Best of in-the-aisles rollers
I laughed at: "The bowler's
Holding, the batsman's (yes!) Willey."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The left costoaxillary vein
In your chest is a vessel that's plain—
A mere triviality
With no personality—
But you need it, so let it remain.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This home's listed; all builders beware.
See that fire mark? It's always hung there.
Once it said, "I'm insured."
Those days gone, it's endured.
Let it be; they're increasingly rare.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
All the Juniors, Americans, Pips
And Romantics had songs on their lips,
Making lead singers shine
But not crossing the line:
Backups harmonize; mustn't eclipse.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
There are exits that end with no pang
Of remorse, or a knell's muffled clang.
Thus this chapter I'll shut
Not with whispering, but
An explosive, loud noise called a bang!

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
Full of joy, full of happiness, glad
Or gladful was Brad as a lad.
As an adult, however,
And not at all clever,
He thought that his life had gone bad.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
On a recent South African stay,
I explored Table Mountain one day.
This Capetonian site
Is a tourist delight,
With a wonderful view of the bay.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Some chessmen I played with last night,
On a chess board with squares black and white,
Were hand carved. The queens' faces
My memory embraces—
They sure were a beautiful sight.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
I'm a surgeon without circumspection,
In need of a corpse for dissection.
Though grave robbing's shoddy,
I've ordered a body
From snatchers—Express Resurrection.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Atossa was daughter of Cyrus
(That emperor, brave but acquirous).
In his play called The Persians,
Old Aeschylus' version's
A portrait of her on papyrus.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A cadge-gloak's a bloke who will beg:
"Could you spare me a crust, or an egg,
Or a spoonful of stew,
Or a farthing or two,
Or a slice of roast lamb (loin or leg)?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Dissolution of marriage: a phrase
That implies you have seen better days.
While a term like divorce
May seem harsher, of course,
They're the same in all meaningful ways.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Through the Blitz lived a glutton so round
He was used as a blimp to confound
Hitler's Heinkel night fighters,
Till, downed by the blighters,
He cratered eight acres of ground.

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
By the door in a Tokyo bar
Stands a man with a Turkish cigar.
See, he's not from Japan—he
Is Azerbaijani.
He caught the wrong plane in Dakar.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The home-owning music professor
Became, all at once, an aggressor.
When told that his taxes
Would treble, with axes
He levelled the luckless assessor.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Your chuckles are put to the test;
Your guffaws are observed and assessed.
Cachinnation, we learn,
Is a function of turn.
Laughing last is the one who laughs best.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Cash or plastic, sir—stop taking on.
No one's said you've attempted a con.
By the time a check's bounced,"
The owner pronounced,
"Both food and consumer are gone."

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
It's at 440 cycles per second
That the modern "A" standard is reckoned.
It's been sharper and flatter;
We needed the matter
Resolved, and this round number beckoned.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Jack's AWTF, the poor guy.
"That's "away with the fairies," I sigh.
He seems lost and confused
So this shorthand is used
To imply he needs help to get by.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
After nearing a lair on a dare,
Cousin Mary was mauled by a bear.
Now in hospital, she
Is as sick as can be,
But alive due to critical care.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
What's the chance of my staying?  Remote.
I'm a drifter.  Not one to devote
Too much time in one place
Or one job, I keep pace
With my aimlessness; onward I float.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
My barking mad neighbour, Louise,
Has cut down my Leylandii trees!
She maintains, "It's my right!
My available light
Was cut down when they swayed in the breeze!"

limerick_list.author: Graham Guest
limerick_list.text:
A crotchety colleague cried, "Cue it!"
But I quavered and yelled, "I can't do it!"
"You must play now, right here!"
So I staved off my fear,
And then picked up my horn and just blew it.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A Biltmore stick's neat as can be.
It's a way that I measure a tree
And determine how thick
Are the ones that they'll pick
To be felled (once the cutters agree).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
It was quite a tumultuous scene
As I showered and ten or fifteen
Men in blue said, "Get dressed,
You are under arrest!"
But I said to them, "Coppers, I'm clean."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Don Carlos: infante, pretender—
A Spaniard who, forced to surrender
In Carlist wars, fled
To la France, where he led
An existence removed from all splendor.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I enjoy looking back, reminiscing:
Puppy love seemed enough, nothing missing.
Now my life's in full swing,
And I love the real thing,
But I still get a charge out of kissing.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Counterpressure is sometimes applied
When you're hemorrhaging badly inside.
It's a treatment for shock
By a medic or doc
That's employed on an ambulance ride.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
For years, for revenge I had bided
My time, till today I decided
I had to let go
Of the secrets I know.
Now that dirtbag's disdained and derided.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Coprophagy's what the scatophagous
Coprophagans dig while coprophagous.
Though dung beetles do it,
I think you would rue it —
You'd cough up your guts and oesophagus.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Classic "Classico", sung by the D,
Has a video kids shouldn't see.
Lasting less than a minute,
The F-word is in it
Nearly one dozen times. (That's for me!)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There is nothing in life I recall
That disturbs me as much as a brawl.
Though I try from each angle,
There's nought in a wrangle
That might recommend it at all.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Build new swimming baths? I say, hear hear!
Filled with asses' milk? That will, I fear,
Never get off the ground;
It won't happen. It's bound
To be dead in the water. Try beer!

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Some belongings are properly chattel:
Clothes and furniture, horses and cattle—
They're your things (no debate),
But you don't own your mate.
Wives a long time ago won that battle.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"What's euphrasy (eyebright)? A plant
Claimed to help fix ill eyes," said my aunt.
"Might it cure my dry eye?"
"Why, let's give it a try —
I don't know if it can or it can't!"

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A top foxhound must run without flagging.
Our whole pack has that knack (I'm not bragging).
Need hunters with bottom?
Our kennel has got 'em.
They'll finish the chase, tails a-wagging.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Young Louisa marked each jot and tittle
As she wrote of four daughters, all little.
"Women need to be heard.
Gender bias? Absurd!
Wooden prejudice—that's what I'll whittle."

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
Good gracious! Tenacious the  -acious!
This suffix should be so audacious:
Inclined to be found in,
And even abound in,
Thin adjectives grown to capacious.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
When doo-wop was pretty much through,
A once Bronx, New York, street-singing crew
Found brief fame.  Their one hit?
"Remember Then."  It
Made a name for The Earls ('62).

limerick_list.author: D Frayer
limerick_list.text:
An armed brigand said, "Give me your stuff!"
I said, "No!", and quite promptly the tough
Had committed the crime,
Taking every last dime.
And to think, I believed it a bluff.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Electronic funds transfer's superior
For payments; it meets all criteria.
In a flash, the amount
Will depart my account,
Reappearing, I fear, in Nigeria.

limerick_list.author: Bob Colonna
limerick_list.text:
I knew a young lady named Mary
Whose consonants often would vary.
Her v's were like b's.
Then she got a disease.
I inquired, "Are you sick?" "Beri-beri."

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
I just cashed a convertible bond.
(Of share swapping, I've never been fond.)
With new bills in a bag,
The top down on my Jag,
I might meet a convertible blonde.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
When crime's overwhelming the nation,
Biology brings inspiration:
Since it seems all else fails,
We're now building more gaols.
Anti-crime? Try cell proliferation.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In a total eclipse of the sun,
A remarkable sequence is run.
Baily's beads will appear
Round the dark lunar sphere—
Awesome beauty that's second to none.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our cabal had made plans to displace
The old duke, thus debasing His Grace,
But the plot was revealed
When an insider squealed.
Now we're facing a capital case.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An evening at home with the Mahlers:
"I said birth control, Gus!" Alma hollers,
"I had asked if you'd please
Go and buy IUDs—
What you brought was Australian dollars!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Hey BENNY! Yeah, you! What's yer beef?
You can spare me the attitude, chief!
If you give me more sass,
I will kick yer damn ass,
And your stay on our beach'll be brief!

limerick_list.author: Harper
limerick_list.text:
When alarum is called in a play,
The cast scurries every which way.
All the actors take flight
As if in great fright,
And the villains get cleanly away!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Crested penguins are found near New Zealand,
Requiring cold water and free land.
Some are rare, and I would,
If I possibly could,
Grant these species a safe-guarantee land.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
With small windmills and bridges and stuff,
Funny tunnels and hills, there's enough
On this crazy golf site
To frustrate and delight:
Family fun, yet remarkably tough!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
She's too sylphlike, too flawless of face,
An embodiment: beauty and grace.
Though perhaps not intended,
She's annoyingly splendid —
A polestar to all in the place.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Southeastern Missouri's appeal?
For soybeans, the land is ideal.
Called the "bootheel," you know,
It's "BOOT HEEL" even though
You would think that it should be "boo-THEEL."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
They're sites of deboshment, by gosh —
Twin sin cities.  In foulness, they slosh.
Don't say "Sodom" (begorra!)
Or mention "Gomorrah".
Your mouth out with soap, you should wash.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Having circled the pugilist thug,
I then gave him a skull-ringing slug.
His nose freely bled
Like a fine Bordeaux red:
He'd a crack in the claret-filled jug.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Your due credits, unless you decline,
Will appear in a courtesy line.
You produced it, you own it.
Now it's apt that fact's known. It
Attributes a name to design.

limerick_list.author: bill ricker
limerick_list.text:
Tina asked a smart gard'ner just what
Aegiceras might do for her plot.
He responded to Tina:
"It's just a verbena.
It'll help, but it won't add a lot."

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
In the era of mainframes, before
PC World was the meaning of "store,"
When a magnet's polarity
Stored each bit's parity:
Memory then was called core.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My employment? I study the cell,
Where the genes, in the nucleus, dwell,
And I chart their morphology.
This cytobiology
Serves science—and pays pretty well.

limerick_list.author: Nan
limerick_list.text:
Van Gogh, Baudelaire, and Verlaine:
Considered, by some, quite insane.
Their emerald-green drink
May have led, so I think,
To absinthism, wasting the brain.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
I have hiked the Canadian Shield;
Sensed the might that a glacier can wield —
As though great taloned hands
Once ripped through those lands,
Leaving scars where the bedrock has healed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Let us ponder the vanishing condor.
It is found in the Andes, out yonder,
And may end up extinct,
As its future is linked
To our Earth, whose resources we squander.

limerick_list.author: Jared Wright (LimerickLife)
limerick_list.text:
The audience tried to be civil,
But their graciousness started to shrivel
When, as dotery  spewed,
The comments were rude
On the speaker's ineffable drivel.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
There's a queue for the mikvah? That's fine.
My defilement's not "standing in line".
The ritual purity
Gives me security;
Making my body a shrine.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Doc performed the  colloidal gold test.
In your shoes, I'd be beating my breast.
There are outcomes; of those
That your CSF shows,
Neurosyphilis isn't the best.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
To Hermes, in winged sandals shod,
The caduceus (white-ribboned rod)
Gave the power to harm
Or to heal and to calm,
As a tool for this messenger god.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
When Chief Shoe Thief returned from his toot,
He canned me. I'd kept stolen loot:
One right boot.  (I'm bereft
Of a leg, yes, the left.)
Got the boot, but did not get the boot.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Please sneeze into your elbow, they said,
So wherever you touch, germs won't spread.
I agreed, and behold!
Now my joint caught the cold.
See that point? It's all swollen and red.

limerick_list.author: Robert Schechter
limerick_list.text:
You know that a study's controlled 
When half of the patients enrolled
Got placebos instead
Of the drug, and they're dead,
While the other half just got a cold.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
The bride had her wedding in June,
Said her vows underneath the full moon,
Kissed her soldier goodbye
On the 5th of July—
Who knew she'd be widowed so soon?

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
My poor home's in complete disarray!
The domestic help's been here today,
And while scouring for Flash,
She unearthed my whole stash
(Which explains this exotic bouquet).

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Bud, deliver — it's cold out — this packet.
You should rug up, and dub up your jacket;
And dub up the house,
Or some criminal louse
Will break in while you're out, and then sack it.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Proud in bright orange scales that adorn ya
("Don't swim near our eggs, mate, I warn ya"),
Go boldly, old goldie,
Bravo! Garibaldi,
The state marine fish (California).

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
This treaty necessitates tact,
Not your "bull in a china shop" act.
The less bombast is used,
The more tension defused
And less chance that relations get cracked.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In fifty-five fiction, you write
A short story that's pithy and tight:
Beginning to middle
To ending—don't twiddle.
You've fifty-five words to delight.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
When a farm worker, out in the field,
Finds an insect pest newly revealed,
That's a biofix time;
Opportunity's prime
To count heat units. Bugs' fate's now sealed!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Pope Christopher (let's give three cheers)
Was a pope for one thousand-plus years!
Yet today, check the list
And his name will be missed:
He no longer appears with his peers.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
At a uni, in gaysocs, you'll find
Fellow students. Their outlook of mind,
If you're lesbian / gay,
Will be just the same way
As your own. For support they're designed.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Please excuse me—may I interject?
Is this woman you hope to elect
One we'll come to admire,
Who'll stand firm under fire?
Our choice must exact great respect.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Needing drink in continuous flow,
We all tote this wherever we go:
Bottled water's a must;
In that wet stuff we trust—
Then we need to go pee, as you know.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The runner's begun to beware
Of her muscle that's shaped like a pear,
For her own piriformis
Is grown too enormous
To fit when she sits in her chair.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When I'm writing, the words catch and etch
Used as rhymes are not much of a stretch.
Shouting, "No!" some say, "Batch
Is a good rhyme for catch."
Adding, "Your pairings make people retch!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This bookmarker's all that it took
To make sure that whenever I look,
I resume at the last
Page—not one I just passed
Or a page far ahead—in my book.

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
One odd little atom was sad;
His friends called him perissad lad.
But according to Bohr,
With one particle more,
He'd be artiad, even and glad.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
If your food-pipe is feeling constricted,
And you wonder with what you're afflicted,
It's time to face facts:
Tell your sphincter "relax!"
Achalasia's how doctors depict it.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Stay outside and keep watch — you're the crow.
If a copper comes 'round, don't you know,
Just ring at the bell
Like you've something to sell.
We'll go out by the back, and not slow.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
A detective inspects with a view
To dissect all the facts through and through,
Thus examining parts
In the hope that he charts
A detectable truth or prime clue.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When Bonnie, a bonnie fine lass,
Is a bunny, her costume seems crass:
Silken rabbit-ears flare
From her tangle of hair,
While a cotton tail sits on her assets.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The wine in these glasses we're clinking
Is fruity and sweet: easy-drinking.
High in alcohol?  No.
So the chances are low
We'll get drunk to the point that we're stinking.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Callisteia are often the prize
To the easiest ones on our eyes.
In antiquity, Greeks
Thought the homely were freaks
(Or, at least, that is what I surmise).

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My hat has a body that's flawed:
Its foundation is crooked, by gawd!
I'm shocked it was stocked
By my hatter and blocked
By a blockhead—both guilty of fraud.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
You say that you've flown from Peru
And we handled your baggage for you.
I can see from your face
That we've misplaced your case.
But don't fret. We might find the odd few.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
Calvin Coolidge was once the VP
Back when Harding was President, see?
But when Harding departed
This life, Coolidge started
As Prez in the year '23.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Deplorably written, played boringly"—
Thus my pan of the play, penned  deploringly—
"This flop deserves censure.
Its viewers, I'd venture,
All drowsed in their seats or slept snoringly."

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
There was a young man of Tralee
Who drove (quite fast) into a tree.
He wailed, "Where's the bar?
I've banjaxed me car.
Won't you buy me a Guinness or three?"

limerick_list.author: D Frayer
limerick_list.text:
Now Abraham (boy, was he zealous!)
Said, "Fellas, the girls will be jealous!
Let's find a sharp flint
And try not to squint.
It's time that we all get apellous."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
As a frugivore, I do my bit
Eating fruit, and will pass the odd pit.
It's a plan, universal,
For much seed dispersal.
The process: ingest and emit.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Noted Ilsa, a tear in her eye,
To her Vic after Rick said goodbye,
"Casablanca was neat,
So please order, my sweet,
A gin rickey for me as we fly."

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
One could pity Saint Thomas Aquinas;
He worked for so long to define us,
Though the logic he sought
And the Bible God wrought
Were at odds with each other — a minus.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Leave this little privy?  Absurd!
I won't go, and I do pledge my word.
There's a rat in this crapper,
And I'm going to trap 'er;
I'll stay here and won't be deterred.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Would you stand by your man with a gun?
Are you true or just in it for fun?
Would you pay off his debt?
Would you aid and abet?
Just how deep does your loyalty run?

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
"Did the film of the concert get big?"
"Not too bad, Meg, it's just half a gig."
"What, you missed a whole half?"
"Don't be silly!" I laugh.
"It is 500 megs, Meg." "I dig!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Here's a pope who is easily missed:
Held the job for one month (I'd be pissed!).
"Don't get comfortable, please."
(So said Otto.) Now he's
Tied for tenth on the "Shortest Reigns" list.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
There's a gizmo they call a collider,
With congressmen smashing inside 'er.
Tiny particle beams
Threaten tax-cutters' dreams,
And its budget won't fit in a rider.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The cudgels some pirates will choose,
And will use to bruise enemy crews,
Can convince the king's guards
That defeat's in the cards—
With an offer they cannot refuse.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Sigyn said, "I'm about to explode-a.
Loki, this Edda's done; there's no coda.
It is open and shut:
You made monsters, you mutt,
With that frost-giant slut Angrboda."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It sells playthings of marvelous sorts
And equipment for little kids' sports.
It's a landmark; what's more,
It's my favorite store—
The cool toyshop called FAO Schwarz.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Some advice, 44, served up free:
Don't misunderestimate me.
A ghostwriter somewhars
Is typin' up memoirs
Restorin' my rep.    —43

limerick_list.author: Benton Randall Olmsted
limerick_list.text:
He's clearly the boldest and brightest.
This diplomat's teeth are the whitest.
He's ambassador-at-large.
Yes, it's he who's in charge.
Of what, you ask? Haven't the slightest.

limerick_list.author: Pete G.
limerick_list.text:
At Amsterdam airport, the lack
Of forethought caused Seamus some flak.
"Your visit, you've stated,
Is business related?"
"Oh no, I'm just here for the craic."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
On the tree trunk it's hard to ignore:
It's a bracket-like fungus. What's more,
It produces and stores
Then distributes its spores.
It's a conk. And the tree? Lost the war.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
She's a goal-directed (purposive) gal
Talking weddings and grammar with Hal:
"We'll be saying I will,
But I'm arguing, still,
That, instead, we should go with I shall."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
A garbage disposal, you'd think,
Has no purpose outside of your sink.
But when lesser things fail
To make juice out of kale,
It's a whiz at preparing your drink.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
All secular pleasures she'll shun:
The cenobite—she is the one
Who's contented to care
For the needy, with prayer,
As she's living the life of a nun.

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
If we all will stay strong, never slack,
Then our enemy won't dare attack.
We think peace is a surety
Through collective security.
They attack one, we'll all whack 'em back.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev and Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Clomipramine lifts your depression
Or your state of compulsive obsession;
It also can aid
With those times you're afraid,
Your neurotransmitters to freshen.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Abjudication—judicial rejection—
Should rest upon just circumspection.
But the judge who decided
That my claim's misguided
Will pay, should he seek re-election.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A blabbering bantering bandit,
Who was rustling a cow, went to brand it.
But his plans had come out—
They'd been bandied about—
So the theft didn't go as he'd planned it.

limerick_list.author: WordWeaver
limerick_list.text:
The inspector shrieked, "Health violation!
Disgusting!  This dive's on probation!
You put that on a plate
When it dates from '08?
Even rats would choose flat-out starvation!"

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
With his opulent bling, Mad Macleod
Down in Aberdeen draws quite a crowd.
He wears trews with brocade,
A bold necklace of jade,
And a fine sgian-dubh made of gowd.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
We'd been boozing it up, and were willing,
But the sex wasn't very fulfilling:
We were short on technique,
With our flesh proven weak,
While our spirits arose from distilling.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
You're deceptory.  Here's what you are:
You're a fake, ethics well below par.
You're deceptive, you trick;
You're mendacious and slick.
You're a phony; I think you'll go far.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The FDA regulates drugs—
Not the kinds that are peddled by thugs,
But the treatments medicinal
You'll be needin' when kissin'll
Infect you with mono-type bugs.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle and Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Haemoglobin's the reason blood's red.
Too anaemic, you'll head for your bed.
Its four haems are the key—
Each contains an Fe.
Keep your corpuscles fed or be dead!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
To be clear, sir, I don't give a whit
If a fruit's flesh adheres to its pit.
Either type is my thing:
Both the clingstones that cling,
And the freestones that don't, are a hit!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Twenty years' worth of lessons and please!
I sit down at the keys and I freeze.
How's my Beethoven? Lame.
And my Mozart? The same.
I can't even play "Chopsticks" with ease.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The trouble with school bands is that
Nearly all the young players play flat.
But the worst noise of all
Ain't the clarinets' squawl
But the sound of a horn going "Blat!"

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
Tasty tidbits will lighten the mood,
Lift you up when you're sad and subdued.
No morsels are moister
Than fish roe and oyster —
Ain't  daintrels the choicest of food!

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
Diphenoxylate: treats when I'm faced
With that "Skip to my Lou" kind of haste.
My loo's door's left ajar—
I can't make it that far?
Kitty's box is strategically placed.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
Sick of low-carb regimes? Feeling jaded?
Try my diet, the best yet created!
Eat cream pies in huge mounds,
And lose fifty-five pounds!
(Hope you don't mind your legs amputated.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
All my buddies said, "Try almond milk!
It's delicious; its texture's like silk."
I believed in them, but
After squeezing a nut
Felt betrayed by false friends and their ilk.

limerick_list.author: buttonbright
limerick_list.text:
There's nothing so prone to abraid
Sleepy kids as a band on parade.
They fidget, they shout,
And they caper about,
While their folks pray to heaven for aid.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When a shrieking soprano appears
With a Valkyrie's breastplate and spears,
That's a clue to determine
The opera's in German:
A warning to cover your ears.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Emissory: word that," said Sy,
"Has two different meanings that vie
With each other—no doubt.
One is this: 'flowing out,'
While the other's 'an agent or spy.'"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Amid rumors of sleeping her way
To the top, she's resigning today.
She's amidst and among
All the chicks getting stung
By the gossipy games people play.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The body began to  decay
At the foot of the bed, where it lay.
He had murdered his spouse
In their house—what a louse!
'Twas the odor that gave it away.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
Long ago, when I visited Florence,
The rain fell in buckets and torrents—
A flood so complete
It submerged every street,
As we watched in dismay and abhorrence.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
On X-Y draw a circular zone.
Add more circles on Z. It's well known:
With a rigid parameter,
Decreasing diameter,
At d = 0, a cone!

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Oh, it's bank paper. What a surprise.
It's so strong and so thin I surmise
That its grammage is fifty,
Which makes it quite nifty
For folding five fruitflies — lifesize.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
The time's running out for him fast,
Though he's started to catch on at last
That he's a dead man
Who's still walking. The plan
Is that his time with us is now past.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"A distinctive and singular feature
Of this goatlike and ungulate creature
Is his bluish-gray coat.
Hail the bharal!" I wrote
For my college zoology teacher.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There'll be abendmusiken all week,
But that concert last night was unique:
A liturgical air
Titled Handel With Care
And the requiem  Haydn Go Seek.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Ettore Artini's acclaim?
There's a mineral bearing his name.
It's artinite—the ore
That allowed him to score
(And gain fame) in the carbonate game.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What enravishes me? My fine wife?
No! With verse my existence is rife!
I love limericks and write
Five-line gems to delight.
(Some day soon I must get me a life.)

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Cost-effectiveness means when you weigh
What you spend (that's the price that you pay)
Against all that you earn,
You might finally learn
You have money to burn—and can play.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
What was Africa's very first name?
Alkebulan. Now ain't it a shame
That they changed that cool moniker.
Was it flushed down a donniker?
Greeks and Romans are likely to blame.
