limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Debbie dated a chauvinist.  Itchin'
To bed him, she ended up ditchin'
The guy.  She asked, "Zack,
Do you wanna come back
To my place?" and he cracked, "Where, the kitchen?"

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
A wreath made of briar and thorn
Was the crown that they used to adorn
My Lord's brow as they mocked.
I am sure they were shocked
When He rose from His grave Easter morn.

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
Do you light Sabbath candles on Friday?
"Yes, I do," said the Jewish mom. "My day—
Friday night—candles blessing,
With tradition not messing,
I make Shabbos, the big don't-ask-why day."

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
With a verb, you can use conjugation
When addressing a word's variation;
But you should be exact,
Scientific, in fact,
So avoid any verbalization.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Patrick pointed the gun right at me.
He was livid, I plainly could see.
While at gunpoint, I said,
"Yes, your wife's in my bed.
Care to join us? One more would make three."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
With his priests giving in to temptation,
He kept secret their child molestation.
No remorse or chagrin
For his cardinal sin
Of protecting his organization.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
Now, catch is a game you can play
With your kids, in the garden, all day.
All you need is a ball
They can hold—i.e., small—
First you throw, then they catch.  You're away!

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
"If you steal, from the mine, copper arsenide,"
To the youths of his flock explained Parson Hyde,
"There's no court prosecution,
But a simple solution:
You'll get tanned by a big copper — arse 'n hide."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I recall when Kirk Gibson played ball
For Detroit and LA.  He stood tall
In both power and speed.
Playing hurt, this tough breed
Hit a Series pitch over the wall.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
Summer's baby got stolen?! But wait—
Turns out Brick's not the father, it's Nate
Or his evil twin Bo!
All the twists on this show
Leave me breathless, shocked. Gasp! Jax killed Kate?!

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
The sea's  cyclobranchiate critters
Have never been thought of as quitters.
Those gills 'round the edge
Of their bodies, I pledge,
Are marks of these prize boat-hull-sitters.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Total cloudlessness reigns in a sky
Clear and black, with the moon riding high.
Winter stars before dawn
Glitter brightly. They're gone,
As the sun applies tender blue dye.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Ship alarms must quite promptly advise
In event the bilge water should rise,
So all crew members know
Of unusual flow,
And take actions their captain deems wise.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
This limerick-writing is not
An art that I practise a lot;
Is it five lines, or four?
Or perhaps even more?
I fear I know diddly-squat.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Brush an ember, your hand jerks away,
'Cause an efferent nerve's saved the day—
You'll need fewer repairs.
The swift message it bears
Leaves no choice, and your muscles obey.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
Evolution is how we progress
To achieve our genetic success.
There are backsliders, though
(Like my daughter's new beau),
Who must still prefer apehood, I guess.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
His anagram sounds rather swell.
No reason why Toto can't tell
That toot and not Otto
Is part of his motto —
And a palindrome word it's as well.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
From league-leaders to poor cellar-dwellers,
We Aussies are AFL fellas
(Keep your hockeys, your soccers
And rugbys, you knockers),
True-blue, through and through AFLers.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A Laredo bond salesman whose passion'll
Assure that his trading's irrational
Will lose on each order,
Both sides of the border;
His bad reputation's binational.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
In no way is this self-adulation,
But I ponder my place in creation.
So, where do I stand?
While my life is not grand,
Maybe egoism aids my salvation.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
I'm texting and whadayaknow,
My butt sends alerts from below.
Since I share every deet
With a post or a tweet,
I inform all my friends, "gtg!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though his writing was often erratic,
Pa's will was concise, brief, commatic:
"My fortune I leave
To my pet beagle, Steve."
I was crestfallen. Steve was ecstatic.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
They say that I'm clumsy — all thumbs.
Woe is me if that day ever comes!
Instead I have toes,
Lined up in neat rows.
I use them to calculate sums.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Punning Jane said to Henry, "Let's ponda.
Yes, absence makes hearts grow much Fonda.
But if love grows no stronger
While absence grows longer,
Try presents." (That pun is a shonda.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I open the door, there's a man
Who insists he was sent by McCann
To deliver my car,
And he's driven it far.
He explains it's a driveaway plan.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Up the Empire State Building, there's
A climb of some 2,000 stairs.
And on Floor 102
There's a deck with a view
(And a heartbreaking shortage of chairs).

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
For that cow, little dog cries a lot
(Jumped the moon, broke her leg, and was shot).
Now the dish is soon due,
But the spoon long since flew
With a braiser he thought was more hot.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I implore you, dear teacher, don't block us
From pronouncing the plural for coccus.
Say it "KOK-sahy" or "KOK-see,"
Each word is a proxy
For microbes that really can rock us.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
At her feet I'm a humble petitioner:
How can one so unkempt proposition her?
If I make my hair sleek
I'll have courage to speak:
First shampoo, then apply the conditioner.

limerick_list.author: LoudNotes
limerick_list.text:
Some people, they like their puns runny,
For puns on the runs are quite funny.
Such dextrous dictation
Is adnomination —
You might even think that it's punny.

limerick_list.author: MattMonitto
limerick_list.text:
His community raises him high,
And his life is a breeze. Dear God, why?
Now my envy's consuming;
I'm jealous and fuming:
He's written more limericks than I!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
That movie was on my must-see list,
My A list (not merely my B list),
So I took my free pass
To the filmhouse. Alas,
"Did you not read the sign? It's No Free List."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
I need bittersweet chocolate today;
Nothing else will my sweet tooth allay.
Low in sugar, some cocoa,
My taste buds go loco —
Don't care what the scale says I weigh.

limerick_list.author: thaivic
limerick_list.text:
Carborexics, you'd think, wouldn't binge
Upon carbs, which would cause them to cringe.
No, it's carbons they stay,
And emissions that may
Upon mankind in future impinge.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
His eyes are round, beady and small,
And are just not attractive at all.
They're set so close together
You can't decide whether
It's a face or an old bowling ball.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
An airman with warlike intent
Went to war with a bellicose bent.
This belligerent flier
Took enemy fire,
And returned more deceased than he went.

limerick_list.author: olioil
limerick_list.text:
When they showed me a tool called an adze,
I was puzzled. What was it? Egads!
The surroundings were strewn
With the wood that was hewn
By the deftly swung strokes of young lads.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Anolis: a genus of lizard
That's rarely found out in a blizzard;
They're chameleons that,
At the drop of a hat,
Can disguise themselves, just like a wizard.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Consumers are those who make use
Of the service or goods you produce.
In a food chain, I think,
A consumer's a link
That might gorge on a thistle or goose.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
He arose with the sun and got cracking
To flee from Nepal without packing.
"I'd expected," he said,
"Just some small-talk. Instead,
She went on half the night with her yakking."

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Circle B is inside Circle C,
But their centers are different, so we
Call the circles eccentric,
As opposed to concentric —
With the same center, that's what they'd be.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Skewed shapes are the chief imperfection
Of a pure equal-area projection.
The extent of each state
May be true but I hate
The map's edge—its eccentric complexion.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Most cells, as they grow, will divide,
While others, like fat cells, grow wide.
Their growth is auxetic,
Which I think's pathetic.
I'd split if I could. (And I've tried!)

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
That old lawyer from Egypt, "Pa" Pyrus,
Sent a letter to sue, not admire, us.
The prime allegation?
Our brain operation
Had damaged his wife's dentate gyrus.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
I'm the crankiest kid in the class,
And my meanness is hard to surpass.
I'm a very bad sport
And revenge is my forte—
If you sass me you'll land on your ass.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Our farm needs an up-to-date tractor,
But my dad is an over-reactor
To anything new.
He says, "Horses will do."
That's decisive to him as a factor!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
I'm just learning to play carpet bowls
So my wife checks my shoes have soft soles.
Carpet golf I preferred,
But she said, "How absurd,
A carpet with eighteen round holes?"

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Contained by the sixty-south latitude
Is a continent cold in its attitude.
The Antarctic Treaty,
Considered a sweetie,
Deserves the whole world's deepest gratitude.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When he visited one of his aunts,
He would bulbitate (poop in his pants),
But his lovely Aunt Jane
Said, "No need to complain,
As I use it to fertilize plants."

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
CFF means on films what you see
Looks continuous — movement that's free
From frame jerks. Analytical
Thought shows the critical
Fusion frequency fools us — the key.

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
My budget is tight, and I see
That your tickets are cheap, almost free.
But I'll have to say "Nay—
I'm unable to pay
The additional 'small' booking fee".

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Asynchronous speech may descend
And result in a dialect blend
Of patrician, plebeian,
And old Tennessean—
From old ways to new, without end.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In this moth family, one special genus
I seek with devotion and keenness.
I'll surely feel high a day
That I meet with Arctiidae:
Empyreuma, as lovely as Venus.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
He was Coolidge's veep, and his name?
Charles Dawes.  He would garner acclaim
When he won the Nobel
And in music as well:
The adapted "It's All in the Game."

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
"Xerostomia," doctors opined,
"Dry mouth of a troublesome kind.
It's been known to deprive a
Poor guy of saliva,
Like  desiccants' drying, you'll find."

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
In the treatment of cancer, it seems
Radiation oncology teams
Have a pitiless foe,
Though dosimetrists know
The right doses for treatment regimes.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Although autoexposure seems slick
(You just point, maybe focus, and click),
My bread and my butter
Was f/stop and shutter.
The camera took over? I'm sick.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
When emetophobia hits
(The fear that you'll puke chunky bits),
You get stressed out and nauseous;
You'll be extra cautious
And pass on the sausage and grits.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Be aboveboard," said Sandy to Steve.
"Keep your cards in plain sight.  Don't deceive."
Still, she lost at strip poker.
That fully clothed joker
Played aces he kept up his sleeve.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Playing Russian roulette when you're bored,
Using rockets to soup up your Ford,
Or annoying a moose
So you can't reproduce
Could well win you a Darwin Award.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Stress OEDILF as this dictionary's name
(Please, no OEDILF: that's just not the same);
Though it's counterintuitive,
Here we must do it if
Ever we hope for acclaim.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My boss (oh my God, what a jerk!)
Loves to pooh-pooh our limerick work.
He will get, oftentimes,
Apoplectic oe'r rhymes —
He gets far off his bean — goes berserk!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
An estoc (a sword some called a "tuck")
Had a point on the end which you stuck,
If you could, through chain mail.
But if thrusting should fail,
You could soon be impaled—a dead schmuck.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
Just like poetry, music is built
Out of phrases that linger and lilt,
And a figure, in song,
Is a phrase that's not long—
Just a few notes, but played to the hilt!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He assumed it was sexy, ironically,
To be cool and speak rather laconically,
But the guy overplayed it.
We all were dismayed; it
Appears he behaved catatonically.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My dealer, "Big Tony" MacLeish,
Says I owe for ten pounds of hashish.
"You can beg, steal, or borrow,
But pay by tomorrow,
Or lose both your kneecaps, capiche?"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When a government's structured to share
Its leadership, choosing a pair
Is not easily done.
A duumvir is one
Of the rulers who're sharing the chair.

limerick_list.author: Anonymity
limerick_list.text:
Ergosterol stubbornly dwells
In the membrane of all fungal cells.
It's in yeast. It's in mold.
It's the sterol, I'm told,
That an azole-based medicine quells.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This front porch campaign, new-created,
Was effective and, yes, underrated.
He'd prevail in a breeze,
Self-assured and at ease:
He stayed home, issued statements, and waited.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Colonitis? I've got it, alas,
And my buddies berate me en masse.
In the chatrooms they post
That I'm self-diagnosed
Since my head's firmly stuck up my ass.

limerick_list.author: cherydactyl
limerick_list.text:
Bel canto's a style operatic
For those who like music dramatic.
A diva will sing,
Using clear tones that ring,
With technique that you'll find quite emphatic.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Unemployed, when a job is your goal,
You can quickly sink into a hole
Of despair if you see
Both your skills and CV
Disregarded. Need cash? Claim the dole.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Liver function's been rendered chaotic.
Diagnosis? It's nothing exotic.
If you don't give up drink,
You'll be dead soon, I think,
As your liver's becoming cirrhotic.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In Kenya, I joined a safari.
By the second day out, I was sorry.
We saw not one giraffe
In a day and a half,
And my tent, from burnt charcoal, was charry.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
There's a negative-numbers abyss
That so frightens my tongue-in-cheek sis:
"I avoid or ignore
Minus one, two, three, four...
Stop at nothing to give them a miss."

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Homophobia's long held its sway
Over dudes, but we're changing, I say.
Men, in friendship, can merge
With no sexual urge.
Let's give bromance its prideful new day!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
It's a problem you've frequently faced:
You begin only taking a taste.
Soon you're gorging on snacks,
Watching corpulence wax.
Did you fear it was going to waist?

limerick_list.author: sl8ofhand
limerick_list.text:
The first 48 states? Just say CONUS.
It's an acronym—and, as a bonus,
May name mollusks as well
(Those of conical shell).
If you find any more, kindly phone us.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
He wants us to come and assemble,
Stand awestruck before him and tremble,
But this alien being,
All-knowing and -seeing—
It's a penguin he tends to resemble!

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
A honeybee trapped in the bore
Of a gun could foresee what's in store.
Said the bee, "I had betta
Flee this lethal vendetta;
I'll get zapped if they trigger a war!"

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
"Call him Dumbo," folks called, through their sneers,
As his friends all made fun of his ears,
Which stood out from his head
At right angles, they said.
He wished he could prune them with shears.

limerick_list.author: Carole Lyons
limerick_list.text:
This marine accommodation is for
(To the former, add ladder) when you're
Ascending a boat
From another afloat
Or descending to one while offshore.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Burgh Island, South Devon retreat,
Has a pub, a hotel and a street.
When the causeway's submerged,
Every walker is urged:
"Take the sea tractor—don't get wet feet!"

limerick_list.author: PdeG
limerick_list.text:
Is there wonder the gentlemen fall
For the ladies, so winsome and tall,
Who strew their fair tresses
O'er deep plunging dresses,
As they strut at the promenade ball?

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My wife hates my habit of hopping
From station to station—no stopping—
While watching TV.
Only snippets I see.
But I'll stay on that channel Home Shopping.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Desensitization is where
You are trained so you no longer care
About things that cause fright;
But suppose your fear's right,
And your apathy shouldn't be there?

limerick_list.author: Ulfras
limerick_list.text:
My shape is just fine, to my mind,
Though it differs from most womankind.
Tipping over's a stunt
You'd expect from my front,
Were I not counterbalanced behind.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Traitor Clarence, assuage your last thirst
In a barrel of malmsey, head-first.
(When it passes the tongue
But goes straight to the lung,
Any liquid will drown the immersed.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's an obsolete word: dimication.
What's it meaning? Perhaps "constipation"?
Or "consuming bad booze"?
If you choose those, you lose.
"Altercation" wins my commendation.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Disk error, reboot with F3.
Enter password and user ID.
Please re-enter your data
Or try again later,
And stop your loud cursing at me!

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
The cooing of doves signals rain,
And it's plain that the rain helps sustain
Their wild being.  With pleasure,
I listen and treasure
Their calling, a mellow refrain.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
Give Grandma a kiss and wave bye-bye,
And thank her again for the mai tai,
And the weed that she shared;
Let's just hope she's not snared
'Fore she visits again in her tie-dye.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Crossing-over's the swapping of genes.
Growing cells can display what that means:
Equivalent snips
Of chromosome strips
Interchange, though they're packed like sardines.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Here's a deal if you pay on the nail:
Each item's a dollar — on sale!
And the shipping? Flat rate,
Which makes this so great:
Every purchase costs ten bucks to mail.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
I have stables and pigpens and byres,
All a gentleman farmer requires,
With my mares and my sows,
Not to mention my cows,
Winning all the awards in these shires.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Doctor Frankenstein finally knew
Why the creatures he built always grew
To gigantism: Frank
Had their diet to thank —
He'd been feeding them elephant stew.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
I'm investing at last in a tux,
And this label connotes certain luxe.
Yes, I have to confess
That I'm out to impress,
So I'll need to fork out the big bucks.

limerick_list.author: Brent Annable
limerick_list.text:
My company makes lots of dough,
Which is subject to taxes, you know.
Above-the-line's shown
What I keep for my own.
And everything else? Down below.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In baseball, the backstop is he
Who, when temperatures hit 93,
Must continue to squat
Till the last pitch is caught.
So, who wants to be catcher? Not me!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
After this bout, don't call me "obscure,"
'Cause as victor, my name will endure.
Touts declared, "You can't take him."
I promised I'd break him.
Now my claim to the title's secure.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
He craves love, but his wife doesn't care;
Her sexcuses are full of hot air.
Like the tyres on his car,
He's prepared to go far,
So he's careful to carry a spare.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Hanging low in a sunny June sky,
The moon gives the daytime a try.
Though it digs the diurnal,
Its third-degree burn'll
Ensure no return in July.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Yes, my body is no longer young.
My joints ache, I've got spots on one lung,
Hair is thin, balls are blue,
But today something new:
I've glossalgia, pain in my tongue.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Seventh round. "Goodbye, sucker!" he said,
But his knockout intention I'd read.
So I focused on sucking
My gumshield and ducking
His punch, which went over my head.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Li'l Boy Blue knew of badges to woo:
Six to gain, each a different hue.
And the limericks he sent
To the BBC meant
That his Blue Peter Badge would be blue.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The car crash caused more than a scare.
In my bladder, it seems there's a tear.
Says my doc, "What you need
Is a cystoplasty, Reid—
That's a surgical bladder repair."

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Free kick, or French kiss, foreign key,
All appear in a list we can see
Dubbed FK in a dict
As abbrevs. To be strict,
More examples exist than these three.

limerick_list.author: SusanL and JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
As the mining crew hammered and bored
Out their tunnels, and carefully shored
Up the walls with their staves,
They exposed ancient caves
In a mountain that nature has cored.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
King Alphonso, when hearing a band,
Needed someone to lend him a hand.
Tone deaf, he required
A helper be hired
To tell him just when he should stand.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
How we mourned our Australian terrier
On that day we at last had to bury 'er.
Our gray canine chum
Left us downcast and glum,
And the mailman decidedly merrier.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Archaic words many and various
Seem  humorous, odd, or nefarious.
But some that persist
(Like alacrious—brisk;
Gladly active) fall short of hilarious.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
Their murderous scheme really worked:
Plied with drink, soon the victims were burked.
They'd be stuffed in a box
For the good Doctor Knox.
(If dissected, I'd surely be irked.)

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It ain't fancy; the thing's just a car.
It runs cheap. I don't push it too far.
It's econobox plain,
But slogs on through the rain.
Since they canned me, I've lowered the bar.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Light a small, narrow space really well
With a bright, slender CCFL.
The cathode lacks heat,
But EM fields still yeet
The electrons like bats out of hell.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Fred is being released: freed, indeed.
So, he's free (for the d, not much need).
For the past tense of free,
Do we need a third e,
As in free(ed)? No, e's gone (i.e. freed).

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My wife never takes blame — she will lie.
At times, when she errs, she will try
Her best scapegoating me.
I'll say, "I, you'll agree,
Fell for you, but a fall guy?  Not I."

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
He looks in his textbook and finds
That to chemisorb means something binds
In a chemical way
To a surface, to stay.
"That's cheating!" the proctor reminds.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
She dreamed of a collet of gold,
And she wondered which gem it would hold.
When he gave her that band,
As he asked for her hand,
Would she find there an emerald bold?

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
At the drop of a hat, two men fought
Without prompting.  The reason?  For nought.
Or at least they forgot
Why they fought on the spot.
Seems the fight wasn't given much thought.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
We find actinofibrils like threads
Where the actinopatagium spreads
In a pterosaur's wing;
It's a membranous thing
That caresses each vortex it sheds.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
She disputes what I say and I do—
Always scolds and debates like a shrew.
She's a difficult wife,
But the love of my life.
(She's a beauty and billionaire, too.)

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Ann alliteratively smoked seven scrod,
Since steaming such fish seemed so odd.
Salmonella spread so,
The smoked scrod had to go;
Sauteed salmon instead fed the squad.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Fred discovered this matter with dread:
Seems his life—it now hung by a thread.
This at first had seemed dire,
But he didn't perspire.
'Twas bifilarly hanging instead.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My frau has a brow that is wrinkled;
From worry, her forehead is crinkled.
Its corrugant power
Reflects how, each hour
That passes, she still hasn't tinkled.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Albert's trivial talk gets us down;
In his gasbagging babble we drown.
His voluble ways
Include no end of praise
For himself, while eyes glaze and brows frown.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
What a cock-up, the ball's on the slates.
You've completely confused all my dates.
What the hell did you do?
I'm marooned in Peru,
Thanks to you. Retribution awaits!

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
A beltway's a very fast road—
Except when the traffic has slowed.
(Ay, there's the rub.)
It encircles the hub
In a loop, where each exit's a node.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Since apnea speeds one's demise,
Keep breathing  while sleeping; it's wise.
Should one be supposing
One's snoring is closing
One's airway, get checked 'fore one dies.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A bloomery process was used
To smelt iron. The folks were enthused
When they found that for real,
It could also make steel—
Leave the iron; with carbon it fused.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Heard a tune, an atonalist wrote it.
I'd hum it, but fear I'd misquote it.
She plays random keys
With a consummate ease.
If her music's off-key, who would note it?

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Reporters who seek to expose
Corrupt leaders experience woes.
Their computers are hacked.
And their phone records?  Tracked.
Seamy deeds, thus, they're loath to disclose.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Bernard Bosanquet's main claim to fame:
The delivery that once bore his name.
But the bosey is now
Called the googly. Somehow
The name changed, but the ball is the same!

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
My clog almanac's not something new,
But it helps me keep track and review
(With the help of each nick
On the edge of the stick)
What's to do, and what then will ensue.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Brass buttons I hope to promote;
Not the ones on a commodore's coat,
But those bright yellow flowers
Girls plant in their bowers
For guys upon whom they may dote.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Darby Theatre's both dark and well lit,
An odd turn of events, I'll admit.
But the lighting's no use
(Turn it off—save the juice!)
Since the actors got lit up and quit.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"My damn bladder's near bursting," said Moe.
"One more drink and I'm sure it will blow.
Pardon me, I must run
Since, in more ways than one,"
He explained, "I have just got to go."

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
She can swear, spit and fart like no other.
She can piss twice as far as my brother.
With her liking for booze
And her home-made tattoos,
She is coarse, but I love her — my mother.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
In music, the second great B,
He is often remembered for V—
He wrote di-di-di-DAH
In his "Fifth." Now in awe
We recall this great code of the free.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When we write, we remain dissentaneous
On a number of things miscellaneous.
One is homophone rhymes.
I will use them at times,
But you won't. We are not consentaneous.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
He defalcated funds from our shop
By skimming some cash off the top.
He was caught with three mil
And his hand in the till
In a sting by an IRS cop.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Since Mount Safa, that high, hilly rebel,
Will not move across sand, scree and pebble
To be here as I ask,
I must turn round the task:
Let Mohammed adjourn to the djebel.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
They have crippled our chance to create
Any meaningful course, in this state,
For our children to learn.
Is it thinking they spurn?
Or just positive growth that they hate?

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
No hero, my dog's apt to squeal.
His training? It just missed ideal,
For in canine uniqueness,
He does have one weakness:
Obeying, "Achilles, now heel!"

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
My godparents vowed to attend
To my spiritual health, so they send
Me to church every day
And demand that I pray.
Yet, to hell I'll get sent in the end!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Granny sat late one night at her table
Knitting fast as her fingers were able.
The twists in the wool
Made the sweater so full,
Employing the stitch known as cable.

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
Armentières is a place we know well
From a First World War song that did tell
Us that, when we passed through,
If we asked "parlez-vous?",
Well, we might meet a mademoiselle.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The word deligate means, you will find,
"To wrap up," or "to bandage, to bind."
The word delegate? Fine,
You'll find that means "assign."
So alike, the words seem intertwined.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"What's cooking, girl, what's going on?
Are you still playing games with Bijan —
Is that Persian still purring?
Just what is occurring?"
"Zilch, squat.  He returned to Iran."

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
I once balanced my checkbook with ease.
But, alas, it's no longer a breeze.
Where is each canceled check?
Banking statements are dreck.
Are they trying to hide all those fees?

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
"Quit your job!?" shrieked my Ma (in fact, twice),
Just concerned about rent money — nice.
But her warnings of doom
Haven't caused me much gloom —
I'm so broke that I can't pay the price.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Got a call from old principal Gus:
"For our trip we must charter a bus.
Get us one that can haul
Forty kids to the mall."
Just one call and it's done with no fuss.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
To those everlasting pees I'm inclined,
Being 80. What brought that to mind?
Broad-leaved everlasting peas
All dug up, near those trees,
For to seek peas unearthed I'm assigned.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
French calligraphers worked very hard
To develop a style called bâtarde.
It was rounded and slanted,
Left readers enchanted,
And garnered commercial regard.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"Labraboxers are fatter than hogs!
Cockerspoodles have faces like frogs!
Let's all stop nature-puttering,"
Tom's ruefully muttering.
"Crossbreeding has gone to the dogs!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
When the co-pilot, Rog, took control,
Captain Over said, "Fancy a roll?"
So Rog did, plus a loop.
"No, I meant for your soup,"
Said the captain, retrieving his bowl.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
As an infant all squalling and wee,
I was baptized. Meant nothing to me.
When I knew what I swore
I was baptized once more.
I was then born again, praises be!

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
The word fulsome meant "loaded", "profuse";
That was then, but the meaning got loose.
Now it's "odious", "vile".
"Fulsome praise"? Makes me smile —
Phony flattery fools the obtuse.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Around Delos, on islands sporadic,
Dwell fisher-folk, far from nomadic,
With many a paddock
For farming of haddock
That's packaged, then labelled "Cycladic".

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
In a chain gang Tom's bound to the next
Wretched inmate who seems to be vexed
Over inconsequential,
Dumb rules penitential,
Like having to work while you text.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Could American Pharoah, great horse
That an army of race fans endorse,
Win the rare Triple Crown?
Derby, Preakness were down.
Just the Belmont remained. Well, of course!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Baby habits are such," explained Ben,
"That I do not belong in the pen.
Your Honor, permit me,
You've got to acquit me.
I only use drugs now and then."

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
When this guy put a gun to my head,
Kindly counselling, "Cash, or you're dead!"
Well, I had to attest
I felt ceding was best.
Better potless than pitted with lead.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
The draining pipe systems of old
Roman homes were quite modern, I'm told.
You could sit and unload —
'Neath the pavement it flowed.
Their clean streets were a sight to behold!

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
A dockyard is where they build ships
Or repair them whilst up on the slips.
There was once nothing finer
Than a great ocean liner,
But since aircraft they've been in eclipse.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
That's a fairy tale, Fanny, and you
Ought to know that it ain't really true.
Such a yarn needn't be
 About princess and pea.
A deception's a fairy tale too.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
"My bodily fluids are ready,
And I bawdily want you," said Freddy.
"Your bawdy request
Leaves me oddly distressed
In my body," said Greta, unsteady.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
It's said, as a child, barely four,
Michelangelo seemed to adore
Not the guilding nor tapestry
In Florence's Baptistry —
But Ghiberti's great bronze northern door.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A Civil War expert named Barb
Had some very harsh words for my garb:
"You're the worst Grant I've seen!
First, your uniform's green?
And your wristwatch confirms you're a farb!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Becky's tower has nary a stair,
Yet she lives on the seventh floor there.
The entrance might strike
One as fairytalelike:
With no doors, you must climb up her hair.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Trading votes on the House floor was why
Dick Gephardt was heard to decry:
"You misunderstand,
No revenge is at hand.
I just wanted an aye for an aye."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
True, I'm sweet, but when dating? It's rough.
Women tend to like men who are tough.
To sweet nothings I'm prone,
Yet I go home alone.
Seems my dulcitude isn't enough.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I'm anthropophobic—it's much
Of the reason I stay out of touch.
People give me the creeps,
Which is fine cuz it keeps
Me at home writing limericks and such.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A buildup of force has transpired.
Immediate action's required.
Things have come to a head.
Please don't let it be said
You go AWOL when missiles are fired.

limerick_list.author: AronKuppersmith
limerick_list.text:
No more moveable type made of lead!
Desktop publishing's used now instead.
With a tablet or mouse,
You can bring down the house
With a layout that knocks 'em all dead.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
There's a butcher I know, name of Chuck,
Stuck his hand in a grinder—bad luck!
Now, piled high, there's a mound
With a pound of ground round—
And some telegraphed punch lines that suck.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Tiny flaws were the cause of the fact
That we lacked big applause for our act.
So we thought about brushing
It up, and were rushing
To fix it when (ack!) we got sacked!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Now that purges don't take up their time,
The reformers are turning to crime.
So the people are storming
For counterreforming—
Restoring a peaceable clime.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
I'll define alpargata with skill:
It's what some people call espadrille.
It's a light canvas shoe
With a rope sole that you
May find worn in the Pyrenees still.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
Each morning my dearest will glower,
Scarfing boxes of Argo and flour.
It's starch that she wants,
Not those cake or croissants.
That's what amylophages devour.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
When  claymation performers ain't viable
Like Wallace and Gromit,  they're liable
To seem less than dynamic —
Let them bake to ceramic,
And start over with clay, 'cause it's pliable.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
When you're deep, engineer, in abstraction,
You're a nexus of immanent action,
And there's no way to know
(It's a manager's woe!)
If you've strayed to a limerick's attraction.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
The effeminate man with big lips
Hits the high notes and wiggles his hips.
His dark eyeliner's shady.
Dude looks like a lady,
But he can't hide the truth when he strips.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Arundinaceous? You jest—call it "reedy,"
That phragmites. Or leave it at "weedy."
Meanwhile, gather a batch;
It makes marvelous thatch.
We'll erect a few huts for the needy.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
I don't have a fear of your cleaver:
In my chin defense, I'm a believer.
I asked them to forge it
As part of my gorget
So you can be hard on the bevor.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
"The risks of infarction and stroke
Are lower for guys who don't smoke.
To prevent these bad ills
Take clopidogrel pills,"
Said my doc, "—no, I really don't joke!"

limerick_list.author: mino
MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A crackerjack con in Sudan
Handcrafted crude shanks in the can.
He made use of his shank craft
To fix a cracked crankshaft,
Then split in the warden's old van.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Aluminum sulfate's acclaim?
It's a compound, retardant to flame.
Says my chemistry chum,
Who's a Cal Tech alum,
"Call it alum—they're one and the same."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The thought of a general election
Fills Remainers with abject dejection,
As Brexiteers glory
In thoughts of a Tory
Supremacy, free from correction.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
All this "Aussie cuisine" stuff is dodgy:
Those wattle-seed muffins are stodgy.
And that roadhouse in Mudgee
Serves leathery budgie
Dressed up as "Bush Bantam".  That's bodgie!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He agreed, though he spoke like a cynic
At the cardiothoracic doc's clinic:
"Of this tumor I'll die,
I am sure, and that's why
The advice I need most is rabbinic."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A word that is melded, like brunch,
Is a blend (here of breakfast and lunch).
Since it's mid-afternoon
And, for supper, too soon,
Is this food that I'm munching my sunch?

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
As I sink deeper down in depression,
I am prone to a pointless digression.
Since my spirit is flatus,
I shall go on hiatus
Till the voices reduce their aggression.

limerick_list.author: Kuranui
limerick_list.text:
In medical terms there's a word
That not very many  have heard.
'Tis true, in all lands,
For those born without hands
(That's acheiria)  clapping's absurd.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
'Neath my driveway of  fine  bedded gravel
They found Lil — soon my lies would unravel.
Told the cops she's a drifter,
But their bloodhounds soon sniffed her.
Judge said "Guilty!" as down fell his gavel.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
The Viking called Eric the Red
Sailed from Norway to Iceland, it's said;
Then fled on to Greenland,
That rarely-been-seen land—
He left his poor neighbours for dead.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
No agreement in sight anywhere?
That's no reason at all to despair.
Mes chères dames, my dear gents,
Situations, when tense,
Will improve if clear words clear the air!

limerick_list.author: oneslowtyper
limerick_list.text:
What a great "man's best friend" I just got,
'Cause I like to break wind quite a lot.
Yes it's true, I've no shame;
Now the dog gets the blame.
Every fart comes from him—true or not.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
My pet crocodile's really a gas!
He comes on to each good-looking lass.
My emydosaurian
Pauses to glory in
Chasing his next piece of ass.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
I'm attuned to the universe, one
With the All! I feel newly begun,
My awakening a prize.
I've now opened my eyes...
Where'd you say we were parked again, son?

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When the weather turns cool, as a rule,
You'll be bundling your children for school.
Will you foolishly clothe
Them in clothing they loathe:
Hats and mittens perceived as uncool?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
We're attending a masquerade party,
My wife in a get-up that's tarty.
She's playing the whore;
I'm her john and a bore
In an ascot, pretentious and arty.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
Iraq's current state is abysmal,
With its prospects of peace rather dismal.
Dubya started this war,
Yielding blood, sweat and gore,
And success odds quite infinites'mal.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You host sock hops, but tell me that none dance?
For the next one, to make it a fun dance,
And avoid your next flop,
Put the "hop" in sock hop
With Abondance there served in abundance.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Is deficit financing set
To make us all paupers? You bet,
If the government borrows
To hock our tomorrows
For spending that's funded by debt.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
With your watery eyes and that wheezing,
You'll find diphenhydramine pleasing.
Antihistamine pills
Cannot cure all your ills,
But they lessen the sniffling and sneezing.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
An addled-brained lad from Key Largo,
Desiring to transport some cargo,
Arranged an affreightment
But made a misstatement.
The consequence? Total embargo.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Of all the good luck charms you'll find,
There is one that at once comes to mind.
Both revered and renowned,
It's the plant known world 'round
As the clover, the small, four-leafed kind.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
This bash is the best it can be —
See the partyers dancing with glee.
When tomorrow arrives
We'll get on with our lives,
And remember this fête accompli.

limerick_list.author: rbalexx
limerick_list.text:
Those bignonia vines can climb trees
And your fence with the greatest of ease.
It's a plant some will groom
For the trumpet-shaped bloom,
But regret once they're caught in its squeeze.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
A Didone is a font whose design
Achieves contrast with strokes stout and fine,
With shading unslanted,
And serifs supplanted
By many a bracketless line.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Though the funeral home tried to mask it,
An effluvium seeped from her casket.
Though they sprayed clouds of Glade,
Sadly, not a soul stayed
Till her casket was fit with a gasket.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
In the mall there's a concourse (a hall)
Where a concourse of folks sometimes brawl.
When the great crowd is done,
It is no longer fun,
As they crawl down the hall at the mall.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Your breach is expellable; cheating,
It seems, is your way of competing.
We shall kick you out;
Should we not, there's no doubt,
That behavior you'll soon be repeating.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
As the constellated lights on the hill
Glow in clusters, the architects' skill
Is displayed, and the peak
In blue dusk stands unique,
With its sky-rising buildings that thrill.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
To the sound of the Westminster chimes
He read: "SHOCK! HORROR! MINISTER'S CRIMES!"
While he skipped to Page Three
He quipped, "Though an M.P,
We must all keep abreast of the times."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Taj Mahal—what a tribute to sex.
Shah Jahan's loving wife didn't vex.
Her bounteous womb
Deserved a great tomb.
So he built her an  edifice rex.

limerick_list.author: CherylinNJ
limerick_list.text:
A cholent's my favorite stew.
Nothing else on the Sabbath will do.
It stays hot in the pot
(Having simmered a lot);
A soul's hearty and nourishing brew!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
A death spiral down from the sky
Means it's likely some pilot will die.
But that spiral looks nice
When it's done on the ice
By skilled skaters — a treat for the eye!

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Give a handshake to greet Uncle Dick.
Clasp his paw in your own, that's the trick.
While you're holding his mitt,
You should smile — just a bit —
And then give his bad knee a good kick.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
You will first need some practice: say "gray as".
Okay, now you can meet Ahimaaz,
A very brave priest
Whom we can't in the least
An old cowardly custard portray as.

limerick_list.author: cilliantsu
limerick_list.text:
You combine in a bottle of glass
Some chlorine—a yellow-green gas—
With some iodine. Grand!
It's a mixture they brand
Chloriodic. I learned this in class.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Jackson Pollock shows little restraint
In Blue Poles as he throws on the paint.
With no figures, no meaning,
No sense intervening,
American Gothic, it ain't.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Shelly wasn't hurt bad, thank the Lord.
When her parents found out, they were floored.
They had her committed
But must have omitted
To get her consenting accord.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
He was one who attempted to show
That his family was valid. Although
The poor Addon would fail,
We remember his tale
As a case of what fathers bestow.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
The unusual way I pronounce
Causes experts to bristle and pounce:
It's cacoepistic,
But still, they're sadistic
To call me an agnorant dounce.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though he's cute and would like to be cuddled,
When he chases the "wabbit," he's muddled.
He'll never win hugs
If he runs after Bugs;
He'll remain Mr. Elmer Befuddled.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Our campouts are brief overnighters.
When butane escapes from our lighters,
Its four-carbon chain
Serves a crafty campaign:
We adore meeting manly fire-fighters.

limerick_list.author: Doug Harris
limerick_list.text:
Mrs. Cooper (her Christian name's Carol),
Has a shape best described as a barrel.
She's convex as a cask
(Having sex is a task),
But she laughs and wears hoops on apparel!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
One marshmallow's made for enjoying;
But several — the taste gets annoying,
Destroying the treatness:
A surfeit of sweetness
That some like myself would call cloying.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mom is hornswoggled, thinks you're heroic,
That you've troubles, and bear them—a stoic,
But you're making a living
On Mom's guileless giving.
You're a parasite, bro—cytozoic.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Three sheets to the wind at the bar?
Not a problem—they'll send you a car.
Got a flat and no spare?
Boom! A tow truck's right there.
Hail, dispatchers! (Wherever they are.)

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
If I'm able to, Hon, I can do it,
Even though, if I do, I may rue it.
Some tasks cannot be done —
No one's able to, Hon.
Since these can't, let's get canned and say "Screw it!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The new  roof is secure and top notch
As the thatcher inserts one more brotch.
With that strong wooden pin
The last yealm is pegged in.
Rarely seen, this is something to watch.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
I bought from the bank an annuity:
An annually paid perpetuity.
The clerk, an ex-doorman,
Complained, "What's the score, man?
Your paperwork's done—no gratuity?"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Seems his flock is attempting to block
The new bishop's intent to defrock
Father Rocco—who made
Some mistakes, but has paid
For his sins. It's a terrible shock!

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
You couldn't conceivably try
To get that proposal to fly.
It can't possibly work:
Can't you see that, you jerk?
Your invention will founder and die!

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
I'm an eloquent, powerful lawyer,
Well known from New York to La Jolla.
It makes excellent sense
To employ my defense.
At my job I'm an artist—like Goya.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
I heard that our fair-headed Faye
Had a major blonde moment today.
No mere "moment" for me:
It's a lifestyle.  You see...
...I forgot what I wanted to say!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Antitumoral agents are those
We prescribe for a cancer that grows
At a moderate rate.
After chemo we wait,
Fingers crossed, till we see how it goes.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Like the tap-dancing feet of Astaire,
Your homegoing feet, I declare,
Will have taken to wings
When a nightingale sings,
As the song says, in old Berkeley Square.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Christmas Eve, Katie boarded a blimp
And bombed neighbors with overcooked shrimp.
Her behavior, so shocking,
Earned coal in her stocking,
Which is why she now walks with a limp.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
For this sauce with tomatoes, you've gotta
Have garlic; you won't need ricotta.
Then red peppers you add,
Which makes the sauce mad,
And your dish is all arrabbiata.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
The chef said the dunfish was done,
And he brought out our plates, one by one.
It's a strange name for cod,
And I find it quite odd,
But it's fancy, and different, and fun.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
When our triplets were born, we weren't wed.
In the courtroom, the magistrate said:
"I declare you're the dad
Of the offspring you've had.
Thus I filiate Ed, Ted and Ned."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I fell hard, on my first time in town,
For her eyes and insoluble frown.
Then her caramel skin
Just kept drawing me in:
Soft and tawny, with fine golden down.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I am searching for methods of jacking
Up life-giving substances packing
Your red cells; what's more,
You need treatment, since you're
Anoxemic (blood oxygen's lacking).

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
He suffers from asthma and hence
His dyspnoea's often intense,
Thus sadly he's prone
To pant hard on the 'phone—
That's the core of my client's defence.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
She likes painting and gardening, my mum.
Using finger paint, Mum's hands become
Full of bright-colored gel.
It's so easy to tell
From her hobbies she's got a green thumb.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
Jayson Blair, the reporter, had zeal,
But his "news", it turns out, wasn't real.
His auctorial bent
To deceive and invent
Has helped land him a six-figure deal.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The stripping of land, denudation,
Can be an enormous temptation.
With resources declining,
Our open-pit mining
Is needed, but draws condemnation.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A hirsute young hombre named Jim
Booked a hot new salon for a trim.
But the barber was careless,
And now Jim is hairless.
Thus endeth the tale of this lim.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Add the word Generation to X,
One will learn straight away, if one checks,
Of the cohort who'd grown
In the '60s, well known
For their views about drugs and free sex.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
The new cheerleader's bod was delectable,
But the quarterback's lust was detectable.
Thus she managed to parry
His headlong Hail Mary—
Yes, the pass that he made was deflectable.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
At the ski resort, this you should know:
To avoid getting stuck in the snow,
Don't get caught at the top
When the cable cars stop —
Which they do when the wind starts to blow.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
I had been in the crow's nest awhile,
Looking out was my duty: espial.
I was bored, I suppose,
When I yelled, "Thar she blows!"
I got ten of the best with no trial.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In gymnastics a gold is his goal,
And his somersault's great, on the whole,
But his coaches advise
That Olympians wise
Will bring more than just one forward roll.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Our exclusivism doctrine appalls
Idealists, but we've had the balls
Since about '62
To forbid any crew-
cutted hippie from walking these halls!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Communications have gone through transition.
You're dismissed as a land line technician.
Don't just picket and pout;
Change directions, branch out.
With new skills, you're a whole new edition.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The Cinderella effect sadly shows
Something each child psychologist knows;
The statistics are chilling:
With assault, rape, and killing,
For a stepchild, the likelihood grows.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
She steps up to the bar for a shot.
"Jack Daniels! I'll take all you got!"
Western boots, open shirt,
Heaving chest—what a flirt!
She's a cowgirl, and udderly hot.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"Let's pick up the pace just a smidgen!"
For my P.E. coach, speed was religion.
"Time to move your fat A!
Chop-chop!" he would say,
Which means "quick-quick" in English called Pidgin.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
We all stifle our groans as young Ross
Starts to speak, as he always talks dross.
Though he hasn't a clue
About  wages we're due,
We stand silent. His dad is the boss.

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
At the wedding of Miss Corleone,
Though to weight gain her daddy was prone,
I did not call him "Pudge,"
Lest I sleep in the sludge
With the fishes. The threat makes me groan.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
Delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol
Is a name mainly used in the lab an' all.
Pot smokers (who, me?)
Simply say THC—
And get high 'cause our lives are so drab an' all.

limerick_list.author: BobfromThirsk
limerick_list.text:
It's a big one, a heavyweight hammer,
An about-sledge, a hot-iron whammer.
It'll readily fettle
Yon hot glowing metal,
Together with blacksmithy yammer.

limerick_list.author: Julia
limerick_list.text:
Measurement, admensuration
Differ only by fancification.
The meanings are fused,
So the latter's not used
(Unless it's for sly obfuscation).

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
I've two clouts.  One is plain. T'other's lace.
The first's fine for wiping my face,
But my fancy clout's t'other.
On her deathbed, from Mother
I stole it. (Why I'm in disgrace.)

limerick_list.author: snakelocks
limerick_list.text:
You point at my skin with a pin
Saying, "That's where this thing's going in."
But for those of my gender,
That acupoint's tender—
For treatment I'll stick with the gin.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Blofeld's girlfriend said, "James, come to me;
Tie me up, twist my heart, spike my tea.
A CIA fighter
Might make demands lighter,
But bondage is better with thee."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Grannie seems in a bit of a flap.
She's frenetically knitting a wrap
As if life will just stop
If she lets her work drop,
So her needles fly zippity-zap.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the dog pound they place every stray
That the dogcatchers nab every day.
Each needs friendship and love.
Take one home. God above
Will your kindness reward—every way.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
That's a lie! And I warn, with all candor,
To say it again  would be slander.
So I'm telling you, sport,
I will sue you in court —
Call me Mafia thug, not Black Hander.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Just call it my final-year caper—
Got a press, and some hot steamy vapor.
The best of my scams:
I "borrowed" exams,
And with pressure and steam, blocked the paper.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With a safe on his shoulder, this brat was
Taking aim on a spot where a cat was,
When a worm with a cough
Scared the pussycat off.
What a deus ex machina that was!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
With bio and geo combined,
Nature's chemistry treats us real kind.
With some water and soil
Mix organics that spoil
And breathe easy together entwined.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Andy Capp likes his football and beer.
Unemployed, he remains of good cheer.
In a change that's profuse:
No more spousal abuse!
From bad habits this strip tries to steer.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
The alcohol found in a drink
Tends to render you drunk, I would think.
If you down six or eight
And you don't feel so great,
You might vomit some up in the sink.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
I used to smoke pot on the green;
Do some crack, not to mention caffeine.
But three months in that place
Wiped the grin off my face,
And my case? Ever since, I've been clean.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Cause of death was no everyday blade,"
Declared Holmes, though in no way dismayed.
"She was carved with a bistoury —
Odd, but no mystery —
A tool of the surgical trade."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The yellow wax pepper is hot,
While the big sweet banana is not.
The dried ancho is mild
(Poblano, my child).
This Capsicum lore is hard-bought.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"I'm the doggerel speed king, prolific —
Plus my verses are priceless — terrific!"
"You're so wrong — they're all chaff,
Worthless trash! What a laugh."
"I'm perplexed. Could you could be more specific?"

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
I find you seductive and gentle;
In your presence, my brain's incidental.
It is nearly for naught—
One one-hundredth the thought:
You're getting me all centimental.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
You can call me a grouch or a cynic,
But if daffodils need an auxinic
So their cells will form shoots
And elongate for roots,
They can get their own ride to the clinic.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When the boss said we all must eat dietingly,
The workers rebelled and yelled riotingly.
He increased their anxiety
With his haughty mock piety,
When he pledged: "You're all sacked, guys," disquietingly.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Arctic owls, with feathers so white,
Go unseen when on snow they alight;
So these raptors view prey
Such as lemmings, that may
Be enjoyed, one assumes, with each bite.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Smarty Alex, the world-famous bird,
Always ready with many a word,
Now is silent and gone,
But his record lives on.
He's the wordiest bird ever heard!

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
"It's a cyanotoxin," said Leary,
"That poisoned the Great Lake of Erie:
Not the whole, but the part
Near Toledo. The start
Of disaster to come? That's a theory."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
The wind and the wild Scottish weather
Turn delicate skin into leather.
On his hill-farm, a crofter
Is keeping it softer
By stuffing his sporran with heather.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl and Znirk
limerick_list.text:
When alien monsters break free
And attack in a brain-eating spree,
Don't jump up in alarm, lest
You jostle your armrest
And topple your drink on my knee.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
If you deaden the sound in an amp,
Or you lessen the force of a clamp,
Find bad gas in a mine,
Or feel moisture that's fine:
You have manifestations of damp.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Please be seated.  You will not feel cheated.
To my new Magic Flute you'll be treated."
(Comparing his notes' art
To the music of Mozart,
Pete seems just a wee bit conceited.)

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A Dutch angle horizon's not true,
Out of kilter and shot upward too—
Say from under a desk—
It's distorted, grotesque.
And we sense something weird will ensue.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
Here's something I don't often say:
We've been painting a ceiling today!
Now I'm spattered and spotted
And Dottie's all dotted
In white, but we've finished—hooray!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I didn't feel right in the head,
So I took to a hospital bed
Where I slept over days
In a sedative haze;
With this dauerschlaf, demons got shed.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
G.F. Handel wrote music of note,
On which listeners frequently dote,
From the right Royal Fireworks
To loud, Baroque choir works,
And suites played on stages that float.

Old George Fred, writing music of taste,
With his notes all impeccably placed,
Moved from Deutschland to Britain,
Where Messiah was written,
Recycling old tunes in his haste.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
At the government office arriving,
To apply for a license for driving,
I stay calm and unstressed
And arrange for my test.
For a rapid approval I'm striving.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A vampire will bite with his eyeteeth.
They're aggressive, and not very shy teeth.
To avoid being bled,
Have his teeth pulled. Instead
Of attacking, he'll murmur: "Bye-bye teeth!"

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
An Apache of warlike appearance
Thought my terror was mere interference
So he shot his sharp arrow
Right into my marrow,
Accounting for my incoherence.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker and SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If you buy a child's LEMONADE sign
'Cause the pitcher's tipped over, that's fine;
As the spilled liquid dries,
You may not win a prize:
Such rewards are more likely condign.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Mentioned Ernie while eating dessert,
"I just noticed these rather overt
Small arbuscules that grow
From our heads. Did you know
That means 'tufts of hair', Ol' Buddy Bert?"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The motorist braked with a honk
And his nose hit the dash with a conk.
Both the sound that he made
And the bump (in a shade
Of chartreuse) on his nose was a bonk.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Revolution? The world went berserk!
Former masters, though, asked with a smirk,
"With the slaves now in charge,
One prime question looms large:
In doulocracies who does the work?"

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
"Philo Farnsworth: Now who can that be?
The name's mystifying to me.
If he's not on the tube,
Then I don't know the rube."
"But you should. He invented TV."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Those coliform colonies restin'
In the folds of your colon (intestine)
Like to colonize there
'Cuz they're getting a share
Of the food that they help with digestin'.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
An ascetic is someone who tightens
His belt; but not so with ascitans.
They dance in a hearty
Heretical party,
Since wine, they imagine, enlightens.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Dead canes he has nipped with a clipper,
Dead branches (our Jack is a ripper),
And dead victims, at need,
To the hopper he'll feed,
Watching sawdust fly out of his chipper.

limerick_list.author: woozy
limerick_list.text:
In caverns, the Morlocks live under us.
We'll need a fierce weapon most thunderous!
If the muzzle is flaring,
Then the sound will be blaring,
When firing the gun called a blunderbuss.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Eating hamburger causing you groans?
Has your gall bladder filled up with stones?
A special photography,
Cholecystography,
Shows them in contrasting tones.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Have to air-dash to see my sick mum,
Cuz I've learned the prognosis is glum.
So I'll catch the first flight,
Since I must do what's right—
That's ensure the old witch will succumb.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
A chinaman's cast through the air,
Flies some yards, bounces legwards, and there
Is smacked by a bat,
Or not, and then that
Is not over; there's five balls to spare.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
In a cozy, warm alcove I knit.
It's my hole-in-the-wall, poorly lit.
I drop many a stitch,
Yet my goal's to enrich
My dear husband, whom this thing may fit.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Night fell quickly," said Sue to her beau.
"It was light just a moment ago."
At the drive-in, the pair
Had sought privacy where
They would soon be ignoring the show.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Your ignition switch suddenly froze?
Are the contact points clean? Do they close?
If they properly meet,
Then the circuit's complete,
And you'll find electricity flows.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
She's asleep at the beach — can't she learn?
Better wake her; she's done to a turn.
Lobster red, what a sight —
She'll be groaning all night.
"Hey! Wake up, you've one hell of a burn."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Once Shirazi built mosques there, and stayed,
The Comoros prospered on trade.
Merchants stopped at its coves
For vanilla and cloves.
Now it's destitute, craves foreign aid.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
On the day a hot album's released,
Fans are drooling: the ways have been greased.
Long before the disc drops,
A good manager's props
Have been earned, and it's on to the feast.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
If absinthe, a greenish liqueur
With an anise-like taste, you'd prefer,
Better hold on real tight!
The effects last all night,
And your mind will be left in a blur.

limerick_list.author: BobfromThirsk
limerick_list.text:
A shaft in a tube: it can slide
Up and down, and then when you decide
The position is right,
You can lock it up tight
With a binder bolt, tested and tried.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The minister's sermon was wooly,
A boisterous message meant fully
To urge and exhort
Women not to abort.
He was using his pulpit to bully.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
"We ignore what the so-called Pope saith
And restore you, King Henry VIII,
As Fidei Defensor —
DF writ immenser,
'Defender of the (English) Faith'."

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
To have dition denotes holding sway;
It's dominion in every which way.
Those who rule with a hand
Deemed of iron demand
The respect of all those they survey.

limerick_list.author: nevadaace and Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
At the abattoir, Pete was in shock:
Stood stock-still as he stared at the stock.
He no longer could hack it
In meat-cutting's racket
Because of severe butcher block.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An ethologist fervently hates
Seeing beasts in unnatural states.
He might study gazelles
Where that animal dwells,
But not chimps in tuxedos on skates.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
The bowler looked on in despair,
As another ball sailed through the air.
Landing over the rope,
It extinguished all hope
Of his average remaining a square.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Precious cargo's in storage below,
From wherever the salty winds blow.
If our argosy sails
Past the pirates and gales,
We'll repay the huge debts that we owe.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Banquet table spot 9: Florence White,
Seated next to me, started a fight.
So reactive was she
To my comments—and me—
That I called her "Miss Fluorine" all night.

limerick_list.author: D F-B
limerick_list.text:
The Athenian court of appeal
Was itself a place hard to conceal,
Set on Ares's Hill.
Areopagite skill
Was to seek truths the gods might reveal.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
There's a great clarinetist named Bilk
Playing jazz as seductive as silk.
With a trademark black titfor
And music that's fit for
A king, he's the best of his ilk.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When you're down 'cause a confidant fails you,
Or your bitterest enemy nails you,
Drain a blackjack of bitter,
And don't be a quitter!
(I'm told that it's good for what ales you.)

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
A camorra's a secret society
Which is known for its evil, not piety.
But write it Camorra
(And don your fedora)
And you mean the Italian variety.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Since as drivers this pair was unfit,
A large car up ahead they then hit.
At the site of the crash,
Did they stop? Offer cash?
Try to help? Call the cops? No, they split.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Eve is earless: the gal's got no ears.
This will limit her choice of careers.
Any eyeglasses maker
Will not likely take her
To model their wares, it appears.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
The Chronicles: two Bible books
Likely written by Ezra. It looks
Like the Books of the Kings
Have omitted some things,
So the Chronicles fill in the nooks.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
I was driving around in my truck
And got stuck in a puddle of muck.
Paddle-free, up a creek,
With my tongue in my cheek,
I said, "Beautiful! Aren't I in luck?"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If the start of your dinner is liquory,
Guests won't notice the salad.  Here's trickery:
For a tart, forceful flavor
Even tipsy folks savor,
Try adding asparagus chickory.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Ayds was candy to help with one's diet.
Then AIDS showed up, causing disquiet.
A sales drop so great
Was the sealer of fate;
Those who sought to lose weight couldn't buy it.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
As our four young boys sat in the pew,
We'd pray flatulence wouldn't ensue.
Weeks on end felt like hell
With the curse of that smell,
So today's gasless Sunday was due.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
If the concept of foreordination
Means it's pointless to strive for salvation,
Destination pre-charted,
Each lately departed,
Prayers aside, may descend to damnation.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I remark to my neighbor, "Nice day."
"Jesus Christ," he says, "made it that way."
Jesus this, Jesus that—
I just want to say, "Scat!
You're just too Christocentric, OK?"

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
In a horrible moral distortion,
Opponents will publish abortion
Providers' kids' pics,
Incite folks to throw bricks;
Barely legal, by tricky contortion.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Don't know why Sir George Back found it pleasing
To explore where the summers are freezing.
Were I in his crew,
I would be the guy who
Would be bitching and wheezing and sneezing.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Near Spain's southern tip lies Gibraltar.
It is British (like, formerly, Malta).
Is is known for its apes,
But it doesn't grow grapes,
And it's not a posh spa as is Yalta.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
Colour rhymes aren't sublime!  It's a crime
That you choose to use hues that don't chime.
Don't say purple — I'll moan!
Orange ain't the right tone!
And with silver, I'm ill! Verse should rhyme.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A lamprey, before it's an eel,
Is larval, with little appeal.
The ammocoete burrows
In undersea furrows
Of sandbeds in search of a meal.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
I love grass—it's so luscious and green,
The most beautiful plant I have seen.
I breathe deep when I smell it;
Alas, when I sell it,
The cops aren't nearly as keen.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though they didn't have cars that need parking,
They had dogs who annoyed them by barking.
Back in days long gone by,
Here's the word they'd apply
To describe something bothersome: carking.

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
So this morning, the boss cut my pay.
And my project?  In full disarray.
My Toyota tonight
Went berserk.  What a fright!
All in all, a disquietive day.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
At sea, sailors descry sail and sight,
Each from vantage of varying height.
So "Land ho!" one may shout
Though it's known, without doubt,
That's not where they're carousing tonight.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
My girlfriend loves pickles and fries,
And garlic with kippers in pies.
Her rank halitosis
Has caused this chemosis;
Her breath's bringing tears to my eyes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My wife's cooking, between you and me,
Is not what I'd wish it to be.
She not only burns toast,
Cakes and meatloaf and roast,
But for breakfast she serves me black tea.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Blonde bombshells?  Jean Harlow was first.
Later Marilyn: beautiful, cursed.
Then Jayne Mansfield was soarin'
Like Mamie Van Doren.
But Paris today?  God, the worst!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The boss has come by with his spouse,
Always pleasant. Perhaps I'm a mouse,
'Cause we don't discuss salary.
Still, he's built us a gallery,
A porch that encircles our house.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
There was once a dog docker named Dale
Who had learned his profession by mail.
"It was simple," he said,
"I just studied in bed—
I'd no need to attend to de-tail."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The theater's surrounded by banners
Promoting a comedy of manners.
I believe it's a spoof
Of society—proof
Of our cultured theatrical planners.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
There are services trite, or bizarre:
Wax your toes, breed your pig, wash your car.
But real items for trade,
Farmed or mined, sometimes made,
Are commodities, sold near and far.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A black-humored Irishman, Pat,
Will perform at the drop of a hat.
He prefers doing wakes
'Cause the corpse never takes
Much offense when Pat's patter falls flat.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My date (like Madonna, but hotter)
Was pleased with the rifle I got her.
I invited the dame
To go hunting. "I'm game,"
She responded. Not thinking, I shot her.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Formosan—this word may not please
Those who favor the term Taiwanese,
But the folk on this island,
Both lowland and highland,
Are the ones with the most expertise.

limerick_list.author: Jim Macaulay
limerick_list.text:
Uncommitted, this gent hasn't got
An engagement or wedding to plot.
As this bachelor knows,
Here's the question to pose:
"Should a man remain single or knot?"

limerick_list.author: JellyFsh
limerick_list.text:
I once took a trip to Andorra.
It was wholly unlike Bora-Bora.
In the Pyrenees range
No temperature change
Prevented my wearing angora.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
You're a famous chiropodist, sweet,
Treating Eva Longoria's feet.
She has ravishing toes,
But a man like you knows
The wrong foot to get off on. Don't cheat!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
A damson's a small purple plum
Which, though tasty in pies for your tum,
Must have sugar—so count
Out a generous amount—
Or the tartness makes pudding-time glum.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Brecciation's the breaking apart
Of a rock into fragments, the start
Of a new brecciation
Through sedimentation.
It'd break a geologist's heart!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Here's the story of Abbey and Abey:
He asked her, "Will you be my baby?"
"Quite possibly, yes!"
Was her answer.  His guess
Was correct: "That's a definite maybe!"

limerick_list.author: Aliza
David Franks
limerick_list.text:
Most country folk don't flip their wigs
Over food trends or health-conscious prigs.
