They don't care who has slimmed,
And won't drink their milk skimmed—
That's just blue john; it's fed to the pigs.

limerick_list.author: Rudi
limerick_list.text:
It's not that this restaurant's dumpy,
It's not that my entree is lumpy,
I'm moodily cross
'Cause I haven't got floss:
It's the stuff 'tween my teeth makes me grumpy.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
She was slim, and her figure was boyish,
But her eyes had a look that was coyish
With a message, complex—
Was she eager for sex?
Was she toy-ish? Enjoy-ish? Destroy-ish?

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Wrigley's Gum, never being outdone,
Mixed up pepper- and spear- mints for fun.
These two flavors so placed
Made it biune in taste,
As Certs says: "Two-two-two mints in one."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Curval,  curvant and  curvate, I've heard,
Are three words which mean "curved". How absurd!
I've been wracking my brain,
But I cannot explain
How this lexical excess occurred.

limerick_list.author: Rudi
limerick_list.text:
When I see something gruesome, I grue:
I shudder and shiver, I do—
That's until someone toothsome
Approaches. I'm truthsome.
"Screw grueing!" I'll think, "Can we screw?"

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
The temple façade at my place
Was too plain, so I added a vase
(Well, an urn) to the peak of
The pediment—speak of
The best acroterion space!

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
Those who accept incrementalism
See trends to and from fundamentalism,
But if credence is lent
To a random event
One defines that as plain accidentalism.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The eyes of its freshers are gleaming,
The faces of graduates, beaming,
As the life of each don
Here in Oxford goes on:
This city inspires much dreaming.

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
The architect noted ironically
(Pointing out architectonically)
That buildings designed
To be one of a kind
Tend to suffer deficiencies chronically.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A worse screeching the crew can't recall:
That fool feedback will empty the hall.
Move his mike or the speaker.
(So he'll sound somewhat weaker;
No one cares what he says, after all.)

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The Cliftonia grow to small trees,
A ways up from the Florida Keys.
In the springtime they bloom
With a gentle perfume—
And the bee-keepers pleasure their bees.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
My existence now hangs by a thread.
If I'm found in this house, I'll be dead.
Brawny husband's returned,
And I'm rightly concerned...
Please, please, please, don't look under the bed!

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
The culicines (students, take heed)
Spread human disease when they feed.
Her proboscis injected?
You might be infected!
Malignant mosquitoes indeed.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Our away day—oh, such inspiration!
Such a boost for our group's motivation!
But I feel at a loss.
Though I slept with the boss,
I've been told to forget wage inflation.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
To the O.E.D.I.L.F. — Hi.
I have kidnapped your Editor guy.
All your members must pay
Fifty dollars today
Or you'll bid Chris J. Strolin goodbye.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"May I ask, 'What's the charge,' Sgt. Neff?"
Asked the pulled-over driver named Jeff.
"Well, two miles to your rear
Your wife exited." "Queer,
But thank God. I just thought I'd gone deaf."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You're an African fish eagle fan?
Let me guess where you're from—South Sudan!
Ha, I got it in one!
Who outguesses me? None!
I'm the national animal man!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A cent and a scent and ascent,
When pronounced, can confuse your intent.
But add context and hear
("I assent, have no fear")
What the sounds of "uh-SENT" represent.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Cockeyed bob is a term from Down Under
Describing a storm that has thunder
And wind gusts severe.
It's not totally clear
How this storm got its name.  Gotta wonder.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
In a feedlot, close by the frontier,
A rancher stopped briefly to peer.
"There is something amiss.
Inside, Ma and your sis
Are gorging on corn with that steer."

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
My chessboard has sixty-four squares.
It is chequered and laquered and glares,
And thirty-two men
Walk it now and again,
But we use it for coffee—who cares!

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
A diacope, also called tmesis,
Cuts a word into two distinct pieces.
A new word's injected;
The meaning's protected —
In fact, interest in-freakin'-creases.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Said a crusty old baker, face red,
"All my regulars seem to have fled;
Buns go stale on the rack."
And his mood turned as black
As the over-baked crust on his bread.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
You've signed up, now your posting's expected,
And your army fatigues you've collected.
When wearing this kit
You won't like it a bit
Since with menial tasks they're connected.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Valedictory: that's the oration
A top graduate gives, with elation,
At commencement, that time
Of beginning a climb
Towards a new life, with great celebration.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
I was seeking a plant that was bold:
Something striking. And soon I was sold
A magnificent palm,
Which stands out like a charm.
Now, I hope it can tolerate cold.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
My relations with women are lame,
I'm alone and depressed — what a shame.
I have run out of tricks
While you're rolling in chicks.
Hey bro, can you spare me a dame?

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
When them hippies up thar on their farm
Tol' me "Earth nut pee" cain't do no harm,
I purt' near had thrombosis.
But L. tuberosus
(Or earthnut pea) shouldn't alarm.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
An unfortunate lady named Ella
Was given the push by her fella
On account of B.O.;
She just didn't know,
Because her best friends wouldn't tell her.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Evil memories came like a thief.
They stole happiness, leaving me grief.
Now my mind has gone blank —
I have liquor to thank.
To forgetfulness! Blessed relief.

limerick_list.author: BobfromThirsk
limerick_list.text:
An auto crash brought to an end
The career of our car-stealing "friend".
At high speed without fear,
He omitted to steer
Round a left-handed right-angled bend.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light and Engineer
limerick_list.text:
My first day on the job—I'm brand-new.
Feeling nervous, I stopped in the loo.
I was in such a rush
I neglected to flush—
Holy crap! The VP saw my poo!

limerick_list.author: Nathan Howe
limerick_list.text:
Among glamorous folks there's a schism
Over Botox and vain egotism.
A wrinkle correction,
This magic injection
Is the can-bulging blight, botulism!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Since my wife's wearing silks and sateens
To the fancy affair at Eileen's,
I must go to that sucker
In best bib and tucker—
My bowling shirt, flip-flops, and jeans.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
So, you say to me, "Judge, let's play ball,"
But this hundred? It won't do at all.
 You just don't understand:
 As a gift, it's too grand;
As a bribe, it's appallingly small.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Best back off, kid, that's Drysdale out there.
Stand too close, he'll be parting your hair.
So stop crowding the plate,
Now, before it's too late.
Think I'm crazy? Just check out his stare.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
My glum friend wears a grimace that grows;
When she frowns, watch it screw up her nose.
She gets surly and mad,
Then gets sulky. It's sad.
What a face—even dour in repose.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's compressed to a flammable mass
That gives barbeque grilling some class.
For a cookout, I'm set
On the charcoal briquette.
(Only fools use electric or gas.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Cowboy Bob cut a calf from the herd.
To a specialized pen it was spurred.
"Every cow on my spread
Must be branded," he said.
Soon a cry from the young'un was heard.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"The Muslin Moth's white." "No, it's grey."
They will both find they're right in a way.
With wings soft as duck-down,
The male is a grey-brown,
And the white moth — it's she flies by day.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
If Vitamin C rings your chimes,
Eat oranges, lemons and limes.
(Some citrus fruit's sour —
You'll grimace and glower.
It's best to add sugar, at times.)

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
On my sill, silver Siamese sat.
That's a blueblood aristo-type cat.
With their air of disdain,
They surveyed their domain,
Barely deigning to reign, until . . . Scat!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The city of Accra's not far
From the country we call Côte d'Ivoire.
But this port is in Ghana
(Gold Coast, if you wanna);
Use English when at the bazaar.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
When I say "have a cherry," I mean
Prunus avium, known as the gean.
This sweet or wild cherry
May well be what Mary
Saw bow to her fetus serene.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Some say making akutaq's an art.
With the fat of a reindeer you start.
Mix in eggs, if you wish,
Raisins, berries, ground fish,
And some fresh-fallen snow—the best part!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
For John Bowlby, a child's deprivation
Of maternal concern (separation)
Can inhibit connection,
Cause lack of direction.
It's the bane of attachment formation.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Engraving takes patience and skill;
You were doing just super, until
You got careless and brash,
Printing counterfeit cash
Showing Monica meeting with Bill.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
As he comes to the end of life's road,
This old man has to creep like a toad;
But no pity he begs,
For he boasts that his legs
May be bloody, but still they're unbowed.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
When worthy ones rule: meritocracy.
When fools are in charge: kakistocracy.
In the US, we note,
Every fool gets one vote.
That's how ca-ca might trump a democracy.

limerick_list.author: rusty and a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
"The ayes have it," Chair says, his voice stiff.
"Motion carried." — "Object! That's skewiff!
We've scarcely a quorum."
Chair: "Please, due decorum."
Sounds tedious? Very! (Board's tiff.)

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Fellow graduates, let me confess
That this brief apopemptic address
Will say Reach for the stars,
But a life behind bars
Is more likely. Good luck, and God bless!

limerick_list.author: Morphiend
limerick_list.text:
All the elves were exceedingly brave,
But the dwarves had won—Maeve was a slave!
She was patient and planned
Her escape from their land:
Now she's free of the gnome and his cave.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
With a juvenile cry of delight —
"Goody gumdrops!" — Britt started to fight.
How she punched and she hit
And she scratched, clawed and bit!
Thus that tomboyish Britt set things right.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Our darts are as sharp as new pins.
We've been playing all night, for our sins.
I've been chalking up scores,
Ever lower than yours;
Yes it's you, by a long chalk, who wins.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
At your high school reunion, they'll stare
Now you're chubby and losing your hair?
No, put fears of this kind
Wholly out of your mind.
Don't concern yourself. No one will care.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Celeste is cerulean blue—
Not the healthiest kind of a hue.
She's expecting to die,
So we'll bid her good-bye.
Say adieu with no further ado.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
How does Hillary come to display
Such a stiff-upper-lipness today?
"Though you may think it odd,
I thank yoga and God
And, perhaps most of all, Chardonnay."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"I learned from the great Chubby Checker
Song 'Pony Time'!  Haw!  What the heck're
You doing?  Not gee!
Was he wrong?  Could it be?"
Yelled a baffled Iditarod trekker.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
The curassow genus of Crax—
They're dimorphic, which means the male lacks
Something found in the hen,
Or vice versa, so when
They're around, you'll know who wears the slacks.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
My wife was real keen we should go
To some diner on 5th. I said, "Whoa!
There's that cafe on 2nd
We use" (for I reckoned
It's better the devil you know).

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
"Kitchen countertop's cracked," said the critic.
So, in shopping for something granitic
That would cover the block
With pastel fine-grained rock,
I obtained and installed the aplitic.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
They've confirmed that the cancer has spread,
And it's certain that soon I'll be dead.
There is no hope for me:
G.R.A.F.O.B.
The Grim Reaper's at the foot of my bed.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
If you drive so befuddled by drink
That the elephants look rather pink
As you veer with such verve
(Alcoholically swerve),
You could sober up locked in the clink.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A gargantuan storm Captain Bligh sees
Is not all he must face on the high seas.
Is his crew going mad?
Either crisis is bad,
But it's clear he is facing two crises.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
She loves me, she loves me... or not.
I'm plucking this daisy a lot.
O horrors: somehow
It's apetalous now
And which was the last?  I forgot....

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
CQD … CQD … CQD …
I seek you; I want you to seek me.
It's a sign of distress
That predates SOS —
The Titanic tried both: RIP.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Aqua, a light greenish blue,
And aquamarine, the same hue,
Both stem, as they oughta,
From aqua, for water;
The stuff that the pisces swim through.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
"Brought to zero": that's annihilation,
And fillip can be animation.
My sister Rosetta
Thinks terms sound much better
With such academicization.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
I purchased a brand new Beretta;
Shot my wife, now I hope to forgetta.
This verse is a clue:
You'd have done the same, too.
Self-reference? You'd know if you'd meta.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Heed me, daughterkin: cleave not to boys,
They'll discard you like yesterday's toys.
Be not tempted, my child,
Lest your soul be defiled.
Wait some years amidst innocent joys.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
As the monarch King Alfred the Great
Wanted Viking attacks to abate,
He gave orders that burhs
Should be built. This occurs
In, I think, the 9th century, late.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
The barmaid looks sexy, though slender;
You ask yourself: Might she be tender?
With bartender's art
She keeps brawlers apart,
Irrespective of faith, age, or gender!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Not a street brick that comes from Detroit
(Though its name, for this verse, I'll exploit),
This cheese has no twin. It
Has peppercorns in it,
Made by cheesemakers highly adroit.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
My wife is renowned as a cook,
While her husband's the consummate schnook.
It was anise I sought for her,
Fennel I've bought for her.
"But that smell, Hon." "It's labelled. Here, look."

limerick_list.author: proof
Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Faith has seven fine kids she holds dear.
Pam has eight (and all monsters, I hear).
Babs and May, I'm aware,
Both have nine and so they're
Grand multiparas all, that is clear.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I purchased a washer and dryer,
The store's boss hung around as an eyer.
This careful observer
Kept watch with such fervor,
It annoyed both the salesman and buyer.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"Good as caz could be glossed 'piece of cake'."
"Yes, that's easy.  A guess I'll now make:
Would then caz be baked dough?"
"Though that's logical, no,
As it's cheese, if you please." "My mistake."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
This limerick with this one, its brother,
Will easily help you discover
Their interrelation:
A strange bilocation
Of words here and there in the other.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A religious fanatic—a boater—
Was adrift with a broken-down motor,
But he didn't despair.
He was certain that prayer
Would bring help to this ardent devotor.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's a scab you might find on the skin
Of your chin, or your knee, or your shin,
That can help a burn heal
By providing a seal.
With an eschar the germs don't get in.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Electronic-type music: insightful
Foes pan it — one critic yelled, "Frightful!"
Synthetically made,
It's, thank God, rarely played.
(Except when my son's acting spiteful.)

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
If my ad's got a low click-through rate,
Its efficiency's up for debate.
Website viewers don't go,
So my business is slow.
Clicks per times-site-is-viewed says it straight.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
This committee is led by the one
Called the chairperson. Meetings are run
By the human in charge,
Whether Marvin or Marge;
And their gender's important to none.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It is part of the natural plan—
Cainozoic, we figure, began
Quite a long time ago.
It's the era, you know,
In which came the ascendance of Man.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
In the winter (with cold blowing snow)
On my bed, canton flannel sheets throw.
I stay snuggled up warm
While outside howls the storm.
I am glad I have no place to go!

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Old Gus was agog over Gertie,
But Gertie was so falsely flirty.
His cronies said, "Yo Gus,
That Gertie is bogus."
Sighed Gus, "But authentically purty."

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
The Warners would run 'round the lot:
Young Yakko, and Wakko and Dot.
Their behavior was zany,
The dialog brainy.
(They were locked in the tower when caught.)

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A one-legged auditionee
Made a hopeful enquiry to see
If as Tarzan he'd do
("Me need Jane, no need shoe"),
Should he prove he could hop tree to tree.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Canna genus of lilies entrance?
Canna tropical herb be, by chance,
Such a source of delights
It enchants and excites?
Canna verse sing the praises of plants?

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
When chaos extended its might,
The darkness was not even night.
There was water, it's told.
Was it timid or bold,
The voice that said: "Let there be light"?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Immobile (I'd broken my leg),
So for breakfast Yvette made me beg.
I discreetly approached
And petitioned for poached.
Not hard-boiled—I just sought a dropped egg.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
There once was a yogi named Jane
Who practiced TM, but in vain.
Pi's digits she chanted
In hopes she'd be granted
The key to a new astral plane.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The veterans marched to the square
To complain about taxes unfair.
But disassociation
Caused mild agitation:
Some wondered just why they were there.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
16 Tauri (Celaeno) shows lustre
Though fifth magnitude's all she can muster.
The wife of Poseidon,
She's always found hidin'
'Midst sisters, the Pleiades cluster.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The ethnologist lived in a shanty,
In the jungle, where rations were scanty.
He studied the lingo
Of Ghana, and bingo!
He learned to say panty in Fanti.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Can an anode and cathode be friends?
Who's in charge when their sparks fly? Depends.
Are these opposites wracked
When they learn they attract?
Are they shocked when their passion transcends?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I suspect that the pirate chief lied
When he told me, "I take greatest pride
In resolve!"  'cause when he
Squelched a riot at sea,
His men nagged: "Who goes over? Decide!"

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Boxiana means all things pertaining
To boxing, which needs no explaining.
They are objects and tales
Of young guys hard as nails,
Who will quit with few brain cells remaining.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
In my Chevy, I'm sure I'll not see a box
More dear (don't sneer!) — its gearbox,
Which controls my car's torque.
I just gawk like a dork
As its splined spindles spin. It's no mere box.

limerick_list.author: Amelia A
limerick_list.text:
They say I like swinging the lead,
But that's not why I linger in bed:
I'm conserving my strength
To review at great length
War and Peace—and it's not even read!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
With technologies splitting off midstream,
It's every computerized kid's dream
To buzz round the world
On a network empearled,
With bazillions of words all in bitstream.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The antrustions signed on with the guard
(Not in vassalage; that's a canard).
Merovingian kings
Felt a call for such things:
Reign is power; retaining it's hard.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
You're a partly digested foul mass;
Semifluid and icky, you pass
Out the stomach and flow
To duodenum—go!
You are chyme, and more stinky than gas!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
An engineman type, heretofore,
Might call "steam engine tending" his chore.
Since the work's not the same,
His old job lost its name —
Such machinery's long out the door.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
He is 8, but he wants to be 10.
"And miss all of year 9? Say again?"
He fussily fidgets —
"I want double digits!"
Claims he cannot be happy 'til then.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The song "Dust in the Wind" says we're just
Here but briefly.  It's futile to trust
That we matter at all.
We are all very small.
In an eye blink, we've bitten the dust.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"My poodle can talk. Here's the proof.
On a loom, there's a warp and a...?"  "Woof!"
"My anthropoglot setter
Can do even better.
What covers our house is a...?" "Roof!"

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
"Dearest friends; let us dine! As it's said,
Together we'll sit and break bread!"
Though a meal seemed a nice
Way of breaking the ice,
He served beans; we broke wind there instead.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Back-forecasting's useful to vet
All our climate predictions. We bet
If old data explain
Who got more or less rain,
Then our models aren't somehow all wet.

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
The ejido's the old Aztec way:
Land belongs to its workers, OK?
(So those Mexicans say
Who regret that today
NAFTA capitalism holds sway.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Come next June, sixty years we will be
Married happily—Marty and me,
And our town will arrive
At age seventy-five.
It's a diamond (for both) jubilee.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Reverend Jenny is now an ecclesiast.
She once stripped, but was not an ecdysiast.
She worked, she has said
In a farm-produce shed;
She stripped pea pods, an expert chick peasiast.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
I'm eating an apple as fast
As I can. It's a groove, it's a blast,
It's so sweet and delicious!
I know it's nutritious—
What's this? A bit worm? I'm aghast!!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Grandpa Michael's a righteous old sod
With some old-fashioned ways I find odd.
For example, when mad
You may hear him shout, "Gad!"
'Cause he can't bring himself to say "God!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A football team captain won fame
With these words, at the start of a game:
"Men, show flection!", said he,
Meaning "Men, take a knee".
(Genuflection? That's nearly the same.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I'm impressed with your classification
Of the types of degasification.
 Removing the bubbles
Will end all my troubles—
To my struggles bring pacification."

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
A daredevil, back in the day,
Jumped his horse over big bales of hay.
Medieval Knievel
Said, "I know the reeve'll
Find sponsors to give me some pay!"

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
His cloddish behavior was quaint
For an hour or two; now it ain't.
He's the king of the dolts,
And my brain just revolts—
Will I date him? I'd rather eat paint!

limerick_list.author: jsolomon
Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
This pustule's malign, by my soul:
It is swollen and burns like a coal.
'Tis an anthrax, filled fatter
With venomous matter
Than Satan with evil is swole.

limerick_list.author: Comicoffee
limerick_list.text:
Don't you think it's a little ironic
Your mom claims she's not histrionic?
She's quite angel-seeming
On days she's not screaming
Or downing her tenth gin and tonic!

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Just imagine what Abe would have said
If a fan proposed carving his head
In the side of a cliff.
He'd have said, "That's terrif,
But I'd like a nice photo instead."

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Shared a room with a hedgehog. We sat, mate,
Swapping spine-chilling tales. There we'd chat, mate.
But then down he was mowed
While out crossing the road—
Now, in more ways than one, he's my flatmate.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
I'm an Anton van Leeuwenhoek fan,
So the microscope-maker's my man;
He's the first one to draw
Tiny creatures he saw,
Animalcules he drank by the can.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
There was once a poetical man
Whose limerick lines didn't scan.
I'll offer a sample:
He wrote, for example,
"The Empire of the Rising Sun was Japan."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A stylish young lady named Carol
Commenced walking 'round in a barrel.
Soon followed the fashion
To stroll with a passion
Down Main Street in wooden apparel.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
"By yon bonnie brae," said the lassie,
"You can show me what makes you so classy.
When we both drink our fill
Of sweet love on that hill,
Then you'll know if I'm quiet or sassy."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
CPAs take a public exam
In accounting. They study and cram
On financial affairs
To get certified—there's
Some assurance their numbers aren't sham.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
The island of Bornholm is small
(A few hundred square miles, and that's all),
Yet strategically speaking
Were the Danes wrong in seeking
To keep it so firmly in thrall?

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
You object to me writing of sex
And of thighs as they ripple and flex?
Well, please take a hike
Or be off on your bike!
With just what should I rhyme BMX?

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The sages taught Ptolemy's spheres
For a thousand and three hundred years.
Though it lasted for ages,
Arrived at in stages,
To that model now no one adheres.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
I was lost in the fog while out sailing
When hailed by a dealer out baling.
"I'm from Haling," I said,
And he nodded his head.
"I can help! I've spent years there in Haling!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The names of some plants may sound silly.
A shrub that is found down in Chile
Produces a nut
That is edible, but
Don't just cut off its fruit  willy-nilly.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
When I was a child, I'd complain:
"Though my gaberdine keeps out the rain,
All this waterproof cotton
Is heavy, and rotten
To wear." I protested in vain.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
While it's true that I'm watching my pennies
Since I'm only a busboy at Denny's,
I have had an affair
With eight waitresses there.
The pay stinks, but you can't beat the bennies!

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio and Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Listen, hitman, I'll shoot from the hip.
Here's the buzz: Don't let mob secrets slip
To the fuzz. Sing no tune
'Less you're rendered immune.
You can then be a turncoat and flip.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Endemism: something unique
To a desert or mountainous peak,
Or a swamp or a plain,
Or some other domain—
Like that Newt, plain to see, up the creek.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
There was a young baker named Jake
Who made the most fabulous cake
Like a fiery cat
With a lamb—fancy that!
'Twas inspired by William Blake.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though the "gaunt look" has gained popularity,
In real life, thank God, it's a rarity.
One more often observes
Winsome women with curves
Instead of severe angularity.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Back on campus, the epithet Greek
Carries with it a certain mystique.
To the ancients, a flat
Full of men was no frat,
But an andron—downstairs, so to speak.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Said my physicist sister, bright Marion,
"A proton or neutron's a baryon,
And a triquark. I've sent a
New paper, on penta-
quarks, …" There, I tuned out. She's a scary 'un.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a pit in the yard one could fall in,
A threat now the baby is crawlin'.
But with shovel in hand,
Mom will level the land.
"A day's work," she explains, "it is all in."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Let's make ice cream! We'll eat and make merry!
Flavored how? Maybe some kind of berry?
Though the hardwood, my dear,
Makes a gorgeous veneer,
Use the fruit, not the wood, of black cherry.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
When an insect's digested its food,
What is left it will need to exude,
And that excrement's frass:
It will pass through the ass
(Or the rectum if ass is too crude).

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When people grin: "You're a dark horse!"
They may give you a cause for remorse;
For those talents you chose
Not to show, they'll disclose
(And embellish what's juicy, of course!).

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
On this website, one thing that I hate
Is to join in a workshop too late.
There's so much I could say,
But I fear, on that day,
I'd embrangle the clever debate!

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
Dragged my pen 'cross the paper. No prank,
Made a line that was straight as a plank.
Said my friend, "What's it show?
Just what is it?" "Don't know,
I'm afraid I'm just drawing a blank."

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
In a pottery shop in Bombay,
Buy a goglet that's made out of clay.
Having filled it up, you'll
Find that water stays cool,
Though this long-necked jug's outside all day.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Our long friendship is now at an end;
Your stinginess cost you a friend —
No more palship, rapport.
The main reason?   You swore
Not to tender a friend a wee lend.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A body check slows or impedes
Your opponent, but sometimes it breeds
The avenging reply
Of an eye for an eye
(Although not from those chickens, the Swedes).

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
While discoursing of Morris or Ruskin,
I like to sip wine from a cuskin.
Then when I get bored,
I just grab my accord-
ion, saying: "I'm goin' out buskin'."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Year by year I've more neutral connection
To which losers have won the election:
I'm in Guam; who prevailed?
My ballot's unmailed.
That's my absentee voter rejection.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Empanadas are turnovers, Fred —
Very varied.  Wrap soft, flat white bread
Round a filling of meat,
Or sweet fruit, for a treat;
Bake or fry. Muy sabroso! Nuff said.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
The copper-rose, cop-rose, or head work
Grows wild, independent of bed-work.
It's the common red poppy,
I learn from my copy
Of Flowers of the Field, a well-read work.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
What our fantasy board game provides:
The idea that fate rides on tides.
Watch the tumbling dance
Of what's shaping our chance:
Decahedrons  — our dice have ten sides.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
You slouch, wretched Brit, round the fort
As if training and drill are as naught.
And you drink till you're plastered,
Britunculus bastard!
You'll jump when I file my report.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
There's no man-made or natural law
Against making a minor faux pas;
So in bed, if I name,
By mistake, an old flame,
Then just why does it rub my wife raw?

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
A daughtercard lives in computers.
(No, it's not a small card with big hooters.)
It connects to a motherboard —
That is another board.
Soncard?  — ah, no.  And no neuters.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
No, he wasn't a poet of note.
Of the daisy, Montgomerie wrote,
"The fields overflow
With gowans that grow."
(And yes, that's a modernized quote.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Raymond's ring reputation is tainted.
With the lingo he's not well acquainted.
When his coach cried, one night,
"Ray just feint with your right,"
Seems he misunderstood and he fainted.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Stop that racket!  That's IT!  No vacation!"
By spiting her face, in frustration,
She cut off her nose.
The rash sanction she chose
Threw a wrench in her planned relaxation.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
No matter how hard I would try,
I'd be frightened and ready to cry,
While to him it was tedium—
To inject contrast medium—
When I'd go for my brain MRI.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
When you give a false name to a Fed,
You tip him a queer chant, it's said,
As a chant's (a) ID;
Or (b) hallmark; or (c)
An ad: "WANTED: ALIVE OR (gee!) DEAD".

limerick_list.author: Cuttlefish
limerick_list.text:
She will let you write page after page
On her life on the screen and the stage.
But one thing you must guess,
For she'll never confess
To her true chronological age.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A bow tie's a neckpiece that hasta
Be knotted just right. It will lasta
Full day and look neat,
But take care when you eat
Drippy sauce with your lunch (bow tie pasta).

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Our young cat's going nuts in the hall,
Taking leaps at the spots on the wall
In a state of pure frazzlement.
He can't catch the dazzlement
That's flashed off my new disco ball.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There's a plant in the marsh that deters
One from wading, the angler avers.
After fishing near shore,
He's got prickles galore—
With the bur reed, he's buried in burs.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
One more loan, then success or starvation:
That's our word on our debt limitation.
But there's always a flaw:
Can the writ of the law
Be enforced on a sovereign nation?

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Neighbors needing supplies and our charity,
Sharpie altered storm's path and severity.
Would such baseless sillery
Have been spawned under Hillary?
Track the eye, and enjoy the hilarity.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
This story is Harlan McDougal's.
He's astounded whenever he googles.
When he got up this morn
And googled his horn,
His mind boggled at oodles on flügels.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Humpty Trumpty cried, "We need a wall!"
Ms. Pelosi said, "No wall at all!"
Will the Donald be humbled
And brought low if he tumbled?
Bible quote: pride precedes a great fall.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Change the baby," she called from the door.
He's my boy, so I've managed before.
I inspected his nappy:
As expected, right crappy.
She's come home: "He's just done a bit more."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
She sat scared in her cell. It was black,
And not one ray of light pierced a crack.
It was black as the Earl
Of Hell's waistcoat; the girl
Let loose tears that could not be held back.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
There's a custom I share with my folks.
Every year we play practical jokes.
On the first day of May
I am careful to stay
Out of range of a letter that smokes.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
In blind blocking, blocks made of brass
Or of zinco are used.  They surpass
Flimsy paperback covers,
But bookbinding lovers
Want gold to adorn Leaves of Grass.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Warp drive failing? I care not a jot.
Laws of physics? Don't give me that rot.
And don't furrow your brow,
Please just energise now—
Cut the crap, beam me up, Mr Scott!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Avatar means a godhead's descent
As a mortal on earth, bless'd event.
Now when avatar's spoken,
It's merely a token:
Motif on a message you've sent.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
An afflux of blood makes you flush
As it moves to one place in a rush.
If you tingle or burn,
It's no cause for concern.
(My favorite example?  The blush.)

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
So Skinny and Fat-as-a-Sow
Have agreed to amalgamate now.
For Fat's share of beef stock,
Lank traded its leaf stalk;
They milked all the cash from the cow.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
Two arguing Romans professed
That each knew what these letters expressed.
As they fought, I was faced
With a horrible taste—
Like the milk of a she-lupine breast.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A tree-dwelling panda perceives
That the bagworm, a moth larva, weaves
A silk casing that's strewn
With small twigs; a platoon
In his tree likes to eat shoots and leaves.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The most diligent person I've seen,
He will work like a bloody machine,
Always gives of his best,
And attacks life with zest—
The epitome (trust me) of keen.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
There's a nut like no other, I've found,
'Cause it ripens, matures, underground.
There's no ifs, ands, or buts
That those Arachis nuts
Make the best peanut butter around.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
After many long months of privation
On this deep-frozen South Polar station,
My relief has arrived,
I survived! I survived!
O euphoria, rapture, elation!

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
The choirmaster thoroughly ticked us
Off for a poor Benedictus;
But we in the choir
Are unmoved by his ire —
It was he, after all, who hand-picked us.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
As June Cleaver, she'll always remain
In our hearts in a motherly vein.
Barbara Billingsley then
Spoofed that character when,
In a film, she spoke jive on a plane.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Amphoterism: this is a quality
Some chemists consider frivolity.
Though it may interface
As an acid or base,
The hydroxyl embraces with jollity.

limerick_list.author: Peter Meyer
limerick_list.text:
Odd numbers (eleven, thirteen)
All have even ones ranging between.
And by their addition,
The mathematician
Gets an even one out nice and clean.

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
Tess's wedding day? Frank was a fink:
Slipped a Mickey in everyone's drink.
With the groom out of ardor
And no one to guard her,
Frank kidnapped the bride in a blink.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With his alieniloquy, Fred
Sought to sidetrack the stranger.  He said,
"Like a mint?  What's your sign?
What's the cube root of nine?"
(The man's wife had been caught in Fred's bed.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The first break in a word such as du-
odenitis is after the "u."
You're not sure how it's done?
Just examine line 1
And line 2 of this verse for a clue.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Some Hebrews considered defections
From Moses and voiced their objections:
"The Red Sea's in the way."
"So divide it, and yea,
Then we won't have to stop for directions."

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
Epigrammatists strive to compose
Pithy verses and snippets of prose:
They flow well; there's no filler;
The punchline's a killer.
(I wish I could write one of those.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What's dragée (with that accent it takes)?
Some poor cave babe whose scalp always aches?
Not at all. Bakers say
It's pronounced as "drah-ZHAY":
Little balls used to decorate cakes.

limerick_list.author: saranita
limerick_list.text:
The good folks in the pews never knew
That their minister, Reverend McHugh,
Had white tissue — two feet! —
Hanging down his pants' seat.
'Twas the choir loft that furnished the view.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said the parents' committee, beseeching,
"Do away with this Darwinist teaching!
The truth lies in Genesis;
Your textbook a menace is.
Let your lessons agree with our preaching!"

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
My neighbor has diamonds galore,
And buckets of money, and more.
I'd consider a break-in
But fear I would waken
That cerberus guarding the door.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
My armor is strong, chased with brass,
The tuilles, cuisse and pauldrons first-class.
A culet? My sweet,
Since I'd never beat feet,
I've no reason to cover my ass.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
In all projects, some task times have slack:
A delay, but the goal stays on track.
That time is called float,
Where the top planners note
Project end dates will not be set back.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Cloth from fibre or yarn? Start to knit,
Although blokes might start squirming a bit.
(We don't like to be seen
Wielding needles) I mean,
Knitting fabric, we'd feel like a twit!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Richard *key, *-crossed Ringo *r,
Goes where up*t sex-*ved *lets are.
*ts at *bucks, he *es
At the cu*d eclairs—
"Ba*d co-*s! *k naked!" (Bizarre....)

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The egg that was served him was bad—
'Twas the worst that the curate'd had—
But when asked, he said, "Well,
It has parts that excel,"
Out of fear that his host would be mad.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Into, once, the polluted old Thames
Fell two jewel-encrusted drunk femmes.
Alimentary waste
Slowly turned them to paste,
A sad fate that they shared with their gems.

limerick_list.author: Matt Schweizer
limerick_list.text:
Far-flung from the summer's sweet blossom
Hides autumn, curled up like a possum.
And through winter's cold jeer,
We still hope for spring's cheer,
So enjoy, for now, leaves that are awesome.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Curarization first made me relax.
It's amazing how fast that stuff acts.
Now I'm stiff as a board
I can't move. Oh, my lord!
I'm in vat twenty-four: House of Wax!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I squinted and furrowed my brow
As I sighted my weapon. Then, pow!
I was having such fun
With my elephant gun,
Till I found I had murdered a cow.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm campaigning for Congress. I chose
A consultant when problems arose.
For high office I yearn,
But I've plenty to learn.
Is he worth what he's paid? Heaven knows!

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
The first casualty of all war
Is the truth, so they say; what is more,
Once the truth's dead and gone,
Then the war may go on
Without reference to morals or law.

limerick_list.author: olwen
limerick_list.text:
If steak is the meal of the day,
Buy Aberdeen-Angus, I'd say.
To start with good cattle
Is most of the battle,
Then cook it in just the right way.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
At the restaurant known as BK
You can have what you like every day;
Order large fries with ease,
Or king-sized, if you please—
It's the place where you "have it your way."

limerick_list.author: Matt Barber
limerick_list.text:
Some book-cookers know how to con
(Like those outlaws who worked for the Don).
Crooked bookkeepers find
Ways to rob accounts blind:
Enron résumés? Better move on!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Watching baseball we look at the field,
Where the dugouts are semi-concealed.
There sit players entrenched;
Some are waiting, some benched.
Past the dugout, you'll find the well-heeled.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Center fielders will often amaze,
Making circus-like catches on plays.
Willie Mays snagged a ball
In the Series that all
Who were lucky to see it still praise.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
As he lit on a light in the lot,
It was clear that he quickly grew hot
When he froze for a sec
(Oh, the woes of his trek),
For this futureless fly now is not.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though I'm not one to whine and complain,
Having sex with my husband's a strain.
Dyspareunia's what
Dr. Scott says I've got.
My vagina cramps up, causing pain.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Do you think Bryan Adams, when he
Said he'd "Run to You", meant to BC?
This heaven astounds
With its heart-stopping Sounds...
All the kids wanna Rocky, eh, B?

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Fascination with birds' views — and fun:
Archaeology, aerially done.
From above, it has found
Things unseen on the ground,
In the light of a red rising sun.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The Big Chill limned a whole generation:
Grown-up boomers, their angst and stagnation.
What they've sought has been handed them;
Here's where it's landed them.
Kasdan's story eludes explication.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
She's a druidess, prophetess, seer.
She predicts what will happen next year.
You're surprised? Think it's funny
That she hasn't much money?
She's a bust picking stocks—so I hear.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My kid sister was angry and whiny:
"Ma, you oughta spank big brudder's heinie!"
It was true what she'd said.
I'd put bugs in her bed,
And the beetles (Goliath) weren't tiny.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Stop the presses! We've got an exclusive:
A new photo of Author Elusive.
Our stringer who shot it
Says only we got it;
The author was crude and abusive.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I bought epilator cream to take care
Of removing superfluous hair.
Its bottle was blue —
My shampoo's? It was too.
Now I use wigs and glue — my scalp's bare.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
To market my fresh balm of gilead
(Which cleared up some spots that poor Willy had),
Extolling its oils
For pox, tonsils and boils,
I'm resorting to this rather silly ad.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Though these letters have dots that are bitty,
To me, i's and j's appear pretty.
Try hijinks in Fiji;
In Beijing play Ouija.
See Ajijic, a Mexican city.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
Once arrested, the wealthy post bail
So they won't have to stay locked in jail
Till their trial completes.
They can then hit the streets,
But while free they must not hit the trail!

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
When arguing I will prefer
To avoid racial insult or slur.
  My points will abound
  With pure reasoning sound
That will force worthy foes to concur.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I am hoping my autobiography
(Part linguistics, part jokes, part pornography)
Will make mountains of dough
And eventually show
I broke ground in my field: lexicography.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A clairaudient woman's my Claire,
Hearing voices not seemingly there,
Like those outside the range
Of perception.  How strange:
Our love's dying, yet she's unaware.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
It's a hard, it's a hard, it's a hard —
So singeth Bob Dylan, the Bard.
How he'd difficultate
The debate — he'd berate.
Oh, it's hard and it's so avant-garde!

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
An audiovisual show
Can instruct you in things you should know.
Someone narrates the scene:
"You should keep your hands clean!"—
"There's the beep! Turn the knob! Hey, let's go!"

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer and SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I contrasted all evening, comparatively,
All the Claras I located narratively.
There were Barton and Bow—
They're both dead, now I know.
Yes, it's so!" Tom asserted, declaratively.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Entomologists, speaking of flies,
Can apprise why they rise to the skies.
They are dipterous, soar
On two wings, never four.
One or three, I surmise, means demise.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
My euphoria's second to none
When with coffee my morning's begun.
Caffeine is so quick
With its day-bright'ning kick
That the decaf I 'most always shun.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The English sack Caen, then advance
On Crécy and the forces of France.
It's the Hundred Years War,
And King Edward will roar
In this battle of longbow and lance.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Young Borg was a dutiful child.
Playing tennis, he never got riled:
As a man on the court,
Very gentle—a sport.
He was Swedish and Bjorn to be mild.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Lepidopterists struggle to learn a
Great deal, and their studies concern a
Bright insect that flies
In the daytime. These guys
Study butterflies, known as Diurna.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Desinter means "dig up from the ground."
Disenter has a similar sound.
If you think it's dissenter,
Your dissent you may enter—
Disagreers will always abound.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
For naught did my studies avail:
'Twas a test I was destined to fail.
Thanks to Kelvin, my hero,
I scored up a zero
On the absolute temperature scale.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
For soothing, no drug can surpass
Analgesics (the pain-killing class).
Two aspirins will do
To relieve aches from flu,
But they won't cure a pain in the ass.

limerick_list.author: Suzanne Kreul
limerick_list.text:
If you alphabetize, it's a duty
For frutti to come before tutti.
List words, if you please,
By their A's, B's, then C's.
At least age will still come before beauty.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
We know game birds are birds of the sort
That are frequently hunted for sport;
A "bird game for some fun"
Though, in slang, is the one
That boys find is quite easily caught!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Just observe as my knuckles contort
With chiragrical pain (pass the port).
Gout's the worst of all trips
When the agony rips —
Lift the glass to my lips, there's a sport.

limerick_list.author: Brent Annable
limerick_list.text:
An anabasis, musically speaking,
Is when motives and figures are peaking.
This is probably why
During "Glory on high"
Those sopranos insist on their shrieking.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For you, allegheny, my vine,
I sit here and weep in my wine.
Though I'm just an old-timer,
I miss my dear climber;
Without you my wine turns to brine.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An away day's a meeting off site,
Where the English might go overnight.
With the office behind,
You can focus your mind
On the problem at hand—get it right.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
But — "I will have my bond!" Shylock cried,
For his bloodlust would not be denied.
Debt unpaid, he would menace
The merchant of Venice,
Avenging his spat-upon pride.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
Brother John! Are you snoring so deep
'Neath your blankets all piled in a heap?
You're a slugabed, sir!
Shake a leg now—bestir
Yourself! What? Have you died in your sleep?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When we call someone "Judas" we claim
He's a traitor. (They're one and the same.)
So don't let it faze ya.
In antonomasia
The class is implied by a name.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
While a black dwarf emits little light,
Yet a star it is, in its own right:
There's no racism in heaven,
Yet for Disney the seven
Comprised no black star in Snow White.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Come on, do what you're hired to do;
It's your job, and you'd best follow through.
If you dodge being duteous,
I'll batter your beauteous
Butt with the sole of my shoe.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
Bat in hand, I must peer through the gloom,
And I fear the next ball spells my doom.
Then the umpires confer
And humanely concur
That "bad light" is the call. Off I zoom!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A mason who worked in Nantucket
Made his lunch in the morn and would truck it
Each day without fail
In a small dinner pail.
(He brought chow from his home in a bucket?)

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Don't hop down the lane, quite at ease:
Stay away from our orb-eyeballs, please,
Or these dreadlamps will find you
To bind you and blind you —
Ensnared and bedazzled, you'll freeze.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
I was driving my lorry; it stalled.
The AA were the blokes whom I called.
When the bonnet was raised,
My fix they appraised:
It was petrol I hadn't installed.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
My back, out of whack in the spine,
Chiropractors once tried to align.
They kneaded and pushed,
I groaned and they shushed
'Til at last I yelled, "Stop! You're malign!"

limerick_list.author: Suzanne Kreul
limerick_list.text:
When the king says, "Oh please, do attend,"
Then you surely don't want to offend.
You had better be there,
Or you'd better beware
That you might lose your head in the end.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
I won't dress up in any old rag,
I wear heels, and I carry a bag—
But you see, I'm a guy,
So you might say that I
Have a high coefficient of drag.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
My friend's a muchacho named Mario
Who lives in New York's largest barrio.
There the old country thrives
As they live out two lives
In a "Spanish/American" scenario.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In the Pyrenees, snow-capped and piney,
Lies Andorra, a nation quite tiny.
You say countries so small
Are worth nothing at all?
You're a dope and can go kiss my heinie!

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
I was sure your restraint wouldn't last:
As expected, the pale's been surpassed.
You're beyond it, in fact.
Yes, the way that you act
Leaves the thickest-skinned rascal aghast.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This Congressional caucus is black
(Of Hispanics and whites, there's a lack):
Representatives all
'Cept Obama, a tall
Presidential contender they back.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I don't care that we're now going steady.
We'll have sex when I'm damn good and ready.
Though I think that you're sweet,
I do not want to cheat
On Rudolfo, Frank, Larry, and Eddie.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
In apprenticeships, people who train,
But from formalized studies abstain,
Are by articling bound
While their set years amound,
Then the status of journeymen gain.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
As COVID-19 strikes all lands,
For a while the whole world understands
To bump elbows, salute,
Maybe bow (that looks cute!);
We're advised it's not wise to shake hands.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Make a custard inside a small pot.
Sprinkle sugar—Oh, almost forgot—
Then apply a hot flame
Till it's burnt, hence its name:
Crème brulée, French for "guzzle the lot".

limerick_list.author: agingjb
limerick_list.text:
King Claudius murdered his brother,
And married the young Hamlet's mother.
This resulted in trouble,
Reducing to rubble
The court, as they slaughtered each other.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When opining that something is phony,
Try using a word that is tony.
The name of a city
In Italy's pretty—
Just smile and pronounce it—baloney!

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
An anachorism isn't — not quite —
An anachronism. Let's get them right...
Snow in Egypt's the first,
While a film-Pharaoh's thirst
Is the second — if quenched by a Sprite.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
The Chinese black mushroom's nutritious,
And many folks think it's delicious.
I've also heard rumors
It helps prevent tumors,
So eating it would be propitious.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The Carrington event caused no mirth
As aurorae were seen 'cross the earth.
CMEs — not the norm —
Hit the earth: solar storm
Of a notable magnitude's worth.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
I saw Jesus! What — haven't you heard?
It's right here, in Ephesians' third.
But my doc has the thesis
It's just eisegesis —
Projection straight into the Word.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
For assembling the famed Model T,
All components were strictly snag-free.
Each part faithfully true,
With nothing askew:
Sure fidelity, that was the key.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Said Ben Franklin, with typical candor,
About being a traitorous bander,
"No matter the weather,
We must hang together,
Or separately do so, commander."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though born British, on Avon's west bank,
I am glad I grew up as a Yank.
Now I've taken the oath
And feel loyal to both—
And for that I've my parents to thank.

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
When the active's the form of your voice,
Then you make a grammatical choice.
Say: "My Rolls-Royce was nicked",
And the passive was picked.
Rather, utter: "They nicked my Rolls-Royce!"

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
I don't understand what you're thinking,
But I sometimes suspect you've been drinking,
When you badger and mock
Such a sweet-smelling brock
With that scurrilous epithet, stinking!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When I called her a bitch, I would render
The opinion I did not offend her.
She is fourteen years old
And she does as she's told.
She's a wolfhound and female's her gender.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Colonialists have ambitions
To settle and farm acquisitions.
The tongue of their motherland,
Set in some other land,
Varies with local conditions.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
In this center of mental malaise,
Each oldster believes he surveys
His Great Work — you and meity:
Each thinks he's the Deity.
We call them the Ancients of Daze.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Antifeminine fashions advance
As designers give up on romance—
And I guess, as we speak,
In each trendy boutique
Every suit comes with two pair of pants.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
The grass is so green and so bright,
It is truly a beautiful sight.
The Emerald Isle
Makes you just want to smile,
Keeps you happy by day and by night.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Said the mayor, on being elected:
"A monument must be erected
To encourage the viewing
Of names of those doing
Above and beyond what's expected."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A shark-raising neighbor, MacKenzie,
Finds stray kittens.  That bum just pretends he
Loves cats. I've the blues.
I am calling the news —
'Cause what truly ensues?  Feeding frenzy.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our daddy declared, and I quote:
"On my kids I am happy to dote."
But the gifts we had gotten
Were spoiling us rotten,
And Mom said: "Butt off, you old goat!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
Unlike The Last Supper, I'm tode,
The Last Brudch could't ever be sode.
The new poidillist style
Was considered quite vile
And was due to da Vinci's bad code.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Adamantoblast: this is a cell
That produces enamel (tooth's shell).
But I had a man who
Liked to turn the air blue,
By his blasting things like "effin' hell".

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When appeals for a cause come by letter,
Or by phone call (the modern 'go-getter'),
Then the cheques you donate
At the time, or post-date,
Will leave poor folk, and you, feeling better.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
A demirep (demimondaine)
Provides service humane and profane;
Yet her half-reputation
Secures compensation:
She puts out for personal gain.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
If you bump into obstacles through
The course of the day with no clue
As to why your skin's color
Turns darker and duller,
Guess what? Bruises turn black and blue!

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
Ahmadinejad's building a nuke,
And the world gives its strongest rebuke.
Yet Mahmoud doesn't care:
"No, not me!" he'll declare.
He's a liar, a fraud, and a kook.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
A rolling stone gathers no moss,
And it might even suffer a loss.
So goodbye vegetation —
This free emuscation
Can clean it and give it a gloss.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
There's a chargemaster list about which
You shall now hear me noisily bitch.
That's where hospital fees
Just make worse one's disease.
And for-profit providers get rich.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Canada balsam resides
In the Canada balsam's insides.
It is fragrant and sticky;
To handle it's tricky.
We use it for microscope slides.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
He's the cockiest dude in the bay,
At the wheel of his red Chevrolet.
It is shiny and big,
So he's sure got the rig
To go pick up a girl for a... day.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Build a pipeline? No way — it'll leak.
She wears fibers, 'cause leather's not chic.
And her glare of reproach
When I murdered that roach…
She's a humorless, firm eco freak.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
I endamaged my car to the max.
Now it's dented and riddled with cracks.
But my beat-up Accord
You can surely afford:
She'll be twenty-nine bucks after tax.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said our botany prof, "On this quad
There's a fanweed; observe its flat pod."
I inquired, "Good to eat?"
"Well, its smell isn't sweet—
Like soiled feet. It's a warning from God."

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
The thrash band Destruction—they filled
My theater, and boy, how they killed!
Of shredding renown,
They brought the house down
(And I don't mean I'll have to rebuild).

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
So athletic's the long-legged emu
He's very unlikely to deem you
Half worthy of racing
Those limbs he loves gracing.
He knows that on one he could cream you.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Annapolis: Found in MD,
Where the Navy trains kids for the sea.
But a sailor on break
Said I'd made a mistake —
Annapolis grown on a tree.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To make alkaline or cause transformation
From an acid to base concentration—
If your pH goes clean
Up from 1 to 14,
That's the process called basification.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
They four-flush — they cheat and they scam.
Their shepherd's degrees were a sham.
I had said, "Get the flock
Out of here." To my shock,
I was fleeced. Now they're both on the lam.

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
Chez Gordon, beware of the dangers:
He's rude to both colleagues and strangers.
Renowned for his cheffing,
His effing and jeffing,
And giein' it laldie with Rangers.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Our short travel from cradle to grave
Is defined by the road that we pave.
Be it hawk, be it dove?
Choosing hate, choosing love?
Birth to death, what's your role? Knight or knave?

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When you dive in the water headfirst,
And you let out a breath while immersed,
Bubbles angrily swarm
In a violent storm
'Til they throng to the surface and burst.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
A curvature, twisting the spine
To one side, can disable; the sign,
As the vertebrae strain
Causing terrible pain,
Is a hump where you're bent out of line.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The spring equinox kept coming sooner,
So the pope called a calendar tuner.
Luigi G. earned his salary
And dropped intercalary
Days to make Easter more lunar.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
I'm a fan (ooh)! I'll kick, scratch and bite
Just to get (gasp) your autograph. Might
I please get you to sign?
In my book would be fine...
What's that? You don't know how to write?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For a squirrel, this rodent is big,
So it sits on a branch, not a twig.
It's less large than a fox,
Or an owl's nesting box,
And it's nowhere near big as a pig.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"Lairy flares? Too much flair, Joyce. So there!"
"Wear drab plaid, pleated pants? THAT'S UNFAIR!"
"Don't you dare raise your voice
To your mother, young Joyce."
(In our home, tempers easily flare.)

limerick_list.author: Robert Schechter
limerick_list.text:
To connote means to hint or imply.
I can't see a good reason why
I should add a and t
To connote, so for me
This connotate nonsense won't fly.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Guess the chances that I ever shall
Date that eye-popping beautiful gal,
And share some real fun,
Are ten thousand to one.
I sure wish I could make her my pal.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
I will sneak to your bed as you sleep,
And then tickle your toes. "Beep-beep-beep!"
You express what you feel
When you try to conceal
A surprised little squeal. It's an eep!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
If you're dormant by day, like a bat
(Diurnation is what we call that),
Then you miss all the fun
Of the afternoon sun,
When we steep in its heat with the cat.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If you step on the tail of your pet,
He may howl and become quite upset,
But don't let him escape;
You should get him on tape,
For creating musique that's concrète!

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
"I'm confounded; you chatter so cheerily 
With winter's grey skies hanging drearily.
My dear sister, you sing
Like a lark in the spring.
How I wish I could too," she sighed wearily.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Todd Duncan, Ann Brown: first to play
The black lovers we know well today.
He sang Porgy, she Bess.
And those voices? God bless!
In our memories they surely will stay.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Euripides, Sophocles, Strauss
Set their tragedies down in the house
Of the daughter Electra
(Pluck lyres, with plectra)
Who murdered her mother (the louse).

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
In my ice-cream, a lump that I spotted
Was something that seemed to have rotted;
It should not have been there,
So, consumer, beware!
For all is not cream that is clotted.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Dilithium crystals provided
The force by which starships all glided
Much faster than light.
Trekkies swear that that's right
Though their claim is quite often derided.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Remember that all things must pass.
Though your heart breaks, that hot, pretty lass
Whom you loved has now gone,
But your life will go on,
And your pain's just a test in life's class.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano and Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
The childbirth was not going well,
Since the kid was enormous as hell.
"Grab the chainsaw!" Doc cried.
With her eyes growing wide,
Mom delivered a loud, healthy yell.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Distillation of crude into fractions
Owes a lot to the bubble cap's actions.
Such a stack by degrees'll
Yield gas, down through diesel,
To tars and asphaltic extractions.

limerick_list.author: MattMonitto
limerick_list.text:
After catching a fish, Bob was struttin';
His prediction was right on the button
That he'd hook a small dace.
Next, he boasted, "I'll place
One more bet; this time, dobule or nuttin'."

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
The king in his coffin reposes
On a catafalque covered in roses.
Thus lifted on high
He offends not the eye
And, moreover, offends not our noses.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For lovers, this river is sure
To possess an uncommon allure.
It's in Asia and flows
To the east, where it goes
To a strait. And its name? The Amur!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Insomnia's taking its toll,
When each day from my warm bed I roll.
As I walk down the street
I am dead on my feet,
Too exhausted for more than a stroll.

limerick_list.author: Jeter Coffee and speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
There once was a priest from St. Cloud
Whose homilies started too loud,
But because of their length
They diminished in strength,
As he lost both his voice and his crowd.

limerick_list.author: Suzanne Kreul
limerick_list.text:
Mr. Dodge thought himself very clever,
So he planned a most artful endeavor.
He did try (or attempt)
To become tax-exempt,
But he failed. Now he's locked up forever.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Charley's wife had gone out on a date
On a sailboat that didn't look great.
Amongst ropes that were hockled,
And sails rucked and cockled,
Chuck was cuckolded, there, by his mate.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The King's offspring I mean to disprince
(Bring him down), but I'll have to convince
The King's Council he's bad,
And would poison his dad—
Just the thought makes His Majesty wince.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
If her cheeks at both ends turn to chubby,
A girl frets that her man thinks she's tubby.
But she worries too much:
Cheeks are sweet to the touch,
And will always score high with her hubby.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
I am asking the doctor to check
This cheloid scar here, on my neck.
Often itchy, it's pink,
And I honestly think
That it looks like I've been in a wreck.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
A kid that's too short for the loo
Will pass urine, and defecate too
When secure on a potty.
What comes from his botty
He'll proudly proclaim: "Look, a poo!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The sporemonger settled his bills
When he promised us fungi with frills.
He decided to cheat us,
And gave us boletus,
With pores where there should have been gills.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
My parents, adoptive, are great:
They made sure I was loved, wasn't late
For my school, learned good rules.
I'm so proud; they're both jewels.
So who cares that my moms aren't straight?

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
As I shaved, his "More gray!" was succinct.
"More distinguished!" I smiled, and I winked.
For my boy, a new word;
So he thought, and inferred,
"Does it mean you are growing extinct?"

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
With representations pictorial,
And many a fine editorial,
The north pole of Earth, it
Would seem, must be worth it,
So savour those scenes circumboreal.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Macbeth, in a glade, or a clearing,
Meets three witches and gives them a hearing.
They address him as Thane,
Say the crown he will gain;
Though he doubts it, the prophecy's cheering.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My old tomcat's an excellent mouser;
This powder's a first class delouser,
And my grandfather toils,
With electrical coils,
To demagnetize ships—a degausser.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm sorry, this doesn't make sense.
Though your talent, I'm sure, is immense,
Fifty bucks for a kiss?!
Yes, you're beautiful, miss,
But I just can't afford the expense.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"What's a dragon fish?" "Two tales unfold:
One's in tropical waters, extolled
For its form" —thus Beck reckoned.
"Antarctic, the second,
Is specially suited for cold."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"What's the bulbospongiosus? Let's chat.
It's a muscle, that's what."  "Where's it at?"
"Near the anus, that's where —
It's one both sexes share.
But it serves different roles, I know that."

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
The monitor started to beep.
This was more than descent into sleep.
He, beginning to pray,
Watched his mum drift away,
Kissed her forehead and started to weep.

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
The angler tells tales of the size
Of the fish that have met their demise.
Credulity stretches
As Fisherman fetches
More beer to embellish his lies.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A coverchief covered one's head
In Chaucerian times, so I've read.
It's an obsolete word
That is no longer heard,
Since today we use kerchief instead.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A wood nymph who dwelt in a dell
Fell under a satyr's hard sell.
In her dingle they wrangled
And wriggled, entangled,
Until she came under his swell.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Abortifacients induce the expulsion
Of fetuses, causing revulsion
In folks who appear
To want us to adhere
To their faith and their God through compulsion.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Defectuosity: what a collection
Of syllables! Further inspection
Reveals that this word,
Sounding wholly absurd,
Is a noun meaning "great imperfection."

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Me dishonest? I'm whiter than white.
Your denouncement is most impolite.
Check my claims—they're within
All the guidelines. My sin
Was pretending the guidelines were right.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Some athletes get contracts so high
While on dope, and it makes me ask, "Why?"
With some help from their juice,
We could all be so spruce,
Breaking all kinds of records, no lie.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
The god Geb, who personified Earth,
Fathered Isis, Osiris. His birth
Was Egyptian; a snake
Was his emblem; a quake
Of the earth, the result of his mirth.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A revhead, a ranga named Lana
(A redhead who loved her Torana),
Drove at dangerous speed,
Copped a fine for her deed —
Then that deadhead saw red, did her nana.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Playing volleyball down at the beach,
We are even at seven points each.
As the onlookers cheer,
It's abundantly clear
That both teams have the win within reach.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Per Dad's fideicommissary plan,
I'm to find then enrich some young man:
Part of Dad's great estate
Is this kid's — got that straight?
I'll dispute it the best that I can.

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
The jackpot is mine — ain't it funny!
Life will change, and the future looks sunny!
Folks felicitate me
And applaud, but — oh, gee! —
What they're after, I fear, is my money.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"One has claws at the end of its paws.
One's a pause at the end of a clause."
You can now tell a cat
From a comma. How's that
For a def with a diff? Hold applause.

limerick_list.author: Pete G.
limerick_list.text:
What magic conspires to draw me
To this rich Danish pastry before me?
Its currants and icing
Appear so enticing —
"Oh, eat me!" I hear it implore me.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
My young daughter enjoys dot to dot.
It's a puzzle that's fun to a tot
Who delights in connecting
The dots. She's expecting
A masterpiece — I'm really not.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Let the chain out and drop it down deep.
Mines will catch in the chain as we sweep
'Cross the bay's muddy bottom.
But until we have got 'em
And cleared 'em, no man goes to sleep.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Hello, duckie's a friendly address,
Although lately it's used less and less;
But in Norfolk (once stuck
As a child), called my duck,
I'd respond with a "quack", I confess!

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
What's a decimal place? It's a spot
To the right of that decimal dot.
There's an endless supply
After "three point" in pi.
But one-fourth or one-eighth? Not a lot.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
My old bathtub, a clawfoot, is deep,
An antique that I opted to keep.
I'm a nut for details,
So I painted the nails,
But my grandmother thinks it looks cheap.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
CIA boss was tainted by sin?
Had our intel been leaked from within?
Did David Petraeus
Deceive and dismay us,
Bring new meaning when claiming "all in"?

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Quoth Adam, in deep contemplation,
"Oh, God, what's a good explanation
For my navel and tits,
Which are purposeless bits?"
Shrugged the Lord, "I suppose, decoration."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Thinking dimly of gloom and of doom,
And as nervous as any new groom,
I deliver my speech;
And he smiles—not a screech—
