Just applause fills the conference room.

limerick_list.author: Graham Guest
limerick_list.text:
Sam Coleridge sat down in the moss,
For new poetry quite at a loss.
He thought, though, that night
A long verse he would write
For his seafaring mate Albert Ross.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Having sinned, you are clearly to blame,
Yet refuse to repent. Now the aim
Of your elders may be
To exclude you. We'll see
Excommunication imposed to your shame.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
They attacked on American soil,
And you question my methods to foil
Any future attacks?
These are terrorist acts.
From tough measures we must not recoil.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I execrate pols, with great sorrow.
I curse lefties who spend just to borrow,
And damn righties who'll seize
On the creed "Just take these
Two tax cuts and call me tomorrow."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Two pints of her blood have been drawn,
And her color's so wan she looks gone.
Achromasia is bad,
But relief will be had,
Because Dracula's leaving at dawn.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A concerned fiancé, Barry Claridge,
Has considered a covenant marriage:
Its purpose, of course—
To discourage divorce,
A custom he tends to disparage.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Bladder campion doesn't inspire
An image we'd likely admire.
This odd name it has rated
With its calyx, inflated.
Called silene, it would rate a lot higher.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I've become an omnivorous reader.
In old books, things resembling cedar,
Like some wood, or a tree,
Are called cedry.  For me
Such a word is a reading-impeder.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Algebraic geometry sucks;
I don't do it for love, but for bucks,
Since its great applications
In code computations
Allow me to wear a gold tux.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Fog-blurred furze, yellow fuzz on the hill—
My blood stirs, a warm buzz in the chill.
How I love you, auld gorse
(And, aye, heather, of course).
Bonnie Scotland the Brave, you are brill!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In the news, here's an interesting item:
Many smugglers hide drugs deep inside 'em.
Body packers are sly.
Between countries they'll fly,
Back and forth again, ad infinitum.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
In this rush-hour traffic I'm thinking
Such glacial progression is stinking.
This automobility's
Zero utility's
Making me contemplate drinking.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
The Aetolian king did ignore
Goddess Artemis, making her sore.
Saying, "Damn you, you prig!"
She then sent him a pig
To demolish his land — what a boar!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Courtly bailiffs escort you to jail,
For your failure at raising your bail,
Where your jailors from hell
Let you bail from your cell
Once a day, just to empty your pail.

limerick_list.author: Ellla B.
limerick_list.text:
Sweet, dig in and enjoy the buffet;
On your way, try the lovely bouchée.
Such light pastry, this,
Aphrodite's sly kiss.
Bet you'll want to head home right away!

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
When the flagship was sunk in a squall,
Death united the great and the small.
Their distinctions were purged
As each head was submerged—
In the end, one capsize did for all.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
A flying-trapeze man named Keith
Stayed aloft by a rope in his teeth.
He'd not much to say
'Til his girlfriend, one day,
Tossed his shorts to the netting beneath.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"The euro's just great!" proclaims Ian,
But what's odd is this guy's Tennessean.
It's undoubtedly true
He's a Yank through and through,
Yet this limerick's a strong euro paean.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
When a warship's required to own,
And it patently needs to be shown
That its CO's not there,
Then this knowledge they share
By an absentee pennant thus flown.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
It's a logic construction of mind
That should benefit all of mankind;
To control a computer,
No words could be cuter:
This language has been well defined.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
If they're stylish, my car will come crashin':
I mow down the well-dressed; it's my passion.
Till it's cancelled some day,
Car insurance will pay
For my trend-smashin' — after a fashion.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He'd a cramp in his side; it was sore.
The calyces deep in the core
Of the aching left kidney
Of the fellow from Sydney
Caused pain that he couldn't ignore.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A drop letter, put in the mail,
In the post office lands without fail.
Then it sits on a shelf;
You retrieve it yourself
(Though you won't have to pay any bail).

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Four towns in the U.S. of A.
And a couple in Canada may
Call themselves Alta Vista,
And maybe I've missed a
Few more. Let's try Google, okay?

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Dimethicone's good for the skin—
Keeps dirt out and keeps moisture within.
I've used it for years,
And so now, it appears,
I'm not half of the age of my twin.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Our most serious faces we don
As the blamestorming session goes on.
Someone died. Who's to blame?
The one person we name
Is a janitor's helper named Juan.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My gal Trish is a hottie, a dish;
To eat out at the Ritz is her wish.
There she dishes out dirt,
Has three dishes, dessert,
And some port, while I munch on a knish.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'd been bullied by neighborhood groups
While their women looked on from the stoops.
The Great War was inviting.
Now I'm skilled, both in fighting
And leading a column of troops.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The Porsche—I am mesmerized by it,
So I buy it, decide I will try it.
Wave bye-bye and proceed—
By the river I speed—
Think I'm snobbish? By Jove, I deny it!

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
"I can add," said my dad, "so I shan't
Let you say it's genetic! Don't rant!
Don't blame me you can't add,
For there's three types of lad:
Those who can, and then those who just can't."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'd call bees' use of bee glue excusable
To make walls of their beehives more fusible.
Buds of trees can present
This strong "nature's cement"
(Great, since duct tape is clearly unusable).

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Confessionalists can do well,
For they sell (when they've kissed) what they tell.
Morals lack for the pack
Who get back from the sack
And send all our illusions to hell.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I'm a dark horse to be the next pope.
It's unlikely, but still I have hope."
"You're the darkest of horses!
The reason, of course, is
You're not even Catholic, you dope!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A Scotsman, wassailing on Bute,
Raised his rye to the sky, in salute;
When from out of his flask
Popped a slithery ask.
He ran after the newt, in pursuit.

limerick_list.author: Peter Meyer
limerick_list.text:
When the teeth in one's mouth aren't many
(Case in point is my great-grandpa Lennie),
There's an adjective fit
To describe him, and it
Is edental (that's not worth a penny).

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Dear old Ptown, my summer escape —
Guys with infants? I've learned not to gape.
Things keep changing out here:
Paired-up pops now appear,
And it's gayby boom time on the Cape.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The right to bear arms is such fun!
You'll always be safe with a gun.
You're never in danger
From mugger or stranger,
So shoot, people—get yourselves one!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The crafter was looking forlorn:
Having fashioned her scarf out of corn,
She'd been 'peccably dressed
'Til the crows grew obsessed,
Madly pecking until it was torn.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
For dissenters with nothing to do,
FreedomWorks has a real job for you:
Disrupt a town meeting,
Shout a "No! No! No!" greeting,
Then repair to the bar for a brew.

limerick_list.author: Philip Chris Erickson
limerick_list.text:
A king may, to someone beneath
Him in rank or in stature, bequeath
His gold or his land
Or his fair daughter's hand
(Which sure beats a kick in the teeth).

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's a flame war we're waging on-line
Via e-mail: he jeers; I opine.
No one's wounded as such;
We're just keeping in touch.
Modern warfare's damned tough to define.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If your train has to travel uphill,
Here's a hint that will help fill the bill:
What will keep you on track
So your train won't roll back?
What will hack it? A cog railway will!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Since I've drained my last glass of bordeaux,
Said 'goodbye' to three friends in a row,
Fetched my coat and my hat,
You might gather from that
Certain clues that I'm ready to go.

limerick_list.author: Jeter Coffee
limerick_list.text:
At the car lot he asked, "Whatcha think?"
His wife's fickleness stirred up a stink.
"M'mind's changed to a lease
On a hot pink Caprice."
(Just the thing that would drive him to drink.)

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
We have chlorophane: green pigmentation
That is part of the eyeball's formation.
It is found in the zones
Of the retina's cones,
Thereby helping the eye's operation.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Being boss is a heady affair,
And the word to describe it is rare:
With a threesome of S's,
This bossship impresses—
Few others in English compare.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
I'm burnt out, just a husk or a shell,
Soul consumed by the workplace from hell,
Where the pressure is endless.
Exhausted and friendless,
I edge to the ledge now; farewell...

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Her smile was concealing her guile
From the moment we walked down the aisle,
So I no longer carry
Our license to marry—
It's been dumped in the circular file.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The head of the vice squad, it's clear,
Has been running a call house out here.
When I called to reach Joan,
Someone answered the phone
Saying, "Vice squad—Commander Lanier."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When we speak of goodwill, what we mean
Is a kindness, a feeling routine
That is marked by benevolence.
Sadly, its prevalence
Nowadays seldom is seen.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
This tropical shallow's replete
With a game fish that measures 3 feet.
It's your catch of the day?
I should snatch it away:
It has too many bonelets to eat.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
The prophet's divinement was grim:
"The tomorrows of mankind look dim.
There are more and more kooks
Who have menacing nukes —
Any hopes for this planet are slim."

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
You complained of the cold. I said "rough it!"
You dealt me a terrible buffet.
I don't understand
Why you struck with your hand,
But the cops will be happy to cuff it.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My Best Friend sired a beautiful daughter.
I got all fired up and I sought her.
I'm no pervert, of course;
She's a young female horse,
That fine filly's a winner — I bought her.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Antoine Domino (nicknamed "The Fat Man"
Or "Fats") was a huge success; that man
Could tickle the keys.
Making millions?  A breeze,
Joining whites with the blacks.  What a cat, man!

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
You may choose, by your own strong volition,
To assume the defending position;
Your case is well built,
But the man's filled with guilt.
He is walking the road to perdition.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Richard Dawkins says God's a delusion.
In his mind there's no doubt or confusion.
The creationist South
Tells him, "Friend, zip your mouth.
Unbelief's an unholy intrusion."

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
There are digital watermarks found
On e-documents, pictures and sound.
You may live to regret
Nicking stuff from the net
That some bounder has found a way round.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Bromine's added to something, which means
Bromination occurs; so this scene's
Got a halogen chain
Or an eosin stain
Or a scientist working on genes.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Many slalomers love to be free
As they zoom down the slopes with esprit.
While they zigzag and dodge,
I relax in the lodge.
'Cause, you see, I prefer après-ski.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
I feel fortified, strengthened, to know
There's a place where I always can go.
It's a really good feeling,
Uplifting and healing,
When your local is just a stone's throw.

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
The parking attendant declined
To direct me to where I could find
A large enough bay
For my huge Chevrolet—
The attendant result?  I got fined!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When your symptoms (psychotic) abound,
Medication can bring you around.
If no other drug works,
Then (in spite of its quirks)
Try some clozapine—best drug that's found.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Methane's energy benefits Man.
So I fart. Yes, I do what I can,
And I can what I do
And I'll send it to you.
Passing gas is no overblown plan.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A lover of wildlife, Jerome,
Saw coyotes when visiting Nome;
But they sang out of tune
When they bayed at the moon,
So he said, "I won't bring any home."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Fire exits?" The manager's weighing
Pros and cons. "Yes, we need them," he's saying.
"In a crisis, no doubt,
They let patrons stream out,
Yet they let kids sneak in without paying!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Sue was taught back in Health class in school:
Practice coitus abstentia.  This rule
She had burned in her mind.
Thus, no guys could she find
After all of these years.  Silly fool.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
You're no actor, no clown, no magician
Whose talents deserve exhibition;
You just cannot compete,
Stripping down in the street
And displaying the doggie position.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Green Luigi, a musical elf,
Puts his Autoharp back on the shelf.
"By its name, I've oft said,
Many folks are misled.
You must strum it; it won't play itself!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"I've a cataract, Jack, in each eye!"
"You have waterfalls?  Strange, they look dry."
"No, my lenses turned white
And can barely pass light,
So I'm losing my sight, smart-ass guy!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
If the aqueduct crumbled, they'd wheedle,
Entreat, pay a bribe to, or needle
The honcho in charge
Of the works by and large
That were Roman and public: the aedile.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A carrion-eater, in essence,
Is a creature of great acquiescence
Who will gladly concur,
Without any demur,
To an offer of rotting putrescence.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I'm empassionate, strongly affected,
And gripped by the fact I've detected
The opposite word —
And yes, this is absurd —
Is impassionate.  How unexpected!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A skin disease currently mars
The hides of my lambs; it's dartars.
I've consulted the vet,
But they're not cured as yet,
And I'm hoping the scabs won't leave scars.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
In the church in New England, a feud
Meant that dark repercussions ensued,
Which faced very sadly,
Disturbing things badly —
Each side getting heated and rude.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Acme Corp. has no credit with me.
When they buy, I must ship COD.
When the goods come, they pay,
Because only that way
Do they know that the stuff isn't free.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Mr Hooper's retirement gift
Was a timepiece too heavy to lift.
"What's this clock made of, lead?"
He exclaimed—then dropped dead.
"Hooper's present no longer," we sniffed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
She replied, "You formidable kidder,
Your disbursement's too small to consider.
The fellow who savors
My sexual favors
Will be (yessiree!) highest bidder."

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
All blackmailers, modern and olden,
Keep victims abjectly beholden
For goods they have tendered,
Or services rendered,
But, most of all, silences golden.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
My verses are just below par;
They're eccentric, grotesque, and bizarre.
Don't review or correct them,
Just love and collect them—
Accept them, please, just as they are.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A struggling young actor from Tripoli
At auditions read speeches too drippily.
While he strove to seem hawkish,
He was maudlin and mawkish,
And was often dismissed rather snippily.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Getting past the despised Berlin Wall,
Escapees had to run, dig, or crawl.
Those attempting a trip
Through its deadly death strip
Would not wait for that grim wall to fall.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
A chafer's a beetle, Egyptian,
Or English, perhaps. Its description—
A large bug that flies—
Fits the scarab, whose ties
Link it back to a jewelled inscription.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
With no word of reproach or dismay,
Dad expressed disapproval today.
How? His manner was cold
And one eye-roll he rolled
Being told I'd just rolled in the hay.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
In an automat (self-serve café),
Much cuisine can be seen on display.
Make your choice, then guess what?
Drop your coin down the slot.
There's your chow!  Eat it now! On your way!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Grover Cleveland, our nation's commander,
Once married would never philander.
But a fastball? No way.
He did not even play.
That's that other G.C., Alexander.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Apartment for rent: lass or lad.
Two rock stars have died in this pad.
Drummer Moon, "Mama Cass",
Both just happened to pass,
In this same London flat. Ain't that sad?

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
A Governor-General (GG)
Is a glorious figure to see
On a gee-gee: of course,
A GG on a horse
Isn't common. I've seen only three.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Blind faith is my sacrosanct creed,
So from science and thinking I'm freed.
I don't hunger for learning
When crosses are burning.
My fideism's all that I need.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Can't sleep 'cause you're feeling depressed?
Are your clothes hanging loose when you're dressed?
Though I can't add a pin
To take your clothes in,
Will Adapin bring you some rest?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Said a basketball pro named LaRoche,
Whose techniques were beyond all reproach,
"As a coach, I'm first class,
So when I park my ass
On a plane, it's first class and not coach."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
H. L. Mencken predicted, "One day
The American voters will weigh
All their choices and find
Their new president's mind
Went away on vacation to stay."

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Ira Aldridge, black actor, played Europe.
Two near-Birmingham towns, brown as syrup,
Formed a "cross-the-Pond" nexus.
Doug Aldridge of Texas
Spurs his horse with a limerick stirrup.

limerick_list.author: Tom Foolery
limerick_list.text:
The word am is a form of "to be"
Focused first-person-singularly,
Which is probably why
It's so popular. I
Think it's peachy. It's all about me!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
While his acts were in fact conspiratorial,
He seemed trustworthy, wise, professorial.
Many millions he stole
When his gang took control
Of the contract to build our memorial.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Despite the advice that we gave yer,
You've engaged in outrageous behaviour.
Now, alas,  overwrought
That your ass has been caught,
You're distraught, but there's naught that'll save yer.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Here in Spain, I am waiting in vain
On the plain to get drenched by the rain,
As this shower is piffling.
It's only just driffling —
A drop or two, now and again.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
With a look at my knotted old face,
Billy said, "Of the whole human race,
Is there any more gnarled?"
In response, I just snarled
And then reached for my big can of Mace.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Ametropic means near- or farsighted;
At times, astigmatically blighted:
Your vision's all blurry.
But please, don't you worry!
With glasses, these wrongs can be righted.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
I'm working today, though it's Sunday.
It's really not much of a Funday.
But these limericks that rhyme
Sure do help pass the time,
And I'll publish them, maybe, come Oneday.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
A denominator's what is divided
Into numbers or entities cited.
If its concept befits
Random disparate bits,
Then it's common, and neither is slighted.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
In the Bronze Age, men already knew
How to make one new metal from two.
Blending copper and tin,
That was how to begin;
Better weapons the object in view.

limerick_list.author: Chrain
limerick_list.text:
In heaven's name, what's an accensor?
Some know it, but I'm a bit denser.
Church candles it lights,
I believe, on dark nights.
To confirm, I suggest you call Mensa.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
To drive there you'll travel roads wiggly
In your car, getting ever so giggly.
Once at Beesands, buy fish,
Cooked or raw, as you wish—
Maybe eels (just like rubber, and wriggly).

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Electromagnetics strikes fear
In the heart of the mere engineer.
The field is immense,
And its theory is dense
In the quantum mechanical sphere.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
I'm a lumberjack — hope that's okay.
I fell trees in the old-fashioned way
With my vicious attacks
On their trunks with my axe.
So when asked, "I'm an axeman," I say.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
This brief sentence: "I'm dying," croaked Herb.
Is a croaker both short and superb.
It's a type of Tom Swifty
That still can be nifty
When based, for its zing, on a verb.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Examine Einsteinian history:
You'll find that the concepts are twistery.
Space warps, no disaster.
Clocks slow or run faster.
All sound like the theories of Mr. E.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You can caterwaul all that you like,
But I'm not gonna buy you a bike!
I can barely pay rent—
It takes every last cent—
So just pull up your bootstraps and hike!

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
I'm just bumping along at the bottom.
Some losses? I've certainly got 'em!
The economy's poor,
I am sure feeling dour,
And my profits? I tremble to tot 'em!

limerick_list.author: Val
Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Chocolate ice cream's my favorite treat,
So I hijacked a truck in the street.
Now I'm pleased to report
It'll never fall short;
It'll take me a lifetime to eat.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"Fallen arches! Perhaps I might die!"
Cried Sir Oliver Pilkington-Pie.
"You don't die of flat feet,"
Said his friend, Doctor Sweet,
"But your instep is not very high."

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
In stilettos and stockings I twirl
And my soft, silken skirts are a-swirl.
With my make-up I paint
That I am what I ain't
And this guy is disguised as a girl.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
My ranger grave (fighting position)
Is a vertical hole, and my mission
Is to shoot at the foe.
There's a tank! Duck below!
(Staying whole is a major ambition.)

limerick_list.author: Nick Szymanski
limerick_list.text:
People ask me sometimes, "What's a cwm?"
I'll explain it, there's plenty of room.
Cwm is Welsh for a valley
Where a glacier did sally
Long before global warming did loom.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A back stabber's bond is pretend.
Her intention's to pose as a friend.
Better watch what you're saying;
She'll wind up betraying
Your trust, and your "friendship" will end.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
In my bomb shelter under the floor,
I am safe from a nuclear war.
Radiation and fallout?
Thick walls keep it all out.
Plus, my wife has no key to the door.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
I would kill for a pill I could take
For this dreadful, incredible ache.
I have lain in my bed
With this pain in my head.
I need sleep, but it keeps me awake.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
What's a crow blackbird? That is a grackle.
Iridescently hued, these birds cackle,
And will gobble a crop,
Make the harvest a flop—
It's a problem for farmers to tackle.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
An exquisitive feline is Fred,
Who holds so many facts in his head,
'Cause he's ever so curious.
It could be injurious —
Yes,  Freddie might  find himself dead.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
What's the deal with these closing costs? Jeez!
Add recording and processing fees
To appraisal, inspection,
Commission collection…
What's next? Charging fees for the keys?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A week's harvest, three cartloads of wheat,
Might be swapped for two months' worth of meat.
A few fothers—that's all,
But enough to forestall
More distress till we're back on our feet.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Watching curling, a game with no spice?
Then be ready to yawn once or twice.
The teams slide a large stone,
Sweep it into the zone;
Think of shuffleboard, bocce—on ice!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Akeratophorous ruminants lack
Any antlers arrayed in a rack.
So the Bactrian camel,
A practical mammal,
Makes do with two humps on its back.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
To the limits, life's currents will comb,
And then whithersoever they roam,
They'll return as before
To the atrium door.
It's the center of heart and of home.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
What was ChemGrass at first then became
Known as AstroTurf, earning the name
From a ballpark in Houston.
Players noticed a boost in
Their pain, cutting years from their game.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Jack is last, once again, the poor dear!
His behind lags behind, that is clear.
Now, why is it I find
When I bring up behind
That my mind brings up bring up the rear?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Egg-crate panels may not be exciting,
But they'll manage the spill of harsh lighting.
Fluorescents too bright?
Grids of squares make things right,
And your work space a tad more inviting.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
You may cark that you'll probably cark,
As that cark's pretty close to the mark,
But to worry you'll die
In the end — my, oh, my —
Is a drain on your life's precious spark.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Dale's horse Buttermilk—buckskin, not white—
Was a figure of constant delight.
Perfect match for Roy's Trigger,
Who was golden and bigger,
Happy trails for the pair were in sight.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
If a boat ghosts along like a snail,
Then its skip may require a new sail.
There is one meets the need
Of providing more speed—
The genoa—but not in a gale!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To pull your limbs inwards, instruct
Your muscles to tense 'til they're tucked
Toward your midline.  What's wrong?
Can't you do it?  Be strong —
Please don't go to pieces, adduct!

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Last night, mugger appear holding shiv.
Mugger force me all money to give.
So Neanderthal Gat
Become crime victim stat.
(That "statistic".) At least me still live.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
The Royals and Rangers and Rays,
The Indians, Angels, and A's,
Red Sox, White Sox, and O's,
Twins and Tigers and 'Stros,
Plus the Mariners, Yankees, and Jays.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Cornwall, the home of the pasty,
Is hilly and pretty, not nasty.
When looking south-west
From a lot of the rest
Of Great Britain, it's kinda most-last-y.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
In cricket, the bowlers don't throw;
They bowl.   Some bowl fast, others slow.
With a wind-up, arm straight,
Some bowlers, those great,
Can bounce balls left or right, high or low.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Working jobs in two cities, Jake thrives
With two cars and two homes and two wives.
Is dividing his time
Between both such a crime?
Neither knows that he leads double lives.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Mister Brit can't pretend to have poise.
How he gowls and he rants at his boys.
With a scream and a shout,
He keeps chewing them out.
All that howling and yelling — such noise!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A glost has a glaze; then it's fired;
Thus can clayware be hotly desired,
Forming colors and shine,
Holding viands or wine,
Even biscuits! (This pun is inspired.)

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
An épicerie's really a deli,
But French-er; the cheeses are smelly,
The confit is ducky,
And those who are lucky
Can buy escargots canned in jelly.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Beware! Cayenne peppers are hot,
And I really don't like them a lot!
It just wasn't nice
Putting them in my rice—
Now my nose wants to sniffle and snot!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Then I picked up the dog's collied paw;
There was soot round the pad and each claw.
Mel felt lost and afraid
And depressed.  He displayed
Melancholy—his sad face I saw.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
When live fish are ploughed up in a field,
How on earth does one parse this strange yield?
It's the bowfin that landed
From floods, and got stranded,
Its gas bladder breathing revealed.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"I'll kill you if you don't agree,"
Says the wife, "to spend money on me."
So the husband accedes,
In case words turn to deeds.
He shrugs. "Cost of living, you see!"

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
A cool-headed lifeguard named Jule
Was unfazed by the pranksters at school.
But he felt quite betrayed
When a Mule Day parade
Lost its way and marched mules by his pool.

limerick_list.author: Fringe
limerick_list.text:
Let me tell you a hair-raising story
'Bout Britain's diminishing glory:
The annals of sports?
That's a long list of shorts.
(This excursus was written in Gorey.)

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Depth-first search, when you're browsing the net,
Is a way to get sidetracked. You set
Out to read, so you think,
But you follow each link
And you've not found an end to it yet.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
Adam tasted Eve's fruit, and this meant
Down a slippery slope they were bent
As they fell from God's grace.
(What a costly embrace!)
To this day, we repent their descent.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
The guns' drumfire crashed when dawn broke,
And soon Iwo was shrouded by smoke,
But though shells couldn't reach
All the holes in its beach,
Many thousands were caught in death's yoke.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and rusty
limerick_list.text:
Wed ten years, now she's fleeing the scene
Over vehicle fuel. I mean,
Her opinion's so strong
That it's GAS-o-line. WRONG!
Any fool knows the word's gas-o-LINE.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The boys at St. Luke's made a fuss
As Abraham boarded the bus.
"He gets Chanukah fun
For eight nights from night one.
What a shame there's no presents for us!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My great-grandpa's so old he's not datable,
As his birth-year's not known, age unratable.
But my great-grandma claims:
With an eye for the dames,
He is datable, randy, and matable.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
The daredevil skydiving jumper
Fell into the back of a dumper.
The lass wasn't hurt,
But the jump took her shirt,
And the traffic? Soon bumper-to-bumper.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Up high on the dry altiplano
There was nothing to nibble but guano,
Which wasn't much fun
In the Andean sun,
But was better with shredded Romano.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
I'll tell how infection is shared,
In communicable terms (nothing spared):
With no frills and no spills,
You can catch others' ills
From their germs — now I'll bet that you're scared.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We're in danger, and my intuition
Declares this a risky condition.
Run for help? We can try,
But how will we get by
Our archenemy's circumposition?

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Canned Heat played some songs from blues past
In their style.  Just three hits they amassed.
Though both founders have died,
The band's touring worldwide
Still today (with a varying cast).

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Dumping toxins may cause some chagrin,
For they bioaccumulate in
All the creatures of Earth.
But for what it is worth,
My third arm helps me play violin.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
The natives cavort in their sin.
Send the light! We must gather them in.
But the missionary strays
In Conradian ways,
And succumbs to the darkness within.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In the pen, many prisoners curse;
Their despair's making matters much worse.
But a few of them might
Come to poetry night,
Where each inmate cites captor and verse.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"Don't deny it", brags Dickie. "In bed,
I'm a stud. I'm a stallion!" Instead
Of me gainsaying Dick,
I'll just note he's a prick.
That's self-evident: can't be gainsaid.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
Take two pipes cut at ninety and held
In some clamps, then they're ready to meld.
Fire up the new TIG
Or industrial MIG,
And join tubes end-to-end: a butt weld.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
Activation analysis is
A bewildering, byzantine biz.
See what samples emit
When by neutrons they're hit;
Try to pass the atomic pop quiz.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
L'chaim! Mazel tov! Girl, you're it!
You're now a bath mitzvah, legit.
You chanted the Torah
And now, kenahorah,
For adulthood you're finally fit!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The ego-ideal as our guide
Brings accomplishment, value, and pride.
Good behavior we ape,
And we let it take shape
As we try to cast badness aside.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
On the apron, the actor died badly,
Far too close to the audience, sadly.
When the curtain then fell,
He was still to be well
In full view. They applauded him madly.

limerick_list.author: Hilary
limerick_list.text:
"My big toe will not move... I have tried."
The therapist quickly replied,
"Your abductor hallucis
No movement produces:
It seems to have curled up and died."

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
I've been taking a booger dance class
From a Cherokee man, but alas,
Though my mask is sarcastic,
My movements are spastic.
I'm blaming my cumbersome ass.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
When the holiday season approaches,
Our kitchen's infested with roaches,
'Cause where goodies are found
Is where roaches abound.
It's where every encroaching roach poaches.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
DNA is the stuff of each gene:
Double helix in peasant and queen.
It determines our traits,
Like our heights and our weights—
Dwarf and giant, but most in between.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's distemperate? Here's a good trick:
I'll define it correctly and quick.
Someone's angry, in rage,
Or the dog in that cage
Has a virus that makes him real sick.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Though it's based on the Julian day,
The Besselian epoch's passé.
All those tropical dates
On astronomers' plates
Indigestibly got in the way.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
We're so plainly amazed at the way
That the airlines make every flight pay.
Now my seat-mates and I,
Lying nigh thigh-to-thigh,
Form a perfect coplanar array.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The bronze bell-roof atop that tall tower
Represents, it's said, masculine power.
That flaring metallic
Homage to the phallic
Casts a shadow that grows by the hour.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
King Darius roared, "Little man! Ye'll
Pray to no one but me. Lions, Daniel!"
Raging beasts tried to sup.
Said the angel, "Shut up!"
And they did, cringing meek as a spaniel.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For seafood, some people like bass,
While others say flounder has class.
For a tasty knish,
Try aquarium fish—
All the dough serves to cover your wrasse.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
When dentists buccolingually speak,
That's their lingo for tongue and for cheek.
(Not the cheek that I sit on —
The cheek my teeth bit on,
Raining buccots of pain for a week.)

limerick_list.author: PGS and Workshop
limerick_list.text:
While afoot down ol' Limerick Street:
"Hi, my friend. How are you?" Note the beat?
Two steps short,  then one long,
I keep pace to a song,
Skipping lightly on anapest feet.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'm so handsome and poised, I convey
Pulchritudinous splendor, parfait!
I can tell you quite plainly,
I'm so frickin' gainly
The clunky folks all look away.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
One more lodgepole stacked up in a deck—
Men at work keeping nature in check.
Lumber fresh from the felling
Is not as compelling.
See it all without craning your neck.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The bottle-fed infant is thought
To be lacking protection he ought
To receive from the breast.
Mother's milk is the best!
(So I argued as shut-eye I sought.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Diazomethane's a chemical gas
That in labs is considered first class,
But it's toxic, explosive,
And also corrosive.
Would I like some? No, thank you. I'll pass.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
You'll find man-eating sleuths, anthropophagi,
Employing their gumshoe esophagi.
Two cannibal dudes
After mystery foods —
Do you think that they ate that old Hoffa guy?

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
It's raining and blowing outside
And my car has just spluttered and died.
My old bike's in the shed
And I must buy some bread,
So I'll brave the bad weather and ride.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
For optimal teaching and learning,
They stuck us in sets. How discerning!
The groups are: the best;
The slowest; the rest.
It's called banding, and bitter we're turning.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Harry Whittington wasn't that quick—
Didn't hear the unfortunate click
When a trigger got cocked.
This attorney was shocked
When he learned he'd been plugged by a Dick.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
"This bureaucracy has to be pared,"
Said the boss, "With no hierarchy spared.
No more duplicate stores
With their branch-office wars;
We'll consolidate!" Man, are we scared.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Just what happens to turkeys once planned
As feasts for Thanksgiving? The hand
Of Commander-in-Chief 
Grants two White House relief—
Then they're both sent to Disney World/land.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The corroboree's starting at eight.
Lock the doors to the store; lock the gate.
All the townsfolk, you know,
Will be down at the show—
Liquor robbery wouldn't be great!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'll drop you at Julie's at nine.
She forgives you. Have fun, you'll be fine.
Relax, have your kicks.
I'll collect you at six.
Don't be late, 'cause tonight I've got mine.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The colicroot, kin of the lily,
May help after eating hot chili,
Relieving your colic.
Its name is symbolic—
To me it just sounds rather silly.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
The achenial sunflower seed
Is a wonderful product, indeed.
What we think is the shell
Is a fruit just as well,
But it's dry and it's thin-walled, agreed?

limerick_list.author: Damian Hey
limerick_list.text:
"To you, dear, my soul I've just bared
And my innermost feelings I've shared."
"Oh, sweet heaven above,
Now you've shown me your love...
And I'd wondered, 'til now, if you cared!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
World War One struck a violent chord.
With a prayer for peace soon restored,
They elected a pope.
What he offered was hope.
What he was was completely ignored.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
My dad claims he's a hall-of-fame gridder,
But I'm starting to think he's a kidder.
He seems short (four feet nil)
To play football. I will
All the rest of his yarns reconsider.

limerick_list.author: John Wellington Wells and speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
If your jaunt your great aunt seeks to haunt,
And to daunt her you want, say "Avaunt!"
It conveys, "Go away!
Do not darken my day!"
It's the anti-aunt taunt you can flaunt.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
In the citadels (halls) where they meet,
They espouse dated dogmas replete
With ideas that alarm me.
The great Sally Army
Dilutes its good works with conceit.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The Brothers Four jumped on the scene
With a song about fields that, once green,
Became parched by the sun —
Almost made number one.
Then they sang for the big and small screen.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
All is calm, but fall weather deceives:
Gusts rise swiftly and flurry the leaves.
Where they'd lolled about mildly,
They're dervishing wildly.
They'll end in my hedges and eaves.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
In drydock at Pearl, "The Big E"
Was patched up real quick  after she
Had limped back from our fleet
Who had caused the defeat
Of the Japs in the Solomon Sea.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You got clap on your trip? You're a louse.
I'm ashamed to admit you're my spouse.
Take those pills, 'cause I ain't
Gonna clap on no paint—
Cure your illness, then spruce up the house.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The effect Lottie sought was hypnotic.
Her dance was from Thailand—exotic,
But it seemed less erotic
Than just plain psychotic.
The final result was chaotic.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Every "carrottopped" guy that I've seen
Has got bright orange hair on his bean.
But whenever I chop
Off a real carrot top,
It's the part that's not orange but green.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
When the buzzards got into a brawl,
I heeded the clarion call:
With my shotgun let fly.
Five at once! (They weren't high.)
Others dove for for that carrion fall.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
"Why, merchant, thy jetons reveal
Thy belief thou art licensed to steal!"
"Nay, the tally be true.
Thou shouldst getteth a clue —
It's a counter-intuitive deal."

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Where's Sally? Has anyone seen her?
She has the most bubbly demeanor.
She's carefree and gay
With such nice things to say—
Finds her own grass is always the greener.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
It's chlorine that's found in our pools,
And in fountains for water at schools.
I just can't get enough
Of this germ-killing stuff,
'Cause for swimming or drinking it rules.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The farmer went out to carouse
In the barn, with the sows and the cows.
He passed out in a coma
Mid their pungent aroma.
To lift him, we needed to bouse.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Sir Bors was a Round Table knight.
Hunting boar was his constant delight.
Did he lecture the others
And bore all his brothers,
Who bore it as well as they might?

limerick_list.author: Carole Lyons
limerick_list.text:
Said a hip college junior named Stan,
"I dig archaeology, man!
I rock in geology,
Mars (areology),
And I've studied abroad—in my van."

limerick_list.author: rosefox
limerick_list.text:
A scholarly gentleman courted
Disaster with works unsupported.
His thoughts categorical
Were so ahistorical
That nothing got properly sorted.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Jack Sprat and his wife, no surprise,
Present us a contrast in size.
His build is quite frail;
Hers, a much larger scale.
She eats burgers. And Jack? Fat-free fries.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
I thought we'd be taking it slow,
To whate'er destination we'd go.
But you're now in a rush,
Pulled the lever marked "flush",
And advised me to "go with the flow".

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Mountains, caves, rocks, volcanoes!  How strange is
The geologists' interest — it ranges.
You can take it for granite,
They study our planet:
Its structure, formation and changes.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"My cause is my wife," declares Eddie.
"As her aide I will always be ready.
Any month, day or night,
Anywhere, wrong or right—
My spousal espousal is steady."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
At that hell-hole the rescue took place.
Pain and joy were both etched on his face.
But that extricated man,
Extracted per plan,
Suffers flashbacks he cannot erase.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Once a centipede, lacking in luck,
By dismembering mishap was struck.
Now it's hampered by one
Wooden leg. Can't be fun
When with ninety-nine bonk! you are stuck.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh and Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Armadillos are tough little creatures:
Heavy armor is one of their features.
Their breath they can hold
Underwater, we're told,
"And don't eat them raw," say our teachers!

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
In dermoplasty, grafting of skin
Can replace nasty scars on your chin.
Could a skilled plastic surgeon
Make you once more a virgin,
Fool a groom who's obsessed about sin?

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The Obama plant program decreed:
We'll provide all the bulbs that you need.
Two guvs are not merry:
Pawlenty and Perry.
They both want their states to see seed.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Diphosphopyridine nucleotide?
To define this coenzyme I sighed.
Could an alias frolic
In fields metabolic?
Nicotinamide adenine tried.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For a rescue from rough, choppy seas,
You'll find colza oil eager to please;
Soothing lotion, of course,
For a human or horse,
And in cooking—it's good for all these.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This story's a downer—it's sad.
My old milk cow's been ailing real bad.
Now she can't even stand.
Called the vet for her, and
The guy called her a downer, the cad!

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
It's a simple song sung to my kitty
When I croon that she's cuddly and pretty.
As I'm singing to her,
She ceases to purr,
And meows in duet with my ditty.

limerick_list.author: Kirk Zurell
limerick_list.text:
My wife's biological clock
Is ringing to wake Dr. Spock!
So, now that we've lunched,
Time to get my card punched,
And start work at producing a flock.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
In the chem-lab, a typical task
Is a cinch with an Erlenmeyer flask.
Narrow neck takes its place
Over conical base;
For solutions, what more could you ask?

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
The dahoon is a south U.S. shrub
That grows in the forest and scrub.
It has leaves of dark green,
And red berries are seen—
Watch out for that sharp, spiny nub!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The G-20 was formed to promote
Deep financial discussion of note
And to study, review,
Global policies too,
From which governments frequently quote.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
To the left and the right of the sign
Known as equals expressions align
(That is if your math talents
Can make the two balance).
Equations — no talent of mine.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
All your carbon's in strings?  Aliphatic.
In benzene hex rings?  Aromatic.
The cycles remain,
But it acts like a chain?
Alicyclic is idiomatic.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
British Forces fare better than most:
Even posted abroad, they get post
'Cause the BFPO
Sees their letters still flow
To and fro, and that's no empty boast.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
A handsome performer who crooned
Kissed a fan who had, over him, mooned.
When his tongue split her grin,
The girl's world seemed to spin,
And the dizzied young woman soon swooned.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
All romance my sweet William eschews
When he woos me with pizza and booze.
Though he's wantin', I won't,
Cuz, you see, Billy don't
Ever send me those sweet billets-doux.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A beach bunny gazed from the sand
At her guy on his board, in command.
He was riding the surf;
She was guarding her turf—
Sitting pretty while bored on the land.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
On the book that I wrote, I got feedback.
Reaction was harsh: "Don't proceed back
To writing another."
"Godawful!"  "Oh, brother!"
"What trash!"  "Waste of cash that I need back."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Here's some news that Cassandra, my friend, heard:
Charlene's resignation's been tendered!
What engendered that act?
Seems her workplace, in fact,
Favors males; it's excessively gendered.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Hey babe, help me out with a study;
My knowledge of women is cruddy.
This experimenter's new,
And my lab rat is you,
To be trained as my hot bosom buddy.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
From parietal cells in our tums
A supply of digestive juice comes.
They produce HCl*
And our I.F.** as well,
Neither one of which helps digest gums.***

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My boss is a boob and a boor,
One whose manners are worse than just poor.
You might ask, with this slob,
Why I stay on the job.
It's the six-figure paycheck, I'm sure.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Nanoscientists, being astute,
With precision observe (they're acute).
Their favorite topic?
All things microscopic.
They analyze objects minute.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Raleigh's cloak became spotted and muddy
In a ploy to become QE's buddy.
Had he brought along duckboards
(Those walk-over-muck boards),
The garment would not have turned cruddy.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You're my captor and I'm your captee,
So I beg you—consider my plea:
These ropes have confined me,
But you can unbind me!
Abstringe me and let me go free!

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
Though the shock from your doorbell was slight,
Leaping boys who yell "Boo!" are a fright.
Your next trick left me drenched,
So, through teeth that are clenched,
I say, "Thanks, but I won't stay the night."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
To flyte is to wrangle, to scold.
And flytings? Abuse: uncontrolled
Or poetical slagging fights
Purely for bragging rights —
Slander, when rhymed, good as gold.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Clip artists are terribly smart;
They'll take all your dough, for a start.
If you don't get the point,
Look at any clip joint,
Or at Microsoft's jolly clip art.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The beyond is the place that we go
After life.  Where I'll go, I don't know.
As much as I wanna
Believe it's nirvana,
My fear is I'm going below.

limerick_list.author: jexia
limerick_list.text:
A gal by the first name of Jill
Had an accent as broad as a hill.
"Whatcha mean that me thighs
Are as wide as the skies?"
She's a broad broad who broadly speaks, still.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Osama bin Laden's attack
On New York let him laugh and sit back,
So secure he would never
Be caught: "I'm too clever.
I won't be caught dead in Iraq!"

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
A firehose doesn't squirt fire:
It shoots water on flame, blaze or pyre.
This long, flexible pipe
To and fro you might swipe;
For a big one, some help you'll require.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Russell
limerick_list.text:
When I was your age, just a pup,
I had dreams, I had big plans then—yup,
To act up on the stage,
Be reviewers' big rage...
Now it's only my knees acting up.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Got my trade guy today on the phone.
Asked: "To what shipping threats are we prone?"
He said, "Focus of fears
Is the 'Gateway of Tears'.
Bab el Mandeb is how it's best known."

limerick_list.author: Gravely
limerick_list.text:
On the eve of our very first date
Bella called me and said, "It's been great.
But I see how this ends:
Would you mind being friends?
My fatidic misgivings won't wait!"

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Every spring, when the soil is still chilly,
Convallaria—also called lily
Of the valley—stems bend
Over bell-blooms; each end
Is a rim that is fragrant and frilly.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Meet two words who are much to my liking:
First, fulgurous: "highly-charged, spiking
Like lightning". Amended,
Makes fulgorous: "splendid".
One root; forking branches. How striking!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Bureau spending's a tad out of hand;
I've got orders: "Assert more command."
I'm "the powers that be,"
So first clear it with me
When your project is fresh, newly planned.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a florist who sternly condemns
The display of his wares without stems
In a bubble bowl. Note:
If a blossom you float,
He will loudly suggest M&Ms.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I take pride in not being a prude,
But to me the word gluepot is rude.
It's a term I detest,
So I'd like to suggest
The term pussy's not nearly as crude.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
Owlets branch weeks before they can fly;
To strengthen their legs is the "why."
If you happen to see
One fall out of a tree,
Put him up on a limb that is high.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
What a playwright beforehand conceives
For an actor to say as he leaves
Is an exit line. Some
Find such lines, when they come,
Arrive afterhand — how that aggrieves!

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
Desiccation is all about drying—
No tears, no it's not about crying.
It takes all the water
(At least, so it oughta)
From lots of the food that you're buying.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
As I've got my pawns into a mess,
I can see that my queen can't progress.
Behind their ranks, serried,
She's trapped. She's a buried
Piece. King? He's exposed. Such is chess.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
The harp is beyond me.  Oh, jeez!
I never could play it with ease—
All my fingers are thumbs.
But the wind itself strums
The aeolian harp.  It's a breeze!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Friar Tuck is a name you will ken:
An old outlaw, in forest and glen.
Remember the friar
In monk-like attire?
The most godly of Robin Hood's men.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
About her, for ten years he'd not spoken,
Till at last his long silence was broken.
Although grief had defined him,
He put it behind him,
And a new life that day was awoken.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Hark the tooting and trumpeting sounds —
There's a bugle-man riding the grounds.
Now the chase comes this way!
There's a fox gone to bay.
Hear the baying approach of the hounds.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Ancient calendars all met a need—
Namely, planning for planting of seed,
Or a festival day,
Sun or moon holding sway—
Though their math seldom stayed up to speed.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
There once was an amateur choir
Whose talents would never inspire.
Their rhythm was stalling,
Their tuning, appalling—
I tell you, their concerts were dire.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
I thought I'd give smithing a try,
So I looked for cheap anvils to buy.
But the ones I could find
Were so poorly designed,
They're just anvil-shaped objects—they lie!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Brett was drenched; he was dowsed, soaking wet,
When he jumped in the pool on a bet.
His tuxedo was wrecked,
And he's mad, I suspect,
As his friends haven't yet paid their debt.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
My new newt's not too beaut, so I'll get
Sweet Yvette (pet evet) to a vet.
With no eft, I'd be left
All alone and bereft.
(Our love's deep, though we've only just met.)

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I buy birds in the colors of booze;
Combinations affect how I choose.
My latest's a parrot:
Chartreuse and deep claret—
Grand drinks and such contrasting hues.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When the sun shines, I always make hay,
But I never put money away.
What's unspent, I will give—
Hey! that's just how I live:
Easy come, easy go, day by day.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
As I hold up the globe, I'm cravat-less;
Though I dress to impress, I go hatless.
Lost my cap, I regret,
As my head's getting wet,
Sans chapeau, I'm emphatically Atlas.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
To divide, it knows only too well,
So it multiplies faster than hell,
While it adds to your strife,
And subtracts from your life —
That's the math of the damned cancer cell.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Chinese drip drip drip drip drip drip drip
Drip drip water drip drip drip drip drip
Drip drip torture drip drip
Drip drip drip drip drip drip
Drip drip drip drip drip drip drip drip drip.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Congruence: the status of being
Congruent, that is, of agreeing.
It's the state in which you
And another congrue
(Your congruency this guaranteeing).

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Trump's opinion of Clinton: "She's horrible!"
She called half his supporters "deplorable,"
But before very long,
She backed off: "half...was wrong."
(Two contenders that sure are adorable.)

limerick_list.author: J Durkin
limerick_list.text:
Grimy germs on me, how do I cope?
Why, it's antibacterial soap!
Killing good germs and bad,
Gadzooks, I've been had.
I have given resistant bugs hope.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Sy's a sly one; he often connives,
With his buddies, to speed when he drives
And to pass through red lights
While they're higher than kites.
This connivance Sy barely survives.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
A Con Edison truck hit a bump
And this ass smashed a pole with a thump.
The huge sign on Trump Tower
Lost part of its power,
And now only lights the word RUMP.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
With spermatophytes, one thing I know:
They have seed leaves when starting to grow.
Cotyledonous seeds
Serve to furnish the  needs
Of the seedling; a start they bestow.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
In a dram, sixty grains may be found,
And twelve ounces can stretch to a pound:
I don't scruple to state
That apothec'ries' weight
Is clearly not metrically sound.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He was small and showed little morphosis
Toward puberty. Doc's diagnosis:
"A deficient key gland
Keeps him infantile, and
I would label it ateliosis."

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Ancient Romans preferred accubation:
They reclined as they dined, in that nation.
Now if you do as they
Did, and feast in this way,
Drink with care to avoid aspiration.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I found panties," the newlywed roars,
"In my dresser.  I'm guessing they're yours!
Take them out!" bellows he,
"Or my bureau will be
Turned into my wife's chest of drawers!"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Their forebears, Miss G understood,
Being ursine, had pooped in the wood.
But three civilized bears
Who used bowls, beds and chairs
Had an outhouse (the third hole was good).

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
My embedment in military force
As a journalist, here at the source,
Is too much of a thrill.
My troop's in for the kill,
And I'm feeling a twinge of remorse.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The chief of our local police
Went out hunting and bagged seven geese.
"Were these burglars I bagged,"
Mr. Lock-'Em-Up bragged,
"Then our neighborhood crime wave would cease."

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
When I clamber up cliffs where I ramble,
Grabbing foliage helps me to scramble.
Though it stops me from slipping,
I'm gambling by gripping
What's sometimes a handful of bramble.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Heavy Metal bands: crash, bang and scream!
Anger, rage and distortion's the theme.
Foulness ghastly, repelling,
Disgusting — yet selling.
Well, kids have to let off some steam.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
To a real estate broker, it's homes;
To a book vendor, all about tomes,
But this website's goal,
And its primary role,
Is to corner the market on poems!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My new doctor (I think he's a phony)
Says my problem's de Toni-Fanconi,
With decreased kidney function.
I feel, at this junction,
His opinion is full of baloney.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
So now, what would you do if you knew
That a drone's programmed target was you?
Would you run? Would you hide?
Dig a hole, crawl inside?
Or just put on a CD or two?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
When a specimen joins our collection,
We start with an ectal inspection:
Kept whole and unbloodied,
It's externally studied,
Then out come the knives for dissection.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A cove called a gloak or a gill
Is a bloke with particular skill.
So, a toby-gill robs
And a cutting-gloak's job's
Good for folk with an edge for a kill.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
At the funeral, dressed to condole
Like a mournful and short-sighted mole,
He'd a doleful refrain:
'How I share in your pain!'
Then he tripped and fell into the hole.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The term autopoiesis is when
Something makes itself over again,
But the flip side, I guess, is
Called allopoiesis,
As practiced by factory men.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Move the cattle gate, let them proceed.
Once they've dunged, they're not likely to feed
Where they've dropped their manure;
They've no need to endure
Such conditions. Fresh pastures they need.

limerick_list.author: Randy Lee
limerick_list.text:
A miner who lived in a cave
Had a daughter this singer did crave.
But Clementine tripped,
So now there's a crypt
Where she lies in her watery grave.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An elephant plays ukulele
As clowns cavort, seven shows daily.
With trapeze acts galore,
Lions, tigers, and more,
There's no bettering Barnum & Bailey.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
No more questions? You've just heard our pitch.
We've been thorough: no bugs, not a glitch.
Now the ball's in your court.
If you add your support,
We'll get cracking; we'll all wind up rich.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Croaking multiple songs, the noise crested:
A beau geste to suggest life's congested.
Such deception may pay,
Keeping rivals at bay:
The male tree frog's domain uncontested.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
The young daddy wants just the right toy
To bring home to his new baby boy.
With an ear-to-ear grin,
He can't keep it all in—
He's just bubbling over with joy.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Jim's in our team, no matter what game,
And although he's a loser, who's lame,
Rude, immoral, unkind,
Half insane, we don't mind:
He's a good guy to us, all the same.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
She ran down the aisle to halt her
And said to the bride, "I love Walter!"
Said Walter, "Since when?
I'll just bigamize then —
There's plenty of room at the altar."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"O mine host, I've a toast. Let me think …
To the host with the most!" (Glasses clink.)
"If you'll not pull the plug,
I'll engage now to chug
A full gage." (That's a quart pot of drink.)

limerick_list.author: Fred Harris
limerick_list.text:
A cellist I know said, "It's funny,
But here's why my mood's always sunny:
I pick up my bow,
And I smile, 'cause I know
That I work a big fiddle for money!"

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The science developed to own
How the biosphere, Earth's living zone,
Interacts with another,
Its lithosphere brother,
Is as biogeology known.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
In her honor, we'll now draw away
The curtain to place on display
A fine bust of the wife
Of our leader. Long life
To them both! (We'll take his head some day).

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
She dyed her hair blue. Ever since,
Her dislike of the hip makes me wince.
(Not the one that she broke—
All things new; I misspoke.)
She's so old now, and I blame the rinse.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Engineership described his skill well.
All us folks thought Mel's bridges were swell.
He'd grown wealthy, I heard,
Till a windstorm occurred.
'Cause of that, his most famous one one fell.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Elvis tried to erect a high shelf.
Since he's tiny (his nickname is "Elf"),
The shelf fell on that gnome
When the ladder he clomb.
"I brung it," cried Elf, "on meself!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
How I hate to break bulk in my store,
But that's just, after all, what we're for.
Many items, like clocks,
May come twelve to the box,
But most folks will buy one and no more.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An old bachelor stated, "I need
A young wife to assure that I breed."
When he met Bernadette,
A brunette bachelorette,
She agreed, "Yes, indeed! Let's proceed!"

limerick_list.author: LMAK
limerick_list.text:
Ceanothus: a genus that burns:
For hot conflagration it yearns.
This chaparral bush
Provides nitrogen push.
After fire it always returns.

limerick_list.author: joshuacronemeyer
limerick_list.text:
The doc put his hand on my liver,
Which shivered and shook all aquiver.
As I poured him a drink,
I explained with a wink,
"I reside by the famed Whiskey River."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
I've gulped Advils and such by the score,
But my purulent jaw still is sore.
I'll dispense with a sleuth
And deduce "abscessed tooth."
I need antibiotics — hard core.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
You forget how you hurt — act forgetfully.
You're not sorry — you act unregretfully.
You forget? No regret?
Well, that gets me upset!
I get irked — you can bet I'll act fretfully!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
A crow step's decor at the top
Of a gable. Should step turn to hop,
It's no longer a course
But a jump by a horse.
With arched back and stiff legs, up he'll pop.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes and Virge
limerick_list.text:
As a stag shows his antlers while strutting,
So the stamen holds anthers out-jutting.
When there's pollen to blow
A sweet stigma's the go
Like a buck needs a doe during rutting.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
A wheat farmer, Billy Bob Graff,
Wasn't any too bright. (Not by half!)
See, his threshing was vain
'Cause he threw out the grain
And then tried to make bread from the chaff.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Aminomethane? That's methylamine.
It is colorless, therefore unseen,
And will break into flame,
But has garnered great fame—
Its industrial use is routine.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
When rhetorical tricks are discussed,
The device called bdelygmia must
Be the worst of them all:
It can make your flesh crawl
And cause nausea, hives, and disgust.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Individuals freely decided
How dividual things got divided—
Whereas protons stay tough
Indivisible stuff
'Til they're forcibly spun and collided.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
It can mean a sports buff — an old crock,
Or elastic to shield you from shock,
But  "High Five" or low blow,
It's important you know
An athletic supporter's a jock.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
What did coconut water provide
To medics that fought on each side
Of the Second World War
When meds weren't in store?
It saved troops who'd have otherwise died.

limerick_list.author: Gravely
limerick_list.text:
O Shakti, with thee I am falling
In love, though one detail is galling.
Those arms down each side —
It's a lot to abide.
Thy distichous form is appalling!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Tom grew up in damp gutters and ditches —
Lost parents, scarce food, flea-borne itches.
A guttersnipe, he
Was as poor as can be:
Tom's young life was the bitch of all bitches.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
Some poets can't nail down a thought
By the end of a line, as they ought.
I get quite disappointed
With structure disjointed —
So fractured, distracted, distraught.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
While your insult was not so appealing,
'Twas revealing of you, I am feeling.
In fact, it was galling,
And rude and appalling,
Though I'm healing and certainly dealing.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
I escape in the quiet of night
On a fabulous fairytale flight
To a fantasy dreamscape,
A peaches-and-cream-scape,
And dwell there till morning's first light.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Where's that money you owe me, you slob?
You're a deadbeat who can't keep a job.
Default on this loan?
Then the fault is your own.
It's a matter I'll take to the mob.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I fell, dislocating my knee,
I was helped by a skilled EMT
Who reacted with urgency
To my medical emergency—
A technician, but not an M.D.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The Birkeland currents revealed
The vastness and scope of the field.
We bask in the auras
Of polar auroras,
With most of their secrets still sealed.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
A dihedron. Well, how about that!
With two faces (two surfaces) pat,
You'd be frankly insane
(If each face must be plane)
To imagine this shape wasn't flat.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
What this pee test, you guys, is about
Is detecting who leaked in the kraut.
You can tell, by the hour,
Its smell gets more sour —
That pisser will soon be found out.

limerick_list.author: Benton Randall Olmsted
limerick_list.text:
Her handsome and dashing young suitor
Spoke amatively as he wooed her.
But once she said "yes"
To his amativeness,
He became undeniably ruder.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
Mind the leaves, bark, the fruits and the peels,
And the sap, and its smoke—the mind reels!
Both are poisonous topics
(East Indies or tropics):
The bastard and real manchineels.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A knight from the stories of old
Found he fancied two maids. Feeling bold
He declared, "By my troth,
I'm in love with you both,
And determined to have and to hold."

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Your consumption's conspicuous, slick,
Gaudy, garish, with glitz laid on thick.
You won at the lottery —
Now you're flaunting your gottery:
Tacky excess reveals you're a hick.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
When I take a quick look at his mug,
Is he more of a boxer or pug?
Features all disarranged,
He is dog-faced—much changed
By the damaging slug of that thug!

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
The universe? Closed. Go away!
If you have any sense, you won't stay.
(An astronomer's joke!)
It means gravity's yoke
Thus will cause its implosion some day.

limerick_list.author: Amanda Richards
limerick_list.text:
A hard-working nail or a screw
Set in brick needs a dook to hang true.
A plug in the hole
Plays a load-bearing role,
So your painting won't hang all askew.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Don's gone doolally (stark, raving mad),
And he's part of this limerick fad.
He writes verses all day
In an anapest way.
(Then again, is that really so bad?)

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
The cardinal winds, sailors know,
Are the ones from due north that do blow,
Or due south or due west,
Or due east; but it's best
If the wind blows where I want to go.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For the French, it was love at first sight,
Building nuclear plants left and right.
Now atomically powered,
Their nation is showered
With light to illumine the night.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
On a hillside, some grass said he saw
A red tail in my foxhound's red maw.
The police said, "That's banned;
But no charges are planned."
Well, so much for my brush with the law.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Sighed Eeyore, a close pal of Pooh,
"I have donkeywork (plenty!) to do.
And it's not so much head work
As effort-I-dread work.
I'm glum, apathetic, and blue."

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Gig economy jobs like I've got
Are a real anti-working man plot.
See, my cab driver neighbor
Gets paid for his labor,
Plus benefits! Me? I do not.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The dodo and aurochs are linked
In a way that is clearly distinct,
Plus there's also a tie in
With the Barbary lion,
And it's not that all three are extinct.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Now that my daughter's full grown,
She has three healthy boys of her own.
My grandsons came from
A dumb crumb and a bum.
(Well, she couldn't have done it alone.)

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
There's a breakthrough that's stirring much awe
Called CRISPR that's now a great draw
As a gene-edit tool —
It's incredibly cool
At locating and snipping a flaw.

limerick_list.author: Sybil Society
limerick_list.text:
Trace your hand down the flat of the spine.
Breathe the scent, read the very first line.
Never judge by the cover:
An ardent book-lover
Will savor each story like wine.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
One more goal we've no chance to achieve:
A new foal for our son's Christmas Eve:
No new colt's on the way
Since our mare, sad to say,
Broke service. (She failed to conceive.)

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
It's only a tiny conjunction,
But but has a critical function:
It indicates, "Though
The preceding point's so,
There's a shift in my thoughts at this junction."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The bloke at the podium spoke
Certain phrases and words to evoke
An emotive response.
What he got: nonchalance.
Were they playing a practical joke?

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Could a guy sport an elephant's trunk?
Would it make the girls think him a hunk?
No, he'd look rather weird,
But a pointed goat's beard
(Hair that's grown on his chin) would—slam dunk!

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
The Chaos Computer Club's hackers
Are known to be web-site attackers.
But the faults that they find
They report. So be kind:
They are heroes—we don't call them "crackers"!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Your gullet's an organ that's hollow.
For its problems, this protocol follow:
Have this test, this exam,
An  esophagogram.
(Some folks call it a barium swallow.)

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Despite your accomplished seduction,
My nerve fibers suffer reduction
Of the highly essential
Transmembrane potential,
And thus, marked decremental conduction.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Will a cochlear implant enhance
Lives of kids never given a chance?
Signals go to the brain,
Then their teachers can train
Them to hear, speak and sing while they dance!

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Since reading a raw lamentation
Will guarantee max ejulation,
Keep tissues nearby,
As you groan, wail and cry,
To effectively blot lacrimation.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
"He's not yet at the end of his tether,"
Said God of the Pharaoh. "But whether
He knows it or no,
He will soon let you go;
He shall thrust you out hence altogether."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Double-minded, my dad's not the kind
Of a genius you're likely to find
Who's as smart as two men.
No, it's just now and then
He's unable to make up his mind.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Global warming's a terrible hoax.
It's just one of those Liberals' bad jokes.
