When Key West and Key Largo
Start floating to Fargo,
Mother Nature may cry "That's all folks!"

limerick_list.author: Carole Lyons
limerick_list.text:
To take messages, summon or page
In hotels, on a train or on stage,
A callboy's enough.
For massages and stuff,
A call girl is the one to engage.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our dining room table's extensible.
It pulls out to serve ten; that seems sensible.
But to welcome my cousin,
You invited two dozen—
Reprehensible, Ted, indefensible!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
His vacation won't really perturb Les.
In the country, distractions disturb less;
But he parks on the lawn
Of his cottage each dawn,
As the road that he lives on is curbless.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
If you'd rather we didn't all hear your throat,
I suggest that you cough and so clear your throat.
Could it be a frog's stuck
In your gorge? — such bad luck!
For amphibians shouldn't go near your throat.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Ronnie Barker won't joke any more
In his Open All Hours sitcom store,
Or eat Porridge in jail,
Or with Corbett regale:
Death has sadly shut Ronnie's last door.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
In pigs-in-the-blanket with rice
Or in coleslaw it's certainly  nice.
This veggie is fine
Every time that I dine.
When there's cabbage, I fill my plate twice.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
When the blatherskite ruddy ducks call,
They're nonsensical, noisy to all
But each other.  The drake
Runs on water to make
Popping sounds to his near slip-and-fall.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Although Chippendalism, for me,
Is no vision of guys hanging free,
Girls will picture undressing
More likely, I'm guessing,
Than chairs made by Chippendale, T.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Michael's boat is in drydock for now.
Something's broken; it may be the bow.
(Or the stern? Which is which?)
Steep repairs are a bitch,
But it's worth it 'cause Mike loves his scow.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
There's a beekeeper keeping his hive
On a route that I've needed to drive.
Down that street, straight and tree-lined,
I've rapidly beelined,
As fast as my car can contrive.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Take the black pea and blue pea. One sees
They've got one thing in common. Now, please,
Can you simply relate
This identical trait?
That's correct! Neither one will grow peas.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Let's talk Catch-22 — we can share
Thoughts on anti-war novels that scare.
There's a scene all about
Snowden's guts spilling out
While Yossarian murmurs, "There, there."

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
An ode to the virtues of Dust:
Shopping Channel says, "Use it, you must!"
Its protective fine layer
Needs no purchase nor payer.
It's a proven home product you trust.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Pressures mercury once stretched to see
Are aneroid now, fluid-free.
Piezoresistance
Beats toxin persistence:
They're all labeled mmHg.

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
A profligate pair in Albania
Had intense aphrodisiomania.
The flesh-focused two
Wondered, "What can we do
To drain the profane from our crania?"

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
A farmer gets maximum yield
When the harvested crop is revealed.
It's not from the raining;
It's consummate training —
Outstanding, again, in his field.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Mao delivered a stern allocution
Portending severe retribution.
The crime that he spoke of
Was making a joke of,
In limerick form, revolution.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
Every morning the same sort of fuss:
Before anyone else, wacky Russ
Would stampede down the street
On two very fast feet,
'Cause "the early bird catches the bus".

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Merry Phelps rings her garden bells merrily
Near her oyster shell border; contrarily,
She has nary a cockle,
And yet no debacle
Occurs—but the maids watch her warily.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The doctor was hailed in Montana
When he moved to my town from Havana.
Though his knowledge was scant,
He evoked Cary Grant—
And, my deah, what a smooth bedside mannah!

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Have a dream? Yes, I do! An absurd
And impossible, beautiful, bird-
like, insistent clear vision
And bright-beamed decision.
Aspiration's my goal's crucial word.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The voyeur in our town, people say,
Is most active at twilight each day.
Comes the dusk, in the gloom,
He'll peer into your room,
So they call him "Crepuscular Ray."

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
"Hey, just hold it right there!  What's your name?"
The instructor called out, as he came
Round the corner.  "Bad luck—
And your mates passed the buck
When they scarpered—so you'll take the blame."

limerick_list.author: P Walowitz
limerick_list.text:
Grim Madame Defarge sat and knitted
Their names and the crimes they committed.
As a citizeness,
She cried, "Kill the noblesse!"
So their heads, one by one, were unfitted.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The day prior demands irrigation—
A clean-out—with bowel preparation.
A laxative's use
Will flush all the stool loose
That has taken up colonization.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
Apostrophize me when you write.
Address me, though I'm not in sight.
O lover, it's true:
I do it for you.
It's rhetorical, mutual delight.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Chemotaxis applies to a sloth
In its movement, but not to the growth
Of a plant, when it's bent
By a taste or a scent.
Chemotropism covers them both.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Need some chemicals, fast? Cast a glance
Over Germany, Switzerland, France:
All along the great streams
Our big industry seems
To produce them in hundreds of plants.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
Innovator, inventor, of fame,
Thomas Crapper's the plumber's odd  name.
He was 'flushed with great pride'
To have royals astride
A new toilet that brought him acclaim.

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
The corporal's "r"s seemed to go:
"That was weally a wight woyal show."
The sergeant said "Thanks,
Give the order — break ranks."
"Ooh, I think I'd best not, don't you know."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Gemeinschaft–Gesellschaft, they say,
Sociologists use to convey
The dichotomy seen
And the difference between
The direct/indirect social way.

limerick_list.author: D Frayer
limerick_list.text:
At Chalcedon, Jesus became
Fully God, fully man (so they claim).
Old Istanbul lies on
Its western horizon
And Kadikoy, right now, is its name.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I asked, "Are you gonna chain up
Your new Pomeranian pup?"
For most people of Maine,
Excess talking's a pain
So he simply responded, "Ayup."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Appalachian, a cheese from raw milk,
With a texture described "smooth as silk,"
Has a buttery taste
(Hint of lemon?) embraced
By rich wine snobs and those of that ilk.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
Aliza
limerick_list.text:
When my mother goes out, she will wear
Pretty jewels for sparkle and flair.
But her earrings are clip-on;
Their spring-loaded grip on
Her ears give her lobes wear and tear.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Angel wings don't just help cherubs fly;
Many plants with that name please the eye.
But alas for a bird,
If that defect occurred
It could never fly into the sky.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
The batting cage has a machine,
Pitching balls that I hit at a screen.
But its aim was so bad,
Here's the thought that I had:
Did the batting coach set it on "bean"?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Scott's as guilty as guilty can be,
Though "Not guilty" is somehow his plea.
Seems his father's the judge.
Here's the verdict. Oh, fudge!
No jail time? He got off scot-free.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My son likes to go on vacation,
Loves to party, enjoys recreation,
But he's failing.  I plead,
"Hey, Joe College, you need
Cerebration and not celebration!"

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
Bombay duck is a fish, that's no lie.
First they clean it, then bone it, then dry
It on poles (there's no hurry)—
It's eaten with curry,
A lizardfish dish I won't try.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
I'm not an alumni. Here's why:
I'm only a singular guy.
  If it's one grad from school,
  The grammatical rule
Is alumnus. (And I'm Sigma Phi.)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Berlin Wall falls: speak Gorbachev's name
If you're playing the liberal game.
Credit Reagan?  No way!
9/11: just say
It's not Clinton's fault — Bush is to blame.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The figure who waits in my foyer
Is Shiva, my wife's Hindu lawyer.
As the aspect involved
When creation's dissolved,
He's a whiz as a marriage destroyer.

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
Motown's Tigers (not "Pumas" or "Pards"),
With their hopes and dreams shattered to shards,
Said, "We've lost! Please don't boo us,
You fans of St. Louis!
Our doom was foretold in the Cards!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
God in Heaven, dear Father, I pray
In frustration.  Please show me the way.
I've lost eight thousand bucks,
And my life really sucks.
I should sack Uncle Billy?  OK.

limerick_list.author: Dixon Wragg
limerick_list.text:
Electroshock therapy clears
The static between people's ears.
A small shock to the brain
Can reduce mental pain,
But it's hard to recruit volunteers.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Tuning into your local kids' station,
You're likely to see animation:
From stop-motion clay
To Japan's anime,
There's many a moving creation.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a drug many sluggers abuse—
Known as andro (for short) in the news.
Androstenedione's bad!
Barry Bonds used a scad;
Now he's sluggish and singing the blues.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Fissile means "able to fission",
If an element can make the transition
Into two or more bits
As its nucleus splits —
A change from its old composition.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
My husband is great—good as gold.
And there's no one more giving, all told.
He's benevolent, caring,
Unselfish, and sharing.
Don't believe me? He gave me this cold.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
If the church is your chosen vocation,
Then you might work in this situation:
Your group is led by
A methodical guy,
The DS of your organization.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
My bitch is a bird: she can track
Any rabbit to hades and back;
Catches mallards aloft
With a mouth that's so soft
They don't think to complain — not a quack.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A lama may guide us to wrathlessness,
And a ride on a llama beats pathlessness,
While by bathing just once
In a month, I'm a dunce,
'Cause from Mama I can't hide my bathlessness.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Touching hands, there we'd walk after school—
Bowered paths, unattended and cool.
In that dark, leafy setting,
We learned about petting.
Things seemed safer those days—as a rule.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
In no tree¹ does this ariel dwell;
And it isn't a mer-maiden belle.²
Though it sounds like a flier,³
Perhaps a high wire,
It's just an Arabian gazelle.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
An adjournment is what you have earned
After meetings where days have been burned.
  But adjourning's most fun
  For a judge. When he's done
He announces, "This court is adjourned!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Late at night, freezing cold, there we were.
Would the engine turn over? No, sir!
Life was dire before,
But had grown that much more:
Things were direr-er-er-er-er.

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
Lord Byron, the poet of old,
Came down like a wolf on the fold.
So many were chaste;
Lady Lamb fit his taste,
But Caro was hardest to hold.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Mary Phelps had a right and left breast.
The poor things, they had nowhere to rest.
Before long, though—hurrah!—
She'd invented the bra;
By the way, it's worn under the vest.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
The electoral candidate played
On the crowd like a breeze in a glade.
"I'm a winner! I'm great!"
Was the gist of his spate
Of self-praise, empty boast, gasconade.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
We suffered a bruising defeat
At the hands of the power elite.
'Twas a crushing display
By the corps de ballet:
They outdanced us—we couldn't compete.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
"Tomorrow I will," so you say,
"Do … whatever. Now please go away."
It is always the same;
You're so good at this game—
Crastination's the word of the day.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The banana in room 23
Was as yellow as yellow could be.
Doc's advice to this guy:
"When new clothing you buy,
Avoid purple." (It clashes, you see.)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Must you get on your soapbox no end?
Dude, your pissing and ranting offend
Even me, who's your clone
In the politics zone.
Keep it up, and you might lose a friend.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
Sneaking past them, I relish the flush
Of success! Just the threat of a brush
With the law is a thrill!!
They can't stop me!!! (Whoa—chill.)
Yes, blockade-running gives me a rush.

limerick_list.author: rhymedawg
limerick_list.text:
Not across spelled out wonky, me ducky.
I won't sweet-talk ya, that's so horse…pucky.
It's like mannose or glucose
Or dextrose or sucrose—
But acrose is fake and it's sucky!

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
Though Jewish, I envy your Easter;
On Cadbury Eggs I'm a feaster.
They're chocolate and smooth,
And my mood they will soothe.
(But they'll add too much weight to my keister!)

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Here's the book on this kid: He can bunt;
Stay alert, 'cause he's up for a stunt.
Look, we know the kid's smart —
Baseball head, lots of heart —
If he squares, don't charge too close up front.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Louie's hip; he's so dernier cri.
Oh my gosh! Is he looking at me?!
The new "hot" guy at school—
Here he comes. (Now, don't drool.)
There he goes, on his way to Marie...

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
"Please don't tax us," the litany starts.
"Your  spending is clear off the charts.
We'll give alms — if we choose,
Though they'll waste it on booze;
Trust our well-chilled Republican hearts."

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
Absolved of all criminal charges,
My view of the future enlarges.
I won't be in jail,
My fate to bewail.
The court system also discharges.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Butt-naked means "lacking in clothes",
A practice that's favoured by those
Who like to display
(To others' dismay)
 What most wish they wouldn't expose.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
She looked up at the lovebird so lissom:
"Oh, how cute, tweetiepie, I could kiss 'im!"
But that budgie let fly,
And kersplat in her eye
Doo-doo plopped, having dropped from its crissum.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
There's a boiling arch outside of town
Where our maple sap's long been boiled down:
This old furnace of brick
Has for years turned the trick.
Local syrup's earned worldwide renown.

limerick_list.author: Dick C. Erd
limerick_list.text:
When Earth's warming has us on our knees,
When we're baking to death by degrees,
And when all seems amiss,
Take cold comfort from this:
That at least we can know we won't freeze.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said a joiner in London named Andy
(With all kinds of tools he was handy),
"All the works of Kit Marlowe
Can't equal my barlow,
A jacknife as cheap as it's dandy."

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
Extra charges?  The airlines just ain't
Doing business with any restraint.
But your anger constrain;
Don't protest all your pain.
($50 to file a complaint.)

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
I will face your new dress so you'll know
Which way round you should wear it, although
It's a face made of fur —
Haute couture, as it were,
Just for facing your fans at the show.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Procreation, dear readers, is rife
With all manner of trouble and strife.
In the midst of each cell
Sits the ladder to hell:
DNA is the spiral of life.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
In the fine art of love I'm a fool;
I get hurt and my heart's full of doole.
Observe how I borrow
This rare word for sorrow.
I do pay attention in school.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Bessie's biopsy found, in her breast,
Signs of cancer, and Bessie felt stressed.
But her lump was benign,
And we'd later opine
'Twas false positive news from that test.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Frank discussions?" My dear, that's a code word,
Euphemistic—this week's à la mode word.
It means that we fought
And we came up with naught;
Speaking frankly, I'd use an explode-word.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Engine's smoking. Right, now I'm awake!
Something fell; a wing started to shake.
After glitch piled on glitch,
We decided to ditch:
"Goin' in, guys. Thank God there's a lake."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
So what? So I donned the wrong hat.
Still, I'll likely catch flak about that.
It was white tie and topper,
So my homburg's improper—
More grief from the wife (the old bat).

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
I was hexed by this witch down the street;
Then my spouse took up voodoo to cheat!
And my sleep's gone erratic
With ghosts in my attic.
My cursedness seems quite complete.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
For this cause, I'm the world's biggest fan.
You need help right away? I'm your man.
I am pleased I can aid—
I don't need to be paid.
By all means, I will do what I can.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Administratively, Davis is deft,
And his role in the office has heft.
He keeps files, answers phones,
Sorts the mail. Credits Jones:
"With his work done, there ain't a lot left!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Pretty please, could you pass me a sheet of
That paper? When I'm in receipt of
Said sheet, it will show
That requests, doncha know,
Are best made in a voice that's entreative.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Do I bulge in these pants?" my wife said.
"Do I seem fat behind?" I turned red.
"I don't dare say 'extremely,'"
I thought. "Too unseemly,
Though her seams stretch so tight that they're spread."

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
I'm aware that I'm on the wrong road,
And I'm speeding—I ought to have slowed,
But I just cannot make
Myself put on the brake:
I'm in cognitive dissonance mode.

limerick_list.author: sl8ofhand
limerick_list.text:
Though it seemed I was thick-skinned (a bear)
When my niece asked to go to the fair,
I'd have felt more avuncular
If I wasn't carbuncular
And my arse wasn't glued to this chair.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There's an indirect object I see
In your "Send me an RSVP."
It's the pronoun you're choosing
And datively using:
The first-person singular me.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
"They're extinct, but that's just around here,"
The zoologist said, with a tear.
"Extirpation's occurred,
But they thrive undeterred
Somewhere else (till they all disappear)."

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A written disclaimer makes clear,
"We can't be responsible here."*
*The above definition,
By author's admission,
Was reached after 12 pints of beer.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
As our priest made the case for salvation,
His passions arose; escalation
Of tone and intensity
Increased my propensity
To escalate Sunday's donation.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
George Bush was quite hard to ignore
But was also quite hard to adore.
Sometimes that's how it goes
As this anagram shows—
People said, at the time, "He bugs Gore".

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
"Pass the pepper, dear." Grandpa said, "Eh?"
Grandma turned to him: "What did you say?"
"Beg yours?" he replied.
"Speak up!" Grandma cried.
Married fifty-eight years to the day.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Do Palin and others believe
That, with death panels, what we'll receive
Is reduction in cost
By the lives that are lost
Via rationing?  Should we all grieve?

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
My collar is aquamarine.
That's a color, a nice bluish-green —
Unless (is this true?)
It's a nice greenish-blue.
Well, whatever, it has a nice sheen.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You screwed up, bro. You're sure gonna get it!
Dad's declared that he'll make you regret it.
He's psychotic, almost.
Do you get it? You're toast!
That is reason enough you should sweat it!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Two scavenger birds that I know
Are often called carrion crow.
One's a crow (no baloney!) —
That's Corvus corone.
The other's a vulture — crow faux.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Dated date, as a term, may sound funny,
But investments are serious, sonny.
If you purchase a bond
Since of interest you're fond,
It's your start date to earn money money.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Joe and Moe both parade with flambeaux:
Dance with flame — that's the game, don'cha know.
It's a damn heavy light
That they twirl through the night.
Their flamboyancy carries the show.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Come straight over and take me, big tipper.
I'm your kitten, your slut and your stripper.
I'll be your sweet feline
If you make a beeline
For me, my hot bod and my zipper.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
An eye for an eye and a tooth
For a tooth show old laws' simple truth:
That no punishment be
More severe than how we
With our crimes have been wrong or uncouth.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
A keen encyclopaedist am I,
As I write encyclopaedias. Why?
It widens our knowledge
Like courses at college—
Today or perhaps by and by.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Sally's allergies seemed like a curse;
Eating berries made everything worse.
But when strawberries Sally ate,
Chlorpheniramine maleate
Helped her itchy red skin rash reverse.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
In his eyes burns a fiery soul.
This effect (in his most tragic role)
Was to playgoers lost
When the lighting got crossed —
He was standing inside a black hole.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's a dress, no Armani creation:
An ephemeral empty sensation.
But, designed for that rich,
Little talentless bitch,
It's already inspired imitation.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I  love funboxes! Want to know why?
They let skateboarding nuts like me fly
Up and down their curved ramps,
Pretending we're champs,
Doing tricks to impress passersby.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The Aprilian winds have brought damps
And lumbago and muscular cramps.
But we'll soon go a-Maying.
Come June, we'll be haying,
As always, like Granny and Gramps.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
For your gift, I spent all sorts of money
On a dacryocystectomy, Honey!
There a doctor will hack
On a lacrimal sac.
(Hope the Empress thinks surgery's funny...)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Mr. Arafat (friends called him Yasser)
Drilled for gas on the campus of Vassar.
This remarkable feat
Was exceedingly neat.
He was boasting for months, "That's a gasser!"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Though he says he's a policy maker,
He's a flack and a jake-leg old faker.
He jaunts to Aruba
And toots his own tuba —
A braggart, a boaster, a  craker.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The term foot traffic might ring a bell,
But an image I'd like to dispel:
With this term we are talking
'Bout folks who are walking.
The ankles and up come as well.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Steve Rogers, a scrawny young teen,
Was the skinniest boy ever seen.
Then they gave him a shot;
He got buffed; now he's hot!
(In the film, my wife squeals at this scene.)

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The Republicans' focus on debt
As our nation's most dangerous threat
Started early '09.
Until then, all was "fine."
How these elephants love to forget!

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
The expediter's starting to freak,
Since the lawn's not been mowed all this week.
I suppose that I should ...
I told Donna the Good
That I would when her pique hits its peak.

limerick_list.author: jayrusalem
limerick_list.text:
Actinobacillus may quicken
The demise of your horse, if he's stricken.
The equuli species
Is spread through his feces.
(The lucky ones live and just sicken.)

limerick_list.author: arnie
limerick_list.text:
The stupid blonde bimbos of Gor
Love treatment that they should abhor.
They're all silly girls
Dressed only in pearls;
Too bad that it's all such a bore.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
My life you have written, I see,
And I'm thrilled I'm the biographee!
I had been quite concerned,
But at last you have learned
That it's always, my dear, about me.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
That d–mned Caper Merchant, Herr Schmaltz!
At first my Wife thought he'd no Faults.
But a fit of the Vapours
Ensued, for his Capers
Included (O Heavens!) the Waltz.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Tied a knot that now can't be untied
Even though all your tricks you have tried?
That is fastness for you,
Just the same as when glue
To your hand and your hair you've applied.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
I'm preparing a marketing flyer
For a product that smokers desire.
It will read "Pipes of clay
Break or crumble away,
So, dear buyer, your best bet's a briar!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"I know that you live all alone,"
Came the whispering voice on the phone.
I went running with fright
On that bitter cold night
And was found doubly chilled to the bone.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
On a world stage Al Gore is performing,
Taking action against global warming.
He presents with great flair
What just might be hot air,
As his lack of sound facts is  alarming.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Our date must have left you in doubt
If I'll ever come out of my drought.
Please don't be resentful
That nothing eventful
Occurred on our only night out.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's no way of withstanding the fire
Of critics' unwarranted ire:
"They can't sing. They can't act.
As a matter of fact,
The whole cast would do well to retire."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
This toaster is functionally sound.
It turns bread into toast, nicely browned.
Though it's scratched and it's rusty,
It works well. My trusty
Old toaster has long hung around.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The pastor, a good friend of mine
Who, though elderly, functions just fine,
Says he plans to keep preaching,
And helping, and teaching
Till reaching the end of the line.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Brother Joseph, you're hereby disfriared:
From your job at our church, you are fired.
You're a chicken—too meek!
Better work you should seek
And perhaps as a baker be hired.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
On the floor of a river you'll find
That a flounder or sole is designed
With both eyes on the right.
On the left, they've no sight—
So this side is defined to be blind.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I came back from a run; I was beat,
And searching for something to eat.
When I finally found it,
I instantly downed it.
Whatever it was, it was sweet.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
What's up with the Friday face, Matt?
You sure look like you just lost your cat.
There's no need be sad—
Skipping meat ain't so bad,
And the weekend is near, so there's that.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
To be born to the manner's a boon.
In your mouth is a silvery spoon.
While you're still in a diaper,
Let dad pay the piper.
The advantage is you call the tune.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
There are uses for cinquefoil, the plant
(Uses quite comprehensive, I grant).
Keep some roots as contingency —
Good for astringency.
Trust all those herbals? I can't.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To some friends with a daughter gone wild:
"I'm so sorry the cops have your child."
While the dad, inconsolable,
Wept tears uncontrollable,
His consolable wife merely smiled.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
In a bottle, a tube, or a pipe,
Stick the stick of a rocket. Don't gripe,
Be afraid, or a douche.
Just ignite it, and whoosh!
It flies up and blows up. Worth the hype?

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
A bookstall sells books, new and old.
Some old ones are pricy as gold!
And if they are rare
With prices unfair,
It's ages until they get sold.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
An A-bomb's a weapon atomic
Whose use cannot be economic,
Since mad heads of state
Might retaliate—straight
To results far more tragic than comic.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The ermine's a wintertime stoat
Once prized for its fluffy white coat.
Now that fur's out of style,
The critter's plush pile
Less often trims cloak or capote.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
If half of the voters, like you,
Vote for red, and a half plus one blue,
You may not think it right
That the blue win the night,
But an absolute majority do.

limerick_list.author: Lawrence A. Herman
limerick_list.text:
Invent baseball? The Congress has said it:
Alexander J. Cartwright gets credit.
They think that this error can
Show baseball's American,
But what Congress has writ, they should edit.

limerick_list.author: Emily Joan
limerick_list.text:
A grim warrior creeps to the lair
Of a fire-breathing dragon. Beware!
But within, he espies
A bathetic surprise:
That serpent just washing his hair.

limerick_list.author: gagman
limerick_list.text:
Alackaday, woe, and alas!
My girlfriend is giving me sass.
I'm hoping tomorrow
She'll give me less sorrow
And exhibit a little more class.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
We're married (I'm queenly, he's kingly),
And we do things both couply and singly.
When I told him that we
In nine months could be three—
And his eyes lit with glee—I got tingly.

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
'Save Our Church'? Your appeal is just bats.
In the lurch. No bells peal. Filled with rats.
No, deconsecrate, Vicar.
Make a buck that way, quicker.
Sell unholy conversions to flats!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Fido barked, "It's the worst time of year:
The damn dog days of summer are here.
Why did humans defame
Their 'best friends' with that name?
That's a serious question, don't sneer!"

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
On the tapestry hung in Bayeux
See the tale of the Saxons' adieu:
They let facial hair grow
But have pas de chevaux;
Mounted Normans have pas de cheveux.

limerick_list.author: Lady Catherine
limerick_list.text:
A certain magnetic attraction
Ended up in a physics infraction.
When opposites fail
To align head to tail,
This calls for a new plan of action.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Stating thermodynamics' first law
At some length would most probably bore.
"Heat is work, work is heat"
Is a summary, neat.
Take a college course should you need more.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
My amanogawa's a tree
Of old Japanese breed, you agree?
Whitish-pink blossoms bloom,
And its branches assume
A tall sheaflike appearance for me.

limerick_list.author: Colin Salter
limerick_list.text:
Bernard Edwards, Nile Rodgers — as Chic,
They made disco risqué, tongue in cheek,
With unlyrical rhymes
("Yowzah! Yowzah!"), "Good Times",
Irresistible beats, and "Le Freak".

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Which came first? Was it chicken-or-egg?
That's a puzzle whose answer we beg:
An anachronous query
Or temporal theory
Providing an omelette or leg.

limerick_list.author: BobfromThirsk
limerick_list.text:
The brewer's old wife, Jill De-Vere,
Was a little too fond of "good cheer".
Full of whisky, she fell
In a vat; now she's well
Cask-conditioned (along with the beer).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A cabdriver said to his fare,
"I will go where you like; just say where."
(Then the bloke in the back
Pulled a gun on the hack.)
"Not to heaven; please don't send me there!"

limerick_list.author: AronKuppersmith
limerick_list.text:
See that girl with the devilish smile?
She's a flirt with the knack to beguile.
You'll get nothing but trouble.
Better run, on the double,
Lest you fall for her charm and her style.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My foe's propagandists are tops,
So the voters are giving him props.
But I'll counter his lies
With the truth, and I'll rise
In the polls when support for him drops.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A Switzerland bank says I'll earn
All the interest with little concern
That the Feds can acquire
The date of my wire,
So soon I'll have money to Bern.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Diverticula: sacs in the lining
Of a tubular organ, defining
Undue herniation
That might cause formation
Of cancer, infection, or whining.

limerick_list.author: Irene Weber
limerick_list.text:
There once was a girl named Alceste
Whose temper was testy at best,
But her artwork, you see,
Was serene as could be.
To this I can truly attest.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Coryphaei are leaders of parties,
Assemblies, and clusters of smarties.
Our captain is one,
And we're in for some fun
'Cause he's passing out rum to us hearties.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There's a corporal—one of the troops;
There are corpuscles, moving in groups
In your blood vessels, and
There's the whip, till your hand,
Giving corporal punishment, droops.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
An investor with downside protection
Has decided to take, on reflection,
A safe long position
To counter attrition
Resulting from market correction.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
The mice here behave aggravatingly.
They've watched Tom and Jerry, frustratingly.
As they tiptoe around
All my traps on the ground,
I'm left baiting their bane unabatingly.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To butterfly meat, what you do
Is to slice it not all the way through
So the image this brings
Is of butterfly wings
When both halves are then opened to view.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
I'm afraid it will take quite a while
To regain my benevolent smile.
I am easily narked,
And my conduct is marked
By dyspepsia, rancour, and bile.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My cat Trish failed to fill a fond wish
To concoct from fresh fish a fine dish —
Forsaking fish baking,
Ironically making
A mess: a fine kettle of fish.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Chiaroscuro's a great way to paint,
Adding depth to each sinner and saint.
Light and dark are emphatic—
Their effect is dramatic.
So I tried; Caravaggio I ain't!

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
That's uranium, piled on the floor—
Not quite critical mass. Add some more,
And a growing, sustained
Chain reaction's obtained—
Then it's time we should head for the door...

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
That provision's dispositively written.
It directs, "Though my son may be smitten,
He inherits no money
On wedding his 'honey',
That gold-digging, avarous Briton."

limerick_list.author: PdeG
limerick_list.text:
I am under the care of my shrink;
Just what is not letting me think?
Is it only the fly
That's annoying my eye?
Don't tell me I just need to blink.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Mom's old Singer's a treasure; that's plain.
But its buttonholer gadget's arcane.
Where small holes would suffice,
The accursed device
Creates dimples. I may go insane.

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
Said the White House aide, "Sir, please decide
What music the band should provide.
Do you want something light,
Or is Haydn alright?"
"It sure is," said George. "Let's go hide."

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
Academic Health Center's for me!
The treatment is usually free!
  The new would-be doctors
  Are guided by proctors.
(For short, it is called AHC.)

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
His partner had never hit back;
When he'd punched her she'd taken the flak,
Till she hacked the Formica
To carve, "I don't like ya!"
Then left.  What a counter-attack.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
John looks cretose — he's ashen and pale;
His complexion's way off (he's in jail).
He's cretaceous, like chalk —
So what gives?  He won't talk.
Marsha says that his alibi's frail.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Recall Alistair Cooke? Who'd compare
With that host who long graced us on air?
Very Brit, head to toe,
His wide coverage could go
From alpha to zed, all with flair!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
A bit of spare change is a cinch:
I'll write for the news in a pinch.
They'll print the whole story
In all of its glory —
And pay me for each column inch.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dave and I both got rashes called favus
Of the scalp. It's a gift our pal gave us—
Seems this fungus is catching.
We're itching and scratching;
Let's hope that our doctor can save us.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Existentialists court the absurd.
Life's a puzzle not solved but endured.
It's chaotic, lopsided,
No guidance provided.
Your questions re-echo unheard.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Baron Munchausen, figure of mirth,
Spread fantastical tales round the earth.
His whole life was ad-libbing,
Spectacular fibbing —
A congenital liar: from birth.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
"It's great to be highly esteemed,"
Said the mayor of the town, and he beamed.
"The respect that I get
Overwhelms me and yet,
If only they knew how I schemed."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Although mistletoe's thought aphroditic,
It slurps sap from its host — parasitic.
But more dull Spanish moss
Simply hangs without loss
To its tree; takes support: epiphytic.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Lisa's dieting efforts were ceaseless.
All her meals were unsalted and greaseless,
But she sighed and looked pale
When she stepped off the scale,
As her poundage, each day, was decreaseless.

limerick_list.author: Edmund Conti
limerick_list.text:
The limerick form is concise.
Its rules, quite precise, should suffice.
Remember, be terse
When composing the verse
And don't be a smut-case.  Be nice!

limerick_list.author: stella
Richard English
limerick_list.text:
"Are your aims truly honest?" she said
As I sat down alongside her bed.
"My aim is quite certain —
So I'll just close this curtain,
Then our aims will be mutual instead."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
His life was cartoonish, replete
With hilarious scenes of defeat.
When he tried to walk tall,
He would meet with a fall
From banana skins left in the street.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Supposedly drawn to a close
Was a threat, but a problem arose
In its wake.  This event,
Called an afterclap, meant
Unexpected and subsequent woes.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
Anomalousness, without doubt,
Is a feature that makes things stand out,
Like a sheep that can type,
Or a cow with a pipe,
Or a girlfriend who's not known to pout.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Her cheeks are aflame with a rosiness
Revealing the shame of her nosiness.
She's seeking to hide
As she's peeking inside
At a couple who snuggle in coziness.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
What makes whiskey from wort? Distillation.
What makes something more dry? Dehydration.
But if acid's your liquid,
The word you'd best stiquid
Is the term that's preferred: concentration.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This gazebo I plan to festoon—
Drape with flowers—beneath the full moon.
There my sweetheart I'll meet,
And I'll kneel at her feet.
When I beg her to wed me, she'll swoon.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In dressage, it would seem to behoove
The equestrian pro to improve.
Half a turn to the right
Or the left in a tight
Little spin is a caracole move.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
From these benchlands, we harvest the vine;
Rocky terrace-grown grapes do just fine.
Helped by mists from the river,
Our vineyards deliver
California's most savory wine.

limerick_list.author: AronKuppersmith
limerick_list.text:
Through the arteries, through every vein,
The heart pumps all the blood they contain.
This biology story,
Known as circulatory,
Maps a network of tubes with no drain.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
An asylee is one who has fled
From his country of birth, full of dread.
Fear of bodily harm
Was a cause for alarm.
Now he's found peace and freedom instead.

limerick_list.author: lopey
limerick_list.text:
I just had an anti-roll bar
Installed on my truck and, so far,
It hasn't been swaying
(I'm on track and staying);
Stability's now above par.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When a girl sighs and swoons, it seems quaint.
We assume we have witnessed a faint
And approach at our leisure.
We doubt it's a seizure,
And we're sure cataplectic it ain't!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Cursorius cursor's a bird
Of the deserts, which cover one-third
Of the Earth. But a lover
Of swift, dashing plover-
Like "waders" says Asia's preferred.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Treating symptoms, not causes, to some,
Is what medicine's sadly become.
Haven't pooped for a while?
Chew on Ex-Lax—and smile!
That's allopathy's style, and it's dumb.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the year fourteen hundred and four,
There were many new worlds to explore,
But I'm sorry to say
That my atlas today
Doesn't show unmapped lands any more.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
They were signed for six albums back when
They were fresh-faced young teens, barely men.
But they split after, actually,
Three.  So, contractually
Obliged, they're together again.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
I hope duty and justice prevail
As we start on this year's campaign trail.
But my vote can be bought
 (If we cannot get caught):
For the right wad of cash, it's for sale.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
When this low daisy cutter comes fast
Off the bat, I don't let it get past.
But my throw to first base
Ends up somewhere in space.
Now I'm goat of the ball game. Dad-blast!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A Jesus freak cried, "I assert
If I Christianize you, you'll convert
And have Christ as your Lord!
So c'mon!  Get on board,
Jews and Buddhists!  Hey, what can it hurt?"

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
Mom took all us kids out for brunch,
And admonished me: "Steve, do not punch
Out your brother like that,
And stop being a brat!"
Then she glowered and gave me a glunch.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
You show no emotion at all:
Never laugh; never rage; never bawl.
Your apathy seizes you;
Lassitude pleases you!
Don't even bother to call!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In this comic, there's Wally, who shirks,
And the pointy-haired boss hiring jerks
To make products that smell,
Don't work well, and won't sell.
In the office from  Hell, Dilbert works.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick and JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
He'd had many a long business meeting,
Fat cigars, too much drinking and eating;
On this solid foundation
His fine corporation
Made his vest-buttons pop from their seating.

limerick_list.author: geniuswaitress
limerick_list.text:
As a counterfeiter, Reginald stank.
All the backs of his bills were just blank.
But forget the reverse;
The front sides were worse:
Beneath President Grant they said "Grank".

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
A dessertspoonful cannot avert
The connection, so sweet, with dessert.
Such a measure of chilli
Provokes, willy-nilly,
A most unexpected alert.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He enlisted a whole entourage
To build a remote hermitage.
With his colleagues and friends,
Who supplied odds and ends,
He constructed a grand bricolage.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
If you want to turn music to dough,
Write a symphony — that you should know.
Your executants then
Will perform it; that's when
You can book a grand hall for the show.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The carpet is threadbare. A path
Has been worn from the door to the hearth.
See the scuttle — admire —
It holds coal for the fire
Which heats water to fill the tin bath.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Dear neighbour, my name is Gilhooley.
I don't want to unnerve you unduly,
But last night you were viewed,
As you danced in the nude,
Through binoculars held by yours truly.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
I was racing my steed round the crescent
When I knocked down a ragged old peasant.
He writhed in the mud,
Then he spat out some blood —
I disdained him as crude and unpleasant!

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
A lawyer can argue all day,
Serving truth like dessert on a tray.
He will take either side
To acclaim or deride,
If a client is willing to pay.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
In their courtlet (small court), Lou drinks beers.
He yells, "Love ya!" out loud. His wife hears.
"Who's that talking, dear, you?
Or the beer?" she asks Lou.
He says, "Me, to th' beer, hun, ah fears."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"What's a davit?" the questioner wrote,
And the Answer Man said (this I quote):
"It's a crane that you'd use,
All alone or in twos,
Good for lifting things onto a boat."

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Though the Prince found himself in the mood, he
Had to go well beyond call of duty:
He refused to critique
The morning-breath reek
He inhaled when he kissed Sleeping Beauty.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
The appliance store fills me with sadness.
All the fridges are built showing fad-ness
With gadgets untold,
But they fail to stay cold.
Thus my frosty review: "Reefer madness."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For Kip's birthday, I bought him a dip net—
A strong, and an easy-to-grip net.
It's for use when he wishes
To scoop up small fishes,
But alas! It is not a non-drip net.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Our town's population has grown,
And its lack of respect is well-known.
Cultural pluralism? No.
Racial tolerance? Low—
And so each of us fends for our own.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
So what if a deadline has passed?
I don't care if I'm finishing last.
If there's work to be done
Or a race to be won,
Am I bovvered? I just can't be arsed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Antiurban fanatics don't like
To reside where you can't ride a bike
Without soon getting brushed
By a taxi, or rushed
Like a steer in a herd down the pike.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Over two meters long they can grow.
These dark fish are fast swimmers.  Please know
Escolar's fatty meat
Is quite oily.  To eat
Is to risk liquid-stool-blasting woe.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
When Trump, the Commander-in-Chief, he
Couldn't sleep and pursued some relief, he
Inscrutably tweeted
A word?  Uncompleted?
The absurd so-called word was covfefe.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
When my son was in first grade, he read
About earth and its structures.  He said,
"I shall be a geologist!"
Wrote his psychologist,
"Michael has rocks in his head."

limerick_list.author: metallel
limerick_list.text:
Your stupidity's truly immense,
And you're not just a little bit dense.
When I ask what you think,
You just nod and then wink,
'Cause you can't even give your two cents.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
A copemate's a person I hope
Will, in partnership, help me to cope.
The thing that I don't
Need is someone who won't,
So I'm sorry my mate's such a dope.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Ann and John don't have sex like before
(At least, not with each other), a sore,
Sorry point of contention.
It's now John's intention
To be celibately carnal once more.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I quickly caught on things looked bad.
People thought me a miserable cad.
Since no wallet was found
On that gal on the ground,
I perceived they all feared I'd gone mad.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
With the fetoscope placed on her bump,
She knew she was "over the hump,"
'Cause it gave her a sign
That the baby was fine,
As its heartbeat went "thump, thump, thump, thump."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Can I not get it through your thick skull?
You're someone I don't want to lull
Into thinking I like you—
Does it not ever strike you
You're truly, earth-shatteringly dull?

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel and JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
My friend Nate's a valet — it's his car fate —
And his clients are often bizarre, mate.
Like Beelzebub, pressed
To arrive as my guest:
"Lord of Flies is the devil in car, Nate."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Yes, I wrote a dark comedy — true —
A satirical take on taboo.
There's a girl on the sauce
'Cause of rape from her boss;
But it's funny, so give it a view.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
When you write about radio, you
Will use frequency frequently. Do
You like saving a letter
Or two? Even better:
Waive seven, by typing fq.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A dictionary's often a tome
Where the zebu and fennec both roam,
But the former's "an ox,"
And the latter's "a fox"—
It's a place definitions call home.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
He's wont to bisexual licks;
Renowned for high sexual kicks.
His sex antics are rife,
Adding spice to his life—
So he roams a wide range with his tricks.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
An emergency? Only one choice:
No IM'ing or pictures, just voice.
9-1-1 would be nice
Placed from any device,
SOS from a fridge or Rolls Royce?

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Was the slav's Glagolitic so kooky,
Acrophonically named from az, buki?
You should learn from your betters
When naming your letters:
What comes after "R" should be Spooky.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Been fishing for herring? Oh, man,
What a catch! Let me tell you my plan:
Try this out; it is great—
Measures volume, not weight—
It holds forty-five gallons, a cran.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Luscious Lulu has choices galore:
Deevy dandies just flock to her door.
Which divine one to choose
With such charms to peruse?
It's the tryouts that doll's drooling for.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Want control of a pest population?
Try autocide; that's propagation
Of males that are sterile.
By this, you imperil
The stock; no more multiplication.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When a coal seam abruptly thins out,
Local miners are saddled with doubt.
So they gather to talk
About whether this balk
Shows that Newcastle's losing its clout.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said the author, "You stink as an actor.
My play flopped. Was your acting a factor?"
I informed my interrogator:
"You're a dastardly derogator,
Defamer, and carping detractor!"

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
Do you long for a strong constitution?
Does your belly need redistribution?
Here's some water — don't spill it.
Now dissolve my pink pill — it
Will become the most perfect solution!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The word coming next? It's emotive.
Of feelings it's clearly denotive,
Like a  love song you sing
Or a big diamond ring
That will lead to a rite that is votive.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In the '70s, I can recall
How America started out small.
Then "A Horse with No Name"
Shot this pop group to fame,
Though the lyrics made no sense at all.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
"I love you," she said. Her caress
Removed all ambiguousness.
Those words might have meant
Quite a range of intent.
(Their use can require finesse.)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The U.N. wants us all to agree
Worldwide issues require that we
Must address them together,
Like curbing hot weather,
But it's all globaloney to me.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Saint Christopher (shortened form Chris)
In legend, it's said, once did this—
Was "Christ-bearer." It's true!
Some believe (quite a few)
To forget him would be quite remiss.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
About it, my friends, make no bones:
I'm possessed of some serious stones.
And my daringness shows
When I'm dipping my toes
Into uncharted bathwater zones.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
It might be that Saturn or Mars,
As they wandered about through the stars,
Froze his limbs with a blow.
Astrobolism, you know,
Blasts the muscles of beggars and czars.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Frit means "frightened" in slang. Also, it's
Fired silicate, ground into bits,
Which was first fused with fluxes,
For glazes. The crux is
Make sure, Fritz, your frit meaning fits.

limerick_list.author: Doug Smeath
limerick_list.text:
The accompanable woman said, "Hey,
If you'd like, we can party all day.
I can be your new pal —
I'm a sociable gal!
For me, life's no work and all play."

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Neath this stone, oh my fellow-men, lies all
My earthly part, in a comprisal
Of all that could die,
While my soul soars on high —
Which I somehow don't think that you guys'll.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
Ahasuerus, the husband of Esther,
Was a king no one else dared to pester
For fear of their life.
But his beautiful wife
Dared to plead for her kin, and God blessed her.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
There are clues a foe gladly employs
When your tech emits radio noise.
Leaking ELINT at length
Reveals actions and strength,
Letting enemies target your boys.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
Pride and Prejudice won her acclaim,
Not only because of its name.
Jane Austen was first
To write books with a burst
Of true wit making romance a game.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"I'll be caught spouting yammers and yelps
When I'm addled," said Addison Phelps.
"And I don't give a fig
If you ken, or can dig…"
(You don't have to be mad, but it helps.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a soft, gauzy fabric, quite sheer,
Known as gossamer. Wear a brassiere
If your blouse is so made
Since without, I'm afraid,
At your boobies the men will all leer.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
When gases explode with ferocity,
The result may be quite a monstrosity.
There's research, so we read,
That can tell us the speed
Of the wave front — the CJ velocity.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There's the nicest of uncles in Nice
Who enjoys finding rocks by caprice.
When he chances on slices
Of granites and gneisses,
He sends all his nieces a piece.

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
It was named for a ruler of Rome,
Though now Turkish in soul, mosque and dome.
In Constantinople
The purchase of dope'll
Be easier far than at home.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Our lookout, a bosun named Norm,
Saw rough seas that were angry and warm.
Said the captain, "I fear
That a hurricane's near,
Steer away from the eye of the storm."

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
If consumption you seek, then you might
Be enticed by a tasty delight:
Here's a creamy home brew
And a meaty beef stew,
Grandma's best—let your senses ignite.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The figurines lining each wall
Show celebrities, fragile and small.
But that moon-faced Jack Benny-thing
Doesn't look anything
Like B. Kubelsky at all.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Cassatt's finest painting could, say, be
Her Girl in an Armchair, or maybe
Some "Mother and Child"
Impressionist-styled
Interior scene with a baby.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
As his wife can attest, for she's seen,
In the morning, he's cloddish and mean.
He can't open his eyes
And he's surly to rise
Till he's had his first dose of caffeine.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
From his home on a Mirzapur pond, he
Portaged his boat and took Gandhi
Down river to pray
On the Ganges one day.
"Did he tip me? Yes, twice," said the dandi.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
What a wonderful, sweet backroom deal!
Our clandestine agreement's a steal:
While it gives you big bucks,
For my rival it sucks —
It's a pact we can never reveal.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh and Workshop
limerick_list.text:
An issue complex is abortion;
It's divisive...that's not a distortion.
It's pregnancy's end,
And let's not pretend —
It's a subject that many and more shun.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
Try my wonderful miracle cure!
It's organic! All-natural! Pure!
Oh, pure hokum, you scoff?
(Ha, I'll still fob it off
On some fools and make bank, that's for sure!)

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
In today's world it's rather unwise
To assume you can tell truth from lies,
Since there's frequent intent
To mislead and invent
By the men who, to sell, advertise.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The First Lady, in Washington lore,
In a shipwreck we shouldn't ignore.
Claim the harbor police,
If she's greatly obese,
She could FLOTUS all safely to shore.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"At the Halloween bash," Jodie wrote,
"Moe resembled a randy old goat,
And he had us in stitches
With his tight-fitting britches
And old-fashioned cutaway coat!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Dawn cuts grease; it's as simple as that.
Wash your dishes in ten minutes flat,
Leaving more time for fun.
How's this miracle done?
Grease dissolves when you break down the fat.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Martian features?  I'm hard to convince
That Cydonia is sculpted,  but since
It includes the odd shape,
Not quite human or ape,
Are you sure that it isn't a quince?

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
My chapbook is tiny and wee;
A bookish chap sold it to me.
My thighs I doth slap
At its verses and crap—
Like this limerick, good chap. Tee-hee-hee!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Achromatolysis—Tom knew it well,
As he would. You see, Tommy's a cell.
"My achromatin parts
Have dissolved. Man, that smarts!
Now my life's gone directly to hell."

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The booze on his breath makes him stink.
(Later on, from his fumblings she'll shrink.)
"Yeah, the wife dropped me here,"
He said, supping his beer.
"Only fair, 'cause she drives me to drink."

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
An alien came to her door.
"In search of new worlds to explore?"
She asked the strange creature.
It tried to beseech her
For Hallowe'en treats she'd in store.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
My shrink said my mem'ry had shrunk
Due to bonking my head on my bunk.
When it switched to "erase,"
I had lost every trace—
Every thought that I ever had thunk.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Dactylitis, as everyone knows,
Is not permanent: pain comes and goes.
You'll seek treatment, I trust,
Even though it is just
Inflammation of fingers or toes.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"It's when Lucy is seen in the sky
That 'a girl with colitis goes by.'
The song warns, I suppose,
Of intestinal woes."
"Clean your ears" is my helpful reply.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
What is Erlang? I'm glad that you asked.
It's a language, computer, that's tasked
With massively scalable,
Job-never-failable
Systems: its nature's unmasked.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
A jest you may guess in a trice:
What, unheard and unseen, smells of mice?
Silent toots (SBDs)
From sweet Puss scent the breeze.
Once called fizzles, close farts still aren't nice.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
In the sky, Earth's celestial pole
Is the point 'round which stars always stroll.
Polaris you know
In the north, but below
There's no southern pole star to extoll.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
The castellan found it a hassle
To supervise running the castle.
He leapt from the turret,
Creating a stir. It
Was said that he flattened a vassal.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I noticed with utmost dismay
That attendance was poor at my play.
All the critics opine
That my writing's divine,
But the public refuses to pay.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When Rudy goes out in his sloop,
He will sometimes invite a whole group;
And they're off for the day
On a sail 'cross the bay.
When the wind goes away, the sails droop.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Listing points that I thought needed mention,
I'd made slides for the Bobsled Convention.
But the overhead's focus
Twists words, hocus-pocus —
Distorts them beyond comprehension.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For some folks the law has attraction,
And they're likely to take civil action.
At the smallest offense
They will seek recompense;
Your expense will provide satisfaction.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
If you're harvesting cotton, then you'll
Need the help of the small cotton mule.
They will bear on their backs
The picked cotton, in sacks,
Standing fourteen hands high, as a rule.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
A basketball star, he shared gold.
By the NBA, then he was told
Of his Top 50 ranking—
Fans still aren't done thanking
Sir Charles, a delight to behold.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
"The cultural content is sparse,"
Wrote the critic. "It lacks any class.
The play's set in a school
Where kids break every rule —
Quite ridiculous. Rather a farce."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We'll be plucking that crown-beard this week—
Not King George's (that fussy antique),
But those aster-like blooms
Which should brighten our rooms.
They're intruders with overmuch cheek.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Once the editing process began,
We worked smoothly for months, as one man.
With this final deletion,
It's reached a concretion.
Our film's solid, complete—in the can.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When the gas gauge reads "F" one assumes
That no threat of a gas shortage looms,
But my hard-up friend Jeff
Says, "Not so! That's low F.
We are running completely on fumes."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Let's beat swords into plowshares.  No more
Will our nations be training for war."
Now we've unforeseen woes,
'Cause we're plowing for those
Who signed peace pacts they chose to ignore.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Top banana, plum job, loads of loot.
Go, man go. You're in business, astute.
You're no lemon, old bean.
Cherry ripe, peachy keen!
Dressed up beaut in your cute bag of fruit.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
There was a young lass from Caerphilly,
Whose thoughts were decidedly silly.
She was well out of wit, see;
You may say she was ditsy
And a scatterbrained blonde silly billy.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
When a one-armed man served as my waiter,
I inquired, "Who was your amputator?
 The cut's clean through the bones;
 Did you see Doctor Jones?"
He said, "No, I was caught by a gator."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
While you're sleeping at night, you may dream,
And no matter how odd they may seem,
Or how creepy they feel,
Dreams seem perfectly real
Till you wake yourself up with a scream.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
He was viewed as a bastard by some —
And this candidate came off as dumb.
But he said, "From that crowd
There's no questions allowed;
I will brook no debate from that scum!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In search of a happier life,
A carver selected a knife,
Cut a tenderloin roast,
Poured the wine, made a toast,
Then proceeded to slice up his wife.

limerick_list.author: Blind Pig
limerick_list.text:
If you happen to journey through adland,
No doubt you'll soon see it's a badland.
There liars hold sway
And hype rules the day,
And Truth's fled away from that mad land.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
At the sausage works, grinders were fed
A mechanic who'd keeled over dead.
I said to a crony,
"That's wrong!  That's baloney!"
"What's the wurst that could happen?" he said.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I'm Mohammed of MoProducts Co.
Brother Noah owns  NoProducts Co.
Brother Colin's no dunce —
Makes two products at once,
As sole owner of Coproducts Co.

limerick_list.author: BobfromThirsk
limerick_list.text:
"He'll never eat that!" muttered Sid,
So we watched him, and blimey—he did.
His cake-hole could match
Any coal-loading hatch,
And his tongue's like a wheelie bin lid.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"It's all right for you, on the hoof!
But your bridge is, quite frankly, my roof.
And I've had quite enough!"
"A good point!" said young Gruff
To the troll, "Dat's fair comment, in troof."

limerick_list.author: Beverley Sharp
limerick_list.text:
As I took a long leap off the pier,
The danger at once became clear.
All the sharks had their bibs on;
Said one:  "I've got dibs on
His drumsticks—now open that beer!"

limerick_list.author: BobfromThirsk
limerick_list.text:
"They must go!" said Lord Gray, then he spat—
"So make Cochrane the first, and that's that;
Who will do us the deed?"
"Me," said Angus, with speed.
"Well then, Archibald, go bell the cat."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Certain whales are some barnacles' base,
A convenience the beasts grant with grace.
Why not even a toast
To the generous host?
Epibionts take nothing but space.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
The contributors scribble and write,
And the editors squabble and fight,
And the stuff we produce
Becomes tidy and spruce —
The OEDILFian Way's a delight.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
They calibrate watches, these guys.
Then they wait for the runners to rise
And take off at the crack
Of the gun down the track.
They're the souls who are timing men's tries.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The performers are marionettes
On their undersized, colorful sets—
Fantoccini, on strings,
Doing spellbinding things—
Entrechats and well-turned pirouettes.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
This prison is dismal and dank,
And I've got my accomplice to thank.
Ratted out by that fink,
I got thrown in the clink,
Where the chains of the leg-irons clank.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For the potluck at church, what I drew—
A fondue au fromage—left me blue.
Edam, cheddar, or brie:
Any two, or all three?
Can you tell me what cheeses would do?

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
My associate, where can he be?
I'm afraid he reneged on my fee.
He was seen on my yacht.
Now the cops fear he's got
"Bathymetrically challenged" at sea.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Now my wife is expecting, I've got
A long list that begins baby's cot
And ends, if you please:
University fees.
Seems I'll have to fork out for the lot!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This machine has controlled respiration,
But it's causing the patient frustration.
Since he's breathing quite well
On his own—what the hell—
Now's the time to attempt extubation.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A forest park ranger named Uma
Battled agrizoophobia in Yuma.
She is fearful no more
Of wild animals, for
She was eaten last week by a puma.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Thomas Adams declared, "I confess
My experiments cause me distress.
I only aspire
To make a new tire,
But chewing gum?  What a success!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The Guinea worm under your skin
May come up through a hole in your shin,
And it's not a homunculus,
But a worm called Dracunculus
That causes enduring chagrin.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Anisomastia's trouble for Helen.
Where it came from, there's no way of tellin'.
If you look at her chest,
There's one apple-sized breast,
But the other's as big as a melon.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
On the one hand, a fruit, when it's blet,
Is overripe inside, and yet
The process called bletting
Is purposely letting
The fruit by light frost be beset.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Let us sing this in notes contrapuntal:
When your view of a pig is full-frontal,
So it's tail's in the rear
And its tusks much too clear,
The part where they grow is its gruntle.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The fertility goddess, Demeter,
Or Ceres—I bow when I greet her.
Thanks to her, my crops flourished,
And my children were nourished.
No goddess is neater—can't beat her!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An athletic supporter is not
In the stands and applauding each shot
As the cheerleaders call
For protecting the ball.
It's a genital holder, that's what.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
I invested some cash in a plane
But the business went straight down the drain.
I bailed out very fast
But that bailout's my last,
As I'll never try flying again.

limerick_list.author: Mr E S
limerick_list.text:
Said a Yank to a Brit, "Is it true
That a Dürer we have here in view?"
Said the Brit, "Were it real,
'Twould be dearer, I feel."
Shrugged the Yankee, "And costlier too."

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Abmigration's a wintertime drake's
Change of flock, when his own he forsakes
For some breeding grounds new,
Where his springtime debut
Makes a mum of each duck that he takes.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
With my chronograph, time's what I measure.
Its exacting precision's a pleasure,
And the intervals reckoned
In parts of a second
Are temporal 'ticks' that I treasure.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Although funding was really a fight,
Now, for people of limited sight,
I have woven a maze
That got plaudits and praise:
"A contextural den of delight."

limerick_list.author: L V Gray
limerick_list.text:
The young woman informed the librarian,
"In another two weeks I'll be marryin'.
Got a book that'll say
How to cook birds of prey?
'Cause my beau says he's eagle-itarian."

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
There is one common ancestor shared
By all species on earth. When compared,
They distinctly endorse
The idea of one source,
Although only a few have been spared.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Young Jack's a poor sailor.  I'll grant he
Can sing a respectable chantey,
But he scarce has a spine
And he can't splice a line
And his hygiene is scanter than scanty.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
"I will donate some plasma," said Mel,
"It'll help some poor soul to get well.
I'm in jail for a crime
But while donating I'm
Extracellular: outside the cell."

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
Afropop's not a cola Ebola,
Like a soda consumed in Angola.
It's pop music they play
In an African way.
It's heard worldwide. Now where's my payola?

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A bikini store mannequin said,
"I'm embarrassed 'cause business is dead.
Drastic price drops — we got 'em.
What's more, since the bottom
Fell out, my face blushes bright red."

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Come play curling, and slide on the ice.
Throw a stone, not just once — you throw twice —
In a team of just four.
Want to make a good score?
Leaving rocks in the cock will suffice.

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
My wife likes a book that's a gripper,
That some would describe as a ripper:
The bodice gets ripped,
As the heroine's stripped —
Though she usually isn't a stripper.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
An electrical outlet is where
You can shock all your friends with this dare:
Stick a fork in, or tweezers
(Both tools are crowd pleasers),
Then zzzzzzt! It will straighten your hair!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Feminazi's a term many use
To express antifeminist views.
These Neanderthal jerks
With their simpering smirks
Are like chimps I see scratching in zoos.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
When our chances of winning are slender,
Practicalities trump any splendour.
When our hope is forlorn,
Dutch defence is reborn:
We pretend to defend, then surrender.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The big hat's always present, of course,
And the "Code of the West" he'd enforce
(So he says), but it's true
Drugstore cowboys like Lou
Never come within miles of a horse.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
At the dosshouse, when asked, "Who's the boss man?"
A young lodger said, "I'm at a loss, man!
Do you mean 'Who's in charge?'
Well, the housekeeper's Marge.
At this doss-house, a woman's the doss-man."

limerick_list.author: Robert Schechter
limerick_list.text:
When I pause to consider my brain,
Paradoxically that puts a strain
On the brain that I pause to
Consider, because to
Consider things causes it pain.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
It's not used in just any old room;
I paid serious bucks for this broom.
It can generate heat
When it's scrubbed on a sheet
Of glare ice — helping curling rocks zoom!

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
The paraffin figures, in stacks,
And the props in their crates, stored on racks,
Wouldn't sell one by one,
Though the sale had begun,
So one price bought the whole ball of wax.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A theory that's now obsolete
Called caloric the substance of heat.
Cold was fluid, "frigoric,"
Devoid of caloric.
Not germane to the junk food we eat.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Cytochemistry's very complex,"
Said that hunky professor called Rex.
"Many compounds will function
Through pairing—conjunction."
I thought, "Must he talk about sex?"

limerick_list.author: Caterwaul
limerick_list.text:
There once was an old man from Lima
Who visited fair Ipanema.
When The Girl started walking,
The old man was gawking
And breathing as with emphysema.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
They're the folks who reside on estates:
Lavish manors, long driveways, large gates.
Country gentlemen seem
To be living a dream
That, for people in penury, grates.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
Foreign policy in the U.S.
Has caused many a nation distress.
Disguised as democracy,
The height of hypocrisy—
It's empire building, no less.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Common drongo shouts "Raptor! Gendarme!"
And may save other critters from harm.
But he's also a liar
Who yells "Mongoose!" or "Fire!"
To steal food after faking alarm.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My surgeon's the best that they've got.
Self-assurance? He's got quite a lot.
Though he's said, "It's no perjury:
I could do your brain surgery
Blindfolded," (Jeez, I hope not!)

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Carcassonne is an ancient walled city
That the French had rebuilt to look pretty.
A real joy to explore,
But for me, so much more:
It's a game that I play without pity.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Since John Muggleton married this dame,
A Miss Spoffin, they both share the blame:
Double-barrelled, I'm stuck
With their folly — tough luck!
(Z. Q. Muggleton-Spoffin's my name.)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My stock market venture was lame,
And no winnings, alas, could I claim.
Turkey futures I tried,
But success was denied;
I could not get ahead of the game.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
These are my words I've written so, please,
Should a publisher say she agrees
To put them in print,
Then, I'd urge her, don't stint
When paying my copyright fees.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
