Certain creatures with tropical status
May be found round a coral bed lattice.
Near a shore, you might say,
"Did I just see a ray?"
What you saw was a big Aetobatus!

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
The taste of her lips? Like a pear.
Love the smell of her freshly washed hair.
And the sight of her lingers
Like the touch of her fingers.
Though when hearing her voice, I despair.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I have seen your colation location—
The Municipal Filtering Station,
And your water's first rate!
After touring I ate,
At its lunchroom, a luscious collation.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
His rebuff has just stuck in my mind,
And I can't seem to put it behind
Me. My wife says I'm nuts,
With no if's, and's, or but's,
Thinks I'm looking for axes to grind.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
This beats all that I ever have seen!
On this scale you can see what I mean:
Your blood alcohol count
Shows what crazy amount
You've knocked back — and you're barely thirteen!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
See those tiny straight lines that don't taper?
They're called burelage, there on the paper
That's used to make stamps.
Forgers' ardor it cramps,
And makes toilsome their criminal caper.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Steve eagerly ran to the kitchen.
Full of vigor, he said: "Let me pitch in."
But when leftover food was
All eaten, his mood was
Less helpful. He loitered there, bitchin'.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We've been too long denied and deprived;
We'll unseat those already arrived,
Who of late have been slipping,
Their images chipping—
And we lurk, expectations revived.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
By Round 10, Danny's cut like the dickens,
And the thought of more punishment sickens.
Yet his corner man, wearing
Full blackface, is swearing:
"Ain't nobody here but us chickens!"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Is fustic a name for a tree?
Over time, it's been given to three.
From pistachio it passed
To the sumach, and last
Dyer's mulberry (yellow's the key).

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
When you named it, I stifled a yelp:
"Mermaid's bladder? That's edible kelp!
I never ate nary
A bit of a fairy
Or sea-maid. It's seaweed, you whelp."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
That's my boyfriend in room 23.
True, he's 50 years older than me,
But he's so nice to care for,
So what's he need hair for?
Just look—he's as cute as can be!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The bare-throated bellbird is loud
With a call that stands out in a crowd:
Like an anvil that's hit
Or a bell. I submit
If you're standing too close, you'll be cowed.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Biorhythms react to the light
Of the day and the dark of the night.
They're controlling our drives
And affecting our lives—
All the time, out of mind, out of sight.

limerick_list.author: woodfostersmith
limerick_list.text:
I am crewing my clipper, the Demon,
And your seamanship skills I'm esteemin'.
You're good enough, mate,
To be paid able rate,
Fitting wage for a fine able seaman!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The oil from East Indian trees
Called chaulmoogras once treated disease
Of the skin.  It's still used
If one's sprained or is bruised
Or has sores, so discomfort will ease.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
All mixed up, in a knot.
         And a limerick that's mortally mangled.
I'm ensnared, they're ensnarled, we're entangled.
      My lines are criss-crossed, poorly angled,
                What a mare's-nest we've got,

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The leader of France is no fool.
In Andorra, he's sharing joint rule
With a bishop from Spain.
There's a name for their reign:
Condominium (rule, but no pool).

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
The casque has no visor, it seems,
So the knight's face shows clearly. She dreams
He rides quickly away
To the sunset and day
Becomes night. On his helmet, moon gleams.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Says a soldier from York named McKenny:
"In the Falklands, a local's a 'benny.'
They're thick and they're slow,
Second rate, don't you know,
And I hear they have tails and antennae."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In writing, the act of creation
Is often just mere transformation.
If this limerick, say,
Were turned into a play,
That would make for a strange adaptation!

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
You're ecaudate. The word makes you quail?
That just means you're without any tail.
Though in your case I'd guess,
Since you lack all finesse,
It just might mean with women you fail.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A vain, egotistical bloke
Tried, through newspaper ads, to convoke
An uproarious crowd
Who would cheer him out loud
And would bellow "AMEN!" when he spoke.

limerick_list.author: saranita
limerick_list.text:
Oh, how versatile, bone ash! (My stash
Comes from cattle bones burned in a flash.)
In ceramics, for scours,
To fertilize flowers—
Don't toss out those bones in the trash!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In a  feverish, nervous condition,
I observed a most foul apparition
In the shape of a bantam:
A shadowy fantom
In the ghostly small poultry tradition.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's a chamber, a burial spot,
That is more like a crypt than a plot.
Guess I'll add the cubiculum
To our Roman curriculum,
Where catacomb study is hot.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
When tobacco leaves yellow or curl,
Or grow long but refuse to unfurl,
You've got frenching about.
But I can't figure out
The resemblance to kissing your girl.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
The culotte (as in one) is a pair,
Or culottes are some ready to wear.
Cut to seem like a skirt,
But quite clever and pert,
These are trousers she flaunts with a flair.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Is the firm in the red or the black?
There's a chief (CFO) keeping track.
If this officer naps
And financial collapse
Is the upshot, he'll slip out the back.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As we age, we increase our verbosity.
Adding weight, we achieve adiposity.
As our hair turns to white,
We lose hearing and sight.
All these changes are caused by annosity.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A baby was left on my doorstep;
The adoption procedure is four-step.
Although left at my door,
She is homeless no more.
She'll be mine after just this one more step.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My waiter is one of those guys
Who serves up such a sight to these eyes.
Now I learn that this beaut,
Who's deliciously cute,
Isn't gay, and a part of me dies.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
I like bathing inside when it's cold,
But in summer I often feel bold.
A good soak in the sun
Can make washing more fun—
Though my neighbors are not really sold.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When the play begins, that is, at rise,
Those attending are rubbing their eyes.
Though it's called Rated G,
They're astounded to see
All the actors are naked. Surprise!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
We all have our ups and our downs,
So we alternate smiles with our frowns,
Like the 3-D cross-section
Of paper-protection —
Corrugated, in whites and in browns.

limerick_list.author: Bit and neilski
limerick_list.text:
King Richard the Third would lament:
"Cut my speech, and you misrepresent
What I said. What a bummer
To leave out the summer
That thaws our forlorn discontent!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My wife is the bellyaching kind.
To her constant complaints I'm resigned.
Like, "Your breath's awful smelly;
Its scent's muscatel-y.
Your wine palate's so unrefined!"

limerick_list.author: Ulfras
limerick_list.text:
Pretty rosebuds are nice in a spray,
Or singly, or as a bouquet.
But since life is so short,
I must loudly exhort:
Gather armfuls of these, as ye may!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
You know one thing that makes my heart sing?
Tiny toadstools that grow in a ring!
It's their fairylike quality
Fills me with jollity.
Look! There's a filigree wing ...

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Four chums went out walking: Amelia,
Cornelia, Celia and Delia.
Imagine their joy,
On befriending a boy,
To discover his name was Ophelia!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
See how Audubon shows us the oriole
In its habitat, chiefly arboreal?
A description in words
Would be crap—for the birds—
When compared to his way that's pictorial.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
My girl's parents suspected a plot;
Other candidates, surely, they'd got,
So they did not rejoice
Over me as first-choice
Future son-in-law: Never! No!! Not!!!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My swain's a farceur: he's a wag.
Of his many bon mots he will brag.
But my father looks down
On the guy. "He's a clown,
And his jokes," says my dad, "make me gag."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Can a nightmare at times be an omen?
Ask Shakespeare's unfortunate Roman.
Did his wife's dream foretoken
His death? She had spoken,
But daggers rent Caesar's abdomen.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
No doubt that I oughta have bought
A trout, like I sought to have caught.
Had I gone to the store,
I'd have paid slightly more,
But I wouldn'a become so distraught.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An anchor store, set in a mall,
Is often the largest of all.
Mall management's plan?
You'll shop Bloomingdale's an'
Then the others, no matter how small.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
He's an eloquent charmer, that's true.
Longwinded?  Why, yes, that's true too.
His sly words? Oily, gracious.
He's a tricky, fallacious,
Fallaciloquent speaker — like you.

limerick_list.author: Kirk Zurell
limerick_list.text:
The acclaimed supermodel had class,
So I acted aloof in my pass.
Since her full bee-stung lips
Were supplied from her hips,
Well, I still wound up kissing her ass.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There are stores and events. "Use your brains!
It's a riddle," my teacher explains.
Mountains, evidence, plus
Twenty cons on a bus.
What unites them? They all come in ______.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Corticium fungi include
Many species that ravage our food,
Like potatoes and lettuce,
Which doesn't upset us,
But coffee? That's serious, dude!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Adusted means "dried up with heat,"
Like a sunblasted slab of concrete.
Without shade, you'll be torched
And your skin could get scorched
To the point where you're red as a beet.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Although horses will never say nay,
Once they've galloped ten miles, that's their day.
Overstressed, they are blown,
And it's clearly been shown
That they'll run till they drop; that's their way.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Three brown bears quit their cottage to forage
(That's "find food") during coolage of porridge.
But then Goldilocks, cruel,
Gobbled baby bear's gruel,
Sneaking in through their unsecured gorage.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
Your PC (and I don't want to harp)
Is, I'm sorry to say, not too sharp:
To locate your friends' Macs
Takes some smarts that it lacks
On its own, so it needs to use ARP.

limerick_list.author: Nitelaf
limerick_list.text:
You went crashing  head-first through the tent?!
That simply was not what I meant
When in passing I said
That the shape of your head
Had an aerodynamical bent.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I am looking for love at first sight
With a blonde who has teeth dazzling white,
And is scantily clad."
For my personal ad,
This description sounds just about right.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Cereal kick-starts the day;
It prepares you for work and for play.
Wheat, oat flakes and bran
For the regular man
Will help keep the snacking at bay.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Custer said to his missus, "My dear,
Little Bighorn awaits; have no fear.
I'll bring back—when we win—
Sitting Bull's painted skin.
It will sure make a swell Sioux veneer."

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Playing cricket, those girls are no use.
Rows of zeros, like duck eggs profuse,
Are their scores. Dash! Aw, shucks!
Though they're all out for ducks,
I would love to go out for a goose.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
I don't vote for the left or the right.
I've no time for bipartisan fight.
I'm not hypocritical,
Just apolitical.
Lib Dems? Well I guess that I might.

limerick_list.author: Rose Nunez
limerick_list.text:
Our CEO's new acquisition
Was purchased against its volition:
His corporate raiders
Were ruthless invaders
Who tendered it into submission.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
She beams by the gate as she greets
Her fresh order of snacky-type eats.
Plates and dishes heaped high
Will entice every eye.
Be on time for the party food treats.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
AGI will determine how much
Of your income is free to the touch
Of the Feds.  I'm disgusted
Because my adjusted
Gross income has got me in Dutch.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Conservation of energy means
That we never will teach our machines
To do work without need
Of an input of feed,
Such as sunlight, or oil, or some beans.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Canine species I've spied guarding docks
Stands waist-high (so might frighten a fox).
Plastic scarecrow coyotes
Creep out boaters and boaties,
But the seabirds still land there in flocks.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
The waiter made quite an assumption.
I think it was quite a presumption.
It's just as I'd feared:
My plate has been cleared.
He sure had a whole lot of gumption!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Say it "FET-id" or say the word "FEET-id",
When you stink, with a retch you'll be greeted.
Folks will close up their noses
At the smell, one supposes;
Don't fart near the place where they're seated.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Jack can play the piano by ear."
"That sounds awkward as heck, really queer!
So which ear: right or left?"
"He's of hands not bereft!
He can play any tune he can hear."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Here's the story of Queenie O'Toole,
Badly treated by men, as a rule:
Seems a billiards shark cheated,
And Queenie's defeated,
Depleted of cash—dirty pool!

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
My wife wants our landscape un-bouldered,
So guess where that burden was shouldered?
I lifted one stone out;
My back was then thrown out—
A rocky two weeks while I smoldered.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"I've got cypridophobia, see?
Morbid fear of contracting VD.
Who needs screwing?" she said,
"We can cuddle instead
And just talk of our dreams."  Lucky me.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
On trash day, we're always on guard:
Knowing what to recycle is hard.
Though we're sure of the bin
That each plastic goes in,
We've no clue what is safe to discard.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
Ever since he began in his teens,
Dear old Dad's worn the tightest of jeans,
So his thundering farts
Leave no room for his parts
And he (BOOM!) nearly blows off his beans.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Are you impotent, can't make your thing go?
Try sea holly candied—eryngo.
Eat roots of this thistle,
And soon your hot kiss'll
Make missy undress, and then... bingo!

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
From Montmartre that chill winter's night,
I beheld a most magical sight:
The cityscape's gleam,
Like a fairy-tale dream—
All of Paris, the City of Light.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn and David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
While two men were out walking abreast,
They debated whose torso looked best.
Said Arnold, "It's mine!"
Leading Tarzan to whine,
"No, it's mine!" and start thumping his chest.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Armoured chlamyphores put up with hair,
But they'd tear it all out in despair
If they knew half the ways
People name them these days.
Armoured 'dillos like folks to be fair.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"The capital city of Texas."
"What's Austin?"  The clue doesn't vex us.
If we'd said: "What is Alice,"
Or "Houston," or "Dallas,"
From the Jeopardy squad would you x us?

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
There's a sea trout that's called arctic char
Which is found only out in the far
And the northernmost seas,
Although some, if you please,
Live in landlocked Quebec — how bizarre.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
It is true these draconian laws
Are severe on all crimes such as yours.
Your offense may be minor;
That's tough, me old china.
Your head's coming off early doors.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Certain therapies draw patients out,
And for demons go questing about—
For results abreactive,
Hard-won and attractive—
Cathartic, they feel, beyond doubt.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In a face-up position, you're lying
With your face facing up. (I'm supplying
This clear definition
With an honest admission:
I wrote it without hardly trying.)

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Near the kidneys (ad renes), a gland
Takes, in stress-situations, command.
What adreno- (adren-),
As a prefix, might mean
You will therefrom, I hope, understand.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
There are hot dogs and tacos  and fries,
And there's pizza, fried chicken, and pies.
Doughnuts, pitas, and chips
All add girth to one's hips
So, then, fast food: avoid it. Be wise.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
When a thing has serrations, and then
These serrations are serrate again,
It's biserrate, in brief.
You might find that a leaf
Or a saw has this feature. Amen.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
A boom can mean good times, when things
Economically rise, and it brings
Welcome riches and wealth.
Boom is bad when mad stealth
Bombers strike out with modern-day slings.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev and SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I think I will croak! My throat's sore!
There's a froggy in there, and what's more,
He has stolen my voice,
So I croak! I've no choice!
I will choke 'til I croak on the floor.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
An illusory sense of wellbeing
Whose name (through assumptions agreeing
With states rather sweet)
Is fool's paradise—neat.
But sweet outcomes I'm not guaranteeing.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Chinese silk plant? Remember one thing:
It is much less like silk, than like string.
Named Boehmeria nivea,
It's (here is more trivia)
Nettle-like, yes, but no sting.

limerick_list.author: Damian Hey
limerick_list.text:
The French Marxist Louis Althusser
(A philosopher extraordinaire)
Said that interpellations
Form subjects and nations
When a culture calls out "Hey, you there!"

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
You'll be cooped up, constrained and encaged,
Restricted and elsewise enraged.
You are so hot to marry,
But so damn unwary.
Congrats, boy, you're getting engaged!

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
On TV was the place they found fame,
Though we note, they don't share the same name.
But I know you won't quibble,
Thwarting Hall, and then Dibble,
We find Bilko and Top Cat the same.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
They've livestock and thrill rides to spare,
But the foodstands were keeping me there:
From the sauteed papaya
To a fried jambalaya.
All manner of fare's at the fair.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Why I'm working this petered-out pit
I can't say. I'm a fool, I'll admit.
Not much color's about;
If the footwall gives out,
I'm a goner. Perhaps I should quit.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
All the candidates had a debate,
In a specified place, on this date,
While two-thirds of the nation
Watched their loud contestation.
Who best steers today's ship of state?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Of choking, I'm deathly afraid,
So the meat that I eat is filleted.
Since the haddock is bony,
I'll order calzone
With fish, but then have it puréed.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The faithful rendition depicts
A reversal, with colorful tricks;
When development halts,
Disappearing assaults
Give a negative, tendered by blix.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
There's no margin or room to suspect
A mistake with a cut that's direct.
Though you've said, "How d'ye do?"
He just glares and looks through
You. Your friendship is certainly wrecked.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
"Build a mousetrap that's better," Ralph said
(Did he mean one that fills mice with lead?),
"And you'll find, the world o'er,
That a path to your door
Will be beaten by folk spending bread."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In London, a man from Siam
Learned English while riding a tram
And practiced "to be"s
Asking "Who's Siamese?"
"He isn't, you aren't, I am."

limerick_list.author: lopey
limerick_list.text:
On the midway, you're eager to ride,
But the carny is rude—even snide.
Flash your old Annie Oakley.
He'll then say, "Okely dokely,
Your admission is free. Step inside."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We want damask, not chintz, and not crepe,
To replace our old drapes. I'm agape
When proprietors ask us
To shop in Damascus,
And my wife? She gets bent out of shape.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A young ballerina from France
Liked to gambol and gamble and dance:
She would bet on roulette
While on pointe, pirouette,
And, when lucky, would leap at the chance.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Of electoral systems, the most
Problematic is first-past-the-post.
Get a single vote more
Than the others, and you're
Declared winner: a dubious boast.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Dei judicium: this, my dear friend,
Is an ordeal that may mean your end.
But have faith that God's planned
To guide your striking hand,
Since on His tender grace you depend.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Horseback hunting horn playing's a gas!
It hangs down from my shoulder.  It's brass.
When I yell "Tally ho!"
I blow fanfares, and lo,
Foxes run from my loud cor de chasse.

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
A man who walked into a bar
Was then stuck there—he couldn't get far.
His magnetic attraction
Induced his inaction—
As bar magnets go, he's a star.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Oystercatchers: To them we'd entrusted
Oyster care, but they've now gone and busted
Molluscs, single or clustered.
Acting headstrong, unflustered,
With their beaks they have hammered and thrusted.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My girlfriend insists I'm a kidder,
But for high naval rank I'm a bidder.
Because I'm a whiz,
A captainship is
The only ship I would consider.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
She's a harlot! No worse, she's a whore!
Worse than that? Can we find something more?
Our most terrible jab?
It is this: she's a drab!
She's a woman that all should abhor.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
On those oldies but goodies I'm sold.
I delight in that true solid gold.
I get simply delirious
Listening to Sirius
Radio's decades of old.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
When the oil crisis turns to a famine, a
Change from delights (such as lamb) in a
Shortage of meat,
For both poor and elite,
Means the fat folks munch thinnies for stamina.

limerick_list.author: Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
Young Boudreaux, he works as a waiter
In N'awlins, and what could be greater?
Free food that's just ragin'
With spices.  He's Cajun—
Part Anglo, part French, and part gator.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
You wanna swap roles—make a switch?
Bet the thought of that sure makes you twitch:
While it's no female dog,
When your days are a slog,
It's so true, Honey, life is a bitch!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Have you spotted my pet cacomistle?
I am writing this formal epistle
To enlist your assistance
And bypass resistance.
She won't just come home if I whistle.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Dish detergent inspired the name
Of the group The Cascades, who became
One-hit wonders (sensations
In 80-plus nations).
A song about rain spurred this fame.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
Crew, company, troop, gang, or ging.
It's archaic, this word. You could sing
With one's members or talk
About having a walk
Or (who knows?) even having a fling.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
So, your view of the world's cosmoplastic?
It's a view that I think rather drastic.
To say the world came
By some plastic force—lame!
It's a theory that's rather fantastic.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The centroid's the center of mass,
Like the spot in a lad or a lass
Where, on average, their weight
Tends to focus—a trait
Of the balance point (rarely the ass).

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"I can see them, the bright lights of Perth, man!
I can't tell you how much this is worth, man!"
Said John Glenn, "I am thinking:
At me, they are winking!
I sure am one fortunate earthman!"

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
A diamondback could be a snake,
Or a terrapin found in a lake,
Or it could be the thing
That you get on a ring
From your former fiancée, you rake!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
With a bombsight there's no need to pray
That your timing and aim are okay.
Crosshairs' "X" marks the spot
Lining up what you've got
To create the best shot. "Bombs away!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Auto-Tune? That's a hymn to your car?
Or the way that you tune your guitar?
No! It makes your recording
Much better, affording
A shot at becoming a star.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
The judge said my money was fake—
That's a verdict I find hard to take.
Especially when,
Both the twenty and ten,
Took me so many hours to make.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
The anti-abortionists cursed
When the judges put women's rights first;
They were really dismayed
By Roe versus Wade,
And are hoping to get it reversed.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The comb-jellies live in the sea
And in waters more brackish (q.v.).
They make up the corps o'
The group Ctenophora,
With ciliate "combs" swimming free.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
As I hold him and stroke his sparse hair, God
(These lifeless last wisps you still dare, God,
To tear from my boy
In your lust to destroy),
Let him feel my deep love, not despair, God.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
I know that it's just superstition,
But I'm struck by a sick premonition
Of dread when I meet
A black cat in the street—
It's a real catastrophic condition!

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
It's the meanest thing on my agenda —
I assemble my list of delenda:
This to blot, this erase,
This destroy, this replace.
Wipe them out, make them pay, no surrenda!

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
A Trabant bids a cowpat he meets a
"Hallo! I'm a car from the streets, Sir.
What are you? Please advise."
Then the cowpat replies:
"You're a car? If you are, I'm a pizza!"

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Frilly skirts and high kicks their career,
The dancers were met with a cheer.
In the wings, Jacques stopped dozing —
Critiqued his composing:
"For the cancan I'm Offenbach here."

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
What a novice you are!  What a noob!
You're an idiot, man.  You're a boob.
You're a nit, you're a twit,
You're a stupid old git.
You're a fool; you're a tool; you're a choob!

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
To dissolve is to seamlessly blend
Between scenes that the screenwriter's penned.
This filmmaker's art
Swaps the scene at the start,
With a mix, for the scene at the end.

limerick_list.author: BobfromThirsk
limerick_list.text:
The audition for Tinker Bell's part
Was cut short by an ad-libbing start,
After which I said, "Runt!
Why'd ya cause such affront?"
She said, "Dad, it was only a fart."

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
It has long been a part of my plan
To visit the beaches of Cannes:
Girls, so amorous, show
Lots of glamorous peau
Where the rich and the beauteous tan.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
Gather roses whenever you see 'em,
Grab your chances and don't ever flee 'em.
Enjoy each new day
Ere they all pass away:
That's the attitude called carpe diem.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
What is this: (BiO)2CO3?
Why, it's bismuth subcarbonate, see?
It is x-ray opaque.
In a fireworks cake
Its fierce crackle will fill you with glee.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An encomium honored a man
As his biodegrading began:
"Dearest Ludwig: While dozing,
Have fun decomposing!"
(It eulogized Beethoven, van.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Diaplasis means setting a bone
(That has snapped, since you're accident-prone)
Or a joint dislocation.
For a quick consultation,
Call 9-1-1, now, on your phone.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Her tiara (the story unfurls)
Is so gemmy — all rubies and pearls.
She wore it and a shawl
At the debutantes' ball,
And mingled as one of the girls.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With all audio/video art,
The word audience there at the start
Noted people who heard,
But the logical word
(i.e. vidience) still stands apart.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I offered my mother-in-law
Soda crackers to gnaw.  She said, "Naw.
I'll just have me a look
In my purse."  Then she took
Out some chewing tobacco to chaw.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Said a sixtyish woman named Ruth,
"I have had many men in my youth
As a chicken, but now
Having sex is like Wow!
So much better, to tell you the truth."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A man and his dog in a barque
That was cut from a log in the park
May by night try to sneak,
Quite unheard, up the creek,
If the dog doesn't bark in the dark.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
It's a town in Nebraska, and he
Starred as Hawkeye in M*A*S*H on TV.
Here's a third and last hint:
This girl sang for a stint.
The name Alda applies to all three.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I live in what's called the "Big Smoke"
With non-rural and citified folk.
We're tough and we're gritty
And love the big city,
And will til the day that we croak.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
He arrived at the end of his rope
After forty-three days as the pope.
He was Anterus, Greek,
And it seems his physique
Wasn't up to it — just couldn't cope.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Manufacturing yo-yos—oh, brother!—
Donald Duncan stood out like no other.
Though this string-and-wood fellow
Did not make a cello,
We joke Yo-Yo Ma was his mother.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This counterinsurgency's loony,
Assuming the Shiite and Sunni
Will love one another
Like sister and brother
As Muslims get all crescent-moony.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Your explicative arguments show
How conclusions from premises grow.
Every step you explain,
So no questions remain.
But your ending — "That's all, folks!" — must go.

limerick_list.author: limarico and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
While the taxman examines my life,
Helen nags me with family strife.
"Since I'm down many years,"
I confess through my tears,
"For the doomage, consider my wife."

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
He farewelled me, that dear friend of mine
Who, on leaving this world, did not whine.
The goodbye words he wrote
Were in this proffered note:
"Get your feet off my oxygen line!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick and JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Bone black is adsorbent: it's able
To turn sugar white from crude sable.
Black ash of burnt bones
Will remove darker tones,
Adding sweetness with light to your table.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
He was making his doorknob rounds quickly,
And not doing too much for the sickly.
If you dare to suggest
That more time might be best,
He will scowl and get all-over prickly.

limerick_list.author: stephenc
limerick_list.text:
I reap through the bristly plain
'Round my new buddy's mouth, and I deign
(I think he growled "please")
To continue: I tease
And start trimming the lion's great mane.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When the acids build up in my bile,
It is harder and harder to smile.
I become supercilious,
Punctilious, and bilious.
I'm cranky; my temper gets vile.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
I was mugged, and the cops made me wait.
British Transport Police? Listen, mate,
When you're needing these chaps
They will Be There...Perhaps —
Like the trains, they are frequently late.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
You count in the first place to ten,
Then you do it all over again.
While this counting mode, denary,
Won't suit machinery,
Binary doesn't suit men.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The hostess served mushrooms farci,
Filled with tender chopped sirloin and brie.
To my lasting disgrace,
I kept stuffing my face
Till more stuffed than the mushrooms was me.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
After owls eat Lord Sepulchrave Groan,
Fleeing Titus finds freedom, Alone.
Later, when he recalls
Crumbling Gormenghast's walls,
He can't fathom his need to atone.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Belowdecks is where I would go
If at sea in a tropical blow.
Though I never get seasick,
With fear I would be sick—
But I can't be blown overboard.  No?

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Great-granny might think it quite strange
Not having to blacklead a range.
If you readily tire
Of lighting a fire,
A cooker's a welcome exchange.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Most kids on the last day of school
Find it difficult keeping their cool.
Then they run like all get-out
Upon being let out,
Unwound like a string from a spool.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
This closed ecological system,
I'm told, has nice features. (I missed 'em!)
It's as biodome known
And provides a home zone,
Self contained, for some species. (Won't list 'em.)

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Sherlock Holmes was retained to reveal
The Fate of the Vanishing Meal.
The case turned banal
When Holmes found a canal.
"Alimentary," he said, "No big deal."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The aficionado will shout
That his fondness for fish is devout.
For myself, I just wish he
Would stop! Ain't it fishy,
This ardent obsession with trout?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The old engine careened down the track,
Sooty smoke streaking out of its stack,
Ever reeling and juddering,
Passengers shuddering
In carriages jouncing in back.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A thief with a long ugly knife
Stole my credit card—changed my whole life.
"What a shock!" (That's my niece.)
"Did you call the police?"
"No, he's charging much less than my wife!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
For thrills, I'd hang cats from a noose.
Told my pastor, who said, "What the deuce!
That is wrong! That is fell!
Keep it up? Go to hell!
Cut that hang-up for cat-hanging loose!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As we hiked up and down the successive
Rows of hills, all my pain was progressive,
As the backpack I wore
Weighed me down more and more,
And the stress on my spine was compressive.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
To duncedom I'm destined to go.
There's no limit to what I don't know.
I'm as empty of head
As I'd be were I dead.
On the street map of brains, mine's Skid Row.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With the national bird called the dipper,
Each wing can be used as a flipper.
Up in Norway, the streams
Are so chilly it seems
Very strange that these birds are so chipper.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When my gut springs a leak, diastaltic
Progression is shot. Then asphaltic
Is the feel of my belly—
No longer like jelly—
It's in spasm, so hard it's basaltic.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If you're courting my daughter, you'll find
I'm a dad of the old-fashioned kind.
Just be fresh on a date—
With my shotgun I'll wait,
And with buckshot I'll spray your behind.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Of my pain I will seldom complain;
On a plane, though, it drives me insane.
I get soda on ice,
With some lemon (a slice),
While my body cries out for champagne.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For the warm-blooded human, this term (ick!)
Means slicing his homeothermic
Integument thin
So a book's bound with skin:
Bibliopegy, anthropodermic.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
When attacked by an Africanized bee,
Sam stood startled, then started to flee.
The bee's mates joined the fun
And when they were done,
Sam, swollen, appeared on TV.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Remember Macbeth's lady wife,
Who cold-bloodedly proffered a knife?
She didn't think twice
As she offered advice
To her husband to end Duncan's life.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Dearest coz, I'm aware you're aghast
When I file my lims first (for I'm fast),
So I'll help you feel good,
Which a kind cousin should,
And ensure my C-O word comes last.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My job is a great one because
In my contract's an odd conscience clause.
I need not serve a hawk,
Or hear bigoted talk.
I just balk, then I walk—to applause.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Though all campers grow old by and by,
Most love camping too much to just die.
So, equipped to the max,
They are soon making tracks
For that camper van park in the sky.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When you wake to the blackness of night
And you flick on the lamp, it's so bright
That you're dazzled; you find,
For a moment, you're blind,
As your eyes readjust to the light.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A symbol of wealth and of glitz, a
Grand lady of Russia who pits a
Bon mot with the wits,
And with potentates sits—
A description that fits a czaritza.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When compared to a statue of wood,
The new leading man's acting seems good;
And contrasted, he's faster
Than a cast made of plaster.
Get him out of the cast! Understood?

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
He inherited A from his dad,
And his mom gave a B to her lad.
Would Mendel have guessed
That both phenes are expressed?
With codominance, blood can be plaid.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
Little twelve-month-old Johnny was pleased
With the food that he flung when he sneezed.
Oh, he knew he was cute
Throwing veggies and fruit,
And he knew that his mom was appeased!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
"Resistance is futile," you said,
While attempting to get me to bed.
But your chance isn't great:
You're too Borg-like to date
'Til that chip gets removed from your head.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
Arithmetic just makes him cringe.
On his sanity, numbers impinge.
He knows seven ate nine,
And thirteen's a bad sign.
He's a bit on the lunatic fringe.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'm inured to your crap; let me pass.
Your comportment is common and crass.
Look, I'm no nine-to-fiver;
I'm a harness race driver—
Spent my life eyeing some horse's ass.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Has that Chanticleer romanced the chickens?
Have those biddies become easy pickin's?
Candle eggs with a light—
There are signs there, all right,
That that rooster's been raising the dickens!

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
What's a chambrel? The hock of a horse
Or a cow or a deer, says my source.
It is also a frame
Butchers use for the same
So fresh meat can become your main course!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I don't know what this means but I should.
I'd define it right now if I could.
Like a cucullate leaf?
Webster's write-up is brief:
It means having the shape of a hood.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cuscuta, a parasite, grows
On its neighbors, and strangulates those
It invades, and what's odder—
This weed that's called dodder
Sucks food from its hosts, as it goes.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
If a clear exegesis of text
Is required, then what must come next?
A critical read
Is just what you need.
It's easy, no need to be vexed.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
In Great Britain Obama was staying,
And his protocol skills seemed dismaying.
He continued a toast
To his dignified host
While her national anthem was playing.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
He was innocent, Blago pretended,
When his Illinois tenure was ended
For soliciting bribes.
Local custom proscribes
Being caught in the act—deprehended.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The condition cryptitis is one
Of the topics the sheepish might shun:
Anal crypts get inflamed,
And the victim's ashamed
To discuss it, so nothing gets done.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
The knights had such cumbersome armor
To shield them from harm and the harmer.
The metal was hot,
So they sweated a lot,
But it made for a great-looking charmer!

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
The worst possible way to arise?
An assault on the nerves, ears, and eyes!
With its smug LCD,
That alarm clock will glee-
Fully see that you unmesmerize.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To measure the angle of dip,
Some captains saw fit to equip
Their ships with aesthetic
Contraptions magnetic.
The dip circle helped guide the trip.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Yo, cryal means "heron", okay?
There isn't much more one can say.
I could pad and add fluff,
But already, enough.
Hey, cry all you like. Make my day.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
When I ask you to say why you're late,
To explain to your own dearest mate,
You pretend not to hear my
Fair questions. It's clear why
You evade them: you had a hot date!

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
If a glance or a brief conversation
Should engender intense fascination,
But you each have a spouse
And two kids in the house,
Meet to cheat: a discreet assignation.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
One thing that an infant knows best,
Like a marmot that's building its nest,
Is a natural notion,
A burrowing motion
That snuggles to mama's warm breast.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The ceratosaur: fast and carnivorous,
And extinct, like those others herbivorous.
This is lucky for me
Since it's clear he would be
Very likely computer-geekivorous.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
In their breakout, they said they'd include me,
 But I think they deluded and screwed me.
 Why I helped with their plot
 To this day I know not,
 For the reasons I did still elude me.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
To make glycerol, heat up some lye
With a fat (like you use when you fry).
It's a viscous, sweet goop,
Which can help people poop
And keep icings from getting too dry.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Yes, I can set those cans at the curb
And can can hired hands, name of Herb.
But to dance the French cancan?
That's something a man can
Do only when drunk or on herb.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
BTH: what you don't want to do.
If the patient finds out, he will sue.
If you bury the hatchet,
You'd best damn well catch it.
Let admin find out and you're through.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Sinful Suzy was not a tame child;
She was wicked and easily riled.
I domesticized Suzy
While in the jacuzzi —
She's wet, but she's no longer wild.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The new runner is expert at hurdling,
And at track meets the world he is girdling,
But he's scary to see—
Like an ogre—and he
Has a look that can set my blood curdling.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
See the crocodile, swimming with style,
Eyeing tourists who visit the Nile,
Gliding closer to thank
Any boat with a Yank,
As he opens his jaws in a smile.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
The baronet-barrister's part
In a criminal act wasn't smart.
His law career's ended,
His license suspended—
Disbarred…but at least not disbart.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
My friend's just been mugged. I've implored 'er,
"Report this disruptive disorder."
She'd told her marauder,
"Get off!" as he'd floored 'er—
That bovver boy simply ignored 'er!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Let your need for a drink on arising
Be an eye-opener (something surprising)
That defeats your resistance.
You're in need of assistance.
"Get some help," you will find me advising.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
An unfortunate nudist from Leith
Sadly sat on his furious teeth.
Although, from a denture,
Men don't deserve censure,
They bit off a bit underneath.

limerick_list.author: sigg
limerick_list.text:
Abimelech's three kings or four.
(It's hard to be sure. Maybe more.)
One more Biblical name
Of no noteworthy fame.
And rhyming them all? Quite a chore!

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
"The hole that you've dug is too big,"
Or "There's nothing to see, not a fig!"
These affronts are obscure,
But each one I am sure
Is an archaeological dig.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
My calendar tells me the truth;
I look at the date and—forsooth!—
It's the end of the month,
Yes, July 31th,
Only two days till August the 2th.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
They used to build ships for the king.
In exchange he allowed them to bring
Foreign goods of all sorts
To the land of Cinque Ports;
As for taxes—they meant not a thing.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Off to Hell was sent fast-talker Dick.
But that eloquent trickster was slick:
He received a reprieve.
But in Phoenix on leave,
Tweeted, "Lucifer, yank me back quick!"

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Every twist, and each sly convolution
Of my plan will achieve retribution.
There is vengeance (served cold)
In each knot and each fold:
There's no fun in a swift execution.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
They're accordant, these ridges — their heights
With their lowlands in sync. It delights
This old seeker for order.
It runs north to the border:
A landscape endowed with fine sights.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
Brad and Chad, two bright carpenter lads,
Sought an adze in the classified ads.
Although they persisted,
There weren't any listed.
Said Brad, "Let's just borrow your dad's."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To a lady I met on the beach,
I said, "Please don't object if I preach,
But the outfit you're wearing
Has everyone staring—
Wear this muumuu on top, I beseech!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Since my recent return from the tropics
I've been dosing with antihydropics,
As I have, it would seem, a
Bad case of edema.
(Let's drop such disheartening topics!)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The word goosey means "goose-like" to you?
You're completely correct in my view.
But it doesn't stop there.
Here's some info I'll share:
It means "foolish" and "scatterbrained," too.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
Obsessive, asocial, near-mute:
My son just does not give a hoot.
The notion I've gotten
Is autism's rotten,
But he is adorably cute.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Grandma's dinners, announced by a bell—
Less a jingle and more like a knell—
Made us all jump and run.
Being late was no fun.
She would yell; she'd complain; she'd raise hell.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I boasted I'd found a rare fossil,
What I thought she had cried was "Colossal!"
But "Callosal," she'd said,
Meaning "inside my head."
My heart bled. I saw red but was docile.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
At the Species Bar, here is my gripe:
That, because of conformity's hype,
You will oft hear a boor
Say, "I'm sorry, but you're
Apotypic, not really my type."

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
In hospitals illness is spread
By divers ways, bed unto bed.
If it moves on bacterially,
It will clearly materially
Increase all the residents' dread.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
We went caving in eastern Kentucky.
Local papers described us as "plucky."
Eight or nine set about
Going in.  Three came out.
All the rest, it is clear, were unlucky.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Lee the limerick writer ain't terse —
Extra lines he appends to each verse;
And perversely he'll blight us
With addendum-icitis.
To high-fivers, like us, he's a curse.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My broker has bought me a block
Of something called air pocket stock.
As he's sometimes malicious,
I'm feeling suspicious—
Do you think I am in for a shock?

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
This is serious stuff — wipe that smirk!
You took upskirts of women at work.
With dumb tricks you're infested;
Your adulthood's arrested —
Like you now, you immature jerk.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Said the soon-to-be-married Marie,
"I'm a damned, oh-so-sad bride-to-be.
I must wed old Henri
And die young, of ennui.
I shall no longer be fancy-free!"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
We knew he was buried first-class
By the concelebration: his Mass
Took five bishops, ten priests
And two popes. The deceased's
Sacramentally pushing up grass.

limerick_list.author: limarico
limerick_list.text:
I thought that the water was drinkable.
Then I came down with something unthinkable.
Now I know that (cough! sniff!)
It's undrinkable if
With your illness the water is linkable.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
What a pity that Dee loved to feast
On those pork steaks with rind thickly greased,
And sweet biscuits deep-fried
With hot grits on the side,
'Cos she popped. Then she stopped. Then Dee ceased.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
See those gays frolic freely on dates?
They cavort in the joy each creates.
Yet we're mopey and down,
Always wearing a frown.
That's our fate in this town — desperate straights.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
There once was a fellow named Derek
Who was, technically speaking, a cleric.
This fossarian (fossor)
Worked hard, the poor tosser.
A gravedigger's life is barbaric.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
There's a seaside vacation I crave
Now bin Laden's not safe in some cave.
I am noting with glee
He was buried at sea.
To the ocean! Let's dance on his grave.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The resorts of Spain's Costa del Sol
Have long been a popular goal.
Moor your yacht at a club;
Do a spa, get a rub,
Hit a beach. It'll help you feel whole.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mom gets lovelier as she grows older.
When we tell her, she laughs; we get bolder.
Then she turns it around,
Saying beauty is found
In the eye of the loving beholder.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
I awake next to big brother Bill,
And I ask myself, stunned, "Did I kill
My own sibling?"—then sigh.
How I wish he would lie
Less cadaverously clammy and still.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
A bimonthly was known in Nantucket
As the every-two-months Island Bucket.
When the owner went broke,
The print union awoke;
Two months later they walked out and struck it.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I've been planning on getting away,
But my flight has been cancelled today.
Now this offer of eight
Thousand air miles is great,
But I'd rather have moola, okay?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Some sausage, I find, is delicious,
But the content's too often suspicious.
So most bags of mystery
I shun. We have history:
In my gut they erupt and turn vicious.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Now it's August, and Dad thinks I sinned in
My internship. What a great wind in
The phone Dad has blown!
Yo, I don't live alone—
I am living in London with Lyndon.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Thick walls and a big iron door
Make a bank vault a good place to store
Your money and rings
And valuable things—
Or wait out a nuclear war.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
I'm a fashion designer whose dreams
Of couture are now ripped  at the seams.
My name's Galliano.
I've been in the guano
Since my drunkenness led to extremes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Bertha Bender was known for her bustiness.
Her breasts roused in men lots of lustiness,
But her husband stayed cool.
"You may think me a fool;
I just watch the guys drool. She has trustiness."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I will send you a five-spot," she wrote,
"For your birthday." I smiled at Gram's note.
It arrived the next day
And I'm sorry to say
That the chance that I'll spend it? Remote!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My mother employed CIO
So in time all her kids learned to go
Right to sleep. There's no doubt,
She opined cry it out
Was effective, although it caused woe.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
SusanL
limerick_list.text:
The Rolex you've bought is declarable
And the luxury tax on it's terrible.
But there's one simple way
To keep customs at bay:
Your new high-ticket item is wearable.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle and mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The catastrophists looked at the Earth
Through the Genesis tale of its birth.
Fossils stuck in the mud
Were explained by the Flood.
Of such thinkers today, there's a dearth.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
This famed wrestler stood seven-foot-four,
And he added to moviedom's lore.
Favorite line (and I mean it):
"Anybody want a peanut?"
Sadly, André the Giant's no more.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The horse tugged, but the cart would not start.
To the driver I yelled, "Have a heart!"
To direct folk's attention,
I yelled my dissension:
"Get a load of the load on that cart!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
What is cucullate? Shaped like a hood
Or a cowl. It is well understood
That the monkshoods take vows
In the church to espouse
Holy orders. (They would if they could.)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I came out.  I'm no longer a liar.
Now I'm camping it up.  Some inquire
Of the swish in my walk,
And the lisp in my talk,
And my voice being two octaves higher.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm asleep, so I don't really feel 'im,
When the surgeon incises my celom,
Cuts my stomach and gut,
Sews them up again, but
Now it's up to my body to heal 'em.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Our best dive bomber won Coral Sea.
It's the Dauntless (the famed SBD).
At Midway, this harrier
Sunk many a carrier
And forced our opponents to flee.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
I am sorrowful, anxious and grievous
At the news that you're going to leave us.
Yes, I'm chary to hear
You're departing, my dear.
I just hope in your memory you'll weave us.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Mr. Smith's a bit crackers; here's why:
"Flat Earth" is a concept he'll buy.
He clings to the notion
That, somewhere, the ocean
Has edges. He'll sail off and die.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"We're unable to moor the Valdez,
And the captain's a grouch we can't please,"
Thought a mate in the crew
On the tanker who knew
Joe's  cantankerous state on the seas.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
If the pain sears through each aching joint,
Don't use pills or with ointment anoint;
Get a full diagnosis
From your head to your toes-es:
Acupuncture goes straight to the point.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
An amnesty (pardon) now grants
Me a narrow escape and a chance
To live life. Now I'm safe,
Though my enemies chafe.
My great joy's not a mere happenstance!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For every transaction she'd make,
She would open her purse and she'd take
Out her charge card and charge it;
Her debt's grown so large it
May break her (or jar her awake).

limerick_list.author: Robert Schechter
limerick_list.text:
When milking a cow, warm your hands.
That's something a cow understands.
Cold hands on an udder
Will make a cow shudder,
And tickle her mammary glands.

limerick_list.author: Rudi
limerick_list.text:
The houseboy remarked to his boss:
"I'm friendly whenever you're cross.
I greet you so genially—
Serve you so menially—
But why? I am now at a loss."

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
At our beer joint they drink (of course!) beer
And all sorts of booze that's served here.
Though the beer and the wine
Are far less than divine,
You can still get quite drunk. Have no fear!

limerick_list.author: Michael Daws
limerick_list.text:
A coffee is just what you need
After spending three hours with a Swede.
It'll wake you up fast,
But it's not going to last,
Though you'll have the advantage of speed.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
It's purification from dregs,
And clarification has legs.
Refinement's there too,
Though I doubt that you knew
Defecation's the word this verse pegs.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
I once fought with a Japanese ninja
And he sought, as a sport, me to injure.
But his blade held no fear;
He could do me no dere
With a samurai sword made of ginger.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
'Tis said new brooms make sweeping a breeze.
Then there's broom that makes lots of us wheeze.
But to sweep raises dust,
And they both have been cussed
As the things that cause many AH-SHNEEEZE!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Cosession's a doctrine that's grand,
Placing Christ at the Father's right hand.
While enthroned on ascension,
He has the intention
To come here again and command.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Put three slices of toast in a stack.
Spread with mayo to make  a fine snack.
In between? Turkey, bacon,
Tomato. You're makin'
A club that'll bring 'em all back.

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
"Overwhelm with amazement profound,"
Or else "fill with great wonder": astound
(From that old word, astoned,
Like your brain's just been boned
By a substance the cops should impound).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Your new girlfriend's so thin! We must flatten out
The folds in her bra. Pat should fatten out,
But to stuff her with pie,
We must first get her high.
Ask the waiter to bring a Manhattan out.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
Why, you dolt, that's the annuals bed!
Take the deutzia back to the shed.
I said pansies in tubs,
Not hydrangea-like shrubs
That were named for a Dutchman long dead.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
We have boots for those working outdoors
And soft slippers for carpeted floors.
Our shoes aren't expensive;
Our stock, comprehensive:
Even ice-skates for penguins on tours.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
My friend is distressed by dyspnoea.
He struggles for breath, and it's clear
His problem dyspnoic
Needs effort heroic —
He's marathon running next year!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My grandfather thinks he's a Hyundai.
I went to his hospital one day.
They use sports for correction.
"The Caesarian Section
Will play the King Richards on Sunday!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Since I've scrubbed down this filthy shebeen,
You will have to agree that it's clean—
Not a germ or a spore
On the tables or floor,
And I trust there's no dust to be seen.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
When inspecting this old compass plane,
Your search for a plane will be vain,
For its flexible face
Gave the swell-fronted grace
To this dresser from George III's reign.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
To Pliny the Elder, 'twas clear
How an ostrich reacted to fear.
But that sensible bird,
Thinking Pliny absurd,
With a blink made the sage  disappear.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
After Einstein resolved to eschew
Any quantum-entanglement view,
Bell's theorem was proved
And our doubts were removed:
All the rules are up-ended anew.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Near Cosenza the Visigoths sing
Gloomy whispering hymns for their king:
Neath a river's cool bed,
They have buried the dead,
So their foes can find nary a thing.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
This knife in my chest makes me pray
You'll stop overreacting, Renee.
Though I say you're a horse
And I want a divorce,
There's no call to be angry that way.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
Even thinking of crossing the street
Makes my face turn as white as a sheet.
Whirling traffic's quick breeze
Sets my body to freeze
My enslaved, agyrophobic lead feet.

limerick_list.author: Rudi
limerick_list.text:
I hope you don't think me fanatical—
Though strict, I am not autocratical—
But I must apprise you
That you must revise "You
Is bad." "Is" is not, there, grammatical.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Although poor, we kids never went short:
It was make-do-and-mend we were taught,
Though the last to possess
Each thin hand-me-down dress
Found it limper than when it was bought.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The dead load of a bridge is the weight
That the bridge, by itself, will create.
Steel and concrete ain't air—
Builders have to take care.
Too much weight is a negative trait.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
He puffed on a long cigarette,
Just as smelly as smokers can get.
He asked, "Please be my wife?"
I said, "Not on your life,
'Cause your secondhand smoke's a death threat."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Quel fromage is so round, never square?
To the French, it's a wheel: Camembert.
This semi-soft cheese
Should win in a Brie-ze,
On a pie chart that's drawn to compare.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"On my list of life's goals," announced Fred,
"Number nine is 'Make love with a Red.'"
Sonia Chekhov thought, "Swell!"
And seduced him. "Oh well,
I can check off that item," he said.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
I swear, folks, it's simply a myth
That the hippie Chrysanthemum Smith
Beads and flowers eschewed,
And joined up where a Jew'd
Get empowered: "The Sons" (B'nai B'rith).

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A man who is drowning will clutch
At a straw.  His predicament's such
That he'll grasp and he'll grope
At what's withering hope,
Thus the chances it helps?  Not so much.

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
If you're taking a ride in the car,
I'd be sure that the door's not ajar.
If it swings open wide,
You might lose what's inside,
Or fall out, and not get very far.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
"A cesspool of moral decay..."
My dad described Vegas that way.
"A cloaca, a sewer,
What'd they use as a lure
To make you choose—Slots! Hey, let's play!"

limerick_list.author: willupanek
limerick_list.text:
Leaves of aloes will heal irritation,
But aloin clears constipation.
Too much of this brew
(Made from aloe plants too)
Calls for aloe in swift application.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
"Now I don't want you fretting, Mama,
But I heard Father crashed our new car.
No, no, no, no, he's fine!
He just drank too much wine."
She replied, with such Englishness, "Ah."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Owl, that Andean condor's no beaut —
His featherless head sure ain't cute!"
"Good friend Duck, I admit
Those wings scare me a bit;
But for that bird I don't give a hoot."

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
In the aftermath, tell me, what track
Is your mind on? Your tongue's fallen slack.
Are you thinking it out
And conceding some doubt,
Or conceiving your counterattack?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I attended a séance, in session,
As a skeptic—I'll make that confession—
But I didn't find tedium:
I observed, in the medium,
Demonianism—that means "possession."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Says Monroe of his exploits heroic:
"I display no distress; I'm a stoic.
I don't work up a sweat—
Not enough to get wet—
None at all. My deeds aren't diapnoic."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As a budding ballet dancer, you
May decide to perform a battu.
Make your feet come together,
As light as a feather;
Collide, then divide them on cue.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A ball-hawkin' basketball cat
Liked to shoot at the drop of a hat.
If he scored, then he stayed
In the lineup and played.
If he threw up an air ball, he sat.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Brother Dom takes hot meals to the poor;
Tender Daisy's half-dressed at the door.
She claps eyes on this hunk
And forgets he's a monk.
Now, alas, the hot meal's on the floor.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Have a car and my clothes without fail
Outside of this old county jail.
It has only one fence,
 Which does not make much sense,
So tomorrow I'll scale it and bail.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Since we've dated, I'm feeling elated.
In Heaven this match was created.
I was frustrated, blue,
As I waited for you—
I'm convinced that as mates we're confated.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
The clever small cylinder lock
Will foil, or effectively block,
Most burglars' attentions
(Though slim its dimensions)
By the way that its tumblers will dock.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Deadly sins, against Thebes, come 11,
Wonders, sacraments leading to heaven,
Days in May, brides for brothers,
Grumpy, Doc and five others:
List of things, all preceded by 7.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A cobleman's sure to possess
A flat-bottomed boat. I would guess
That all fishermen know
There's a reason, although
The poor fish, I'm sure, couldn't care less.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
"Please stop jabbing yer thumb in my face
And just keep yer damn feet in their place!
Where ya putting that toe, Sis?"
"Without acrognosis,
I've no sense where my parts are in space."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
To a nature preserve, my donation
Was my time, doing tree emuscation.
I cleansed lots of moss
From ten oaks, so the boss
Said he'd give me an oke commendation.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Exhibitionistic types think it OK
That their bodies be put on display.
Such flaunts should be banned,
As most bods ain't that grand
(I can tell you firsthand, by the way).

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Making sense of this page is frustration;
It's coded, hush-hush information.
Don't speak of it yet,
Not until we can get
Us a cryptanalytic translation.

limerick_list.author: Colin Salter
limerick_list.text:
Short attention span? Try channel-hopping
With your TV remote, never stopping
Long enough to have got
Any punchline or plot,
Flicking quickly from news to home shopping.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"Your insufferable swearin' and screamin'
Must cease, you foul sulphurous demon!
I shall blow you away.
Now begone, devil, pray.
I exsufflate you. WHOOOSH!" (Am I dreamin'?)

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
The corpse in my yard's decomposed;
There is no cause of death diagnosed.
Putrefaction and rot
Likely isn't worth squat
To the cops, so I think it's case closed.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and Dottie
limerick_list.text:
When composing a readable rhyme
On this site, poets cheat all the time.
And who is the first
On the list of the worst
Of offenders? I'd have to say I'm!

limerick_list.author: Gumby
limerick_list.text:
A medieval physician who's mean
And whose dark disposition's routine
May blame the black bile,
And self-bleed for awhile,
To solve problems with kidney or spleen.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Though I majored in English and psych,
I've loved planting since I was a tyke.
That's what life's been about:
Reaching up, branching out —
I'm dendritic, and that's what I like.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though the prices in stores may be steep,
"As ye sow," they say, "so shall ye reap."
It's no bargain if I
Go to jail when I buy
Out of somebody's trunk on the cheap.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Cain and Abel were farmers in Spain
Who saw four years of near-zero rain.
But A. calamus needs
H2O to grow reeds,
So unable, were they, to raise cane.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
Dementia: the stuff that I knew
Seems elusive. Between me and you,
I fear losing my brain.
Again and again
It's "I'm sorry, I haven't a clue."

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Her beckoning glance had allured me,
Her luscious red lips reassured me.
I succumbed to her charms
And fell into her arms,
But one whiff of her breath quickly cured me.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Folks declare it's an odd eccentricity,
But in living, I treasure simplicity.
My abode on the Cape,
Hexahedral in shape,
Cost a million for basic cubicity.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
So what if the guy lives on gumbo,
And gets drunk every Friday on bumbo?
Man, it gives me a jolt
When you say he's a dolt,
And a nitwit, a moron, a dumbo!

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Archaeology: study of old stuff,
Conducted by those who behold stuff
Made by Romans or Greeks.
When the Ancient World speaks,
You should listen, 'cause some of it's gold stuff.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
I have walked a circuitous path
On my way from my bed to the bath.
That's a risk when you dwell
In the 4-D Hotel:
Midnight rambles entail higher math.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
His technique is not naturalistic:
His art's on cloud nine, expressionistic.
His artistic devotion
Can stir strong emotion;
I'd say he is "movingly mystic".

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
For sheer horror, Code Lindbergh's unmatched.
It declares a vile plot has been hatched
And then put into play.
I can't fathom a way
I'd have lived if my child had been snatched.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This Victorian bowl made of glass
Has a silvery base adding class.
It's a basket the bride
Is displaying with pride
(While the bridegroom is grabbing her ass).

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
Albugineous:  white as can be,
Like a berg, or a ghost you can see;
Like the white of an egg,
A cadaverous leg,
Or a branch on a snow-covered tree.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I am trying, alone at my desk,
To compose something gripping, Dantesque,
But it's daunting to storm
Using limerick form,
And I'm sure I'll end up with burlesque.

limerick_list.author: Julia
limerick_list.text:
The definitive bibliophile
Stashes books beyond count in a pile.
Though it might seem outrageous
To read all those pages,
It's kept her amused for a while.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Close the curtain; the sun's in my eyes.
Though it's noon, I've no reason to rise.
Lest we're under attack,
I'll remain on my back—
Sweet decumbency: life's greatest prize.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
"My tastes run to tidbits like truffles;
My cuffs feature satiny ruffles.
I'm dandified, foppish,
And over-the-toppish.
In short, I am beauish," he snuffles.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Into hot, molten glass the man blows.
While it's soft, then the glassblower knows
He can shape it and stretch it
(And, later, might etch it) —
As easy as blowing his nose!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
This brand born in Pittsburgh, PA,
Softens dishwater.  Also with spray
For the body and beads
For the bath, it succeeds.
Yes, with Calgon, I'm taken away!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An action-type figure's a toy
That will make a fine gift for a boy,
But remember they're never
Called dolls; if you ever
Say that you'll extinguish his joy.

text: This is a test to see how well you are paying attention. This text is a series of limericks. At the end of the list of limericks, there will be a question. The question will be about one of the limericks. Please answer the question as concisely as possible.
